I am experiencing an elevated sense of enthusiasm concerning the expanded culinary options currently available. Following a query posed to two representatives of the establishment regarding the precise moment at which these novel selections were introduced, neither individual proved cognizant of the specifics. Consequently, I have deduced that their implementation must have occurred recently. My gratification with the culinary excellence of the burger I consumed was somewhat diminished by its preparation, specifically that it had been cooked beyond the point of optimal doneness. In light of this, I shall endeavor to specify a less well-done preparation during future orders. Furthermore, my request for thermally treated potato strips was fulfilled, yet my offspring expressed dissatisfaction with the accompanying beer cheese. Following our communication of this discrepancy to the server, we were informed that the cheese in question was not of the customary orange hue and texture, but rather appeared more akin to a thin, white liquid. Additionally, the price of this item was $7, which seemed excessive in relation to its quality. The dish in question consisted of small, bite-sized pieces of pretzels, accompanied by the aforementioned beer cheese. Upon sampling the cheese, both myself and my offspring concurred that its flavor was unremarkable and lacking in depth, bearing little resemblance to the characteristic tanginess of beer cheese. Indeed, the absence of any discernible flavor was so pronounced that I felt compelled to convey my disappointment to the server, who failed to demonstrate a convincing level of belief in my account or offer any form of compensation. This response was unexpected, as I would have anticipated a greater degree of concern and perhaps even a complimentary replacement. My offspring, having opted for an appetizer in lieu of a main course, left me feeling somewhat remorseful. However, my satisfaction with the broader range of menu items has increased my inclination to revisit this establishment and sample one of the newly listed sandwiches. Previously, my associations with Goldies had been limited to burgers, chicken wings, and pizzas. Now, I look forward to exploring the diversified array of offerings.

"I visited this establishment with the intention of indulging in a comprehensive massage therapy session. The experience was merely adequate, as I was unfortunately subjected to auditory distractions emanating from neighboring clients, which hindered my ability to fully unwind and enjoy the treatment. Additionally, I felt that the masseuse applied excessive pressure to my shoulder region, resulting in lingering discomfort the following day. Furthermore, I was taken aback by the peculiar practice of having the masseuses congregate at the payment area, awaiting remuneration before allowing clients to depart. This encounter was certainly unique, but I fear it may deter me from revisiting the premises in the future."

After I found out that Sephora stocks Korres products I headed over to the new store in Fairview, Pointe Claire. Apparently Sephora Quebec doesn't stock Korres but Ontario stores do, due to packaging regulations (i.e language, as Korres products are in Greek and English)

Completely ridiculous and another reason consumers will always find a way to buy elsewhere if they don't get access to what they want. So I can shop online at SkinStore.com and only pay 5$ shipping from the USA for an entire order.

Apart from that, Sephora did have a great selection of brands, not all girly, if you know what you are looking for.   Staff were very helpful and  love to to direct you to the $150 creams (sorry couldn't resist). I would recommend researching the brands first though, many may just be in there because they have compliant packaging rather than really being the best brands you can buy. Many were missing in the store from the Sephora website. The prices seemed inline with elsewhere i.e. Dr. Hauschka prices were the same as Olgivy's, but again, I would compare as some products may have a premium attached to the price simply because you can't readily get access to that brand elsewhere in Montreal. 

Another thing that sucks is that on the Sephora website orders in the US over 50$ are free, however Canadian orders it's over $150 to get free shipping, Again, check out skinstore.com
Outdoor mall.  More for the 40+ crowd.  On a warm day, it's a nice place to walk around as there's mist sprays everywhere and various restaurants to eat at.

"We opted for a spontaneous excursion to Las Vegas on the fourth of July, and our accommodation of choice was this establishment. Upon arrival, we utilized the prompt and efficient taxi services, taking advantage of the nominal fee of $15, inclusive of gratuity. The process of checking in was seamless and expeditious, allowing us to promptly settle into our capacious two-bedroom suite, complete with a fully equipped kitchen. The amenities and location of this hotel catered perfectly to our desire for a respite from the vibrant and extravagant atmosphere of the city's renowned strip. Although the hotel does not boast the same level of luxury as its counterparts along the strip, it compensates by providing complimentary shuttle transportation to prominent destinations such as MGM, Mandalay, and the airport. Our assessment of this lodging facility is adequate, considering its unpretentious nature and functional amenities. 

To optimize your experience, it is advisable to allocate ample time for hailing a taxi, as the distance from the hotel may deter drivers from venturing in that direction, and any delay in their arrival may result in the loss of your reserved ride. It is imperative to heed the front desk's instructions regarding the designated time for your taxi pickup, as punctuality is crucial to ensure both the timely arrival at your destination and the fulfillment of any prior commitments, such as dinner reservations or theatrical performances."

"The further they move up Eastern, the less I tend to enjoy them. My family and I have been patrons of this establishment for years, purchasing birthday cakes and other pastries, but unfortunately, we have noticed a decline in quality over time. When I first returned from Korea, I was eager to visit Freed's Bakery, as I had missed their delectable treats during my time abroad. Their strawberry shortcake, black forest cake, and fruit tarts were among my favorites, but upon subsequent visits, I noticed that the cakes had become excessively sweet and somewhat dry. It is possible that my palate has evolved, but simultaneously, their prices have also increased. It seems that the quality of their products has not kept pace with their rising costs. Additionally, some patrons have mentioned that the service at Freed's can be inconsistent, ranging from attentive and friendly to neglectful, with staff occasionally disappearing for extended periods, leaving customers unattended."

Decided to take the family here after receiving a coupon and was intrigued by the all natural concept. We loved the decor and the place seemed clean. We were immediately disappointed when we discovered the lack of a kids menu. We were informed by the staff that we could order anything plain. So we get to pay $6 for a burger for our 6 year old. Same with the hot dogs. You pay for a Chicago dog and then tell them to hold all the good stuff.  Fries are separate although the large seemed to feed us all. We ordered waters and were presented with 5 shot glass sized plastic cups. I realize they make money on drinks but this is Arizona!  We need water. 

The only saving grace is that the food was pretty good. The burgers were small but had good flavor.  Just wondering how American cheese made into an all natural place.

We may come back, but I doubt we will make a special trip.

Our group stayed here for our Vegas trip. I would have much more liked to stay in a burlap sack. I understand that renovations take time and money. Seeing that this place robs people at the table, you would think ALL of thier rooms would reflect that. NOPE

They have 4 different buildings and unfortunatley my friend was in the "old building". His room was literally 2 beds and a TV. The service at the front desk is non existant and the bellhop looks like they are angry at you.  

I couldnt complain about my room but i wondered to myself...why aren't all the rooms like this? The Wold Fare Buffet was disgusing and there is a food court inside of the Casino with all terrible eateries. 

They just need to punch up this place alot more to be competing with other Hotel and Casinos on the Vegas Strip.

DH & I went to Upper Crust for Happy Hour. We had a pizza and wings, which were on happy hour specials. The pizza was good, similar to the grimaldi's style. The wings were a one star. The ambiance was a little dark, could use some color. Lots of TV's to watch any game were available.

I was really really torn on whether to give H&H 3 or 4 stars!!  

The cocktails are standard quality craft cocktails, but without any frills and nothing particularly spectacular about it.

The atmosphere/decor is just ok.  It's very bare and, due to the lack of crowd, empty feeling.  I suppose we did go out for drinks at around 8 on a Sunday evening, but I mean, who doesn't do that? right? :p 

Service was pretty average as well.  There was only one bartender/staff, but it was sufficient for the small number of people.  He also didn't seem too interested in telling us more about the cocktails and basically told us all the cocktails were great.

In the end, we choose the Agnatha & Anni and the August 21st, 1959.  I really liked my Agnatha.  Crisp, tart, strong.  I didn't like all the tiny ice bits in it though, but that's easily remedied as the ice melts.  The August 21st was ok.  I'm not a fan of smoky flavored drinks, but if you are, this one would be a good choice.

Overall, I would come back again because it's just too convenient.  Plenty of street parking, closely located, solid cocktails, and no worries about finding a table.

Great Sushi have to try the spicy tuna..I also tried the Fillet mignon steak & chicken and was a bit dissipointed. The chicken was a bit dry.. But after I asked for some teriyaki sauce... It was all god again...Over all I was impressed.. When I'm back in town I defently will be stopping back by to try somthing different...

This is definitely not the place to go if you have older children.  This place is catered for kids under the age of 8.  They do have laser tag though which can entertain the older kids- but beware of the little ones in there too!

"Indulging in gatherings at the prestigious Ritz Carlton has led us to indulge in the hotel's esteemed bar and restaurant, Bistro 24, which has proven to be a delightful and serendipitous experience, particularly on a Friday evening. The Grill Night buffet has surpassed our expectations, offering an array of delectable delights that would satiate even the most discerning palates.

The appetizer buffet boasts an impressive selection, featuring Blue Point oysters, lobster bites, seared tuna adorned with wasabi cream, bite-sized filet mignon, succulent shrimp, duck, and an assortment of artisanal cheeses. Moreover, a dedicated sushi stand showcases an array of expertly crafted sushi rolls, further elevating the dining experience.

The outdoor grill station offers a veritable feast for carnivores, with mouthwatering filet mignon, lamb chops, organic salmon, and grilled shrimp accompanied by creamy mashed potatoes and a medley of grilled vegetables. To cap off this gastronomic journey, a decadent dessert stand beckons with its tantalizing treats, while an extensive wine list provides the perfect accompaniment to this epicurean adventure."

"Some of the most memorable culinary experiences can arise from venturing into unassuming establishments, as was the case with this particular restaurant. Despite its unremarkable exterior and questionable surroundings, this cozy eatery boasts an inviting ambiance, impeccable cleanliness, and a menu that showcases exceptional culinary prowess. 

My acquaintance and I decided to patronize this establishment based on our proximity to the area and the presence of a discount coupon. Our decision proved fortuitous, as we were rewarded with an exquisite dining experience that surpassed our expectations. 

The complimentary tortilla chips were cooked to a golden crisp perfection, while the accompanying bean and salsa dips were delightfully flavorful. Furthermore, the rice was expertly prepared, and the generous portion sizes only added to our satisfaction. My fellow diner, a self-proclaimed chile relleno aficionado, lavished praise upon this establishment's rendition of the dish, lauding the light, airy batter and copious amounts of melted cheese. 

We shall undoubtedly return to this gastronomic gem, whether or not we possess a financial incentive in the form of a coupon."

I perused all the critiques prior to investing in the Groupon, hence I was cognizant of what to anticipate. As I possess the attribute of being an accomplished procrastinator, I postponed scheduling my appointment until it was practically expired. Fortuitously, the young lady was capable of accommodating me within a few days of the deadline! They assigned the females to collaborate, with Jennifer undertaking my manicure while Kelly performed my pedicure. Both young women executed their tasks proficiently, exhibiting cordiality throughout the approximate duration of ninety minutes. My dual laments are as follows: 1) The positioning of the chairs rendered it somewhat uncomfortable, as I sat sideways for the pedicure and rotated my torso for the manicure, whereas I noticed they possessed a chamber furnished with couches for solely pedicure recipients, appearing considerably more comfortable. 2) I failed to perceive an adequate assortment of hues for my preference, as I incline toward neutral tones. Upon utilizing my Groupon, I retain one additional discounted visit, subsequent to which I shall be subject to the full tariff, which does not compare favorably with the cost of visiting a salon. Although I do not indulge in having my nails treated frequently, I aspire to revisit the establishment in the near future.

"The culinary offerings and hospitality we experienced during our recent visit were truly exceptional, representing a remarkable upgrade from the mediocre fare and lackluster service we have grown accustomed to in recent times; however, it is worth noting that our enjoyment of the establishment's ambiance was slightly marred by the presence of an unsettling individual accompanied by his canine companion, whose questionable adherence to basic sanitary standards left us feeling somewhat apprehensive regarding the overall cleanliness and safety of the premises, despite the otherwise excellent quality of the food and beverages served."

"During the culinary celebration known as Restaurant Week, a companion and I opted to partake in a dining experience at this establishment, securing reservations in advance to ensure our admittance. Upon entering the eatery, we were greeted by an ambiance that, while perhaps lacking a certain je ne sais quoi, still managed to exude a sense of warmth and hospitality. The libations offered on the beverage menu proved to be both delectable and potent, providing an auspicious start to our meal. My gastronomic journey commenced with the selection of a starter, specifically the Pickle Plate, which showcased an assortment of vegetables that had undergone the process of lacto-fermentation. For my principal course, I elected to sample the pan-seared trout, accompanied by a side of barley risotto. The fish was cooked to perfection and boasted an impressive flavor profile, while the grain dish complemented it admirably. Lastly, I indulged in the key lime pie for dessert, primarily due to my unwavering fondness for all things citrus. In conclusion, my visit to this restaurant was a thoroughly enjoyable experience, and I eagerly anticipate the opportunity to return and explore their regular offerings."

My first experience at Vintage was on Valentine's Day and sat outside on patio by the fire. Very classy and they have an amazing Sangria. Most Saturday nights they have one of my fav local singers, Sarah, she is a great performer. This is a great place for a date night or a chill place for friends to meet.

this has always been our go to for Chinese food at a buffet

living in Vegas my whole life we have had a lot of Chinese food places come and but this place never fails to be fresh.

if you are into sushi they have an entire sushi bar and its very fresh and kept up to date they even have little stickers of when they were put out on the buffet so you can ensure that  it is not too old

they have an amazing selection of Mongolian barbeque and it's like a pic your own Chinese food and they cook it fresh for you it is to die for

this place is pretty big and seats a lot of people has a lot of traffic so very rarely do I see a wait but it is always packed and because it is always packed the food turnover is incredibly quick  very rarely have I seen dishes cold,  empty or close to empty usually its full fresh heaping piles of goodness that you can scoop on to your plate

they have fresh crawfish hot and cold they have a good soup selection and a great Chinese selection all the way from fried rice to want on soup too fried wontons to pot stickers to muscles to hot wings to pizza for the kids

it is definitely worth the price you will not regret going 

Enjoy!!

It is imperative that we provide an update regarding Bricktop's, as the culinary experience offered therein is truly exceptional and worthy of elaboration. While the celestial bodies remain unchanged, my acquaintance's laudatory melody inspired me to expound upon the delectable nature of their brunch offerings. Hence, my companion and I ventured forthwith to sample the gastronomical delights proffered by this esteemed establishment in SouthPark.  

Bricktop's brunch menu boasts an array of innovative dishes, aligning with their contemporary American eclectic style, akin to their lunch and dinner selections. Patrons may create their own bloody mary cocktails at the bar, complemented by an assortment of specialty beverages such as blood orange mimosas and bellinis served by the carafe â?an absolute delight.  

During my successive brunch excursions, I have had the pleasure of savoring the same scrumptious entree â?French Toast. This sumptuous dish consists of generous slices of brioche bread, skillfully cooked to a golden brown perfection, accompanied by an assortment of sweet caramelized bananas, warm maple syrup, fluffy whipped cream, and crispy bacon strips. Although somewhat indulgent, this treat is undoubtedly worth the modest price of $11. For those seeking an additional decadent indulgence, the bite-sized homemade doughnut appetizer, comprising thirteen sugary doughnuts paired with three diverse dipping sauces â?raspberry, chocolate, and vanilla cream â?is an absolute must-try.  

While the cost of partaking in Bricktop's brunch extravaganza may escalate somewhat owing to the liberal consumption of mimosas, the culinary experience is indubitably worth the financial investment. Thus, I wholeheartedly recommend paying a visit to this esteemed eatery and relishing in the delectable fare they offer.

"Cantina undeniably excels in providing an exceptional dining experience, offering a wide array of delectable cuisine and potent potables that cater to the discerning palate. Despite its unassuming exterior, this establishment is often bustling with a vibrant clientele, particularly during peak hours, thereby necessitating advance reservations to avoid prolonged waiting periods. Rest assured, the delay will be inconsequential, as the culinary offerings and hospitable ambiance are well worth the brief interval.  

Cantina presents an extensive selection of premium Mexican libations, including their signature margaritas, which are undoubtedly among the finest in the city. For those who crave something divergent, the Kiwi/Strawberry Special is an exquisite alternative. Additionally, an assortment of quality Mexican brews is available on tap for your pleasure. Imbibe liberally, as everyone else is indulging in the same manner.  

Their menu boasts an impressive variety of dishes, leaving patrons spoiled for choice. For a lighter repast, the chopped tostada salad is an unparalleled option. Alternatively, heartier appetites will be satiated by the flavorful refried beans and tender pulled chicken. However, the true piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance lies in the Kobe beef fajitas, which are an absolute must-try. Suffice it to say, Cantina warrants repeated visits. Nonetheless, it's advisable to refrain from planning an energetic evening subsequent to dining, as the convivial atmosphere and satisfying fare will leave you suitably sated and exhausted."

"The gastronomical offerings at this establishment are truly exceptional, and it is highly recommended that patrons arrive either prior to or subsequent to the peak lunch hour in order to optimize their dining experience and ensure seating availability."

"Inexpensive alcoholic beverages and satisfactory culinary offerings are readily available in this establishment, which caters to individuals seeking an unpretentious atmosphere; however, patrons should anticipate and accept the possibility of increased decibel levels, as such an environment is customary in a working-class drinking establishment."

Borealis, an eatery nestled in the environs of Cambridge, boasts an unparalleled culinary experience, courtesy of its steadfast commitment to the mantra 'think globally, act locally.' This philosophy translates into a scrupulous emphasis on locally-sourced ingredients, with the restaurant's provisions and beverages being procured from the surrounding Waterloo Region or within the confines of Ontario. The resultant cuisine is consistently impressive, albeit subject to occasional fluctuations in menu items owing to the vagaries of local availability and the whims of the chef. Patrons can indulge in a diverse array of Ontario brews and vintages, showcasing the region's rich oenological heritage, while the interior ambiance exudes a warm, welcoming charm, reminiscent of a bygone era. A spacious concrete patio graces the entrance of the edifice, further enhancing the allure of this gastronomic haven. Although the tariff may prove prohibitive for regular visits, the exceptional fusion of gastronomy, libations, and ambiance that Borealis offers warrants a rating of four stars, thereby recommending it to epicures seeking a truly distinctive dining experience.

"This establishment purveys an array of items that are either exceptional or lackluster, which is a common trait among consignment shops. However, I have had the privilege of discovering a few desirable pieces during each visit. These include babyGap denim trousers and an assortment of other distinguished labels such as Janie and Jack and The Children's Place. I hold this store in high regard and now, as I am expecting once more, I shall have to investigate their maternity department as well."

"Do not allow yourself to be deterred by the nomenclature, even if you do not possess an ardent fondness for vinous beverages, as there exists an abundance of potables to sample; having partaken in a midday repast at this establishment, I must say that I was thoroughly impressed by the capable and hospitable personnel, as well as the delectable comestibles they served."

Where the condiment serves as the dominant component, and the bread assumes an elevated status, Canes poultry dish does not possess any extraordinary attributes, and the potatoes prepared in a fried manner fail to elicit excitement; however, the aforementioned condiment exhibits remarkable quality, prompting me to procure an additional four servings each time, for the purpose of immersing both my avian entity and my potatoes within its delectable confines. Although I harbor an inclination toward coleslaw, the variety offered by Canes underwhelms my expectations, compelling me to opt for an increased quantity of toast instead.

"I have an immense fondness for this establishment, evidenced by my unbridled enthusiasm towards both its locations; however, I must confess that my predilection inclines me towards the western venue. Their extensive menu boasts an impressive array of more than 20 vegetarian options, which cater to my culinary inclinations as a self-proclaimed habituÃ©. The delectable offerings include an assortment of remarkable salads, such as the Bruschette Salad, which I highly recommend, and the Athens Fries, whose excellence transcends mere description. My ardent affection for this eatery is such that, were it feasible, I would partake in their gastronomic delights on a daily basis."

"Oh, what a delightful culinary escapade I embarked upon in Henderson! Meandering aimlessly in search of a delectable luncheon, my peregrinations led me to an array of unremarkable chain restaurants that failed to entice my gastronomical inclinations. Just as I was about to resign myself to the uninspired fare of Taco Bell, my gaze alighted upon an unexpected oasis amidst the arid retail landscape - a newly established Trader Joe's! 

Boasting an immaculate interior replete with expansive aisles and an abundance of tantalizing products, this novel emporium exuded an irresistible appeal, its pristine atmosphere redolent of the invigorating scent of a new automobile. Furthermore, the absence of the throngs of patrons that often beset the San Francisco locations rendered the experience even more enjoyable. 

My attention was captivated by the pre-prepared sandwich section, which offered several vegetarian options. Opting for the PB&J sandwich lunch bag at a most reasonable price of $3.49, I was introduced to an unprecedented gustatory combination that piqued my interest. This innovative offering comprised a half PB&J sandwich accompanied by a diminutive bag of freshly cut green apples, a similarly sized packet of 100-calorie cookies, a length of string cheese, and a small bottle of water. Although the sandwich itself was not without its flaws - the bread exhibited a certain dryness, while the peanut butter and jelly filling displayed an uncommon stiffness in texture - the assortment of complementary edibles in the bag ensured that my gastronomic excursion remained thoroughly satisfying. 

At a mere $3.49, I consider this culinary adventure an unmitigated success. My fervent hope is that fate will smile upon me, allowing me to encounter this delightful Trader Joe's creation once again upon my return to San Francisco."
People honestly review airports? As if you have options? As if you honestly decide whether or not to visit a city because of it's airport? The fact this this has 800+ reviews blew my mind!

"Although the eatery's ambiance may not be particularly elaborate or sophisticated, the culinary offerings more than compensate for any perceived deficiencies in terms of aesthetic appeal. Indeed, the flavors and aromas emanating from the kitchen are reminiscent of those found in establishments featured on the popular food network show, Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. In fact, the quality and presentation of the dishes served at Flavors of Louisiana are such that one might surmise that the proprietors have successfully implemented a formula for creating an unparalleled gastronomical experience. The essence of this formula seems to lie in the harmonious marriage of various ingredients, skillfully combined to produce a symphony of flavors that tantalize the palate and satisfy even the most discerning of diners. Furthermore, the absence of an excessive amount of grease in the dishes allows the natural flavors of the components to shine through, thereby enhancing the overall enjoyment of the meal. Additionally, the generous portions served at Flavors of Louisiana make it an excellent value for the price, especially considering the high quality of the cuisine. While a liquor license would undoubtedly enhance the dining experience by allowing patrons to enjoy a cold beverage alongside their meal, it is not necessary to appreciate the exceptional quality of the food. In conclusion, Flavors of Louisiana is an exemplary establishment that sets itself apart from other restaurants in the area due to its commitment to serving delectable and satisfying dishes that showcase the rich culinary heritage of Louisiana."

"Gourmet sandwiches, albeit delectable, tend to necessitate consumption in multiples of 1.5 to 2 units per individual, thereby rendering the overall experience somewhat costly. Nonetheless, for those seeking purely sensory gratification or possessing limited appetites, this venue remains an excellent choice for social gatherings. The sole drawback consists of the prolonged queues that often ensue."

"We celebrated our tenth anniversary at this establishment, having previously visited and thus being cognizant of the culinary offerings. Upon perusing the menu, we noted that it now features a greater variety of Ã  la carte options, allowing patrons to either curtail their expenses by selecting fewer courses or indulge in the unlimited fondue experience. Our dining experience was further enhanced by the utilization of a Groupon, which the restaurant graciously accepted. While my personal preference did not incline towards the Swiss cheese fondue that we ordered as an appetizer, my spouse expressed satisfaction with it, indicating that it may have been a matter of individual taste. The remaining courses were thoroughly enjoyed, with portion sizes that were adequate yet not excessive, leading to a sense of satiation. We opted to share a single dessert, which served as a suitable conclusion to the meal. Although the service was somewhat sluggish (and the dining area was not particularly busy), this venue is not intended for those seeking a hasty dining experience, rendering it a minor inconvenience. I derive pleasure from partaking in a leisurely dinner and savoring the ambiance."

"Upon finally indulging in the culinary offerings of Caffe Boa, I must admit that my expectations were surpassed by the gastronomical delights presented before me. Following the unfortunate spectacle of Payton's porcine butchery at Devoured, I felt compelled to sample the fare of this establishment, and I am pleased to report that my experience was largely satisfactory. \n\nThe colossal paper cone of french fries that I requested as an appetizer was indeed impressive, and the accompanying sauces elevated the dish to a level of unparalleled flavor. However, my selection of a calzone as the main course proved to be a questionable decision, as it failed to meet my expectations of a traditional calzone. Although the flatbread housing the ingredients was unique and enjoyable, the overall composition of the dish struck me as somewhat unconventional. While the quality of the ingredients within the calzone was undeniable, I cannot claim that it fully satisfied my cravings. Nonetheless, the service provided by the staff was commendable, and I appreciated the ambiance of the patio area. Unfortunately, the uninspired atmosphere of the strip mall in which Caffe Boa resides detracted from my overall satisfaction."

If you have perused a few of my critiques, you would be cognizant of the fact that I do not frequently visit or endorse numerous franchise eateries. However, Texas Roadhouse constitutes one of the rare exceptions to this rule. I have had the pleasure of dining at eight distinct establishments across five separate states, and each experience has been characterized by satisfactory service, meticulously prepared steaks, and an exceptional value proposition. This particular location upholds the same lofty standards, boasting a commendable server, delectable fare, and a seamless call-ahead seating system that minimizes waiting time to a mere sixty seconds.

Smooth, rich, flavorful.... vegan?  I was a bit doubtful about trying soy gelato (soy-lato?), but after trying the spicy chocolate, I was hooked.  I had a mix of the chocolate soy and a regular mixed berry, and while both were very good, the mixed berry was a bit more icy rather than smooth.  The spicy chocolate was very rich, smooth, and had great spicy flavor.  I could not taste any real \"soy\" flavor either, which was nice.  They have a diverse selection of flavors, including sugar free selections.  Definitely a great place to get dessert!

"A remarkably satisfactory breakfast venue, located approximately 10-15 minutes away from the strip, rendering it a worthwhile excursion. We had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable offerings at an early hour, around 9 am on a Wednesday, and were impressed by the bustling atmosphere, which suggested that tardiness in arriving might result in a delay in being seated. Upon our prompt seating, we opted for Mama's French toast, accompanied by eggs and a choice of either bacon, sausage, or ham, with the latter being our preference. Additionally, Anthony selected the ham steak plate, which included toast (specifically Texas toast), potatoes, and eggs, all of which were expertly prepared and presented. The culinary experience was thoroughly enjoyable, satisfying our breakfast cravings, and we were also afforded the opportunity to encounter Mr. Mama, a gracious and dedicated proprietor who took great pride in ensuring the satisfaction of his patrons, even extending the offer of coffee refills personally."

Literally hadn't been here in years. Went today to see 'Takin over the Asylum' and it was a great production! The theatre itself is beautiful, very classical with a massive chandelier and everything! Students get \u00a35 tickets on Wednesday matinees too!

"It is utterly impossible to refrain from bursting into laughter, as I am compelled to quote Nicole W. for the second time, for she succinctly encapsulated the essence of Alexander Michael's by stating, 'Alexander Michael's is the quintessential go-to spot for solid food, good drinks, and superb company, all packaged into a quaint little spot in the 4th ward.' Particularly for those residing within walking distance, this establishment represents a veritable haven where one can repeatedly indulge in unpretentious culinary delights, complemented by an impressive array of artisanal beverages. My personal experience involved consuming their delectable chicken pita, which surpassed my expectations with its impeccably cooked, seasoned chicken nestled within a warm, sturdy pita bread. Furthermore, a side of beans satiated my additional craving for protein, obviating the need for the ubiquitous French fries. 

The ambiance of the restaurant is undeniably captivating, boasting a unique charm that is accentuated by the presence of a beam in the ladies' room, which has become the unsuspecting victim of numerous visitors who have inadvertently collided with the structural element. Moreover, the menu features a historical account of the house, providing patrons with engaging reading material while they await the arrival of their initial round of orders. 

My sole criticism pertains to the presence of a television in the dining area, which seems somewhat incongruous with the otherwise cozy atmosphere created by the low ceilings. However, this minor drawback does not detract significantly from the overall appeal of Alexander Michael's, which remains an ideal setting for savoring a satisfying meal amidst convivial surroundings."

"Upon entering this establishment, one cannot help but notice the unique feature that graces the entrance; a large fish tank that serves as the floor, providing an unconventional yet captivating welcome to the premises. The interior design boasts a contemporary flair, with sleek lines and a palette of muted hues that exude a relaxed ambiance. On a Wednesday evening, we opted to partake in a pre-dinner libation at the bar, where the atmosphere was tranquil and the clientele sparse, allowing us to savor the experience without the encumbrance of overwhelming crowds. The sushi that followed was a culinary delight, with each piece expertly prepared and presented, showcasing the freshness and quality of the ingredients. However, a minor drawback was encountered in the form of the bathroom's sink, whose unconventional faucet design, while aesthetically pleasing, proved problematic in terms of functionality, as the water flow was erratic and required a forceful slamming of the handle to activate, resulting in an inconsistent and somewhat messy experience. Nonetheless, the overall enjoyment of our visit remained undiminished."

What a great "Americana" restaurant! This place brings back so many memories of what used to be very popular restaurant's back in the day ~  the buffet/cafeteria's.  This Furr's is conveniently located just west of the 101 Hwy on Grand and Sun City.  You can tell this Furr's has been around since the fifties based on their sign and building but they have done a very nice job maintaining everything inside and out.  

I had a very enjoyable lunch last with some fellow Yelper's; Rand H., Mike C. and Scott W..  This Furr's is a cafeteria however once you go through the line once, you can go back as many times as you like to, all for the same price of $7.39.  I really liked this concept because your not picking through what other the prior people have handled ~ you know what I mean!  You choose what you want and they serve it to you.  

They have most of the traditional "Americana" food options to choose from.  I recommend when you first go through the line asking for smaller portions and trying more varieties of things.  This way you can refill on what you really like without over stuffing yourself.  Everything was very tasty and fresh.  I'm looking forward to going back to this Furr's so hopefully I will see you there.

I have had the pleasure of frequenting Culver's on multiple occasions, and my son has developed an unwavering fondness for their delectable cheese curds, which are truly exceptional and worthy of high praise. Prior to visiting Five Guys, I harbored reservations regarding the pricing of Culver's, categorizing it as somewhat expensive in relation to other fast food establishments. However, upon experiencing the gastronomic delights offered by Five Guys, I now comprehend the disparity in quality and am willing to compensate the additional expense for a superior dining experience, specifically Culver's signature Butter Burger. In conclusion, Culver's surpasses its fast food competitors in Surprise, Arizona, in terms of culinary excellence and value, rendering any previous misgivings regarding price utterly irrelevant. The restaurant's shakes are also noteworthy for their rich, creamy texture and delightful flavors, while their burgers and fries are cooked to perfection, further solidifying Culver's status as a premier dining destination. It is worth mentioning that the cheese curds remain the undisputed highlight of the menu, warranting repeated visits and enthusiastic endorsements.

My spouse and I opted to dine at this eatery on a Friday evening, taking advantage of the pleasant atmospheric conditions by occupying a table outside. Although the outdoor seating area was somewhat congested, it did not detract from our enjoyment of the experience. In fact, it was evident that the establishment made a concerted effort to accommodate as many patrons as possible in their patio space. Furthermore, they offered an English version of their menu, which was beneficial for us since our proficiency in French was limited.

The restaurant boasted an extensive array of diverse pizza options, accompanied by a vast selection of toppings. However, this abundance of choices proved to be somewhat overwhelming, making it challenging for us to make a decision regarding our order. Consequently, it required some time for us to finalize our selection.

Upon conclusion of our meal, we relished the delectable pizza, savoring each bite while engaging in leisurely conversation. The crust was cooked to perfection, and the numerous toppings necessitated the use of utensils to consume it properly. Despite the impressive quality of the food, the service left room for improvement. Specifically, I had to hail the server multiple times to request additional water. Notwithstanding this drawback, I would still highly recommend this establishment to anyone visiting Montreal in the future.

"I have been indulging in the luxury of bringing esteemed individuals to this exquisite establishment for a quarter of a century, relishing in the ambiance and delectable cuisine that has consistently impressed my guests, whether it be for commemorating momentous occasions, bidding farewell to respected educators, or simply treating out-of-town visitors to an unforgettable Sunday repast."

"The gastronomical experience offered by this establishment is quite impressive, particularly in light of its modest pricing. The fare provided is of a superior quality, catering to both vegan and vegetarian dietary preferences. The staff exhibits a commendable level of courtesy and attention to detail, ensuring a seamless dining experience for patrons. Furthermore, the musical ambiance is well-curated and maintained at a comfortable volume, creating a convivial atmosphere conducive to socializing or productivity. While the menu may be somewhat restricted in scope, it is important to note that the venue compensates for this limitation with an array of scrumptious, animal-friendly pastries. Lastly, the intimate nature of the dining space actually facilitates focus and efficiency for those seeking to combine a satisfying meal with work or other creative pursuits."

"I have an unwavering affection for Grand Lux Cafe, a sentiment that is underscored by my unrelenting enthusiasm for the establishment's culinary offerings and exceptional service. Although the present location may not quite rival the opulence of the Venetian site, it nevertheless exudes an aura of elegance and refinement that is complemented by the spaciousness and pristine condition of the facility. The staff is remarkably attentive and courteous, ensuring that each dining experience is a true delight. Of particular note is the Molten Chocolate Cake, a delectable masterpiece that lives up to its name and promises to satiate even the most discerning palates. It is advisable to place an order for this divine dessert early on in the meal, preferably upon ordering one's first course or appetizer, so as to allow for the approximately 20-minute preparation time and ensure that it arrives at the table in a timely fashion."

This review is for the hotel only.  The room was exceptionally nice for the price. Clean and modern. The bed was also very comfortable--great pillows.  The shower was the best ever--convenient shelf, good lighting, great pressure. A nice lighted makeup mirror too that swivels for those of us that prefer to shave in the shower.    The rooms were quiet and the ventilation was excellent. These are the things a hotel room should be judged by.   

Staff seemed pleasant and cooperative. Willing to accommodate when they can.  Not 5 stars only because my room service meals were a little inconsistent.  

The location speaks for itself. It's not the strip--thankfully.

I thoroughly relished my experience at this establishment! Upon arriving early on a Thursday evening, we opted to partake in some libations, only to discover that the bartender had graciously offered complimentary well drinks for the initial sixty minutes. Such an auspicious occurrence proved to be particularly serendipitous for our group, with the exception of a singular individual who had elected to order a non-well beverage, thereby incurring an exorbitant fee. The ambiance within the venue was remarkably tranquil, featuring ample seating areas and a sonorous soundtrack that contributed to its overall convivial atmosphere. It would be egregious folly to overlook this hidden gem merely due to its location removed from the primary thoroughfare, as the meager cost of a taxi ride and the advantages of arriving promptly render it eminently worthwhile.

Mystery Castle is pretty dang weird.  You get a lot of the vibe just by looking online, but it's definitely interesting to see in person.  The guy who built it used a lot of cheap, recycled items.  I was most fascinated by the burned bricks, they were super cool!  The two guys working were so incredibly nice and enthusiastic during the tour.  It's cash only, and I thought it was worth the price. However, it really seemed like the creator was a d-bag.  When you read the synopsis, he built a real castle for his daughter - who he had abandoned 15 years before.  Sure, it sounds like he had some redeeming moments when he contacted his wife and kid that he had left without a word and passed on his money to them after he finally kicked it, but the guy had an elaborate bar with a \"wishing well\" (which was pretty clever) so people could order their drinks downstairs and have them brought upstairs, because he hosted a lot of parties.  Just, you know, without his wife and kid.  It would have been nice to go on the tour when Mary Lou was still around, because she's the one I actually find interesting in the family.  Cool experience, but the thing my husband & I talked about most afterwards was the dad who left his daughter when she was 4 years old and thought about her from afar.

The text is: Mystery Castle is pretty dang weird.  You get a lot of the vibe just by looking online, but it's definitely interesting to see in person.  The guy who built it used a lot of cheap, recycled items.  I was most fascinated by the burned bricks, they were super cool!  The two guys working were so incredibly nice and enthusiastic during the tour.  It's cash only, and I thought it was worth the price. However, it really seemed like the creator was a d-bag.  When you read the synopsis, he built a real castle for his daughter - who he had abandoned 15 years before.  Sure, it sounds like he had some redeeming moments when he contacted his wife and kid that he had left without a word and passed on his money to them after he finally kicked it, but the guy had an elaborate bar with a \"wishing well\" (which was pretty clever) so people could order their drinks downstairs and have them brought upstairs, because he hosted a lot of parties.  Just, you know, without his wife and kid.  It would have been nice to go on the tour when Mary Lou was still around, because she's the one I actually find interesting in the family.  Cool experience, but the thing my husband & I talked about most afterwards was the dad who left his daughter when she was 4 years old and thought about her from afar.

The modified text is:

Enigmatic Mystery Castle presents an unconventional and captivating ambiance, which can be perceived through both virtual and physical means. The resourceful builder, who opted for a plethora of economical and recycled materials, has crafted a structure that exudes an air of peculiarity. My fascination with the charred bricks, in particular, was piqued during the tour, as they boasted an undeniable allure. The two gentlemen conducting the tour radiated warmth and fervor, making the experience even more enjoyable. Although cash payment was the sole option, I deemed it a worthy investment. Notwithstanding, the castle's creator appeared to possess a questionable character, as evidenced by his abandonment of his four-year-old daughter and subsequent lack of involvement in her life. Despite occasional displays of compassion towards his family, he prioritized hosting numerous social gatherings, complete with an innovative \"wishing well\" bar feature. Unfortunately, these events took place sans his spouse and offspring. A tantalizing experience, yet the most discussed aspect post-tour revolved around the father's decision to desert his daughter at such a tender age and his subsequent remorse.

"The quality of service remains satisfactory, however, my frequentation of the establishment has diminished subsequent to the augmentation of prices, concurrently accompanied by a decline in culinary excellence."

Ah, Parc Jean Drapeau, the memories...
When just dating my hubby, we'd spend an hour everyday after work walking and talking, getting to know each other at this park.
The beautiful trails, the vast places to sit and relax and all the events that occur there it's just a great Montreal landmark and for good reason.
When you want to have a nice day outdoors and not leave the island just head out there and enjoy.

"My spouse and I have frequented Minecci's on multiple occasions. Although we have not indulged in their pasta dishes, the items we have ordered have been palatable. Specifically, our preference is for the lightly battered cod, which is adorned with marinara sauce and a few kalamata olives. While the breading could be omitted, the dish remains flavorful. The soup has consistently been of high quality, while the salads, though unremarkable, are still adequate. However, my sole criticism of their culinary offerings pertains to the veal parmigiana. I found it to be somewhat lacking in quality, particularly given the price point, and surmised that this was due to the utilization of ground meat rather than a filet. \n\nThe ambiance of Minecci's can be described as nostalgic and subdued, yet it exudes a certain charm reminiscent of a quaint family eatery. The dÃ©cor, though not lavish, appears well-maintained. This establishment may not be suitable for a sophisticated urban dweller's evening out, but it serves as a cozy setting for a casual date or intimate family gathering."

OMG! This place has SO much stuff and a really big selection. I would've probably bought alot of clothes here but I already did alot of damage at the outlet stores. The women's selection is huge and the ones in SF do not even compare! This place is crowded and noisey. I didn't like that one of the cashiers only accepted credit or debit cards because it made everyone else paying cash have to wait longer. Unlike SF, they have pulling baskets and not actual shopping carts. I feel sorry for the person who has to clean up the mess at the end of the day.

Found KJ kitchen with  fellow Yelp member's review. It was our first time there and overall the food was simply outstanding! We ordered Pork Belly, Oxtail with red wine and pork chop Cantonese style. All the dishes were delicious including the complimentary soup and dessert! The restaurant was very crowded when we walked in around 7.30pm and we waited for a while for the food to arrive. Still, our overall enjoyment of the food was very positive! Will return but probably either earlier before the dinner crowd or after! Great food that did not disappoint!

The people in there were just great to us. In particular the RN in the cardiac unit that helped me (Morgan) was so cheerful and helpful he really took the edge off of being there. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because of the facility. Yes an older facility will be a bit worn but things that are fixable should be. The hinges on my bathroom door screamed at all hours of the night (and others did as well) and the water faucet shook the whole room when turned on due to air in the lines. Both of these could be remedied with a maintenance person in there for less then 30 minutes.\n\nAll in all though both my wife and I have been admitted to John C. Lincoln and we trust them to take good care of us when needed.

Great company to work with and very affordable prices. Lots of inventory to choose from as well, almost too much :) We did our whole downstairs with wood laminate as well as new baseboards which turned out great. They were very honest people to work with & we will be using them again when we do our upstairs.

First Las Vegas Ramen experience that I indulged in yielded a palatable sensation, prompting me to express my satisfaction with their spicy tonkotsu ramen bowl, which was tantamount to a culinary delight. Additionally, my exploration of their fried rice and gyoza offerings did not elicit any dissatisfaction, as they demonstrated a level of quality that was on par with my expectations. Furthermore, I was pleasantly surprised by the reasonable pricing, which compared favorably to establishments in the Bay Area. Consequently, I shall return to this eatery when hankering for ramen in Las Vegas, and perhaps sample their Tonkotsu-Shoyu Ramen on my subsequent visit.

"Mesa's culinary offerings surpassed my expectations, boasting an impressive array of delectable dishes that catered to my palate's discerning inclinations. The ribeye, in particular, showcased a remarkable depth of flavor, while the jalapeno cornbread exhibited a delightful synergy of spicy and savory elements. Furthermore, the establishment's spacious interior and welcoming ambiance made it an ideal setting for larger gatherings, which we took advantage of during Restaurant Week by indulging in their exceptional three-course prix fixe special for a mere $56 per person."

I have been here since I was a kid. The thai food is F A B U L O U S! The only problem is that they really should waive the extra rice fee of $2.50 if you have four or more people. But other than that, this is the BEST thai food in Las Vegas and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants to try something new or any good thai restaurant.

"The experience was satisfactory, with a range of alternatives available for selection. Its geographical position was advantageous, facilitating ease of access. However, our expectations were not exceedingly elevated."

"The mixologist responsible for concocting the potations at this establishment is truly gifted in their craft, as evidenced by the delectable elixirs they create. Similarly, the culinary masterpieces presented as entrees are equally impressive. However, I must express my disappointment regarding the sashimi, which, despite its exorbitant price tag, failed to meet my expectations in terms of both quantity and quality, when juxtaposed with the superior offerings of my local sushi purveyor. Needless to say, for such a premium price point, I anticipated an unparalleled level of excellence in the fish utilized for the sashimi. Unfortunately, this was not the case. Nonetheless, the lamb belly dish is truly exceptional and unrivaled in its flavor profile. My only regret is that I did not have the opportunity to sample it prior to indulging in the rabbit entree on a subsequent evening, as the lamb's sublime taste would have made for an ideal introduction to the meal."

"We opted to partake in an early evening repast on a Monday, as our offspring were experiencing hunger pangs and were cognizant of the fact that certain establishments offer complimentary nourishment for juveniles on this specific day of the week. Upon arriving at the venue, we were greeted by hostesses who appeared to be engaged in leisurely conversation, leading us to harbor apprehensions regarding the quality of service we would receive, based on previous experiences and reviews. However, we were seated in a timely manner, and our server materialized within a span of two minutes to take our beverage orders. Throughout the meal, the service we received was indeed satisfactory, as our server struck a balance between attentive and unobtrusive, ensuring that our needs were met without being overly intrusive. A male individual, dressed in plain attire, approached our table and enquired about the quality of our dining experience, to which we responded affirmatively. Subsequently, he surreptitiously approached me from behind and removed my empty cup, inquiring whether my server was providing me with an additional beverage. I replied in the negative, and it is worth mentioning that, while we assumed him to be a manager, a introduction or visible identification would have been appreciated. Notwithstanding, the culinary offerings were palatable, and the service generally efficient. It is also worth noting that a prolonged period of time, extending from 11 am to 7 pm, Monday through Friday, is designated as 'happy hour' at this establishment."

"It is comprehensible how an individual can harbor animosity towards this establishment, primarily due to the extensive queue that encircles the premises. The similarity between this scene and the Indiana Jones attraction at Disneyland is uncanny. Fortunately, I possessed a Fast Pass, which enabled me to bypass the line, thereby avoiding an excruciating wait. My acquaintances informed me that certain patrons had been waiting since 10 pm and had only recently reached the front of the line. The prospect of enduring such a lengthy delay was unsettling, to say the least. Upon entering this venue, my inner demon became apparent, albeit metaphorically. The ambiance of this establishment has a peculiar effect on one's psyche, prompting a carefree and whimsical demeanor. Although I typically find house music to be irksome, there was something peculiar about this setting that compelled me to engage in frivolous behavior, characterized by an uncontainable desire to leap up and down. The vast dimensions of this space enable it to accommodate a sizable crowd, comprising individuals who share a common objective: to partake in enjoyable activities. The evening concluded in the early hours of the morning, with my feet experiencing exhaustion to the point of near-crippling discomfort. Nonetheless, I must express my gratitude towards XS for the exceptional treatment I received."

I have nothing but great things to say about the Mac Shack! High quality pasta, fresh vegetables, and a friendly staff! I ordered carry out this time and even after the drive home the food still had great flavor! \n\nGreat vegetarian options!

Of all the novel and contemporary frozen yogurt establishments, this particular venue is the one I visit with the utmost regularity, primarily due to its convenient proximity to Central Phoenix and their exceptional "Twitter Tuesday" promotion. They boast an array of consistent flavors and toppings, which cater to my unwavering predilection for the delectable cookie monster variant, replete with diminutive yet adorable peanut butter cups. While my experiences have led me to surmise that the prices charged by this enterprise are marginally higher than those of their competitors, my unwavering dedication to their Twitter account and exclusive Tuesday patronage have enabled me to capitalize on a covert code word, uttered in a subtly eerie manner, resulting in a gratifying fifty percent reduction in cost. Thus, for two frozen yogurt treats, my beau and I expend approximately five dollars, a sum that can hardly be considered exorbitant or unreasonable.

Overall is a good place to eat. It's a tasty sandwich for a cheap price, specially considering the location.\nI had the all American sandwich which I liked but didn't loved because it had cranberries on it. My boyfriend had the cannonball and loved it.

"Matt Goss, formerly associated with Palms hotel and casino, has now transitioned to Caesar's Palace hotel, bringing his extraordinary talent and captivating stage presence to a new venue. Although I have yet to witness his performance at the latter location, I am confident that it will be equally, if not more, spectacular than his previous shows. Goss's powerful, sensual, and svelte voice, accompanied by his remarkable dancing skills and affection towards his audience, creates an unforgettable experience for those in attendance. Additionally, the inclusion of his skilled band and alluring female dancers further enhances the overall quality of the production. As a result, I find myself compelled to participate in the musical experience, singing and moving in tandem with Goss's performance. Upon receiving the opportunity, I will undoubtedly attend his show at Caesar's Palace, eager to indulge in the enthralling atmosphere once again. Indeed, the show exudes an essence of sexuality and passion, resonating deeply with the audience through its tantalizing music."

wasnt sure what to expect from this place being that it was in the Plaza hotel, but food was good, i had a poke bowl and the wife tried the seared ahi plate and both were very good. Still when it comes to poke, their sister location Poke Express up on Craig rd, is the place to go

Wasn't sure what to expect but it was not cheesy, which I really appreciated. They are funny, a little political, and they do neat illusions.\n\nBefore the show, there's a guy on piano and one on bass. The bass player is an unassuming Penn. There's audience interaction throughout the show. Afterwards, Penn and Teller meet and greet people as they exit until every last person gets a chance for a photo or autograph, which I think is really, really nice.

Beso is situated within the luxurious Crystals shopping mall, in close proximity to the esteemed Aria resort. Upon entering the establishment, we were greeted with exceptional hospitality, as we were promptly seated and presented with an extensive wine list, followed by the rapid arrival of our orders. The prices of the entrees at Beso range from the upper $20s to $50s, and with the addition of tips and taxes, the total cost per person can reach approximately $75, provided that one desires beverages and sides.  

Our culinary excursion began with the delectable oyster shooters, which did not contain alcohol, much to our delight. Among these, the tomato gazpacho oyster shooter reigned supreme in terms of flavor and quality. For our main courses, we opted for both the tuna and salmon options, which were skillfully prepared and served in generous portions. Although sides are available for purchase, they are designed to be shared, and the wild mushroom side dish, priced at $11, was excessively large for two individuals to consume.  

Despite feeling satiated, we were intrigued by the enticing dessert menu and decided to indulge in the heavenly churros, accompanied by a rich caramel sauce and creme. To our astonishment, we managed to devour all six of these delectable treats.  

The lavatory facilities are located upstairs and can be accessed by taking an elevator and navigating through the nightclub. Additionally, Beso features an outdoor patio seating area and a cozy dining room, the latter of which is not particularly spacious but offers comfortable booths. Our table offered a picturesque view of Aria's fountain, as well as a distant perspective of New York, New York's iconic fake Empire State Building, providing a sense of familiarity and comfort, reminiscent of dining at the renowned Zylo Steakhouse within the W hotel.

I always have a great time. 

Huzzah !

If you love the sun and happy people then this is the place for you.

The price to enter is a little spendy but for a full day of fun and people watching it is worth it. I suggest this festival and all it has to offer.

Wow!  I was introduced to this place by my friend who is a local in Vegas.  She asked me to ride the free shuttle out here from the strip, mainly because driving on the strip is so nasty!  So I rode out and met her at Sam's Town.  I must say, I was quite impressed by the interior of this place.  Very western feel to it. 

The place itself is huge!  It has 2 floors of gambling, and a huge movie theatre!  I ate at the buffet here also.. the food was impressingly good for the price!  They have a different food theme every day of the week.  I was there on Saturday, which happens to be Prime Rib night.  I did not know there was a bowling alley there too, but I'm going to come here next time I am in town!  

I definately liked gambling here much more than on the strip.  I never win anything on the strip.  I gambled at Sam's town for at least 2 or 3 hours, but I didn't lose a dime!  I came out positive!  I don't know if I was just lucky or what.. but the machines were really generous to me!  Also, the cocktail waitresses come around quite often!  It was really a great experience.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be taking the shuttle back to Sam's Town!  =)

I have had a membership with Massage Heights for about 9 months now. I will probably never do it again. I like this place, but I work at a resort on the strip and they add more to the experience. It is always the little things such as the extra pampering, water and healthy snacks before and after. I know that my place of work doesn't offer a membership, but it is worth the money everyone once in a while. I will completing my 1 year contract\nOf massages with Massage Heights, but will not do another membership with them since I feel for what I pay for I can get better service elsewhere.

I am also somewhat conflicted about Tram's.  I have been a few times now, and it seems to be somewhat hit or miss.  I've had the Pho a few times, and while always fairly good my satisfaction largely hinges on the amount and freshness of basil and mint that is brought out.  The other dishes are usually well made and well seasoned.  \n\nI enjoy the short menu and the waiter who is fun to interact with.  This place is usually pretty busy even on a weekday evening.  Surprising given the location.  Definitely better than Pho Minh up the street, but I still think Spice Island has the best Vietnamese dishes in town.

"On my inaugural visit to this eatery, I must confess that my culinary experience has been utterly transformed, as my previous lack of enthusiasm towards Asian cuisine has been drastically altered to an unwavering fondness, thus ensuring my future patronage."

I am perpetually dubious when I venture into a Thai eatery, as my unwavering fondness for massaman curry (and its cognates) has led me to experience a wide range of inconsistent quality across the Thai culinary landscape. I have encountered an array of subpar massaman preparations, including those that are inordinately saline, nearly raw, or devoid of flavor. Motivated by my unrelenting quest for a satisfactory massaman experience, I opted to sample the offering at this particular establishment.

The massaman curry presented itself as a veritable delight, boasting a rich, velvety texture and a profound depth of flavor. The potatoes were cooked to perfection, their tender flesh yielding easily to the fork. The shrimp, albeit retaining their tails, were succulent and flavorsome. While the sauce exhibited a faint similarity to tomato bisque soup, it was nonetheless savory and well-balanced. I thoroughly enjoyed this dish, and it satiated my craving for a genuinely satisfying massaman experience.

The ambiance of the restaurant was pleasing, with wooden accents ubiquitous throughout the space. Although the layout was not overly cramped with tables, the floor appeared slightly unkempt, its glossy surface reflecting the evening sun's rays with unfortunate clarity. My criticism notwithstanding, I relished the meal and harbor intentions to revisit the establishment for further indulgence in their massaman curry, while omitting the dessert course in favor of more palatable options.

"Wow, this culinary establishment is quite delectable. I visited this eatery with a sizable assemblage of epicureans and had the opportunity to sample an array of their offerings. Among the hors d'oeuvres, we indulged in the foie gras, spicy crab salad, and tuna tartare. For my main course, I opted for the'surf and turf,' which deviated from the traditional format, as it consisted of a substantial portion of foie gras accompanied by a piece of butterfish. This delectable dish was situated atop a bed of shredded Brussels sprouts and was complemented by a rich black truffle sauce, resulting in an unparalleled gastronomic experience. In addition, I ventured to sample various other dishes and sides, such as the creamed spinach, gnocchi, and lobster au curry. Notably, the creamed spinach was sublime. To conclude my meal, I relished the chocolate soufflÃ©, mixed candy bar, and chocolate and praline bush. The soufflÃ© emerged as the most exceptional dessert, and it was accompanied by a side of pistachio ice cream, further enhancing its flavor profile."

This is a great places to have happy hour with friends.  I enjoy everything here from the atmosphere to the drink specials and sushi.  They offer a variety of fun martinis and have good happy hour prices on sushi and nigiri.  It is also fun to enjoy your meal while sitting at the sushi bar and watching the chefs make your food fresh right in front of you.

If you want a good, interesting burger in Las Vegas... this is the place.  Good, crispy fries (including sweet potato and oxtail chili!)  The burgers are nuts-- the Bahn Mi and Kalbi burgers are my favorites.  Haven't tried the "wagyu and foie gras" burger yet.

OK, here comes the maybe-not-so-good stuff.  It's kind of a strip mall feeling.  Because it's in a strip mall.  And... the meat isn't the best burger meat I've ever had.  Kind of tastes frozen... or just CAFO-beefy.  Not bad, but not particularly beefy. They definitely focus on dressing up the average burger meat well.  

But, they do that.  The burgers are great, and the beer selection's particularly good for Las Vegas, where most places seem hell-bent on serving Lite Beer or Blue Moon and that's all.

Worth a drive and a bit of a search to find if you're anywhere near there.

"As an itinerant patron, I had the pleasure of experiencing the ambiance of this establishment during a recent sojourn, and I must say that I am gratified to have done so. The demographic diversity of the clientele on the particular evening in question (a Friday, to be precise) contributed to a convivial atmosphere, which was further enhanced by the attentive and expeditious service proffered by the staff. It is worth noting, however, that certain patrons may have encountered less-than-ideal sanitary conditions in the restrooms; personally, I have had the misfortune of encountering far more distressing examples of such facilities, and thus, my expectations in this regard were not particularly high. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, I found the experience of consuming beverages from diminutive containers to be quite intriguing, albeit somewhat messy, as I inadvertently spilled a greater quantity of liquid upon my person and the surrounding area than I actually managed to ingest. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly recommend this venue to others and eagerly anticipate my next visit."

"Maggiano's culinary offerings are indeed remarkable, with their chicken Alfredo dish being a personal favorite of mine due to its unparalleled flavor profile. Although I have had the pleasure of sampling various other menu items, this particular entree continues to hold the top spot in my esteem. Additionally, the chicken francese and potato dishes are equally palatable options that contribute to the restaurant's overall gastronomic excellence. Furthermore, the exceptional customer service we received during our visit, particularly from the maitre'd Loray who efficiently accommodated our seating needs, and our attentive server, only served to enhance our dining experience."

"It appears that this eatery is a veritable hit-or-miss affair, with the culinary experience oscillating between exceptional and subpar renditions. I have had the privilege of partaking in their gastronomic offerings on multiple occasions, and while the salad bar consistently impresses, the remaining dishes exhibit marked variability in quality. Despite the occasional inconsistency, I have opted to procure a salad from their establishment on numerous instances, as the convenience of takeout proves an attractive feature. Alas, the popularity of this restaurant during peak hours often translates into a sizeable assemblage of patrons, rendering a tranquil dining experience somewhat unlikely."

I really like George Street, it hosts some of my favourite shops; Cath Kidston, Penhaligons, Coast and Karen Millen and a massive Paperchase to name a few. Even if some of those shops are more for window shopping than a usual shopping spree. In addition all the swish shops there are also a lot of great bars and restaurants too.\n\nOn a summers day it's great to walk along George Street, most of the shops are housed in gorgeous buildings and it isn't as hectic as the likes of Princes Street where crossing the road is like having a near death experience.

"Although not particularly fond of vegan cuisine, I opted to sample it on a whim during my visit to this establishment, which offered an eclectic ambiance that was further enhanced by the friendly demeanor of its staff. My experience took place on a weeknight evening, and while the venue was relatively crowded, I was pleased to observe that the management had adopted commendable measures aimed at minimizing waste and pollution, such as utilizing cardboard packaging instead of Styrofoam for takeout orders and providing wooden utensils, which demonstrated their commitment to environmental sustainability. However, I did notice a minor inconsistency in their approach, as they placed the entire order in a plastic bag, which seemed incongruous with their otherwise admirable efforts to reduce waste; nonetheless, this did not detract significantly from my overall satisfaction with the dining experience."

Bask In the Ambiance Bask in the Ambiance. Plenty of seating. I prefer to sit at the bar so i did. A Few tvs with sports on while your rolls are being made. They have happy hour on the weekends though i Opted for all you can eat. The rolls that arent included in AYCE are only 99 cents which is a score. I must say HONEY ROLL HONEY ROLL is where its at. Also a 1/2lb of crab legs with dinner all you can eat for 9.99 that cant be beat. 

The rolls come out fast and fresh. Not to much rice either. Im a fan of the Rainbow roll as well. The service was a little slow to remove my plates and keep my drink refilled in the beginning but they made up for it and then some. Once im on this side of town in the future and want Sushi i know where ill be going for Lunch. Also they have Kobe Burgers on the menu which seems more than appetizer to me, so they would probably put me in a food coma. Love the ingenuity of the names and ingredients with the rolls. 
Kudos

#aroundchandler So I finally made it here. So much hype about this place. Now I don't consider myself your average wing eater. I eat a serious amount of buffalo wings. I even made it to state championship for a wing eating contest. The wings here are good. The wings them self are average, but the sauces are way above average.  I always judge wings based on the standard hot. The hot was fairly hot, but very tasty. I also tried the ATL rub. The flavor was fantastic. I'm not a cool aid drinker, I stay away from sugar. But the fact they had cool aid I thought was pretty cool.  I will be a regular here and will try all 18 flavors of wings!!   #chandleraz

We indulged in a delectable luncheon at an all-you-can-eat establishment, whereupon we were presented with an array of gastronomical options, each station showcasing a distinct culinary style. While the diversity of the offerings was indeed impressive, the quality of the fare was somewhat inconsistent, with certain dishes proving to be palatable while others fell short of our expectations. However, the beauty of a smorgasbord lies in its ability to allow patrons to sample a variety of edibles without committing to a single plate, thereby enabling us to savor an assortment of flavors and textures. According to our familial consensus, the standout items on this particular visit were the chilled and grilled jumbo shrimp, coleslaw, corn bread, Italian chicken stew, bok choy, carne asada, flan, and chocolate mousse cake.

I have to admit - I'm a huge fan of this ampitheater mainly in comparison to the ones in the DC area. It was really easy to get to, easy to park and easy to get in and get seated. 
Back in July, I went to see Dave Matthews and had a GREAT time, mostly because of the venue. They were pretty lenient - you're allowed to bring in food items as long as they are in one ziplock bag. I did that instead of getting screwed by the vendors.
All in all, I was just grateful not to have to wait 3 hours to get to the ampitheater and then another 4 hours to get out (Nissan Pavilion, I'm looking at you). 
Loved it!

"The assessments provided by previous patrons did not engage in hyperbole when alluding to the sluggish nature of the hospitality experience; rather, the duration of time elapsed between the placement of our order and its subsequent delivery rendered the dining encounter utterly woeful. Notwithstanding this unfortunate circumstance, the culinary offerings, particularly the steak and eggs, did possess an undeniable appeal, with each bite showcasing a profound richness of flavor that, alas, could not compensate for the protracted delay preceding their arrival."

When pondering the optimal venue for indulging in a delectable steak dinner, my cognitive faculties invariably gravitated towards The Greentree Inn, an eatery that, despite its proximity to my domicile, had remained unexplored throughout my residency in the vicinity. Upon deciding to patronize this particular establishment, I was delighted by the exceptional quality of the culinary offerings and felt an appreciation for the ambiance that permeated the interior space.

"It is gratifying to observe a chain that is dedicated to delivering a high-quality product and exemplary service, as demonstrated by the consistency in taste and presentation across different locations. Recently, while visiting Phoenix, my spouse and I decided to dine at a Habit Burger Grill nearby our accommodations, primarily to assess the uniformity of their offerings. Indeed, our meals were comparable in quality and flavor to those we have previously enjoyed at a Habit restaurant in California. Notwithstanding the slightly elevated pricing relative to portion size, we would unhesitatingly endorse and revisit this establishment for satisfying our cravings for delectable burgers."

"Mmmmmm...gastronomical excellence personified by an unctuous, savory delight...I mean, simply dabbing it with a napkin would not suffice, for the palatable, mouthwatering slices remained resolutely saturated with an abundance of rich, velvety grease...kind of good, if you will! 

In pursuit of a culinary experience beyond the ubiquitous franchises, I ventured forth to New York Pizza, only to find the establishment bustling with activity on this particular Wednesday evening. Undeterred, I expedited my order with alacrity, opting for a solitary pepperoni slice...which, much to my satisfaction, cost a mere trifle of $3! 

The interior ambiance, though modest in its appointments, exuded a certain charm, comprising a few tables, chairs, booths, and televisions...unpretentious, yet functional. 

To my delight, my pizza emerged from the kitchen with remarkable celerity, allowing me to hasten my departure with minimal delay! 

The crust of the pizza demonstrated a satisfying texture, generously adorned with an array of pepperonis, cheese, and, of course, a copious amount of that delectable, golden elixir known as grease. The sauce, too, boasted a subtle, yet tangible piquancy, striking a harmonious balance between flavors that left me in accord with Ben G's sentiments; although diverging from the traditional New York-style pizza, it remained undeniably scrumptious!
