My gastronomical exploration of this eatery merely whetted my appetite for further indulgence, particularly after laying eyes on the delectable Philly cheesesteak that another patron had ordered, its tantalizing aroma wafting through the air, beckoning me to return and sample its splendor."
This place rocks! Can dine inside at a booth with TV or on the patio w/ your mut! The aju sliders are delish!

"Two Words = Exceptional Culinary Experience.

Every staff member at this eatery exudes amiability, which distinguishes them from numerous establishments in Las Vegas, thereby creating a welcoming ambiance for patrons.

1 star = Efficient production line, where each individual behind the counter exhibits cordiality and warmth, thus providing an excellent initiation to the dining experience.

2 stars = The proprietor extended a warm greeting, presented us with samples of their delectable offerings, and ensured that we thoroughly enjoyed our meal, exemplifying exceptional customer service and fostering loyal clientele.

3 stars = Kalua pig flavor = explosively delicious. A culinary masterpiece that bursts with flavor upon consumption, bearing no resemblance to bland, mass-produced fast food fare.

4 stars = COCONUT BARK = sublime indulgence. This reviewer craves this restaurant's proximity to home, allowing for frequent replenishment of their addictive coconut bark, priced at $3.50 per bag, yet well worth the expense, accompanied by a generous portion. However, reluctance to share arises, so procure your own! (Humorous tone).

The sole absence of the fifth star stems from the minor setback of slightly disintegrating tacos and burritos during consumption, attributed to the novelty of the restaurant and potential wrapping and filling technique refinement. Nonetheless, a superb destination for seekers of rapid, delectable Hawaiian-inspired cuisine, with the coconut bark being an unforgettable highlight."

It was a quick trip downtown from Mesa, I didnt like some of the people getting on the train but hey its public transport. My legs were also hurting from the seats on the short trip downtown I have RLS and man it hurt for days after. It was great for saving gas and if I worked by one I would take it daily. This was my first time so watch where you park by the pickup locations cause I got my car towed, $200 fine!!! I would take it downtown again but park in the right spot this time.

"We opted for the wedding helicopter package, which afforded us the opportunity to tie the knot while on a nocturnal aerial excursion above the Las Vegas Strip; an experience that proved to be utterly breathtaking and unforgettable. As we were seated in close proximity to the pilot, the panoramic view from the aircraft's window gave us the illusion that we were actively participating in the flight itself, rendering the occasion even more extraordinary. 

The service provider offered an additional photography package, which we decided to incorporate into our wedding plan, and we were delighted that we did so. The photographer captured numerous memorable moments, thereby providing us with a treasured keepsake that we can cherish for years to come. Given that the same individual who took our photographs would also be responsible for recording the ceremony on video, we elected not to avail ourselves of the latter service, reasoning that it might be challenging for a single person to competently fulfill both roles simultaneously. In hindsight, we are grateful for our decision.

Prior to embarking on the aerial voyage, it is advisable to ensure that the microphone embedded in your headset functions properly. Unfortunately, my own microphone malfunctioned, necessitating me to repeat my vows several times before they were audible to others. Despite this minor setback, the overall experience was truly fantastic, and anyone considering a similar arrangement for their nuptials can rest assured that they will be ecstatic with their decision."

"Indubitably, another quintessential Charlotte establishment for an opulent and amorous dining experience. Upon entering the Fig Tree, I was eager to indulge in their culinary offerings, having already determined my entree of choice prior to arrival. Fortuitously, my companion, with her refined sensibilities, had secured reservations during the Yuletide season, thereby enhancing the ambiance to suit our preferences. I opted for the grouper, lavishly adorned with a rich butter sauce and succulent lobster meat, which proved to be an exquisite selection. The cheese plate we shared preceding the entrees was satisfactory, albeit perhaps slightly overpriced at $17. Unfortunately, my companion did not share my enthusiasm for her pork chop entree, expressing disappointment with the preparation of the chops, which were allegedly too fatty. I sampled the chops subsequently, and while they did possess a notable amount of fat, I persevered and enjoyed them nonetheless. The hospitality we received was exceptional and charming, and despite the minor drawbacks, the overall experience was sufficient to warrant future visits."

"It is my utmost pleasure to indulge in the delectable offerings of Dunkin Donuts, with a particular fondness for the Toasted Coconut and Chocolate Frosted cake variety; these scrumptious treats constitute the epitome of culinary excellence, in my humble opinion. The vast majority of the time, I opt for the Coffee & 2 donuts combination, as it provides an ideal balance between satisfying my craving for caffeine and indulging in the rich, sweet flavors of the aforementioned donuts. My frequent patronage of this establishment has led to a familiarity with the staff, who have become adept at recognizing my voice when placing orders via the drive-thru; this rapport has been fostered by my consistent ordering of the Toasted Coconut & Chocolate Frosted cake duo, which, I must stress, is a crucial aspect of my Dunkin Donuts experience. It is worth noting that, on occasion, the staff has erroneously provided me with a chocolate glazed or chocolate frosted glazed donut, which, while delicious in their own right, do not compare to the unparalleled taste of the Toasted Coconut & Chocolate Frosted cake. To ensure an optimal experience for patrons such as myself, I highly recommend taking advantage of the coffee punch card, particularly if one tends to favor medium-sized cups of coffee."

I like the large selection of tapas.  My husband and I tried many several different plates, 1-2 from each section.  Favorites are deep dried artichoke and the foie gras.  The deep fried beignets (bunuelos) were delicious!

"I had the pleasure of partaking in an evening outing with my significant other at this establishment, and I must say that my expectations were thoroughly surpassed by the ambiance, hospitality, and culinary offerings. The ingredients utilized in the preparation of the dishes were remarkably fresh and delectable, with the Chow Mein being particularly impressive, boasting an unparalleled level of quality that rendered it the most satisfying instance of its kind that I have had the pleasure of consuming in recent memory. The staff members were incredibly cordial and attentive, providing a level of service that greatly enhanced our overall experience. However, I must admit that the lone sushi roll we sampled, specifically the Golden Cali Roll, fell somewhat short of my lofty expectations, eliciting a tepid response from myself, although my companion seemed to derive greater enjoyment from it."
Didn't really feel welcome. However, the roast beef sandwich with blue cheese was outstanding.  Probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.

We indulged in a luxurious sojourn at the illustrious Golden Nugget from June 29th to 30th, 2013, marking our maiden stay at this esteemed establishment and any hotel in the downtown area. Our opulent Rush Tower suite surpassed our previous accommodations at the Palazzo, where we customarily reside. Despite various factors that could have potentially impeded our stay, including sweltering temperatures of 117 degrees, financial losses, and the presence of our 10-year-old offspring, we experienced an unparalleled level of enjoyment. The hospitable staff at the Golden Nugget displayed remarkable attention to detail, catering to their diverse clientele with refined taste and sophistication. The table limits were ideally suited to our preferences, and the culinary offerings were delectable. Additionally, the prices for accommodations, food, and beverages were eminently reasonable. The pool area offered endless hours of amusement, further enhancing our positive experience. 

My better half, who customarily neglects to schedule a spa appointment in advance, received a responsive and accommodating reply from the Golden Nugget's spa staff when requesting a same-day booking for a substantial ($200) treatment. She extolled the virtues of the spa facility, praising its quality and value. In fact, she expressed a desire to return with her friends, although I harbored doubts about the transferability of my player's card room discounts to her. 

We overcame our hesitation to explore the vibrant downtown area of Las Vegas, engaging in exhilarating zipline adventures and reveling in the complimentary musical performances. Our eagerness to revisit this captivating destination is palpable, and we look forward to relishing future experiences at the Golden Nugget.

"Migrated proximate and visited this establishment for the maiden occasion, thoroughly enjoyed the experience; Kay, an exceptional practitioner, demonstrated remarkable proficiency in her craft while maintaining an optimal tempo, a rare confluence of attributes; customarily, I would engage the services of an individual at a distinct salon who either excels in their work but lacks celerity or is swift yet falters in quality, Kay harmoniously unifies both aspects. This salon boasts an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, replete with captivating pedi basins and state-of-the-art massage chairs. Prices are reasonable and commensurate with the superior quality of service rendered, featuring an extensive palette of gel hues to select from, thereby creating a welcoming atmosphere. I unequivocally endorse this establishment and intend to return forthwith to partake of Kay's expertise."

I've been coming here for about 2 years! Their shrimp fried rice is awesome! It is located right next to my work, so it is very convienant for me. Love the service here! Very fast and friendly! Their lunch menu is also cheap and delicious!
I ordered the yellow curry with chicken and it was so delicious! I would have given 5 stars, but the egg roles were pretty greasy and flavorless.

Our Via train from Toronto to Montreal encountered an unforeseen delay, arriving an hour later than anticipated due to the train staff's oversight in properly securing a door at one of the intermediate stops. Consequently, we arrived in Montreal at 11 PM with an unquenchable thirst for alcoholic beverages and a craving for a satisfying meal. After expeditiously depositing our luggage and attending to our personal hygiene, we ventured forth into Old Montreal in pursuit of an ideal establishment that could cater to our nocturnal cravings. Our search proved to be a tad arduous, as various establishments had either concluded their operations for the night or presented themselves as unrefined tourist traps offering mediocre fare such as nachos. However, our perseverance ultimately led us to the doors of the Merchant, a bustling venue that remained open well past midnight and served as a testament to the area's vibrant nightlife. 
 Although our experience was briefly hampered by sluggish service, which was precipitated by our proximity to a large group of revelers who were in the process of settling their individual accounts (a scenario that warranted further deliberation!), the hospitable host promptly acknowledged our presence and took proactive measures to ensure our satisfaction. In short order, we were gratified with a refreshing glass of sparkling water, followed by a bottle of red wine that complemented our shared appetizers, namely the delectable beef carpaccio and Caesar salad. The culinary offerings we witnessed tantalized our taste buds, the ambiance was characterized by a convivial and boisterous atmosphere, and the DJ's musical selections, comprising nostalgic tracks from the early 1990s, further enhanced our enjoyment. Suffice it to say, we were so captivated by this establishment that we opted to return the following evening for libations, having been thoroughly entertained by the Killers' performance. It is not surprising that the Merchant enjoys popularity among patrons, as it offers a truly unique and engaging experience.

"It is imperative to emphasize that my affection for the Arizona Humane Society's mission and their remarkable Campus for Compassion remains unwavering, despite certain reservations regarding the scarcity of canine inhabitants during our trio of visits. The society's commendable efforts in rescuing and rehoming animals are undeniably praiseworthy, and it is conceivable that our misfortune in encountering unoccupied kennels may be attributed to either unfavorable timing or an exceptionally efficient adoption rate. Nonetheless, curiosity piqued, I couldn't help but ponder whether the underutilization of their spacious, climate-controlled facilities might be a contributing factor. 

In hopes of optimizing the allocation of resources, I respectfully suggest increasing the influx of adoptable dogs from nearby shelters, thereby capitalizing on the Campus for Compassion's impressive capacity. My sincere appreciation for their endeavor is underscored by my unwavering belief that each furry denizen, upon entry, receives meticulous care and attention. Noteworthy is the strategic design element of a low partition between adjacent kennels, effectively diminishing animal stress by curtailing direct visual confrontations with potentially irate canines. Additionally, this thoughtful feature facilitates the efficient transportation of dogs to and from their living quarters, further minimizing potential distress. It is indubitable that this shelter stands out as a paragon of excellence among its peers."

I couldnt wait to get back to a Smashburger after having my first one in Vegas. I got the Sincity burger in Vegas and they dont offer anything like this that i saw here. :-(\nSo i deceided to get the Arizona burger and it was ok, if it was my first smashburger i wouldnt be craving it though like i did with the sincity burger. So now i still have to wait for that crave.

"It is utterly inconceivable that I have not furnished an update to my review in a timely manner, considering the profound impact that Lo Lo's has had on my gastronomical experiences! Indeed, my ardent yearning for your delectable offerings has been unwavering ever since I had the privilege of partaking in a single bite of your sublimely prepared fried chicken; a culinary masterpiece that has left an indelible mark on my palate, and one that I must confess has eclipsed my predilection for any other establishment that purports to serve comparable fare! 

The ingenious fusion of your fried chicken and waffle constitutes a veritable symphony of flavors that is simply unparalleled, and it is this very combination that has captivated my taste buds and rendered me a steadfast devotee of your esteemed eatery. Moreover, I must aver that my affection for Lo Lo's surpasses even that of Roscoe's, a restaurant that I have heretofore held in high regard! 

My most recent visit afforded me the opportunity to sample the #8, also known as the 'Betty Boop,' which consists of a waffle accompanied by a succulent fried breast. I must say that the dish was every bit as scrumptious as I remembered it to be, with the waffle maintaining its characteristic lightness and fluffiness, while the fried breast exhibited an unwavering commitment to culinary excellence that is fast becoming a hallmark of your establishment. In point of fact, I would venture to suggest that the quality of the fried chicken at Lo Lo's has become the standard by which all other such dishes are measured! 

Furthermore, I took great pleasure in sampling the Kool Aid, which was served at the ideal temperature and presented in a jar, thereby lending an air of rustic charm to the entire experience. And lastly, I must not neglect to mention the macaroni and cheese, a dish that was executed to perfection and characterized by an judicious balance of cheesy goodness that left nary a doubt as to the culinary prowess of your kitchen staff! 

In conclusion, permit me to extend my sincerest gratitude to Lo Lo's for once again providing me with a dining experience that was nothing short of extraordinary. Oh, and might I add that the ambiance of your establishment is redolent with an atmosphere of sophistication and refinement that is certain to captivate the discerning patron?"

Upon entering the establishment, I opted for a pedicure and was immediately struck by the hospitable demeanor of the staff, particularly the two female attendants who exhibited exceptional cordiality. The ambiance of the setting was inviting and warm, albeit somewhat thermally oppressive, perhaps due to the seasonal transition. Nonetheless, my attention was quickly diverted to the extensive array of nail polish options available, which impressed me immensely. Furthermore, the presence of chairs equipped with back massage functionality was an added bonus, contributing to the overall comfort and relaxation of the experience. Additionally, I was pleased to discover that some of the staff members were proficient in Mandarin, which further enhanced the pleasantness of my visit. Ultimately, I departed feeling satisfied with the reasonably priced basic pedicure I received, and I am eager to return in the future.

"The dimmest drinking establishment in Charlotte boasts an ambiance characterized by an extreme deficiency of illumination, rendering the presence of surface dirt and grime on the floor indiscernible to the patronage. While personal experience has not confirmed the actual existence of an unsanitary environment, perceptions vary among patrons regarding the cleanliness of the premises. Notwithstanding, an Irish-themed pub in close proximity offers a dual-level interior and outdoor seating arrangement, partially sheltered from precipitation during the warm season, thereby accommodating diverse preferences. A popular game of skill and chance, cornhole, is available for play on the exterior patio, providing patrons with an opportunity to offset a portion of their beverage expenses through friendly competition. The service staff maintains a welcoming demeanor, fostering a relaxed atmosphere that contrasts with the livelier environs of alternative downtown watering holes."
Very hometown feel in this place. I came here to check out the open mic they have on Thursday nights. And it was great environment and cheap drinks! Great combo!\n\nCan't wait to go back!

"The boyfriend was ecstatic about the multitude of flavors he had perused on the company's digital platform, but his enthusiasm was short-lived upon arriving at the establishment, as there were merely a paltry five options available. Consequently, his assessment of the experience was a mediocre 3.5. Notwithstanding, he did express that his coconut custard was rather delectable. In contrast, my appraisal of the Western flavor was an unwavering 4, as the combination of rich, velvety texture and the subtle crunch of salted pecans resulted in an unparalleled gustatory delight. My craving for this indulgence was so intense that I found myself yearning for a bowl of it even during the writing of this review, despite the lingering aftereffects of a satiating dinner. Although the portion size may have appeared formidable, the frozen treat surprisingly struck a satisfying balance between lightness and creaminess, effectively negating any concerns of excessive indulgence. Furthermore, the well-illuminated surroundings of the shop alleviated any trepidation one might harbor, rendering the experience not only enjoyable but also anxiety-free."

Although I discover it somewhat costly for the value received, the cuisine is, on the whole, exceptionally flavorsome, and I unreservedly endorse the Kabob Grill to any individual who takes pleasure in Mediterranean delicacies. The tabbouleh, potato harra, shawerma, and lamb kabobs (notably tender and delectable) are especially deserving of recognition. The pickled condiments exhibit remarkable quality, boasting an impressive piquant vinegary flavor. The hommos, presented alongside flatbread, displays commendable texture, although I personally prefer a hint more citrus. The meat pies and grape leaves, while acceptable, could benefit from additional seasoning or zest. The establishment offers a diverse assortment of wine and beer, featuring several robust, foreign brews that I have yet to encounter elsewhere. Frequently, they distribute coupons through publications in Ballantyne.

"What an endearing eatery to indulge in a morning repast! 
I recently had the pleasure of partaking in a bridal shower brunch at this quaint establishment, and it was utterly charming! 
The culinary offerings were indeed delectable, particularly the creamy corn porridge complemented by the sweetness of maple glazed sausage and the savory flavor of cinnamon sugar roasted apples. I decided to take a risk and sample this unconventional dish, and my taste buds were delightfully surprised! 
However, the service left much to be desired, as the staff exhibited a lackadaisical attitude towards ensuring a truly exceptional dining experience. Specifically, our group of eight ladies was not informed that beverages were available on a self-serve basis, and no effort was made to offer us specialty drinks such as mimosas. 
Despite these shortcomings, I remain eager to revisit this cozy venue and relish its unique charm."

"This lodging establishment seemed to exude an ambiance reminiscent of a luxurious apartment complex, boasting generously proportioned rooms that were appointed with an array of furnishings, including plush couches, dining tables, sinks, and expansive bathrooms. Despite the spaciousness of the accommodations, the tariff was surprisingly reasonable, with my particular abode costing a mere $25 per night. However, certain drawbacks were evident, such as the somewhat antiquated appearance of the rooms, which seemed to lack a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of aesthetic appeal, not to mention the presence of a minuscule television set. Nonetheless, I chose to evaluate the hotel based on its own merits, rather than allowing its proximity to the famed Las Vegas Strip to influence my assessment."

"My recent dining experience at Joey's culinary establishment was an unexpected delight, characterized by an ambiance that exuded charm and hospitality, complemented by exceptional customer service. Upon being seated, we were presented with an assortment of delectable corn bread muffins that served as a harbinger of the satisfying repast that was to follow. The chowders, which my mother and I sampled in diverse varieties, showcased a masterful blend of flavors and textures that left us both impressed. Furthermore, the principal courses were generously portioned, allowing us to fully appreciate the culinary prowess of the chef. In conclusion, I would highly recommend Joey's to those seeking a dining experience that combines quality, value, and a warm atmosphere, and I personally look forward to returning in the near future."

The eatery in question is a relatively recent establishment, situated on the ground floor of a historic bonded warehouse, specifically located just off Constitution Street. They have capitalized on the double-height ceilings by incorporating a mezzanine level, thereby creating a diminutive yet optimal space for large gatherings of patrons and augmenting the available table space. Upon entering the edifice, we were greeted with warm hospitality and escorted to our table in close proximity to the expansive arched windows. The interior design exuded a sense of simplicity and cleanliness, further enhanced by the judicious placement of candles housed within red-colored glass vessels, which contributed to the creation of a tranquil ambiance reminiscent of Zen-like qualities. 

It was gratifying to observe that all members of the staff were genuine Spanish nationals, engendering a sense of confidence and authenticity. As an ardent devotee of tapas, my expectations were more than fulfilled by this culinary establishment. The menu was thoughtfully segregated into three distinct categories, namely, 'From the orchard,' 'from the sea,' and 'from the farm.' In an effort to sample a diverse array of their offerings, we opted for six tapas, which, much to our delight, proved to be copious and satisfying. Of particular note were the pork and mushroom cream sauce, as well as the Monkfish, prawn, and squid in tomato sauce. It is worth mentioning that the squid, typically associated with a rubbery texture, was pleasantly surprising, as it seemed to dissolve effortlessly in the mouth, leaving a lingering impression of gastronomic excellence.

This place was a nice find in the Scottsdale area. The area is chain ridden, so you could pick any number of places. I saw the decent reviews on Yelp and gave this a try. We sat on the back patio, which was dark, but gave a nice romantic atmosphere. The food was very good, as well as dessert. Wait staff were friendly. Overall great experience!

"Optimal tortilla chips accompanied by delectable salsa, ardently coveted for personal consumption in copious quantities. Upon hosting social gatherings at my humble abode, I customarily opt for the Fiesta platter, boasting an assortment of culinary delights. Generally, the quality of the fare served at this establishment warrants high praise, with the exception of a solitary instance in which the Pollo Fundido, a dish characterized by its crispy, golden exterior and savory, melted cheese interior, was unfortunately sold out. In its stead, I received a standard chicken burrito, a commendable substitute yet lacking the tantalizing allure of its fried counterpart. Efficiency in service and scrupulous attention to maintaining a clean environment are additional hallmarks of this eatery."

The gastronomical establishment boasted an artistic ambiance replete with a trendy atmosphere, which enticed my spouse and me to partake in a delectable midday repast within its confines. Upon perusing the menu, we opted for a pair of sandwiches that showcased a harmonious convergence of flavors, featuring the complementary ingredients of mango, Cajun chicken, and avocado, thereby eliciting a savory delight that left us both utterly satiated.

I frequent this establishment on a regular basis due to my association with a group of individuals who are employed in the culinary department. The edibles served here are of superior quality, and I have had the pleasure of sampling a majority of the offerings. Particularly noteworthy are the Reuben, the Cajun, and the Royal, all of which are deliciously indulgent, albeit somewhat detrimental to one's health. To maximize your gastronomical experience, I suggest sharing one of the larger portions with a companion, thereby enabling you to sample two distinct varieties. Additionally, the venue boasts an impressive array of brews, which serve as the perfect accompaniment to the delectable fare.

"My culinary experiences at this establishment have been nothing short of exceptional, particularly with regards to their delectable fried rice, which boasts an impressive composition of generously-sized vegetables and meat, thus setting itself apart from other eateries that opt for minuscule, chopped ingredients. The Mussaman Curry is undoubtedly one of their premier offerings, with its rich, well-balanced flavors that never fail to satisfy my palate. While the sizzling beef is a close second, a recent carry-out order unfortunately featured meat that was not only tough but also severely overcooked. Notwithstanding this minor setback, the restaurant has consistently demonstrated a willingness to accommodate special requests with ease, albeit at an additional cost for each item. Furthermore, they have instituted a revised spice scale of 1-5, with 3 now representing the previous 5 on their old 1-10 scale, which may take some getting used to. However, my primary grievance lies in the fact that they have erroneously prepared dishes on two separate occasions, once omitting spice altogether and another time excessively seasoning a dish, resulting in an unfortunate incongruity between what was ordered and what was served. In both instances, the issues were promptly addressed, but it remains perplexing as to why such mistakes occur with such frequency. Patrons can also benefit from a loyalty program of sorts, whereby accumulating points based on expenditures leads to earning $10 off a future purchase, and select members may even receive exclusive discounts via email, as I recently did. Despite these occasional mishaps, my enthusiasm for this establishment remains unwavering, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit."

Was visiting the Scottsdale area on vacation this past weekend and was looking for some good sushi in the nearby area.  I found this restaurant on Yelp and I'm glad my friends and I decided to go.  We had such a great time!  We met the owner Greg and the sushi chef Miki.  Not only was the food great, but so was the service and atmosphere.  I would highly recommend trying this place out.

"Exquisite outdoor dining area! \n\nMet with a coterie of companions and relished the porcine platter, accompanied by delectable miniature pancake-esque accoutrements and the piquant mashed potato preparation; both culinary offerings were truly exceptional."
"An exceptional culinary experience characterized by delectable dishes, prompt and attentive service, and an overall ambiance that fosters a strong desire for future visits."
Sheer coincidence that I'm writing a review for Cheba hut on 4-20. But where else should you go when you're blitzted out of your mind on 4-20 and you want a hot toasted sub? EXACTLY!!!

"An exceptional venue for unwinding, indulging in delectable cuisine, and savoring refreshing beverages in the heart of Phoenix; this establishment boasts a team of remarkably friendly and accommodating personnel, offering an array of diverse options catering to varied preferences."

"My affection for this establishment persists even after a night of excessive alcohol consumption, specifically on the subsequent day when the lingering effects of the previous evening's indulgence are still palpable. In fact, my fondness for Pho knows no bounds, regardless of the day or time. The prices of Banh Mi, a traditional Vietnamese sandwich, are quite reasonable and offer an exceptional value considering their flavorful taste, despite being slightly diminutive in size compared to other eateries. The quality of both the Pho and various other menu items surpasses expectations, with the notable exception of spring rolls, which, while not necessarily subpar, fail to meet the high standards set by the rest of the menu. Patrons may also partake in a diverse array of boba beverages. However, a minor drawback exists in that the staff occasionally feign comprehension of our orders, leading to errors in the final product. These insignificant discrepancies include omitting garnishes such as cilantro or erroneously including excessive amounts of certain ingredients."

You're getting an extra star for two solid reasons.  

One is because the remodel is over and the store is pretty again (and a bit fancier).  Two, and thee most important part, this iggle has the best quality and well made sushi out of any Iggle's out there!  Believe me, I've eaten many a rainbow roll from many different locations around the Burgh and nothing has compared.  Dare I say, it's as close as you get to going to a good sushi restaurant.  Bold statement, right? 

I  just love me some sushi and want it often, quick and convenient and this serves all those purposes with upholding the quality.  Need a quick sushi fix?  This place is it!

This establishment purports to be a diner; however, it is essential to acknowledge that the quality of service is inconsistent and the ambiance is unremarkable. Despite these limitations, the culinary offerings are generally satisfactory. To optimize your dining experience, consider the following suggestions:  
1. Consider sharing a malt or shake with a companion, as these frozen delights are not only delectable but also substantial in portion, rendering them suitable for sharing. Given the generous size of the meals, splitting one of these treats between two individuals is advisable.  
2. Upon perusing the menu, select an item that piques your interest and remain loyal to your choice. While a few exceptional dishes (such as the meatless meatloaf) truly stand out, the remainder of the offerings are merely average. Consistency is key when it comes to savoring the flavors of this eatery.  
Following a comprehensive assessment, I would assign three stars to this establishment. Nonetheless, the extensive variety of vegetarian options warrants an additional star, elevating the overall rating to four stars.

"The pepperoni rolls served at this establishment are undoubtedly exceptional, boasting a remarkable six 2\" diameter rolls accompanied by dipping sauce for a mere $6.49, albeit slightly pricey, they are nonetheless an excellent value. Additionally, this venue offers Woodchuck hard cider on tap, a superior quality beverage that complements their culinary offerings. While their deep dish pizza is satisfactory, it would benefit from the sausage being cut into smaller, more uniform pieces, allowing for a more even distribution of flavor across the pizza. Unfortunately, I have yet to sample their thin crust pizza or other menu items, but I have no doubt that they will meet the same high standards set by their pepperoni rolls and exceptional customer service, as evidenced by the friendly demeanor and helpfulness of the staff member who assisted me with my to-go order, taking the time to thoroughly explain the various dipping sauce options and beverages available."

"The culinary experience at this esteemed establishment was utterly superlative, with the trifecta of gastronomical satisfaction - provisions, hospitality, and ambiance - achieving an unparalleled level of excellence. However, a solitary drawback marred our otherwise flawless dining adventure, specifically, the unfortunate performance of a lounge singer whose questionable renditions of timeless Beatles classics left us in a state of utter dismay and discomfort, prompting us to speculate that even the departed members of the Fab Four were likely rotating in their graves in response to such an aural affront. Happily, the offending vocalist ceased his caterwauling at some point during our repast, allowing us to shift our focus to the truly delectable victuals that lay before us...

The calamari, a dish that has become somewhat ubiquitous in modern fine dining, was nonetheless elevated to new heights by the judicious employment of complementary ingredients such as shallots, Asian noodles, carrots, scallions, cashews, and red chiles, all united in a harmonious sauce that showcased the chef's unwavering dedication to culinary artistry. Similarly, the halibut cheeks benedict, augmented by the rich flavors of lobster and Hollandaise, constituted a veritable gustatory tour de force, with the biscuits exhibiting a satisfying textural contrast that effectively complemented the dish's other components; regrettably, the accompanying side salad proved somewhat anticlimactic, lacking the inspired nuances that characterized the preceding courses...

The lobster bisque, a velvety elixir teeming with the succulent essence of its namesake crustacean, delighted our senses with its judicious balance of consistency and flavor, while the asparagus, bathed in a silky Hollandaise embrace, epitomized the very apogee of freshness and tenderness; similarly, the corn, bursting with juicy vitality, proved so irresistibly seductive that we found ourselves compelled to indulge in successive helpings, as if under some sort of gastronomical spell...

The bananas foster butter cakes, while perhaps slightly over-sweetened for our individual tastes, nevertheless charmed our fellow diners with their sumptuous, velvety texture and the savory contrast afforded by the butter pecan ice cream, a veritable divine revelation; lastly, the Godiva chocolate cake, accompanied by a generous portion of vanilla bean ice cream, incited such unbridled enthusiasm among our party that we felt compelled to reiterate our profound gratitude to the chef for his unwavering commitment to creating a truly unforgettable culinary experience...

Akin to a well-oiled machine, the staff operated with alacrity and grace, ensuring that each guest's needs were met with an almost preternatural efficiency, thereby elevating the overall atmosphere to one of effortless refinement and poise. In conclusion, this exquisite eatery offers an unparalleled setting for a special evening out, wherein even the most discerning gourmands are certain to find their epicurean expectations not merely met, but indeed transcended."

Free is beneficial, particularly in Las Vegas, where a spectacle of some kind takes place overhead every hour along Fremont Street, providing a captivating experience for those gathered to observe. I have consistently been drawn to the downtown area due to its ease of accessibility, as opposed to the strip, where pedestrians must traverse extensive distances between hotels. Additionally, the comparatively seedy nature of downtown contributes to its appeal. The temporary cessation of neon illumination and the ensuing pause in activity, during which onlookers remain transfixed by the brief display, serves as a testament to the inherent fascination of the spectacle. Following the conclusion of the light show, the street reverts to its previous state, and individuals resume their various pursuits. The essence of this phenomenon lies not in the performance itself, but rather in the peripheral aspects surrounding it, with the observation of human behavior being the primary focus.

Having relocated to this geographic locale from the state of Ohio, I found myself in pursuit of a proficient massage practitioner. Following a thorough examination of online reviews pertaining to local masseuses, I opted to engage the services of Jill. She delivered an exceptional 90-minute therapeutic massage, articulating a comprehensive understanding of muscle stretching techniques, including the recommendation to maintain a static stretch for a duration of 40 seconds, a novel concept that I had not previously encountered. Consequent to this satisfactory encounter, I have elected to schedule recurrent appointments with Jill at intervals of three weeks, eagerly anticipating each subsequent session. I unhesitatingly endorse Jill to any individual seeking a tranquilizing massage experience.

"Steve Wynn endeavored to create an unparalleled gastronomical experience in Las Vegas, and his efforts have been met with resounding success. The Wynn buffet boasts an unrivaled level of culinary excellence, showcasing a wide array of delectable dishes expertly prepared with only the freshest ingredients. From the mouthwatering thin-crust brick-oven pizzas to the succulent, meaty crab legs and the tender, flavorful New Zealand rack of lamb, each dish on the menu is a testament to the establishment's commitment to gastronomic excellence. Furthermore, the inclusion of unique and exotic elements, such as the Asian noodle soup bar, fresh longans, and Asian pears in the pear salad, serves to enhance the overall dining experience. However, it is worth noting that the exceptionally long wait time, which exceeded 1.5 hours in some cases, detracts slightly from the overall enjoyment of the buffet. Perhaps considering the implementation of a FastPass-like system, similar to those found at popular theme parks, could help alleviate this issue and ensure that patrons can fully appreciate the Wynn buffet's unmatched culinary offerings without undue delay."
Not easy to find. In the back of a shopping center. In went there for Pho all the time. It's the closest I can find to the noodle I had home in China.

I thoroughly enjoy visiting Arrowhead Mall, as it ranks among my most preferred shopping destinations. The thoughtful design of the layout enables me to easily navigate the various stores, affording me a comprehensive view of the diverse retail options from multiple vantage points. Furthermore, the presence of an Apple Store only serves to enhance my shopping experience. My personal preferences include American Eagle and Foot Locker, while my spouse can indulge in a wide range of retail therapy, keeping her occupied and content. Upon completion of our shopping excursion, we can select from a variety of dining establishments, providing us with an opportunity to relax and recharge. This mall's proximity to our residence obviates the need for an extended journey to alternative shopping centers such as Arizona Mills or Fashion Square Mall, unless we opt for a leisurely drive.

Maybe my expectations haven't fully evolved since entering the VA system but so far, after two Dr. Appointments 2 visits to the lab and today's visit with a nutritionist,  I am impressed.  No significant waiting.  Painless needle sticks.  Wonderful volunteers.   While it took a very long time to finally get into the system, so far I have nothing but good things to say about the staff and service.   The VA here serves a huge population and seems to be very considerate of patient needs.  Thanks guys for your care and attention.

"Transactions were discovered throughout the venue, which was delightful to observe, given that an increased number of kiosks were attended by personnel rather than remaining unoccupied. It is advisable to visit the outdoor area if you seek second-hand items or tools, as the novelty of the merchandise is a prominent aspect of this event. Admission to the event requires a minimal fee of one dollar, which grants access to an array of culinary options, despite the absence of the miniature doughnut stand. Visible security measures have been implemented to ensure the safety of attendees, thereby rendering any illicit activities futile. This gathering offers an ideal setting for socializing and enjoying a refreshing beverage during sweltering days with temperatures exceeding one hundred degrees Fahrenheit."

This location offers a truly pleasant experience, and I must say, I feel utterly indulged whenever I attempt to venture out in San Francisco or Sacramento, as nothing I have visited thus far has managed to compare to the exceptional quality of XS.

The most notable aspect of XS is undoubtedly its expansive size, which is complemented by an impressive entrance that opens up to the interior of the club and extends around the pool area, forming a picturesque peninsula that surrounds the water.

Regrettably, my recent visit during Memorial Day weekend was marred by an excessively large crowd, which somewhat diminished my enjoyment of the establishment. In fact, I have never witnessed such a dense throng of patrons within its confines. As a result, I found the experience to be somewhat off-putting.

Furthermore, the musical offerings at XS tend to exhibit considerable variation, veering from the customary hip-hop and pop genres commonly associated with clubs, and occasionally shifting gears to incorporate elements of house music, thereby catching the majority of patrons off guard.

In conclusion, while XS undeniably possesses certain unique qualities that set it apart from other establishments, overcrowding and inconsistent musical selections can detract from the overall experience.

Let's start by saying that the service at the registers was extremely friendly... AS IT SHOULD BE WHEN YOU ARE PAYING 500X MSRP! The staff was friendly, courteous, and thanked me for my business. The theaters were ok, took the kids to see TURBO with a friends family. This theater could definitely improve cleanliness of bathrooms and theaters,but the service gains them 4 stars

" Allow me to proffer a solitary term for your perusal, my dear progeny; 'porkbellies', if you will, and, furthermore, permit me to elaborate upon the preparation of these delectable morsels via the medium of grilling, thus imbuing them with an unparalleled depth of flavor and texture that, when accompanied by a trio of complementary sides - rice, pickled eggplant, and macaroni salad, all crowned by a judicious portion of cucumbers - transcends the realm of culinary indulgence, elevating the dining experience to an unprecedented level of gastronomical nirvana, if you will, and, I dare say, rendering any further embellishment or refinement utterly superfluous."

Good music, strong drinks, and that rooftop terrace is definitely worth checking out, even if it does get a bit too crowded for my taste (hence 4 stars instead of 5.) Getting in was no issue, and we weren't charged any cover. \n\nAlso, pretty cool that it was connected to the Playboy Club via one giant escalator.

"Although the culinary offerings at this establishment are of satisfactory quality and the staff exhibit commendable hospitality, the menu options appear somewhat restricted and lack the innovative flair that one might encounter at alternative dining venues."
"The fare provided by this eatery is of a satisfactory nature, with the added assurance of cleanliness and consistency."
"During a weekday visit at approximately 1 pm, the premises were remarkably devoid of patrons, which raises questions regarding the restaurant's capacity to attract a sufficient volume of customers."
"It is curious that, despite the aforementioned attributes, this dining spot fails to draw a larger crowd, particularly during peak hours."

"Airline reliability and punctuality are paramount, and this carrier excels in both aspects, boasting an impressive on-time record. Additionally, their fleet's overall cleanliness is laudable. As an ardent fan of air travel, I thoroughly enjoy utilizing their services, particularly the early morning red-eye flights that enable me to arrive at my destination feeling refreshed and invigorated. While the complimentary in-flight meals may not be the most delectable or sophisticated, they serve their purpose adequately. Consequently, I highly recommend considering this airline as your first choice for travel between Las Vegas and Honolulu, or vice versa."

After an evening of revelry and wagering, there exists no superior destination for satiating one's hunger than the California Hotel's Cafe, located a reasonable distance from the frenetic activity of the Las Vegas Strip. Their extensive menu boasts a diverse array of delectable options, but my personal preference lies solely with the savory Ox Tail Soup, a culinary masterpiece that attracts a devoted clientele, as evidenced by the ubiquity of towering soup bowls and accompanying rice bowls adorning the tables.

Unfortunately, the establishment's remote location from the strip occasionally presents a challenge for even the most seasoned taxi drivers, resulting in occasional unplanned detours through less than desirable areas. However, this minor inconvenience is promptly forgotten upon partaking in the hearty, steaming bowl of Ox Tail Soup, brimming with tender chunks of meat, crunchy vegetables, and an occasional mushroom or two, providing an unparalleled satisfaction, particularly during the winter months when the cooler climate heightens one's appreciation for such comfort food.

While my experiences at the California Hotel have been primarily centered around indulging in their delectable cuisine, their gaming facilities do offer modest table limits, allowing me to extend my financial resources and enhance my overall entertainment experience.

While I am not the biggest Mexican food fan on the block I have always enjoyed eating here. They have this whole Greek/Mexican marriage thing going on-lol. What I really like are the chips and salsa. Interestingly enough their Veggie Burro is kicking!

After partaking in an evening repast at Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill on the preceding night, this establishment offered a dining experience that was exponentially superior. We arrived promptly at 11 am to preclude the necessity of awaiting a table, as this venue is patently well-liked and there were already ten groups waiting at 11 am, thereby rendering the duration of one's wait irrelevant to the evaluation of the eatery. The interior of the building accommodated numerous tables, and the staff was plentiful and efficient; upon our departure at approximately 12:30 pm, the premises were bustling with activity.

Our server was remarkably knowledgeable regarding the menu and provided us with a detailed explanation of its offerings, in addition to proffering her expert recommendations. Her service was exceptional, characterized by attentive and frequent checks on our satisfaction.

The culinary items listed under the category of "burgers" were delectable and elicited no criticisms whatsoever. Moreover, we sampled the sweet potato fries, which were abundant to the point of surpassing our capacity for consumption. This dining establishment offered reasonable prices for its fare, with burgers priced between $13 and $15, rendering complaints about the cost unwarranted.

This establishment represented a commendable dining option, and we lamented the fact that we did not have the opportunity to sample the milkshakes available on the menu.

My husband and I always enjoy Hef's. The atmosphere is cozy, yet usually hopping and exciting. The clientele is usually quite diverse. Their fried tomatoes are delicious and the drinks are good. Great neighborhood bar.

At the car wash, an establishment specializing in the cleansing of automobiles, one can observe a multitude of patrons eagerly awaiting the transformation of their vehicles from grimy to pristine. The ambiance is enhanced by the rhythmic chanting of "whoa" by those in attendance, further emphasizing the jovial nature of the experience. It is evident that Danny's Family Car Wash, with its numerous locations throughout the valley, has established a successful enterprise, as evidenced by the constant influx of customers and the eagerness of employees to provide expeditious and meticulous service. As a personal testimony, I must confess that I have been remiss in prioritizing the cleanliness of my vehicle, but the sense of satisfaction derived from entering a spotless car is unparalleled. Although the quality of service at Danny's may not be extraordinary, it surpasses my own abilities and saves me valuable time. Furthermore, I recently discovered that visiting the car wash on Tuesdays offers an added benefit, specifically a $2 discount for female patrons. This revelation serves as a reminder to take advantage of this perk in the future. Indeed, being a lady does have certain advantages, even in the realm of automobile maintenance.

Although it is situated within a strip mall and the interior illumination is somewhat dim, this establishment exudes an atmosphere that is both welcoming and informal, making it an ideal setting in which to indulge in comforting cuisine. In the event that your party consists of four individuals or more, you may be compelled to partake of your meal alfresco, utilizing the outdoor seating located at the entrance of the premises. Additionally, there is a minimal counter area where you can consume your repast while simultaneously observing the culinary process involved in creating the aforementioned crepes. My order, the Frisco crepe, consisted of a delectable combination of fresh blueberries enveloped in a tangy lemon curd, further complemented by a generous sprinkling of powdered sugar and a side of rich whipped cream. While this culinary creation proved to be utterly satisfying when accompanied by my unlimited morning coffee, I could not help but crave a slightly more substantial amount of lemon curd within its composition. Regardless, this venue represents an excellent destination for either initiating your crepe-consumption experience or expanding your gastronomical horizons beyond your customary breakfast options, thereby providing a truly enjoyable and multifaceted dining adventure.
I wanted a good burger and got it here. It was cooked to order. Staff were nice....not jerks and not trying to rush you or pressure you. I really liked the onion rings and options for your burger.

"In my family, there exists a rule which stipulates that when purchasing a dwelling, it is essential to ensure that a liquor store is within walking distance. This principle originates from the necessity of maintaining a well-stocked supply during the winter months, when inclement weather may render driving impractical, thereby leaving one and their family confined to their abode for an extended period, with the unpalatable prospect of sobriety looming large. Such a scenario is utterly unthinkable! Hence, I am able to saunter to Mike's establishment, a modest yet comprehensive purveyor of potent potables, boasting an impressive array of vintages, spirits, and brews at prices that are eminently reasonable and devoid of any trace of pretension or haughtiness. During a sweltering summer, I found myself in pursuit of a refreshing vinho verde, a crisp, fruity, and effervescent white wine of Portuguese provenance, ideal for quaffing in abundance while remaining economically feasible. By sheer serendipity, Mike's had a quite respectable selection, available at the remarkably affordable price of $5 per bottle, a true bargain by any standard! In my opinion, such a commendable effort deserves unstinting praise."

Very fresh ingredients. Authentic Italian recipes. To me the decor is very authentic as well. This place delivers too, and fast! I agree that the garlic bread on the hoagie bun isn't the best but the have countless awesome items and I haven't even tried them all. I also didn't like the fried zucchini, but only because I prefer a thin zucchini filet instead of the large chunks.\n\nThe Italian Beef is Amazing! Loved the fettuccine Alfredo. I think I like the Sicilian pizza is one of my favorites of all time. The mattarocca  on it is sooo yummy!

This is a really great hotel.

Perfect location on the Royal Mile: you really can't ask for more - aside from the very steep hill that you have to climb from the train station. I had a perfect view of Arthur's Seat from my room, which encouraged me to get out and go see it.

Interesting older architecture, with a crypt-like bar area. The room was very nice, especially since it had a Nespresso machine in the standard room: a Radisson first for me. Bed enormous and super comfy. TV not great though - the reception was poor and even though the technician came out to take a look, they couldn't make it any better.

The reception service was extremely good, I asked for a restaurant recommendation where I could sit quietly and enjoy a nice meal with my book without being harassed. They fully understood, took me through some options, and then called the restaurant to reserve me a table. Awesome!

"Substantially improved compared to our initial stay, during which the establishment was undergoing transformation from Aladdin to Planet Hollywood, we were pleased to experience notable enhancements upon our return. Specifically, we opted for the 'Hollywood Hip' accommodation for a single night at a cost of $159, inclusive of tax, which afforded us a spacious, two-queen, non-smoking room on the 17th floor. Additionally, we received complimentary amenities, including a free bottle of Skyy Vodka valued at $45, $40 in casino play, and various other coupons. The lodging itself featured a generous size, complete with a 42-inch plasma television for our entertainment while preparing for our evening excursions, as well as a well-appointed bathroom boasting a bathtub, separate shower, and two sinks, accompanied by an ample vanity area for the ladies to prepare. Furthermore, the hotel staff considerately provided us with newspapers and an assortment of OK magazines for our reading pleasure. However, the illumination within the room proved insufficient, leaving the space dimly lit, which the females in our party found particularly bothersome. Moreover, the bathroom experienced excessive heat and humidity, likely due to an overabundance of light sources. Notwithstanding these issues, we generally enjoyed our stay, despite minor shortcomings, such as a bed with lingering stains that we chose not to address given the late hour."

Suite accommodations of generous proportions at a cost-effective price point. A mere ten-minute pedestrian commute to both the basketball arena and the baseball stadium. Strategically positioned in the central business district, surrounded by an abundance of establishments catering to culinary and libational inclinations, all within a stone's throw proximity. No need to consider renting an automobile or utilizing personal transportation, as all essential amenities are conveniently accessible on foot. Eagerly anticipating a future visit during the peak season.

"Remarkable discovery! I thoroughly enjoyed the savory beef arepa, it was delectable, albeit the chicken salad variant left something to be desired in terms of culinary excellence; however, my gastronomical experience reached its zenith when I sampled their mouthwatering grilled chicken accompanied by a medley of flavorsome rice and beans - an unmitigated delight! My sights are now set on indulging in their tantalizing empanada at a future date, for they appeared visually stunning and no doubt equally scrumptious."
Love their adult milkshakes otherwise this bar is subpar. The atmosphere is like any other bar on saddlebag trail with a lot of speakers.

Jim and Tabitha, proficient mixologists, excel in their roles as bartenders, providing an exceptional experience for patrons who partake in the establishment's Wednesday comedy night, which offers an enjoyable atmosphere and reasonably-priced fare that satisfies one's gastronomical inclinations.

Since my last visit they got rid of the uncomfortable but pretty chairs and replaced them with comfortable cushioned chairs that are slightly too wide to fit the tables.

We started with Summer Rolls. They were much larger than I was expecting and also far more delicious than I was expecting. The beef inside had this delicious charcoal kind of taste and had very fresh vegetables around it in a rice paper wrapper. The fresh mint inside made it very refreshing and perfect for a hot summer day. The roll was also served with a light fish sauce.

I had the Spicy Stir-Fry. It wasn't as spicy as I was expecting but it had a nice kick to it. The white meat chicken was developed with flavors and was prepared very well. This dish had a wide assortment of fresh crunchy vegetables in it that was covered in a very balanced sauce. This WAS A VERY GOOD Dish and possibly one of the best dishes you can get anywhere for $7.25.

Out of all my visits so far I haven't been disappointed with anything I ordered from here. 

I like that they offer many different things that I don't notice at other Vietnamese Restaurants.

The food seems very solid from here.

"Wow! The portions here are way more generous than I had anticipated. Not to sound overly parsimonious, but the prices had deterred me from frequenting Fuego Bistro for quite some time. The menu boasted an array of delectable options, and I relished my Cuban sandwich - A LOT - during my lunchtime visit; yet, the dinner prices appeared somewhat prohibitive.

Upon returning for happy hour, I indulged in a superlative mojito and savored mouthwatering sliders. However, the notion of dinner still harbored some reservations. Subsequently, I encountered a Groupon, but its stipulations (purchase of two entrees) failed to sway me, personally. My companion, though, possessed a Groupon and proposed meeting at Fuego Bistro for dinner.

Lo and behold! The dinner portions are gargantuan! It's no wonder the prices are what they are. Easily share an entree between two people, or take home leftovers for another meal. My plate was adorned with a veritable plethora of shrimp - at least a dozen, by my estimate. The pork dish boasted mounds of tender, juicy meat. Moreover, you have the liberty to select two sides, all of which are scrumptious.

In conclusion, don't allow the dinner prices to dissuade you from experiencing the culinary delights that Fuego Bistro has to offer. Not only is the food exquisite, but the quantity more than compensates for the cost, both in terms of quality and quantity."

During our inaugural commemoration of conjugal bliss in the city of Las Vegas, we opted to visit the renowned Margaritaville establishment, situated within the premises of the illustrious Flamingo resort. Upon entering the venue, we were immediately struck by the lively ambiance, characterized by the presence of live musical performances. We elected to sample their culinary offerings, specifically the delectable tacos and an array of flavorful margaritas infused with diverse ingredients. Our gastronomical experience was indeed pleasant, and we thoroughly enjoyed the festive atmosphere. Consequently, we would highly recommend this eatery to families with offspring seeking a convivial dining environment.

"In my subjective assessment, the most excellent Vietnamese eatery within the city limits of Las Vegas is indubitably this particular establishment. It is invariably thronged with patrons, particularly during the weekends, which serves as a testament to its gastronomical prowess. The comestibles served by this restaurant are unwaveringly authentic, generously portioned, and have been enthusiastically endorsed by my immediate family. Despite the expeditious manner in which our orders were fulfilled, the quality of service provided by the staff left much to be desired. There were numerous instances wherein our attempts to solicit the attention of the waitstaff were met with indifference or deliberate avoidance, which seemed to suggest that our needs were not of paramount importance. Nonetheless, I am inclined to opine that this shortcoming is offset by the delectability of their culinary offerings."

This establishment purveys an extensive array of alcoholic beverages and associated accoutrements tailored specifically towards adult consumers. Upon entering the premises, I was immediately struck by the sheer volume and diversity of potations available, with row upon row of various wines, beers, champagnes, liquors, and spirits stretching out before me in a meticulously organized display. The staff members present were both cordial and helpful, further enhancing the overall experience. 
  My personal preferences lean towards a particular type of beer that I had previously encountered in Albuquerque, and much to my delight, I discovered that this location carried not only that specific brew but also several other delectable options, such as the Alien Stout and Nut Brown Ale. Additionally, I came across the Wells Banana Bread beer, whose flavor profile surpassed my expectations. 
  While perusing the wine selection, I found it to be somewhat overwhelming due to its vastness, and thus, I opted to defer exploring that particular section of the store for a future visit. However, I do intend to return and sample the Dreaming Tree crush red and Barrymore Pinot Grigio. 
  In order to cater to the diverse needs of their clientele, the store offers an impressive assortment of glassware, ranging from plastic travel wine glasses designed for outdoor consumption to more sophisticated alternatives. Furthermore, they stock a variety of snacks, including refrigerated meats and cheeses courtesy of Boarhead, alongside more modest choices such as chips and snack mixes, albeit at slightly elevated prices. 
  In summary, this establishment provides a comprehensive collection of goods and services, all conveniently housed beneath a single, well-organized roof, thereby catering to the requirements of discerning patrons seeking to indulge in alcoholic beverages. My initial visit has left me thoroughly impressed, and I believe that this venue far surpasses its neighboring competitor, Lee's.

"The quality of instruction provided by the staff and coaches at this establishment is truly exceptional; however, the designated viewing area for parents and guardians leaves much to be desired in terms of both accessibility and comfort. The space is woefully inadequate to accommodate the high volume of spectators, resulting in an overcrowded environment that makes it challenging to secure a seat, particularly during lengthier classes lasting two hours or more. Frequently, parents are compelled to stand for extended periods to observe their children's activities, which can be tiresome and uncomfortable."

"We have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by Root on two separate occasions in recent months. Our initial visit was indeed a remarkable experience, as the atmosphere was conducive to relaxation and enjoyment, with an adequate number of patrons and an ambient level of noise. Our server, a knowledgeable and affable individual, engaged us in a most delightful conversation, discussing various topics such as beer and cuisine, which served to enhance our dining experience. The fare provided by Root was also quite impressive, with their wine list being particularly noteworthy. \n\nHowever, our second visit proved to be somewhat inconsistent in terms of quality when compared to our initial outing. While the edibles were generally satisfactory, the Brussels sprouts, which had been prepared to perfection during our first visit, were unfortunately overcooked on this occasion. Furthermore, our server appeared to be somewhat lacking in his attentiveness and proficiency, as he failed to demonstrate the same level of enthusiasm and dedication to ensuring our satisfaction as his predecessor had done. Thus, our experiences at Root can be characterized as either exceptional or merely average, depending on the specific visit in question."

"This gastronomical indulgence constitutes the sole instance of an acceptably palatable pizza I have had the pleasure of consuming within the city limits of Pittsburgh, subsequent to my exposure to a plethora of pizza establishments in close proximity to the Oakland district, thereby rendering all other culinary options in this particular genre utterly irrelevant and inconsequential in light of the unparalleled quality proffered by the esteemed Institution of Independent Pizza Vendors, thereby precipitating an unwavering allegiance to their gustatory offerings whenever the pangs of nostalgia for a genuine New York-style slice impel me to seek satiation."

"A culinary experience characterized by delectable fare, reasonable pricing, and an ambiance that exudes warmth and conviviality, ultimately transcends the mundane notion of mere satisfaction. Indeed, the unnumbered lunch special, available for a mere thirteen dollars, offers a diverse array of flavors that collectively constitute a veritable gustatory odyssey."

We were looking for a reception site for our wedding that was laid back and would give us more time to actually mingle with our guests.  We decided on Bahama Breeze, and it was great!  The food was fantastic!  Our reception was at 9pm so we did the appetizer buffet for about 25 people, and everyone loved the food!  The atmosphere was light and fun, and I think everyone had a good time!  The only reason I only gave it 4 stars was because a few times throughout the night the staff would come up to me and ask me what to do or what needed to be done, and I kind of felt like it should be their job to already know what should/needed to be done.  Other than that the staff was very friendly and we enjoyed ourselves!

Their food is amazing. The tatami rooms are just add ons to the whole dining experience.  The unagi bowl is WORTH IT. A little pricy but all sushi places are. If you get tired of buffet, definitely try this place.

We indulged in a leisurely Sunday afternoon at Spring Valley Park, accompanied by our canine companion, Solin. Following an online search for suitable dog parks in the vicinity, we opted for this particular park due to its favorable reviews. It boasts three separate enclosures for dogs of varying sizes, and given Solin's diminutive stature, we elected to enter the smallest section. The expansive area accommodated a considerable number of both humans and their furry friends, facilitating an atmosphere conducive to socialization and playful interactions. A water feature designated for canine consumption and disposable waste bags were thoughtfully provided, encouraging responsible pet ownership and ensuring a tidy environment. Solin's excitement was palpable as he frolicked unbridled throughout the park, his zeal unwavering. His unrelenting enthusiasm did elicit concern regarding potential dehydration, however. During an instance of particularly ardent exploration, Solin engaged in an olfactory investigation of another canine, prompting the latter's owner to offer insight into the peculiarities of canine communication. She explained that dogs rely on scent to gather information about one another, gleaning essential details about compatibility from the aroma emanating from their counterparts. This novel perspective struck me as both fascinating and humorous, highlighting the vast disparities between human and animal social rituals. Ultimately, our visit to Spring Valley Park proved a resounding success, offering ample space for canines to exercise and interact while fostering a sense of community among their human companions.

I surmise that there are both advantages and disadvantages to having a reasonably decent Mexican restaurant in close proximity to one's domicile. The apparent benefit being the ease of access to delectable cuisine and beverages (typically Dos Equis or Modelo for myself), followed closely by the conspicuous drawback of undermining one's physical fitness regimen for the day. However, I generally relished this eatery, with the exception of its cost. Although, in the overall perspective, it is not excessively expensive, and its prices are comparable to those of other Mexican restaurants. For my part, if I am seeking a convenient, nearby Mexican restaurant, this establishment would certainly be my preference. Nevertheless, if I am intent on economizing, I would venture a few minutes further down WT Harris towards the institution of higher learning and indulge in Zapatas (my utmost favorite).  
I found every other facet of this business to be agreeable. The ambiance and decor were suitably arranged for a Mexican restaurant, creating a pleasant atmosphere. The culinary offerings were skillfully prepared and were quite appetizing. The beverage selection was plentiful. The hospitality was impeccable. What more could one request, truly? This establishment featured specialties, which appeared enticing to the majority. Undoubtedly deserving of a trial visit!

So I found this great little restaurant on Yelp during one of our many Vegas trips and I have to say that I am in love with the french toast sandwich!!!! I'm a huge fan of savory and sweet and this place nailed it to the wall!! Great place to have breakfast after dancing the night away on the Las Vegas strip! I just wish I lived closer because the food here is amaziiiiing and totally crave-worthy!

I am fulfilling my civic obligation as a juror twice a week for a duration of four months, which conveniently allows me to explore a previously unfamiliar part of Phoenix during my retirement. Each day, I indulge in culinary excursions to diverse establishments, savoring a variety of delectable dishes. Cartel Coffee Lab, a trendy eatery boasting an eclectic ambiance, offers an array of tantalizing options beyond their specialty coffee drinks, including breakfast, lunch, and possibly dinner. Upon ordering the BLT, I was inquiringly asked if I was agreeable to the presence of an egg on the sandwich, to which I responded affirmatively, having been exposed to a similar variation of the dish, known as a BELT, during my sojourn in Canada. The friendly server, who attended to my needs with remarkable attentiveness, ensured that my dining experience was thoroughly enjoyable, engaging in conversation and expressing genuine interest in my satisfaction with the meal. While I cannot confer a perfect rating without multiple visits, I assure you that the quality of both the nourishment and hospitality at Cartel Coffee Lab warrants a hearty recommendation. I eagerly anticipate my next visit, when I shall relish their espresso offerings and likely upgrade my assessment to a well-deserved five stars.

The staff members exhibited exceptional cordiality and hospitality, ensuring that our stay was thoroughly enjoyable and hassle-free. The rooms were spacious, well-appointed, and meticulously maintained, providing us with a comfortable and relaxing environment to retreat to after a day of indulging in the various recreational activities available on the premises. The swimming pool was an impressive expanse of crystal clear water, replete with picturesque waterfalls and surrounded by lush greenery, creating a tranquil ambiance that was further enhanced by the cleanliness and maintenance of the facility. We did not experience any delays or inconvenience during our stay, as the service was prompt and efficient. Additionally, the lazy river provided an idyllic setting for a leisurely float, while the on-site restaurants offered an array of delectable culinary options, although at a slightly higher price point than we had anticipated. Nonetheless, the quality of the food and the overall dining experience made it a worthwhile investment for a family vacation centered around poolside fun and relaxation.

After having been terrestrially domiciled on this planet for a duration of twenty-seven revolutions of the earth around the sun, I ultimately had the gratification of partaking in a culinary experience of Korean BBQ for the first time in my life, which transpired in Las Vegas of all locations. We relinquished our ten-dollar beverages at XS and decided it was an opportune moment to relax the gastronomical constraints of our belts at D.J.K. Two remarkable individuals of Korean descent navigated us through the menu; alright, that's a slight exaggeration...they placed the orders on our behalf, but I am exceedingly grateful that they did! It is imperative that you sample soju, a potent Korean liquor that complements the cuisine remarkably well. Additionally, if you happen to be present between the hours of eleven o'clock in the evening and two o'clock in the morning, you will receive a twenty percent discount on your total bill.

"This gastronomical establishment, specializing in delectable Italian cuisine, has proven to be the most exceptional in Las Vegas, boasting an impressive menu that includes an array of mouthwatering pizzas and equally tantalizing dinner entrÃ©es. My personal preference is the chicken Marsala, although I have also indulged in the shrimp Alfredo, various pizza options, and focaccia, all of which have garnered unanimous approval from both my local and visiting acquaintances. While placing an order for delivery may present a minor challenge due to the youthfulness of the female staff members, who can sometimes struggle with effectively communicating the details of the order, the expediency of the delivery process and the superior quality of the culinary offerings more than compensate for any initial difficulties. Moreover, the prices at this eatery are eminently reasonable, making it an excellent choice for those seeking a satisfying dining experience without breaking the bank."

"Indubitably, my experience during the latter portion of the twentieth century's final decade was characterized by an unwavering fondness for this establishment, which served as the culinary epicenter of my inaugural visit to this city in over a decade and a half. My gastronomical expectations were not only met but exceeded, particularly with regard to the succulent crawfish appetizer that preceded the main course. It is utterly inconceivable that I would tolerate such an extended hiatus before once again partaking in the delectable offerings of this esteemed eatery."

Great concept, basically as much toppings you want for $12.

The pizza is the perfect size for 1 person too. The crust is nice and thin. So you can easily finish this by yourself without feeling guilty of eating all those calories.

I was glad to hear that there is another branch in Hillcrest, San Diego. So I will definitely stopping by that restaurant as well.

Again, the pizza is good. Good quality, and choose your toppings or just go for their standard menu, all for $12 per pizza.

"Tremendously delectable tacos and an ambiance that exudes an air of intriguing uniqueness! As an individual who frequently embarks on journeys to Texas, I must say that the quality of these tacos rivals, and perhaps even surpasses, the culinary excellence of those which I actively seek out during my sojourns in the Lone Star State."

The indulgence of a self-made waffle cone, complemented by the richness of Almond Joy ice cream, served as the quintessential treat for my taste buds, as I relished in the hospitable demeanor of the servers and savored the palatable quality of the frozen delicacy, thereby fulfilling my craving for a satisfying dessert experience; thus, ensuring my future patronage at this establishment during my subsequent visits to my significant other's domicile in the Steel City.

"We visited this establishment for a midday repast with Rand H., and our culinary experience was rather satisfactory, boasting an extensive array of approximately 40 diverse items, analogous to the customary Indian smorgasbord in scope. The preliminary liquid offerings, specifically the egg drop and hot and sour varieties, were indeed delectable, prompting me to partake in a bowl of each. The primary dishes, encompassing a multitude of flavors and textures, were executed with remarkable proficiency, warranting top marks - five stars, to be precise. However, their concluding sweet course, comprising jello, sliced peaches, and those minuscule, gelatinous spheres commonly referred to as lychee, proved somewhat lacking in quality. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, we enjoyed a superlative luncheon at a most reasonable tariff of $5.75; regrettably, the hospitality we received fell slightly short of excellence, thereby precluding a perfect five-star rating. Nonetheless, in light of the exceptional culinary prowess displayed, I confer upon them a respectable four stars."

This review is only for the crepe I had...it definitely satisfied my crepe-craving and sweet tooth! It had nutella, whipped cream, caramel, chocolate sauce, bananas, and candied hazelnuts. There is no possible way to have a bad day in Vegas when you start off breakfast like this ;)

"My culinary experiences at this establishment have been consistently satisfying, with the ambiance and outdoor seating being particularly noteworthy.
