Following my initial visit, I opted to reserve judgment until I had sampled their offerings on multiple occasions. Now, having patronized them thrice, I can confidently attest to the delectability of their fare. However, it is unfortunate that the quality of their service has been inconsistent, with prolonged waiting periods and momentary lapses in attention to detail. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, the merits of their gastronomic creations and overall ambiance warrant further exploration."
Nicer thrift store, many items to choose from, they got rid of there 99 cent days, and half price/99 sent colored tags. not too much junk. overall a trip worth while, especially for cloths! ;)

Tonight's vacation dinner destination was Bandera, situated in the historic Old Town Scottsdale district. We had been apprised of numerous laudatory reviews pertaining to Bandera, and thus, we were eager to partake in the culinary experience it offered. It is worth mentioning that Bandera shares a familial relationship with two esteemed restaurants, Houstons and The Rutherford Grill, both of which have received top-notch ratings from this writer.  

Upon arriving at the establishment approximately a half hour prior to our scheduled reservation time, we opted to indulge in a pre-dinner beverage and sample the Deviled Egg appetizer on the inviting patio area. Our table was promptly prepared, and we were seated in no time. We elected to initiate our dining experience with the Grilled Artichoke and Cornbread side dishes...the artichoke was exceptionally delectable. The cornbread was truly remarkable, ranking as the most flavorful and satisfying iteration I have had the pleasure of consuming. For my primary course, I selected the Steak and Enchilada combination. The 6oz filet was skillfully cut into three manageable portions, each generously coated with a rich, deep crimson spicy sauce. The enchilada boasted their signature rotisserie chicken as its central component. Both dishes proved to be thoroughly enjoyable. 

My better half chose the Macho Salad as her main course. Upon the arrival of the salad, we noticed that an integral component, specifically the rotisserie chicken, was absent. However, the oversight was rapidly addressed, and she relished it to a considerable extent. 

While I did appreciate Bandera's offerings, they fell slightly short of my lofty expectations, perhaps due to the incorporation of a Mexican fusion element. A commendable effort, nonetheless, warranting a respectable four-star rating.

"I am effusively praising the exceptional massage therapist who executed an outstanding job of alleviating the tension in my muscles a few days prior. Her name is Miranda, a somewhat reserved individual who requires a brief period of familiarization to become conversational. Despite her slender physique, she possesses remarkable manual dexterity and demonstrable strength in her fingertips. It is evident that she has extensive knowledge and expertise in her field, which has led me to schedule another appointment within a relatively short time frame. Additionally, I must commend the immaculate condition of this establishment's facilities and the majority of the staff members, particularly the individual stationed at the reception area, who exhibits a courteous yet no-nonsense demeanor, thereby creating a welcoming atmosphere for patrons."

"The cinematic venues are all remarkably pleasant and appear strikingly pristine, boasting an array of modern amenities that cater to the diverse preferences of their patrons. The concession stand offers an extensive selection of delectable treats, including the tantalizing corn dog bites that caught the fancy of my elder child, who was delighted by the attentive service of the cashier, who ensured timely delivery of the order to our designated viewing area despite the brief preparation time required."

I went there during the \"Montreal poutine week\" , their brisket poutine was so good, the meat was very tasty, however, the service was slow , we had waited about half an hour to have the poutine and there are not many tables, so maybe takeaway is better.

This establishment evokes memories of the coffee shop iteration of the boba store where I am employed, which I find rather peculiar. Upon entering and departing, we were cordially greeted by the staff, who exhibited a relaxed and accommodating demeanor. The pricing system was straightforward and reasonable, with amounts rounded to the nearest dollar, which I greatly appreciate. I opted for a soy iced latte, which was quite impressive, boasting a distinct earthy quality that differed from the customary coffee beans I am accustomed to. The flavor was neither overpowering nor bitter, striking a perfect balance between strength and subtlety. The welcoming ambiance of the interior design beckoned me to linger with companions, engaging in one of the various board games available. However, my primary intention was to utilize the venue for academic purposes, thus I refrained from indulging in the diverse amenities offered. Unfortunately, the cashier professed unfamiliarity with the renowned grouchy cookies, much to my surprise. Notwithstanding this, I was pleased to discover prompt and hassle-free Wi-Fi connectivity. Regrettably, the distance between this establishment and my residence precludes me from visiting more frequently, as I would have liked.

"Tammy Coe Cakes has emerged as a culinary haven in Phoenix, boasting an array of delectable edibles that have captured the palates of local gastronomes, while the hospitable nature of its staff has fostered a sense of belonging among patrons, thereby solidifying the establishment's reputation as a cherished component of the city's epicurean landscape."
Was looking for WOC's and the sales person was really friendly to my surprise. I would def come back here if they have stock.  Better lucky next time for me.

I possess a diminutive stature of merely 5 feet and 2 inches; thus, I necessitated the alteration of a pair of jeans with a low-rise design to accommodate my relatively diminutive height. My quest for an establishment capable of providing such services led me to this particular business, whose reputation for punctuality, exceptional craftsmanship, and benevolent customer service preceded it. Although their prices may not be the most economical in comparison to those of other tailors, the quality of their work and the attentive nature of their customer care justify the slightly higher cost.

This culinary establishment was serendipitously uncovered during an impromptu search for a delectable noodle-based dish. As I was in close proximity to my alma mater, I elected to utilize my mobile device to peruse online reviews and ratings for local eateries specializing in said cuisine. Upon accessing a popular search engine, this particular venue appeared among the top results, thereby piquing my curiosity. My initial trepidation stemmed from the apparent dichotomy in their menu offerings, which seemed to juxtapose Italian and Asian influences. However, my intrigue was sufficiently aroused to warrant further exploration, thus prompting me to physically visit the premises. Upon entering the establishment, I was struck by the diverse array of options presented before me. Despite my predilection for Italian fare, my craving for something more exotic proved decisive, leading me to opt for a traditional Thai dish. To my delight, the Pad Thai exceeded my expectations, boasting an impressive medley of flavors that thoroughly impressed my discerning palate. Subsequent visits have only reinforced my favorable opinion of this unassuming eatery, which maintains a relaxed ambiance ideal for informal dining experiences or convenient takeout. In fact, I often enjoy relishing their culinary creations within the comfort of my own abode, accompanied by engaging television programming such as reality shows or dramas featuring domestic sagas. Overall, this hidden gem is worthy of consideration for those seeking a satisfying meal in a low-key setting.

Mango, chili, lime, oh my! This pie is awesome. The first bite is strange as it's spicy, yet rich and tart. Go past the first bite and you'll be back for more (if you can handle the spice!). \n\nI enjoy Mama Toledo's!

We visited this establishment during their happy hour promotion approximately two weeks prior to composing our assessment, but unfortunately, we were unable to provide our feedback in a timely manner as the business had already ceased operations by the time we were prepared to share our thoughts, with said closure occurring in June of 2013, thereby rendering our intended review obsolete.

"The young gentleman, Kiddo, entered the photography studio for his senior portrait session, adhering to a prearranged appointment. Following a brief interval of approximately fifteen minutes, during which time he changed into his formal attire, he emerged from one of the rear studios. Subsequently, a thorough examination and evaluation of the diverse photographs and poses ensued, resulting in an exceptional quality of images. The studio's proficiency and expertise were evident in their ability to capture the essence of the moment and portray it in a visually appealing manner. Additionally, they offered a unique opportunity to take supplementary photographs in casual attire, which proved to be an excellent complement to the traditional graduation gown shot. Ultimately, my satisfaction with the experience and the quality of the photographs led me to recommend this studio to my acquaintances and loved ones, with a return factor of eighty-five percent."

Omg, best dinner ever, try the meatballs for an appetizer !!!!! It's unassuming how good it was going to be but we will be BAck next time we are in Vegas. Good value as it was not I the casino. I enjoyed the sangria? Although don't sit overlooking the mall, it's very warm by there. Sit inside the resturaunt

The true eastside contender.  Sakana is a real deal Ayce ace.  

Appetizers like dynamite and nigiri are second to no other ayce sushi joint.  With fresh and oversized cuts of fish.  You have got to give these guys a try.  Rice ratio is still the best feature to this restaurant.  Gone are the no limit uni, sweet shrimp, fresh oyster and deserts.  Those have now joined the ranks of the "1 per".  Sadly there were no uni and fresh oyster today.  All that aside it is still an excellent choice for a man vs. sushi night!

The fried stuff was great.  The specialty rolls were good.  The star of the show for me was definitely the Super White and the Garlic Tuna.  My meal mates were definitely impressed with the quality for ayce.  Lobster and Popcorn Lobster Rolls had them smiling today.  The Bulgogi was not the favorite for them.  Indulge in the Quail Egg.  

I feel bad for ordering a bite more than we could chew.  It's a mistake giving everyone a turn at the ordering sheet.  They kindly did not charge us for the last 2 rolls that we over ordered..  Thanks guys!  Service will be courteous and pleasant here.  I am willing to restore the missing star in this rating if they have Uni next time we come.  Yes there will be a return visit from us!

I am delighted to be cognizant of the fact that this establishment has been reopened under novel administration. Prior to its closure, I would have likely accorded this eatery two stars or fewer, due to my perception that the premises were consistently unclean and my concern that such lack of attention to tidiness in the work environment might raise questions regarding the quality of their culinary offerings. However, since this particular Burger King has resumed operations, it appears to have undergone a considerable transformation for the better. The personnel are meticulous in their approach, exhibiting a high level of friendliness and promptness. Additionally, the venue is now noticeably more sanitary. I sincerely hope that this upward trend will persist.

"Over the past two years, there has been a marked improvement in the quality of the food and services offered by this establishment, making it a challenging task to refrain from bestowing a perfect five-star rating upon it, despite its affiliation with a large corporation, given the exceptional value it offers for the price, which makes it an ideal destination for those seeking affordable and satisfying culinary options."

"Based solely on their delectable pastries, which showcase an unparalleled level of culinary mastery and expertise in the art of baking, I would unhesitatingly bestow upon this establishment a perfect rating of five stars. However, my evaluation process does not succumb to such superficiality and shallow assessments, but rather encompasses a holistic approach that takes into account various other aspects of the dining experience, including the quality of the food, the ambiance, and the service. Thus, I shall provide a comprehensive review that reflects my genuine sentiments and impressions of this restaurant, without being unduly influenced by my admittedly immense fondness for their sublime pastries.

The dining area exudes a warm and inviting ambiance, with the option to sit outside and savor the delicious fare amidst the picturesque surroundings. The service has consistently demonstrated exceptional quality, with the staff exhibiting a keen attention to detail, prompt responsiveness, and an unwavering commitment to ensuring the utmost satisfaction of their patrons.

My personal preferences, while not exhaustive, include a few select items that have earned a special place in my heart and taste buds. These include, but are not limited to, the flavorsome hummus, the delectable gyro, the crispy flatbread pizzas, and last, but certainly not least, the mouthwatering pastries that have captured my palate and left me in a state of unabashed delight. In conclusion, this restaurant has secured a place among my favorites, and I eagerly look forward to my next visit, when I can once again indulge in their culinary masterpieces."

"Based on some local insight, I opted to dine at Sedona Lounge, which turned out to be an excellent culinary experience! Located in Summerlin, it's just a short drive from the Strip via the 215. Although the interior ambiance is somewhat subdued, the atmosphere exudes an air of refinement and sophistication that belies the reasonable price point of the menu offerings. Rumor has it that renowned tennis player Andre Agassi is a occasional patron of this establishment. 

My dining companion, Mrs. C, continued her streak of judicious ordering by selecting the most affordable option, which surprisingly turned out to be the best dish. Her uncanny ability to identify culinary gems never ceases to amaze me! The three-course menu, available for approximately $30, featured: 
- A rich chicken consommÃ©, elegantly presented in a teapot and subsequently poured into a small bowl of mushrooms at our table 
- Sear scallops complemented by a creamy bacon and mushroom sauce 
- A decadent crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e 
While other three-course menu options were available, Mrs. C's preference was to indulge in the finest dishes, as is customary in Las Vegas. 

I opted for the New York strip, while our dining companion's mother, who now resides in Vegas and had recommended Sedona Lounge, chose the filet mignon. The Sunday evening steak menu was a remarkable 50% off, making for an exceptional value. My only minor criticism was the absence of a baked potato option to accompany my steak, but this did not detract from the exceptional quality of the cuisine. Overall, Sedona Lounge offers a fantastic dining experience, further enhanced by the Sunday special promotion."

Service was great and so was the food.  I now want to open my own \"sliders\" restaurant after enjoying the chicken parm sliders.  Great selection of beers and several options for tasting flights.  Their deserts looked amazing but we didn't save room.  Overall, great experience and one of the most reasonably priced meals we ate while in LV.

I didn't stay here but I came here to walk around and shop! Planet Hollywood would be a really good place to stay at because its kinda in the middle of the strip plus SHOPPING!!! They have sooooooo many stores inside! I love all the lights outside of this place and inside its just so fun! I think I can spend hours inside shopping..=)

"My culinary experience was largely satisfying, despite some minor drawbacks.  The costly fare was, for the most part, delectable, yet certain aspects of the presentation were somewhat incongruous.  Specifically, the beef tartare, an otherwise exceptional dish, was accompanied by two distinct beds of mashed potatoes, which seemed somewhat superfluous.  The striped bass, obtained from the specials menu, was undeniably flavorful.  Moreover, I thoroughly enjoyed the taste of the butternut squash tortelli; however, I felt that its visual presentation could have been more aesthetically pleasing.  While the portions were appropriately sized, it is worth noting that the majority of entrees exceeded $50 in price, making it a rather expensive dining excursion.  The service, on the other hand, was truly commendable. \n\nFellow patrons, please take note: it would be greatly appreciated if you could maintain a moderate tone of voice and ensure that any children in your company are kept under control.  Due to the restaurant's tile floors and high ceilings, Olives has the potential to become quite loud."

This establishment proved to be exceptional, boasting impressive attributes such as efficient and friendly service, an accommodating staff, and a superior quality of food. Specifically, the pace at which our orders were fulfilled was quite rapid, almost instantaneous, which greatly enhanced our dining experience. Furthermore, the presentation of the dishes was aesthetically pleasing, with each item being carefully arranged to create a visually appealing composition. However, I must admit that I would have preferred it if they had offered sashimi as an alternative to sushi, as this would have allowed me to better appreciate the natural flavor and texture of the fish without the distraction of rice. Nonetheless, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who takes pleasure in indulging in sushi, as the portions are thoughtfully designed to provide an optimal balance of ingredients. Overall, this dining establishment is certainly worthy of praise and recognition for its commitment to providing an exceptional culinary experience.

"Indubitably, the culinary experience offered by this establishment is of unparalleled excellence, with the GARLIC CHICKEN accompanied by an abundance of savory gravy being a personal favorite. The portions are copious, and the prices, reasonable. Although, it must be noted that the Adobo can, at times, exhibit a propensity towards excessive saltiness. Nonetheless, the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet transcends mere culinary indulgence, reaching an apogee of gastronomical delight. A word of caution, however, the establishment's seeming indecision regarding their expansion into California may prove to be a hindrance to their otherwise well-deserved success. An expedited resolution is recommended."
What's not to love! Old town Las Vegas. Tons of lights.\nZipline. Lights. Gambling. Lights. Great food. Lights.\nA must in anyone's lifetime. And can I say this again ... I won here too!

We had an exceptional experience, characterized by a lack of difficulties or inconveniences, and the personnel were incredibly cordial and accommodating. We endeavored to prolong our stay from four nights to seven, but unfortunately, the establishment was fully booked for the entire duration. However, we greatly appreciated the shuttle service, which provided us with convenient transportation for both grocery shopping and excursions to the renowned Las Vegas Strip. We are eagerly anticipating our return visit!!

We work about 1/4 mile from this great little spot.  It used to be called the Brown Bag Sandwich shop and I ate there a few times a year.  Since they've been Arizona Sandwich Company, I've eaten there on average once a week, and for good reason.  

All the sandwiches I've had are awesome.  The bread is so soft, it feels like a goose down pillow.  They hook you up with a healthy portion no matter what item you order.  The sides are delicious and the desserts look amazing too.  (I don't normally do desserts)

We are greeted by name now when we arrive which feels great.  The daily specials are a no-brainer.  Lately I don't even peruse the menu.  I just go with the daily special and have yet to be disappointed.  

Here's a tip: follow them on FB and you can get a $2 sando if you're hot on the status updates.  

I recommend checking this place out.  It's directly east, across the strees (52nd) from the QT on the corner of University/52nd.  

The best part, is that I can get in/out in less than 15 minutes.  That really helps for people with very busy schedules.  

See you there!

The Times Square Neighborhood Restaurant is a neighborhood jewel. Breakfast is tasty at a totally reasonable price. Dinner of pizza and wings were some of the best we have ever had. A great local restaurant with excellence service, great beers on tap, and authentic Italian food at such a reasonable price. Don't pass this place....it truly is a must try!

We had the pleasure of partaking in a delectable luncheon at this esteemed eatery in the company of some acquaintances during our sojourn in this charming town. The delay in being seated was approximately twenty minutes; however, the ambiance of the outdoor seating area, replete with a live musical performance and a picturesque view of Scottsdale and Camelback, more than compensated for the brief wait. I opted for the Market Sunflower salad, which boasted an array of flavorsome ingredients including blackened chicken, goat cheese, bacon, dried strawberries, blueberries, sunflower seeds, and my spouse chose the Smoked Turkey Ciabatta, featuring gouda cheese, bacon, sweet tomato, and roasted red pepper aioli. My culinary experience was thoroughly enjoyable, as I relished every bite of my salad; however, my husband's satisfaction with his sandwich was somewhat diminished, despite the fact that the sweet potato chips served alongside it were undeniably scrumptious. I would unhesitatingly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying repast.

Who would have conjectured that Las Vegas would eventually gain recognition for their sandwiches? Well, I am now convinced that they have accomplished such a feat, subsequent to savoring "Earl of Sandwich" within the Planet Hollywood hotel and casino. I placed an order for "The Full Montagu," which turned out to be a sizzling hot roast beef sandwich, complemented by turkey, Swiss, and cheddar cheese, lettuce, and, of course, the renowned "Earl's mustard sauce." I decided to omit the tomatoes, as I have come to realize that, at times, tomatoes possess an excessive amount of juiciness, which has the potential to overwhelm my sandwich, causing it to become somewhat disrupted;). Anyway, I also had the opportunity to sample the "Earl's grey lemonade," which I found to be relatively satisfactory, not excessively sweetened. The majority of individuals might argue that the most appealing aspect of a sandwich lies within the meat or the sauce, however, I firmly believe that it was the "Earl's artisan bread" that truly won me over. It managed to maintain a perfect balance between being robust enough to securely hold the meat and toppings, while simultaneously retaining a soft texture that prevented it from becoming soggy. Therefore, if you ever find yourself in Vegas and desire an alternative to the customary buffet, I highly recommend indulging in a sandwich at "Earl of Sandwich!"

"Optimizing the consumption of calories post-dinner at Windsor, an excursion to Churn presents itself as a judicious endeavor, owing to the establishment's proffering of distinctive ice cream flavors, nostalgic confectionaries, playful knick-knacks, and baked delights. My niece sampled the Peach and Honey ice cream, only to find that the unadulterated honey overwhelmed the peach flavor, resulting in an overly saccharine experience. In contrast, my selection involved a traditional butter pecan ice cream sandwich, wherein the patron has the autonomy to choose from an array of freshly baked cookies and pair them with their preferred ice cream variety. Regrettably, the ice cream failed to maintain its solid state under the sweltering summer sun, leading to an accelerated melting process. Thus, I shall defer my exploration of additional flavors on a pretzel cone until a later date, when the ambient temperature is less oppressive."

Great place for our Saturday brunch. Our party of 10 got seated promptly. We sat by the window and a partial view of the pool area and tropical trees, which was nice.

Everyone enjoyed their meal. My sister and I shared the Filet Benedict. They split it for us, which was cool. I also enjoyed the their Bloody Mary. One of the girls ordreded the Exotic Coconut Pancakes that included a mini coconut and mango butter. It was the right amount of sweetness. Very yummy!

Great place for a low-key yet tasteful brunch!

I have been looking for a great breakfast spot in my area and I have found it!  Parson's is a great little family owned place where the owner still works with the staff on a daily basis.  The location itself is worn out, but the food definately delivers!  Let me just say this now....  Best Pancakes in town!  No question.  The staff is super nice and the food flys out of the kitchen.  It's a great Breakfast spot, not to be overlooked!  And don't pay attention to Jennifer D's review.....she is from Snottsdale where they really have no idea of what a good traditional breakfast should be.

The culinary experience was utterly superb, with the pho and fried rice being particularly delectable. Despite our enthusiasm for the meal, we encountered a minor hiccup in the form of unfulfilled expectations regarding the spring rolls, which regrettably did not materialize even after a polite reminder. Nonetheless, the satisfaction derived from the primary dishes was sufficient to preclude any lingering feelings of hunger, thereby rendering the oversight relatively inconsequential. Suffice it to say, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit to this gastronomic haven.

"The sole reason I refrained from bestowing a perfect five-star rating upon this esteemed establishment was due to the occasional difficulty in securing parking proximate to the rear of Town Square, particularly during peak hours. However, this minor inconvenience does not detract from the fact that this venue ranks among the most pleasant and enjoyable in Las Vegas. While the cost may be slightly higher than that of other theatres, the luxurious auditoriums, comfortable seating, and impressive presentation more than compensate for the additional expense. Furthermore, the presence of numerous bars, restaurants, and retail outlets in the immediate vicinity allows patrons to engage in various activities before or after their cinematic experience, all within a convenient walking distance. It is worth noting that this theatre boasts an unusual security measure, with multiple armed guards patrolling the premises, which may elicit mixed emotions. Nevertheless, the theatre's extensive facilities catering to children are undoubtedly a valuable asset for families visiting during the daytime. In conclusion, this venue offers a truly unique and satisfying experience, well worth the investment."
Food was great and the atmosphere was lovely. The drinks were a little pricy, even tho it was happy hour. service was a little slow tooo.

I have had the privilege of partaking in the indulgent ambiance of Drai's on two separate occasions, whereupon my first visit, the esteemed establishment elected to curtail their guest list prior to the clock striking 11:30 pm, thereby necessitating a financial expenditure of $20 per person for my companions and me, a trio of ladies, which proved to be a tad disappointing, to say the least. Conversely, during my second visit, we were accorded the benefit of being included on the guest list once more, with the added bonus of complimentary admission for the ladies and a moderate tariff of $40 for the gentlemen on a Saturday evening during Labor Day weekend, a proposition that I deemed to be quite reasonable. The queue for the guest list, I must remark, progressed with remarkable expediency.

The venue, boasting an air of opulence and refinement akin to that of Marquee and XS, featured an expansive dance floor indoors and a picturesque pool area outside, accompanied by a pair of bars situated on the opposing side of the dance floor. The true piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of Drai's, however, lay in its spectacular array of lighting effects, comprising dazzling LED screens, a gleaming LED disco ball, and captivating lasers, all of which combined to create an atmosphere of unadulterated joviality and merriment, further enhanced by the presence of exceptionally skilled DJs. It is worth mentioning that Drai's is conveniently housed within the luxurious Cromwell hotel, where guests can avail themselves of complimentary valet parking, and I would like to take this opportunity to emphasize the importance of extending a gratuity to the valet staff, as it is only proper etiquette.

Cheapest place to buy liquor.
For all the Californians, think of...Bev Mo!! 
$24 for a 750ml bottle of Hennessy. 

You can't go wrong with that!!!

I'm really happy to finally have Downtown Summerlin open. There are a good list of shops, restaurants and stores available. I love how it is similar to Town Square and can be seen right off of the 215 freeway. It was fun to watch it grow as I live just down the street. I hope to see all the bad stores like Shaggy Chic or Off Broadway Shoe Warehouse (don't waste your money those places they have terrible customer service) and more places like Earl of Sandwich and GAP come that way I don't have to drive all the way to Fashion Show Mall for a good shopping trip. Also the luxury regal isn't bad since it's more adult friendly than kid friendly :)

"Happy Hour reigns supreme, offering an unparalleled culinary experience with its delectable chips, salsa, and bean dip that are simply sublime. I frequent this establishment with regularity during happy hour and consistently indulge in their extraordinary Mexican Pizza, which boasts an unrivaled flavor profile. Additionally, their margaritas are a masterclass in mixology, expertly crafted to delight the palate. The service at this venue is also exceptional, thanks in large part to the friendly and attentive demeanor of Letty, who tends bar with remarkable proficiency."

We procured an exceptional offer from Hotwire for our temporary lodging at the MGM, which amounted to a mere $50 per night, inclusive of an unparalleled panoramic view of the renowned Las Vegas Strip. My incredulity was piqued by the hotel's economical pricing, given its opulent interior design, spotless ambiance, and expansive windows that afforded an unobstructed perspective of the city's vibrant nightlife. Although slightly irksome, the green light emanating from the exterior did not significantly impinge upon our enjoyment; we quickly acclimated to its presence following the second night of our stay. Furthermore, we were presented with a discount of $20 on the MGM buffet, which we deemed utterly worthwhile due to the culinary delights served, including an array of delectable morning mimosas that proved an ideal elixir for alleviating the effects of a late night revelry. Based on our thoroughly satisfactory experience, we would unhesitatingly reserve accommodations at the MGM via Hotwire in the future, as it fulfilled our expectations of a Las Vegas hotel by offering a combination of immaculate amenities, reasonable rates, and a prime location.

"C'est le 'first kiss' bar par excellence! Mesdames, if you are invited there, it is highly likely that you will experience a romantic atmosphere reminiscent of a bygone era, characterized by soft lighting, retro music, cozy nooks, and drinks served in stylish glasses, all of which contribute to an ambiance conducive to relaxation and socialization. Once captivated by the melodic tunes and mildly intoxicated by the sweet alcoholic beverages, you may succumb to the charm of this unique and original establishment, located in the heart of Montreal. The proprietors of Big in Japan have successfully transformed a once-dingy bar into a nearly perfect setting, eliciting a sense of coup de foudre, or love at first sight, from those who visit. If you are interested and have the financial means, you can even purchase your own bottle of whiskey, prominently displayed above the bar using a magnet, adding to the allure of this already enchanting venue. However, be aware that space is limited, so act quickly to secure your spot at this esteemed location."

We paid a visit to The Keg for our evening meal and experienced a truly enjoyable dining experience, characterized by attentive and expeditious service, a culinary delight that left us exceedingly satisfied, and an atmosphere that exuded elegance and refinement.

Upon being seated, we were immediately attended to by a courteous and proficient server who presented us with menus and offered recommendations from the extensive offerings. The goat cheese appetizer, which we opted to initiate our meal with, was sublimely prepared, its rich, velvety texture and subtle tang impeccably balanced, thereby eliciting immense gratification.

Furthermore, the mixed greens that constituted the salad course were crisp and fresh, their flavors enhanced by a judicious application of dressing that avoided overpowering the palate. Likewise, the vegetables accompanying the entree were cooked to perfection, retaining their natural sweetness and firm texture without being overcooked or mushy.

For my main course, I requested a rare filet, which, upon its arrival, proved to be a masterful execution of the chef's craft, boasting a tender, juicy texture and a satisfying, deep red hue. While it would have been even more exceptional had it been served with a slightly greater quantity of blood, this minor shortcoming did not detract from the overall excellence of the dish.

Similarly, my spouse's selection of filet and crab was likewise impressively prepared, each component cooked to perfection and harmonizing beautifully with the other elements on the plate. Of particular note was the coffee, whose quality equaled that of the delectable creme brulee we sampled during a previous visit, constituting a welcome surprise given our past experience.

In conclusion, The Keg presents itself as a superlative alternative to more expensive establishments such as Ruth's Chris and Morton's, offering a dining experience that is every bit as satisfying while being more budget-friendly. Therefore, it is with great enthusiasm that I recommend this esteemed eatery to those seeking a sophisticated culinary adventure.

"An exceptional golf facility situated within the picturesque confines of Arizona State University's campus, featuring a state-of-the-art clubhouse that offers an extensive array of ASU merchandise and serves delectable, moderately priced meals during the daytime hours."

Located within the expansive retail confines of Ocean Terminal, this particular branch of Clinton Cards boasts an impressive array of products, ranging from an assortment of greeting cards, wrapping paper, stationery, and an eclectic mix of gifts that cater to diverse tastes and preferences. Upon entering the store, I found myself becoming increasingly captivated by the diverse offerings, leading me to spend an extended period browsing through the various items on display.  

During my leisurely exploration of the store, I was particularly drawn to a selection of adorable compact mirrors, pencils, pens, and key rings, each featuring endearing animal designs. These diminutive items were part of a promotion, priced at an affordable 99p, which prompted me to purchase several of them.  

While perusing the wedding-themed section of the store, I chanced upon what can only be described as the most unconventional gift item I have ever laid eyes on. Presented in a box emblazoned with the phrase, "Congratulations on your Wedding Day," the contents revealed a somewhat bizarre figurine of a black cat sporting a diamante collar and earrings. I must admit that I found myself in a state of utter incredulity at the sight of this peculiar item, left speechless by its sheer audacity. My curiosity piqued, I couldn't help but wonder what sort of couple would appreciate such an unusual gift on their special day. Needless to say, I wouldn't recommend presenting it to any newlywed pair expecting a traditional or even remotely conventional gift.  

Despite my reservations regarding their questionable taste in wedding presents, I must commend the Clinton Cards branch for its overall inventory, meticulous organization, and the warm demeanor of its staff members.

During the diurnal hours, a most agreeable and tranquil ambiance permeates the establishment, complemented by an excellent beverage commonly referred to as coffee. In the evening, this atmosphere of relaxation is further enhanced by the presence of live musical performances or open-mic nights featuring local talent. Unfortunately, the location of this establishment within a commercial strip mall serves as a notable drawback.

"Groupon served as the impetus for my inaugural visit, and my inherent trepidation was palpable upon entrance. However, my prolonged curiosity regarding this establishment was satiated by the acquisition of a discounted Groupon, which afforded me the opportunity to indulge in their culinary offerings at a reduced cost. My expectations were surpassed, as the flavors present in their dishes were remarkably rich and diverse. Specifically, the eggplant dish I ordered was tantamount to a gastronomic masterpiece, boasting an unparalleled depth of flavor that was reminiscent of a beloved family recipe. Furthermore, the spaghetti sauce was akin to a velvety blanket of savory goodness, enveloping my taste buds in a comforting embrace. The complementary cheese bread served as an excellent accompaniment to the meal, its texture and flavor harmonizing seamlessly with the other components of the dish. The ambiance of the restaurant itself contributed significantly to the overall experience, exuding a warm and inviting aura through its eclectic decor and the friendly demeanor of the staff. Such factors combined to create an atmosphere that was at once cozy and refined, effectively cultivating a sense of familiarity and welcome in those who entered. My satisfaction with the meal was such that I would eagerly anticipate future visits, for the authenticity of the cuisine was undeniable, mirroring as it did the cultural heritage of the proprietors themselves."

Pros: 24/7, service great, We were hungry so just about anything would have been good. I had the asian lettuce cups. Made to perfection. Hubby hada mushroom swiss angus burger with fries. He ate the whole thing! \n\nCons: A bit pricey.

"The caliber of the sushi served at this establishment is exceptional, boasting an unparalleled level of freshness and artisanal craftsmanship that has garnered widespread acclaim from gastronomes and aficionados alike. Furthermore, the attentive and responsive service proffered by the staff is of the highest order, fostering a welcoming ambiance that is conducive to an enjoyable dining experience for both singles and couples seeking a romantic evening out. However, it must be noted that the prices charged for the culinary offerings are somewhat elevated, which may prove to be a deterrent for some patrons who are budget-conscious or have certain expectations regarding value for money. Nonetheless, this venue remains a popular destination for those seeking a premium sushi experience, despite the absence of any particularly unique or innovative elements in the menu options."

"This eatery, specializing in Sino-culinary delights, boasts an unpretentious ambiance, yet offers a satisfying gastronomical experience, primarily due to the reasonable tariffs and delectable fare. Its proximity to my workplace renders it a frequent destination for a midday repast. Efficiency in service is paramount, as the staff strive to accommodate incoming patrons by expediting the departure of existing customers, thereby creating an environment not conducive to lingering; however, the palatable victuals and economical pricing facilitate a hasty exit."

How has Great Harvest escaped notice? It's a franchise, but....

This place feels like a casual, local spot, with a friendly counter staff. They ply you with bakery samples when you walk in the door. Try one of the unusual breads, like Guinness-cheese, or jalapeno-cheese. Slather your chunk with an appropriate amount of soft butter or preserves.

In addition to delicious breads, rolls, cookies, and other sweets, they make great sandwiches for lunch. They offer usual suspects, like turkey, ham, and roast beef. The chicken salad was a bit iffy, but the club is tasty. Great Harvest goes a bit heavy on the red onion on most, so take some breath mints for afters.

A box lunch comes with chips, a large drink, and a dessert from the pastry case. Try a Savannah Bar. They are delicious oaty crumble bars, rich with butter, sugar and fruit like blueberries, apples, cranberries, or peaches. Because they dish up your sweet right after you order, you generally get to finish your dessert before your lunch arrives.

My only complaint is that the place can feel a bit disorganized at times. But they usually aren't terribly busy, so even during the lunch rush you can generally grab a table and a quick lunch.

This establishment boasts exceptional quality, and my frequent visits (eight, to be precise) within a mere three-month period serve as a testament to its excellence. Notwithstanding, a solitary instance of the unavailability of non-white rice varieties constitutes the sole unfavorable occurrence throughout my numerous visits. 
  As it pertains to the culinary offerings, it would be inaccurate to describe them as extraordinary. However, it would be equally erroneous to categorize them as inferior. Each dish I have sampled, including curries, pad thai, phrik khing, hot and sour soup, sweet and sour pork, and others, has been, at the very least, palatable. The curry's spicing exhibits impeccable precision, while the phrik khing's vegetables exude freshness and crispness. The sole dish that failed to impress me was the sweet and sour pork, yet this disappointment stems from my preconceived notion that Chinese cuisine served at Thai, Korean, Japanese, or Vietnamese restaurants tends to fall short of expectations. In contrast, the hot and sour soup elicits sheer ecstasy, ranking among the most flavorful creations I have ever had the pleasure of consuming. 
  Based on these factors, I assign the food a rating of 7/10. Nevertheless, considering the reasonable prices, I might reevaluate this score upward to approximately 8.5/10. 
  It is worth mentioning that the service has consistently met high standards during each of my visits, with the same courteous and friendly waitress diligently attending to my party's needs. 
  To summarize, this establishment offers satisfactory nourishment at a reasonable cost, complemented by a charming server.

Made it back in for sushi over the weekend and it was good! The only thing I didn't like was the \"crab mix\". It comes in a lot of the rolls and I just wasn't partial to it. I did really like the spicy tuna and the spicy crunch rolls. The summer Vegas was good too, but minus the crab on top. \nWe missed happy hour pricing, but it was still a gret value at regular price! We left full and happy!

"Gourmet burgers and gastronomical dogs, accompanied by expertly grilled thin crust pizzas, an assortment of delectable sandwiches, and a plethora of additional culinary delights. The unparalleled creativity and innovation that Joe's Farm Grill brings to traditional dishes is truly remarkable, particularly when utilizing their own organic and locally sourced produce. Furthermore, the relaxed and welcoming ambiance only adds to the overall dining experience. For a comprehensive critique and visual representation, please refer to the following link: http://blog.phosyzzle.com/2011/03/02/joes-farm-grill/"

Stopped by  here for a late night dinner. The portions are HUGE and I do mean huge, one plate could probably feed me for 2 days. I ordered the skewer, beef was a little dry but not bad. The Mai Thai I ordered was also in a big glass but tasty and they also serve breakfast all day long which was a plus.

"Satisfactory poultry-based shawarma, acquired the midday repast iteration which was, in my opinion, sensibly priced at an approximate cost of seven dollars and fifty cents. Notwithstanding the server's inadvertent substitution of carbohydrate-rich grains in lieu of the vegetable alternative, the culinary experience remained a worthwhile investment. Favorable appraisal regarding the pecuniary aspect; anticipating future luncheon visits."

Initially, it is imperative to note that there exist two distinct locations of the esteemed Lino's Pizzeria, and our family has had the pleasure of frequenting the establishment situated on Tenaya Drive for nearly a decade. Throughout this duration, we have developed a profound appreciation for their culinary offerings, particularly their delectable pizzas, which cater to our discerning tastes. My spouse, a native of New York, possesses a profound affinity for well-crafted dough, a quality that Lino's consistently delivers. Moreover, their Giardiniera sauce, an Italian condiment characterized by its piquant flavor profile, has become a personal favorite of mine. Our household places orders from Lino's with a frequency of several times per month, as their culinary excellence remains unparalleled in our opinions.

"The perpetual improvement of Grand Avenue continues to elevate its stature, precipitating a probable influx of populace akin to Roosevelt's scenario, thereby driving artisans and avant-garde establishments towards the western vicinity. Notwithstanding, ephemeral gastronomic gems like The GAP persist (albeit appellation legitimacy remains dubious), offering distinctive culinary experiences. While pizzerias tend towards homogeneity, these enterprising restaurateurs exercise creativity, boasting an exceptional Brussels sprouts dish; albeit, my eccentric chicken entrÃ©e (concocted by an allegedly inebriated chef) transcended expectations during a state of inebriation characterized by an unquenchable craving for sustenance (colloquially denoted as 'drunchies'). Anticipation for forthcoming musical events and performances at this venue runs high, fostering an atmosphere conducive to artistic expression and communal revelry. 

Desirable additions to the establishment might include:

Draft beers and growlers, emulating the successful program instituted by Federal Pizza, which would complement their existing offerings and enhance overall customer satisfaction."
Yummy Boba tea, great slush drinks, and cute servers. What's not to love? \n\nWell, it can get a little expensive for a college student, but prices are comparable to Starbucks ;) Go get some Boba!

"Hitherto, I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on a solitary occasion; however, I must confess that the personnel here exhibit a markedly greater degree of cordiality and warmth compared to their counterparts at other UPS Stores or FedEx/Kinko's locations that I have had the privilege of patronizing. The underlying factor contributing to this disparity in demeanor remains unclear, but whatever the reason, it is undeniable that these individuals derive palpable joy from their work, which, in turn, has fostered an environment that not only ensures my return to this specific venue for all future shipping needs but also serves as a testament to the exceptional quality of service that characterizes this facility. Furthermore, the convenience of its proximity to my domicile serves as an added benefit, rendering it the optimal choice for my shipping requirements."

To diverge momentarily from the more genuine Mexican establishments we have been frequenting of late, we opted to sample the culinary offerings of Salsa's, which tends towards an Americanized style of Mexican cuisine. This does not inherently render it inferior; rather, it simply presents a distinct departure from the norm, thereby catering to diverse palates. Consequently, those who crave an authentic experience may prefer to seek sustenance elsewhere.  
The interior of this particular Salsa's boasts an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, marred solely by the illumination. Positioned along the right flank of the eatery, a combination of ceiling fans and subdued lighting generates a bothersome stroboscopic effect that proved so distracting we were compelled to relocate. Upon doing so, no further issues arose.  
Our server exhibited exceptional proficiency, attending to our needs with celerity and efficiency. Glasses were consistently replenished, while edibles emerged from the kitchen in a timely fashion. Inquiring about recommendations is customary for me when visiting a novel dining establishment (novel in my experience, not necessarily recently established); thus, I posed a query to our waitperson, who graciously furnished guidance. This minor detail elicits praise, as indifference on the part of servers constitutes an unfortunate commonality.  
The fare itself delighted our taste buds, as fresh ingredients melded harmoniously with judiciously apportioned sauces. A steak chimichanga constituted my selection, and its quality ranked among the superior examples I have had the pleasure of consuming. For this variety of Mexican cuisine, enthusiastic endorsement is warranted; hence, an exploratory visit is strongly advocated.

We have been twice in the last couple of months, different kids, different issues. The staff was friendly and responded to our issues accordingly. When I brought in a child with low O2 levels, all the examination rooms were full. But, the dr saw us immediately after finding out. Diagnosis was spot on. \n\nWe also have had xrays done to make sure a toddler sized pinky wasn't broken. The waiting room is a bit drab, the crowd is mixed, and you'll see people in their pajamas. But, it is worth the 25min drive, passing urgent cares in the way, to see a pediatrician.

"Upon conducting an examination of the Kohl's retail establishment situated in the southern region of Phoenix, Arizona, also encompassing Ahwatukee, it became apparent that the absence of any substantial divergence between each storefront under the Kohl's brand umbrella rendered my assessment relatively uniform. However, it is worth mentioning that Kohl's tends to offer quite enticing sales promotions, which, when combined with the discounts extended to their credit cardholders through both traditional mail and electronic correspondence, can culminate in remarkable bargains for shoppers. My astonishment persists regarding the considerable quantity of merchandise that can be acquired for a relatively minimal expenditure, which I attribute primarily to the judicious utilization of clearance racks and strategically positioned sale indicators throughout the store's premises. Furthermore, I must commend the store's maintenance of a clean and well-organized environment, as well as the efficiency of the checkout process, both of which significantly contributed to a satisfying shopping excursion. As an individual who places a high value on frugality in my consumer habits, I generally find the Kohl's shopping experience to be quite agreeable, and I hope that your own encounters will yield similar sentiments."

"I had the pleasure of indulging in the Ahi salad, which was tantamount to a gastronomical experience, with the avocado being slightly overpowering, yet still complementing the dish's overall flavor profile. However, the burger truly stole the show, boasting a symphony of textures and flavors, from the tender, juicy patty to the perfectly toasted bun. The Snickers sundae was the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, featuring a delightful contrast of crunchy and chewy caramel, rich peanut butter sauce, velvety chocolate sauce, and a generous dollop of whipped cream. The sheer magnitude of this dessert made it nearly impossible for two individuals to consume in its entirety. I am eagerly anticipating my next visit, when I can sample more of their delectable offerings. The menu presents an array of culinary delights that are sure to satiate even the most discerning palates, making it challenging to select just one item. Although there may be a brief wait, it is inconsequential given the exceptional quality of the food and service."

As a self described lazy person, I decided to change things up from my typical Las Vegas debauchery and food come eating habbits to do something active in the desert for once. We found Sky Zone after reading some reviews so my buddy and I (who are huge coupon whores) added Sky Zone as a friend on facebook and scored on their $3 off admission and headed over to check it out.

Cool moon shoes + an injury waiver= AWESOME TIMES 

The whole place is a giant trampoline broken into squares so you and your friends can have your own little area. There is dodge ball on the far side but you dont have to get involved if you dont want to. Just jump around, race your friends, or try and bust out some flips. Its SO exhausting. We lasted for maybe 5 minutes before we had to sit down and an hour is a LONG TIME. We would probly do the half hour next time just because we're so out of shape. 

Seriously awesome stuff, as a big kid, I have to say its pretty fun to just let it all bounce out and fly around. Everyone is like a kid in here!

"It is not advisable to visit on the first Friday of the month, as the venue tends to become excessively congested; however, the ambiance exudes a trendy and stylish vibe, complemented by an impressive selection of artisanal provisions and expertly crafted beverages. Although the staff may come across as somewhat reserved, the atmosphere fosters an environment conducive to socializing, with seating arrangements that encourage intimate gatherings or casual interactions among patrons. For those seeking a gastronomic experience, the grilled cheese and tomato soup are highly recommended, despite the premium pricing. Additionally, the establishment offers a unique pasta special, available on either Wednesday or Thursday, though the specific day escapes my memory. To avoid disappointment, it is suggested to arrive promptly, as the venue has been known to reach capacity rather quickly."

My predilection for acquiring boba beverages is unequivocally satiated by this particular establishment, as it constitutes my go-to venue for procuring such consumables. Amongst their diverse offerings, my preferences gravitate towards the Honey Green Milk Tea and Thai Tea variants, which I unwaveringly esteem as my top picks. It is imperative to request a punch card, as it facilitates the accumulation of loyalty rewards, thereby enabling patrons to enjoy discounted or complimentary beverages subsequent to a specified number of purchases.

"We had an exceptional dining experience at this establishment, accompanied by our parental units. Although the ambiance was vibrant and bustling, it did not detract from the overall enjoyment of our meal. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and contributed significantly to the positive nature of our visit. The culinary offerings were indeed impressive, particularly the slow-cooked pork sandwich, which lived up to its reputation and satisfied our gastronomical expectations. The shrimp appetizer was an unexpected delight, boasting a rich, velvety texture and a symphony of flavors that harmoniously complemented the main course. Unfortunately, the dessert menu did not quite meet our expectations, lacking that certain je ne sais quoi that would have elevated it to the same level of excellence as the previous dishes. Nonetheless, we unanimously agreed that the combination of delectable cuisine, exceptional service, and convivial atmosphere merited a return visit."

"My affection for Ginza and the concept of a sushi bar within a pseudo dining car is unwavering, as it exemplifies Japan's propensity for adopting and refining Western practices, much like the quintessential American chrome dining car that failed as a retro 50s diner. Sushi, by nature, is a communal and social experience, but the boisterous Japanese pop music at Ginza somewhat mitigates this aspect. Personally, I prefer the accompaniment of more subdued music or, at the very least, a volume that allows for effortless conversation. Perhaps I am an anomaly in this regard, but I unequivocally endorse the culinary offerings and commend the friendly and attentive service. If you seek a unique venue to commemorate a birthday, look no further than Ginza, as it truly is remarkable."

I've only used Sunset Park for the dog park.

Sunset park has two dogs parks located on the south side of the park (warm springs side). One park is for the bigger dogs while the other is for smaller dogs.

Both enclosed dog areas are very big and have plenty of room for dogs to run around. Their are hoses at the park so that people are able to wash their dogs or fill up water bowls. The parks as well offer poopie bags incase you forget you own.

They is a shaded area with tables for owners to sit and relax while dogs have fun playing.

My only issue with this place is those that frequent it often and feel entitled as royalty. I bring my dog here when I'm in the area and she isn't very social. She likes me to walk with her and if I sit down, she lays next to me. Dogs at times don't understand personal space and wouldn't let her be. The owners don't help if others dogs were pestering her or playing too rough. I believe one of the regulars said something to the point as, "if you don't want rough dog play, don't bring your dog here."

Outside that, it's great. It's just those days when you have the "Michael Vick Battle Dog Owners"

Nino's is a one of those places you hear about, want to go & give it a try and drive past it over and over again until the stars line up right and the soccer team you are playing on is sponsored by Chrissy's Nino's Pizzeria!! How crazy is that?!\nIt's a fun place to go for some beers, small pitchers are available :-), wings and pizza. The pizza is tasty and will fill you up, no mater how you want them to cut it for you! The wings are spot on with flavor and meat...some of the biggest wings I've seen in a restaurant ever!! They've got a pretty decent menu and does cater to those who are watching their figure more than the average soccer player with hearty salads!! They do have desert for the kids and enjoy having kids in the shop. I think the kids get a bigger kick out of going after Saturday night soccer than anyone!\nGo sit for a spell, have a few beers, grab some hot wings and a couple slices of pie! Great place to chill and watch life go by for a bit on Olive & 99th Avenue!!

After numerous unsatisfactory sojourns at the Center City Hilton, I opted to explore alternative accommodations and discovered the Omni, which has become my preferred choice for lodging in the area. For those seeking more economical options, the Aloft, situated directly across the street, offers suitable amenities at a lower price point. Conversely, travelers seeking a more luxurious experience without the extravagant cost of the Ritz may find that the Omni strikes an ideal balance. Throughout my eight stays at the property, I have consistently received exceptional service from the front desk staff, enjoyed spotlessly clean rooms, and appreciated the convenience of satisfactory room service. Although my personal preference lies with the larger executive corner suites offering a picturesque view of the city's central hub, I cannot comment on the quality of the standard junior suites. Notably, the hotel's prime location allows for effortless walking distance to various dining establishments such as Chima, Ruths Chris, Pita Pit, and numerous other eateries, bars, entertainment venues, and recreational facilities situated near the epicenter. In fact, I have enthusiastically recommended this lodging to my kin visiting for my impending nuptials. My experiences at the Omni have been nothing short of delightful, making it my go-to destination for future stays in the area.

"Such an array of options!  I opted for the pennyworth with mung bean and grass jelly, while Mr. W selected a three-color dessert.  Both were utterly delectable~  Although I was eager to sample their snow, my satiation from dinner precluded me from partaking in any additional culinary indulgences.  Nonetheless, a nearby table was enjoying a substantial plate of it, and it appeared truly remarkable. \n\nThe service was extremely cordial, and I appreciated the diversity of choices they offered beyond the standard boba tea fare.  Without a doubt, I shall return!"

"Indubitably, an establishment meriting a rating of 41/2, as evidenced by my recent visit, during which I partook of their delectable cuisine, specifically a scallop roll enveloped in soy paper and embellished with a dollop of caviar, an indulgence that elicited utter amazement. Furthermore, I sampled an array of sashimi, featuring yellowtail, snow crab, Japanese halibut, albacore, and octopus, all of which were impeccably fresh and expertly presented. Additionally, I enjoyed a solitary piece of tuna nigiri and a bowl of savory miso soup, both of which further contributed to the overall epicurean experience. To complement these culinary delights, I indulged in a pair of martinis, accompanied by a shot of Deleon tequila, a beverage of unparalleled smoothness and uniqueness, albeit at a premium price. However, given the occasion, the expense was more than justified. Notably, the service was exceptional, with our server exhibiting consummate professionalism and offering judicious recommendations for other local eateries, thereby enhancing the overall dining experience."

My family and I have consistently derived immense pleasure from partaking of culinary delights at this esteemed establishment, whereupon the comestibles are invariably fresh and the personnel endearingly cordial. Nonetheless, it has come to our attention that a recurring anomaly pertaining to the accuracy of our orders transpires when opting for the convenience of takeout, which unfortunately diminishes our overall satisfaction.

"The fourth star is merely a token of appreciation for the establishment's ambient surroundings and the hospitable demeanor of its staff. Located within the newly-erected, trendy hotel in Las Vegas, this stylish bar boasts an extensive array of specialty cocktails, one of which, the Hot Mule, I had the pleasure of sampling. To my surprise, the drink was not only visually appealing but also possessed a rich, complex flavor profile that was both refreshing and satisfying. Although the alcohol content remained a mystery, the beverage's taste was undeniably enjoyable, allowing me to unwind and bask in the tranquil atmosphere of the bar for a brief interval. As I visited during a weekday, the patronage was sparse, consisting of merely a handful of individuals. However, I can infer that the venue likely transforms into a bustling hub of social activity on weekends, attracting a diverse clientele of hipsters and mature women seeking a vibrant nightlife experience. Nevertheless, during my visit, the bar exuded an aura of serenity and elegance, which was greatly appreciated."

Their rolls are REALLY good. Their happy hour special is EVERYDAY. 5pm to closing.. which is REALLY good. 50% off sushi rolls, and 30% off nigiri. Everytime I go there, we get the same waitress.. and she's great! Very attentive, fast, and friendly. Food comes to you really fast, and I love how the place looks inside. Really cozy.. I come here like once a week..Definitely a good place to go.

We visited this establishment for an evening meal on the weekend and endured a delay of approximately one hour and fifteen minutes before being seated, during which time we had the convenience of registering our name and receiving a text notification when our table became available, affording us the flexibility to temporarily depart and indulge in a beverage at an alternative venue if desired. Fortuitously, space was available at the bar, allowing us to order a drink and partake in the delectable pesto fries appetizer while awaiting our turn. The pesto fries were scrumptious, and their exceptional quality motivated me to opt for the pesto pasta as my primary dish, a decision I am delighted to have made. The pasta sauce was additionally remarkably creamy, which greatly enhanced my enjoyment of it. My spouse selected the fish and chips, sampling a few bits of it as well, and found it to be superb, boasting a wonderfully crispy batter. Their tartar sauce was truly outstanding. My closest acquaintance chose their burger, which I did not taste due to my abstinence from beef consumption, but she reported it to be mouthwatering. I shall unquestionably revisit this establishment in the future.

"I am not expressing any dissatisfaction with the cost, as I was cognizant of the fact that the tariff was $40 per individual as of the previous Saturday evening.

There was an abundance of culinary options available; the meat selection was particularly impressive, featuring prime rib, beef Wellington, lamb chops, pork belly, and an array of other delectable cuts. Furthermore, the seafood offerings were diverse and included crab legs, prawns, sushi, caviar, ceviche, and numerous other aquatic delicacies. The variety of salads, asparagus, cheeses, cured meats, soups, olive breads, and other edibles was truly astounding, making it impossible for me to sample everything.

The assortment of sweet treats was equally impressive, boasting incredible cheesecake, macarons, lemon meringue, chocolate confections, ice cream, bread pudding, fresh fruit, and a plethora of other tantalizing desserts. The vast array of comestibles was truly staggering, and I must say that the majority of the servers were quite hospitable, with a special mention going to the gentleman who was skillfully cutting up the medium-rare beef and pork bellyâhe was particularly friendly and accommodating. However, one female server seemed somewhat put off when my companion politely requested that we clean the table, which still had remnants of food on it. Moreover, the man responsible for serving the beef Wellington exhibited a rather gruff demeanor and vocally reprimanded a coworker instead of allowing anyone to partake in his dish. To get his attention, I had to call out âexcuse meâ?multiple times. Additionally, the individual tasked with dispensing the caviar displayed a certain level of incivility, responding brusquely when I inquired whether I could sample the black caviar. His curt reply was, âUH, ITâS CALLED AMERICAN CAVIAR!â? which I found rather amusing, as I had never had caviar before and was unfamiliar with its various denominations.

In summary, despite a few minor drawbacks, the experience was generally enjoyable, and the cuisine was undoubtedly delicious. I was thoroughly satiated and cannot indulge in such rich fare regularly, so it was a welcome indulgence."

"It would be a fallacious and misguided notion to categorize ZiZi's as a purveyor of vegan health food, as their offerings cater to those seeking indulgent, gratifying cuisine. While some vegetarian options are available, it would be injudicious to expect a profusion of vitamin-rich, meticulously prepared produce. Instead, ZiZi's excels in serving up delectable, albeit slightly sinful, fare that caters to our baser culinary desires. Their chicken tenders, buffalo chicken sandwich, and spicy wings constitute the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of their menu, with the latter being particularly crave-worthy; so much so, that one could easily develop a daily habit. To avoid languishing in their sweltering waiting area during the height of summer, it is advisable to preemptively place orders over the phone. Unfortunately, the outsourcing of their delivery services contributes to an already sluggish process, making it a less than optimal experience for patrons. A relocation to a more accessible venue may help alleviate such issues and enhance overall customer satisfaction."

My husband and I love to entertain and also enjoy a bottle of wine or a couple beers together.  Total Wine offers domestic and International liquor.  Everything from beer, wine, vodka, soju, sangria, etc.  Prices range from fair/modest to expensive (depending what you are buying).

They also have a walk-in Humidor area with a nice selection of cigars (yep, I smoke a nice cigar with my hubby on occasion!)

On certain days they have a counter set up where you can sample wine, one day we were lucky enough to sample some wonderful tequila.  The representatives were knowledgeable and helpful.  No high pressure sales; "if you like, you buy"  if not, it is ok too!

There is an amazing variety, fair prices (you can get 10% discount for buying a case of wine), the staff is friendly and super helpful!

It is a great one-stop shop!  It is clean, uber-organized and if you don't find what you are looking for---the very knowledgeable staff is quick and very informative.

Total Wine is our TOP SPOT for stocking up on all our alcohol!  A MUST for entertaining and party planning!

Super pleased!

Great location in Old Town Scottsdale. Room was only $89 on Memorial Day weekend for a suite. They don't have room service, but they have a food menu: you call in your order. When it's ready, the call your room, and you go down and pick it up. The food was good!

"Capacious servings at remarkably affordable tariffs. Establishment maintains fastidious cleanliness and crispness. Personnel exhibit automaton-like demeanor, yet proficiently expeditious in their duties. Management accepts various forms of payment. However, be advised that premises shut promptly at 21:00 hours."

"I have an immense fondness for this establishment, as it seamlessly integrates various elements that I hold in high regard, specifically sandwiches, an Italian ambiance, an extensive wine selection, and a welcoming, relaxed environment. Were I to possess a market, I would unquestionably strive to replicate the unique qualities of this particular venue, if circumstances allowed. Notwithstanding my unwavering admiration, there is a single aspect that I would consider implementing differently in the future, specifically the utilization of advanced planning regarding orders, particularly when I am yearning for DeFalco's delectable offerings on a Saturday around midday, at which point I would opt to telephone my order in advance, given the widespread popularity of this eatery during the lunch hour."

I embarked upon an expedition to discover the premier fish fry venue in Madison and serendipitously encountered this establishment. Prior to my visit, it was advisable to be cognizant of the fact that reservations are not accepted and the premises tend to become overcrowded on Fridays, thereby necessitating a considerable waiting period. This cozy, local tavern boasts a substantial patronage and offers a diverse array of fish options for their Friday fish fry, encompassing both baked and fried variants of cod, perch, and walleye. I opted for the latter, which was utterly delectable. Furthermore, I found their garlic chili fries and homemade chili to be irresistible, resulting in an unfortunate yet humorous consequence involving a hypothetical wheelchair. Unquestionably, this eatery ranks among the superior fish fry destinations within the city limits, and I am eager to return. Notwithstanding, my sole grievance pertains to the absence of reservation facilities and the temporary suspension of carry-out services during Lent, owing to an influx of excessive patronage. Nonetheless, it is heartening to witness a business that flourishes to such an extent that it must decline some customers.

"I had an irrepressible desire to investigate and experience firsthand the essence of Arizona's vibrant social scene. Specifically, I yearned to witness a live performance, one that would showcase exceptional musical prowess and provide an atmosphere conducive to unencumbered merriment. My expectations were not only met but exceeded by a considerable margin, as the sonic offerings of the disc jockey in question were truly awe-inspiring, eliciting a sincere expression of gratitude and admiration. The ambiance of the venue itself was reminiscent of establishments found in my native locales, boasting an intimate dance floor, strategically positioned tables, and a canvas that served as a visual focal point. Furthermore, I was treated to a captivating performance by the talented ensemble known as Simple Citizens, hailing from Los Angeles and featuring a diverse instrumentation, including a trumpet player, which added a unique and engaging dimension to their sound. Of notable mention was the special pricing offered by the bar, with a nominal cover charge of $10 and drinks available at a mere quarter of the standard price prior to 11 pm, escalating to a still-reasonable $5 thereafter. Such information serves as a valuable resource for future visits to this enchanting state, compelling me to frequent this establishment with increased regularity."

```
"Excellent hospitality and a congenial team. \nMy culinary experience involved consuming their tuna salad, which contained succulent albacore tuna and an assortment of fresh, crisp greens that were not merely comprised of iceberg lettuce. \nI would unhesitatingly recommend this establishment to others."
```

I've been here quite a few times, and let me give you the tl;dr about the place.\n\nThe traditional hotdog, with a bunch of different stuff on top of it. I'm a hotdog lover and I've tried every single regular dog on the menu -- and I like it most of the time. Except that it's just that odd time when something comes out a bit strange or not quite right that makes me dock one star.

The culinary experience offered by this establishment boasts an intricate harmonization of flavors, which is undoubtedly a testament to the chef's artistry and dedication to their craft. Our server, Craig, provided exceptional service, demonstrating a profound understanding of the importance of catering to the needs of his patrons. Notably, my spouse and I have certain dietary restrictions, and the kitchen staff exhibited a commendable level of vigilance in ensuring that the ingredients used in each dish were carefully selected to accommodate these limitations. While the prices may be slightly elevated compared to those of other establishments serving similar fare, the quality and presentation of the dishes render them a luxurious indulgence that justifies the additional expense. We would unquestionably consider returning to partake in this gastronomic delight once again.

When we arrived at this establishment today, it appeared to be a conventional pizzeria, albeit with a limited selection of pies, specifically a solitary pepperoni variety, which we found somewhat perplexing given the relatively early hour of our visit. Notwithstanding this anomaly, we were impressed by the welcoming ambiance of the interior, particularly in proximity to the boulder station, rendering it an ideal destination for a post-cinematic or pre-cinematic excursion. Furthermore, we were pleased to discover that the prices were reasonable and the slices were generously proportioned, thereby making it an appealing option for aficionados of pizza, such as myself, who can confidently endorse it.

The name of this place deserves 5 stars. Mayyybeeeee I'm a little immature, but it never stops making me giggle.\n\nGreat 24 hour pho spot in Vegas. You can always find either drunk or hungover vegas-goers here. Service is shitty and rude, but they are fast and efficient on bringing your food and bill out. They want you IN and OUT. no joke.

The Arts Factory is a cool place to hang out and procure some amazing art and other oddities. There is of course your normal awesome paintings and canvas works of art, but there is also an eclectic mix of other forms of \"art\" and fun things. Hiptazmic studio which is full of awesome upcycled/recycled jewelry and decor items, along with original art pieces, tshirts, engraved tags, patches and more. Happy Panda toys with it's awesome vinyl toy collection, they also throw release parties where you can come in and trade with other fanatics. Then there is Hell Pop, they have a great comic and alternative book selection!\n\nThe Arts Factory has a little bit for everyone with the variety of items within its walls. Bar and Bistro the restaurant is also worth a visit, the pizzas are tastyriffic! Best time to come down and check things out is on First Friday, not only is the AF hopping but there is a plethora of booths and other happenings in the immediate area for your perusing pleasure.

"Solely accomplished remove out at this location.  I have been thoroughly impressed by the efficiency of the counter service, which has consistently demonstrated a proficiency in expediting orders and facilitating a seamless dining experience for patrons, thereby fostering an environment that encourages repeat visits and perpetuates a positive reputation for the establishment."

I'm going to give this 4 stars because there are very few options for Malaysian and Dim Sum in Pittsburgh but if this were in a larger city it would probably be more like 3 stars.

I went there once for lunch and had one of their Malaysian noodle soup dishes which was pretty good but not amazing.  I also went for Dim Sum on a Sunday and very much enjoyed it.  They had a large diversity of options and everything was very tasty.  It's certainly not at the level I've had in places like Boston, Seattle, or NYC but for Pittsburgh I was very satisfied.  My friend who had lived in China for a year also found it to be pretty decent.  I would definitely go there again.  

The service was very good and the prices reasonable. The atmosphere was comfortable though I found the lighting to be rather dark.  There is also some outdoor seating available when the weather is good and a full bar with seating.

My colleague and confidante suggested a hasty retreat from our workplace to indulge in a culinary excursion at Haps, which I wholeheartedly embraced despite having brought my own repast. Upon arriving at the eatery, we were greeted by an array of delectable cobblers, including a tantalizing peach variant that elicited my unbridled enthusiasm. Opting for the special advertised on the sandwich board exterior, I ordered the hot ham and cheese comestible, accompanied by a generous beverage and, of course, the aforementioned peach cobbler. The attentive cashier inquired about my desire for ice cream, which I respectfully declined, given its potential detrimental impact on the optimal consumption temperature of my coveted cobbler.
