Observing the preparation process, I noted the employee tasked with assembling our edibles retrieve a peach cobbler from the display case and promptly place it within the microwave oven, ensuring an imminent gratifying experience. As I collected my replenished beverage, requiring two hands to manage its copious volume, our sandwiches were simultaneously prepared with commendable expediency. Upon returning to our workplace, I eagerly delved into the succulent peach cobbler, savoring each bite and relishing its unadulterated flavor, briefly pondering sharing a portion with my companion before deciding against it, as it was simply too delectable to relinquish even a morsel. The accompanying sandwich proved satisfying as well, with its quality and cost constituting a reasonable equilibrium.

"Love that Sambalatte has extended its operational radius by establishing a new outlet on 215 & Jones, thereby obviating the need for an arduous excursion to Summerlin. Although the dimensions of this novel establishment are somewhat diminutive compared to its predecessor, it boasts an expanded alfresco seating arrangement that affords patrons the opportunity to bask in the balmy ambiance of a temperate day, albeit with a caveat regarding the sweltering heat of a Vegas summer afternoon. My visit transpired at approximately 6 pm on a quiescent Wednesday evening, and owing to the sparse attendance, the staff was able to expedite their attentions with remarkable celerity. I opted for an iced macha latte, and while no specification of magnitude was solicited, the generously proportioned cup in which it was presented came as a welcome surprise. Its flavorsome contents thoroughly satiated my expectations and left me convinced of its value. On a previous occasion, I had sampled their Nutella latte and found it equally gratifying. Sambalatte offers an assortment of delectable pastries and desserts, inclusive of the increasingly ubiquitous macaroon, for customers to enjoy either within the premises or transport them to a preferred location for consumption. This charming edifice provides an idyllic setting for a leisurely coffee break or a casual rendezvous with acquaintances, and its ample parking facilities serve as a bonus amenity."

"My acquaintance and I opted to partake in an evening excursion to this establishment approximately thirty days prior. Upon our arrival, it became apparent that there were no visible parking facilities available, with the exception of an attendant-operated valet service positioned at the entrance. As such, I was compelled to utilize their valet amenity, which I must admit, I find somewhat unsettling, as I am accustomed to managing my own automotive parking needs gratis. Nonetheless, we proceeded to gain entry into the venue and secured a table in close proximity to the bar. The culinary offerings presented a unique fusion of Mexican and New Mexican flavors, which I must say, were truly delectable. Unfortunately, my memory fails me in regards to the specific dish I ordered, however, I distinctly recall enjoying it immensely. Additionally, our server graciously suggested a superb bottle of red wine that complemented our meal perfectly. The hospitality we received was indeed impressive, and while the prices may have been slightly elevated, the quality of the dining experience was undoubtedly worth the additional expense. In conclusion, I would highly recommend this establishment as an ideal setting for a romantic escapade."

"For an optimal dim sum experience at a reasonable cost, one must be willing to compromise in certain aspects. Firstly, the servers may not always be attentive or readily available, necessitating proactive measures to acquire their assistance. Additionally, the staff may exhibit signs of fatigue or irritability, potentially resulting in a less than cordial encounter. Furthermore, it is advisable to expedite the payment process by bringing your stamp card to the front counter, thereby avoiding an extended wait time. Notwithstanding these caveats, the establishment earns four stars due to the subjective nature of service quality in Chinese restaurants, which often deviates from Western standards."

Food was well done and well presented.  The grilled octopus was cooked just right. And the main dishes and dessert were quite good.  On the pricy end but was good for taking my wife there for her birthday dinner and a special evening.

Having been a resident of Las Vegas for an extended period of time, specifically eight years, and having become accustomed to the various amenities offered by the Suncoast, I opted to stay at this particular establishment due to its reasonable rates and reputation for being a well-maintained property. My decision proved to be a judicious one, as my recent overnight stay at the Suncoast was a thoroughly satisfactory experience.  

The Suncoast Hotel and Casino is widely recognized as an exceptional locals' casino, situated in the picturesque community of Summerlin. As a result of its affiliation with the Coast (Boyd) brand, the property offers competitive rates, making it an attractive option for those seeking a high-quality gaming and hospitality experience without the necessity of being in close proximity to the Las Vegas Strip.  

Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by the friendly and efficient check-in staff, who demonstrated a keen focus on ensuring the comfort and satisfaction of their guests. The cleanliness of my room was impressive, surpassing my expectations and providing an atmosphere conducive to relaxation.  

As an enthusiast of gaming, I found the comps offered by the Suncoast to be generous and readily attainable, even for a casual player such as myself. The table games available were typical of most establishments, yet the dealers were personable and engaging, enhancing the overall gaming experience. While the poker room was somewhat underwhelming, particularly in comparison to the extensive facilities offered at the Orleans, the Boyd sportsbook remained a highlight, providing me with an enjoyable experience and fostering my anticipation for future visits, especially during the forthcoming football season.  

In conclusion, the Suncoast Hotel and Casino presents itself as an unparalleled value in Las Vegas, boasting a combination of affordability, excellent maintenance, and a commitment to ensuring the satisfaction of its patrons.

"A culinary experience of unparalleled quality, complemented by an ambiance that exudes a sense of vibrancy and vitality, characterizes the essence of this esteemed establishment. While the Key West Margaritaville may fall short in terms of its aesthetic appeal, this particular venue more than compensates for such deficiencies with an abundance of delectable fare and an atmosphere that effortlessly captures the essence of conviviality."

"Upon perusing my culinary options, I opted for the Shrimp Fried Rice, a seemingly innocuous dish that, much to my delight, transcended my expectations in terms of both quality and quantity. Specifically, the copious amount of genuine shrimp, devoid of any artificial or diminutive substitutes, combined with the generous serving size, left me thoroughly impressed and contentedly satiated."

Approximately 5-7 minutes from the renowned Las Vegas Strip, this establishment offers an engaging experience for families with children, lasting anywhere between 1-2 hours. While the museum primarily focuses on the historical aspects of nuclear testing and its impact on surrounding regions, rather than delving into the scientific intricacies of the atomic era, visitors can still glean a substantial amount of knowledge from the compact exhibition space. However, due to the limited scope of the museum's content, it is unlikely that patrons will feel compelled to revisit the attraction after their initial visit.

"Within the confines of the Planet Hollywood shopping complex, this particular establishment boasts an acceptable level of quality. While the customer service experience may not align with my customary expectations, the culinary prowess of their coffee concoctions remains undeniable. Furthermore, the comparative lack of inconvenience associated with this venue serves as a notable advantage when juxtaposed against the Starbucks located within the Planet Hollywood Casino."

"As a regional resident, I have not had the opportunity to experience the accommodations offered by this establishment, but I have frequented the premises for various activities and events. The maintenance of the facilities has consistently met my expectations, and the staff members I have encountered have demonstrated a commitment to providing excellent customer service. The culinary options available on the property have also been satisfying, particularly the recently introduced Zenshin, which has become a personal favorite. In addition to the dining options, the resort boasts a diverse range of entertainment options, including a bingo hall, bowling alley, and movie theater. Furthermore, I have attended several comedy performances and conventions hosted at the venue, which have proven to be enjoyable experiences. Overall, the resort offers a diverse array of activities and attractions, without the inconvenience of excessive crowding typically associated with the Las Vegas Strip."

This is my new favorite buffet on the Strip! We came on a Friday afternoon, and somehow miraculously avoided waiting. Literally paid and walked right in. It was $32/ person. I loved that there were various cuisines and it was grouped accordingly. My favorites were the tacos. I thought it was comparable to taco places and there was even a full salsa bar to match. I also surprisingly loved the hot and sour soup and found it just as good as ones in Chinese restaurants, ha! Towards the end of our meal (or the beginning of dinner service), crab legs arrived. Yum. Some negatives would be the overdressed (thus salty) Caesar salad and the overcooked (thus dry) prime rib. The desserts looked really good too but I was so full I just had a scoop of blood orange sorbet. Restroom is in very close walking distance (right by the entrance) and service was average. I will be back!

I tried this place about a month ago, and have been back at least 4 times since. So glad to finally find a Chinese food place near my house that I love. When I call in an order for pick-up, the food is ready within 10 minutes and reasonably priced. 

I've never eaten inside the restaurant myself, but it seems nice. There are always a couple waitresses busy keeping the customers happy. It's a small interior, with about 10 booths and 6 tables (which could be pushed together to accommodate a larger group). 

Great wall is in the small strip-mall just South of Walgreens (which is at Williams Field Rd). Also in the strip-mall is Sherwin Williams and Little Caesers

"It was a momentous occasion, one that marked the genesis of an amorous odyssey, when I first encountered the object of my desire; the sentiment of fondness that I experienced was unparalleled, and the cost, though not inconsequential, was a paltry sum relative to the value I obtained in return. It was, in point of fact, an unbeatable combination."

We deliberately traversed along the Pennsylvania Turnpike with gastronomical yearnings for an extended period, merely due to our intense craving for Indian cuisine. Such actions were indeed perilous, as our tolerance for hunger pangs customarily leads to capitulation to a convenient sandwich at a roadside eatery. Upon entering Coriander India Grill, we were greeted by a hospitable host who promptly accommodated us in a cozy booth. Shortly thereafter, a platter of crunchy papads accompanied by the customary triangular receptacle containing chutneys arrived, temporarily alleviating our hypoglycemic state. Following a cursory examination of the menu, we opted for lamb vindaloo (graded at a fiery 10 on the Scoville scale) and palak paneer (rated a relatively mild 7 on the Scoville scale). Although we were intrigued by the prospect of savoring south Indian dosas, their rarity did not warrant the risk, given the prevalence of northern Indian fare in most establishments. The culinary offerings were delivered expediently, and their flavors were indeed delectable! The vindaloo lived up to its billing, unleashing a torrent of spicy heat that, admittedly, I should have anticipated. My previous experience with authentic Indian cuisine notwithstanding, I erred in estimating my capacity to handle such fervent zest. Conversely, my partner's palak paneer was sublimely rich and velvety. Our satiated visages and contented dispositions upon exiting the eatery bespoke our unwavering intention to revisit Coriander India Grill during future excursions to Pittsburgh.

While the crustacean extremities may not be of optimal quality, the cost of $16.50 for local patrons to indulge in an unrestricted quantity of said appendages, in addition to delectable prime rib, sushi, clam chowder, a savory stir-fry of Chinese origin, and an exceptionally high-end gelato, renders any potential complaints inconsequential. I wholeheartedly endorse this particular buffet to any individual seeking to obtain an exceptional value for their monetary investment in the Las Vegas region, as I have personally visited numerous such establishments and found this one to be superior in both pricing and culinary offerings. However, it is advisable to arrive promptly at 5:30 p.m. or earlier to avoid an excessively prolonged queue.

"On my maiden visit to this establishment, I was taken aback by the seemingly exorbitant prices, however, upon partaking of their culinary offerings, I was pleasantly surprised by the delectable flavors and exceptional quality. Thus, I am inclined to return and sample their diverse menu items."

We indulged in a seated experience at the bar, whereupon the bartender manifested exceptional attentiveness towards us! We opted for the Lollipop Passion Goblet, an extravagant concoction that surpassed our expectations with its remarkable presentation and delectable flavor profile, rendering it a worthwhile expenditure of $36. The beverage's unique feature was the incorporation of dry ice, which, upon being poured by the bartender, produced a captivating fog effect. Reminiscent of a Midori Sour, the drink's taste was complemented by the inclusion of lollipops and a candy necklace, contributing to an unforgettable sensory encounter. Furthermore, we sampled their fries and fried macaroni and cheese, with the latter eliciting a favorable response, while the former was somewhat average in quality. We eagerly anticipate future visits to explore more of their extensive goblet selection and savor their culinary offerings!

Went here with my girlfriends for a late breakfast after a night of partying.\nThe french dip with truffle tator tots hit the spot and helped cure my semi-hangover.\nService was good and my coffee cup was constantly refilled!

"While awaiting the arrival of a public conveyance subsequent to disembarking from a railway carriage, I elected to avail myself of the opportunity to enter a commercial establishment specializing in the sale of various culinary items, specifically Princess Mall. (It is worth noting that the British populace appears to possess an affinity for conferring regal appellations upon various entities.) 

In light of the fact that I had not partaken of sustenance at a Spud U Like for a considerable duration, my curiosity was piqued upon espying said eatery within the confines of the aforementioned shopping center's food court. Thus, I opted to revive the tradition of indulging in a hearty potato-based meal, reminiscent of my halcyon days spent in Exeter, wherein I frequently engaged in the consumption of copious amounts of toppings atop a potato. 

The number of individuals participating in this culinary excursion tallied two, and, owing to my predilection for monotony, I selected the sour cream and chives option, whereas my companion, Sylvia, opted for baked beans. It must be acknowledged that the latter choice seemed somewhat anomalous, given Sylvia's Slovakian provenance, and the query arose as to whether she was familiar with the existence of baked beans, much less their preparation via culinary heat. (Is it truly accurate to describe the cooking process as 'baking'?) 

I elected to procure Meal A, comprising a topped-up potato and a beverage. However, my preference was for a coffee, thereby necessitating an additional payment of 40 pence. 

Both potatoes proved to be delectable! The attendant responsible for serving our repast exhibited commendable promptness and his demeanor was affable, pleasant, and engaging. This diversion served as a most agreeable prelude to boarding the vehicle transporting us to the aerodrome."

It is lovely little theater that offers a great movie experience. Never a crowd, theater is clean and the snacks are what you would expect - popcorn, candy and soda. Stop by Wine Expression before or after and have a great afternoon

It was my first visit.  All my co workers have been talking  about this place....with that said,  ..........walking up to this establishment is not impressive.  Please do not take a 1st date here.  All I have heard is about the expansion..and thank goodness!! 

This place is dark, the staff look like they are all on tour of some skating boarding ESPN tour  in town.

BUT!!!!

The staff  (who look like skateboarders) were great!  Each one of them so friendly, polite and very attentive. 
Beer selection-par none...excellent selection on tab.  
The expansion section is inviting for large groups...which was perfect for our work HH.
MENU- as my friend would say......UNBELIEVABLE!
I took home a Carne Asada concoction and it was sooooo good.  The calzone idea is great! When you can come up with creative stuffing you can't go wrong.  

Ambiance 3 ..too dark for me 
Staff  5+ -very friendly, attentive & polite
Food 5+- the calzone spin -UNBELIEVABLE...so good.  even take home.
Beer 5 -great selection on tab......can't get that everywhere.

"An establishment that excels in all aspects, offering an impressive culinary experience, exceptional customer service, and an ambiance that exudes sophistication and refinement. My previous encounters with French cuisine have been limited, but I have found that it is often characterized by meager portions. However, this restaurant defies that convention, as evidenced by the generous serving sizes of their dishes, particularly the steak. The quality of the food is also worthy of praise, with each bite showcasing the chef's dedication to culinary artistry. The complementary sides, including hand-cut fries and freshly baked French bread, further enhance the dining experience. For those who prefer alfresco seating, the outdoor area offers a romantic atmosphere and stunning views of the surrounding area. Overall, I would rate this restaurant 4.5 stars, a truly exceptional rating that reflects the high standards they have set for themselves."

"An exceptional venue for leisurely socializing. Cordial hospitality and delectable cuisine. My personal preference is the BLT&E, boasting an abundance of flavor, a harmonious balance of ingredients, and a tantalizing hint of uniqueness."

Awesome service and clean rooms. I wouldn't mind staying here again. I didn't like the carnival buffet though. I heard it was world class buffet, maybe on a world I have yet to visit. Congealed macaroni a cheese and old sushi is not my idea of world class. And the whole meal certainly wasn't worth $32.00. Other than the awful food, especially the over-price Chinese restaurant across the way, my stay was great. Will be staying there again and soon.

"I thoroughly enjoy perusing the extensive array of apparel offered at this establishment, as it provides me with an ample selection to choose from, thereby ensuring that I can find items that align with my personal preferences and style. Additionally, the prices are quite reasonable, allowing me to acquire a substantial quantity of garments for a relatively modest expenditure. However, it is important to note that the quality of the merchandise may not be of the highest caliber. Furthermore, it is advisable to be aware that returns are not accepted for dresses, and exchanges or store credit are granted only under certain circumstances. As an astute shopper, I make it a point to try on all items before making a purchase, thus mitigating any potential issues. This venue is particularly suitable for individuals who are budget-conscious and seeking fashionable attire, particularly those in the age range of teenagers to early 30's. While some items may be deemed unattractive by some, the diversity of options ensures that there is something for everyone. The store maintains a well-organized atmosphere, and inventory is replenished regularly. Although the customer service may not be exceptional, the staff members are generally helpful and accommodating, provided that one takes the initiative to seek their assistance."

The atmosphere of this restaurant may make you question your decision to eat here because it very obviously used to be a Yoshi's/Kyoto Bowl style place, but I'd encourage you to ignore it.  Lose yourself in the little-too-loud dance music and dig in to the interesting menu.

We got the Salmon Lover, Delish, Eel Cucmber, and Sixty Nine rolls.  All were very enjoyable - they were tasty, had good texture, and were more interesting than the standard sushi restaurant fare.  The Salmon Lover was our favorite - a must try.

Side note:  I'm allergic to avocado, so I usually get nigiri instead of rolls when I try a place for the first time.  The nigiri here was a little on the spendy side and the rolls were so interesting, I asked the waiter if it would be a problem to leave the avocado out.  He was really nice about it and everything came out allergen-free!

"We have had the pleasure of frequenting this establishment on numerous occasions, but our most recent visit proved to be a distinct departure from the customary level of service we have grown accustomed to. Our group of three individuals had the misfortune of enduring an extended wait time, despite possessing reservations for 8:45 pm. In fact, we did not secure seating until nearly 10 pm, which we found to be utterly unacceptable. Furthermore, our interactions with the hostesses were marked by brusque and perfunctory behavior, while the wait staff displayed an egregious lack of attentiveness in addressing our needs, including the neglectful omission of refreshing our beverages in a timely manner. However, we must commend the bartenders for their courteous demeanor and the exceptional service provided by the busser, Isaac, who demonstrated remarkable proficiency in resolving the issues that had plagued our dining experience. Indeed, his efforts were so impressive that we opted to reward the restaurant with a four-star review, despite our initial inclination to assign a rating of only one star. Notably, Isaac's dedication and commitment to customer satisfaction served as a testament to his exceptional work ethic and dedication to ensuring an optimal dining experience for patrons. Additionally, our server Mark, a seasoned veteran in the industry, exhibited a similar level of professionalism and attention to detail, further solidifying our positive impression of the restaurant. While there is always room for improvement, we must acknowledge that the efforts of Isaac and Mark significantly mitigated our dissatisfaction and restored our faith in the establishment's capacity to deliver quality service."

"An exceptional happy hour experience awaits those who arrive prior to 6 pm, allowing them to capitalize on the venue's remarkable 'island time' menu, which includes delectable cocktails such as grapefruit basil martinis, mojitos, and margaritas. Our group of four thoroughly enjoyed these beverages, and the atmosphere was further enhanced by the presence of delightful appetizers, including the highly recommended ahi tuna poke and fish tacos. However, our gluten-free companion faced some challenges in finding suitable dining options, ultimately settling for a salad despite the underwhelming selection of gluten-free entrees. Nonetheless, everyone relished their meals, and the ambiance was truly captivating."

"I recently had the pleasure of discovering an exceptional new venue in Las Vegas, conveniently located directly on the renowned Strip. The sophisticated and refined ambiance of this establishment effectively simulates the charming atmosphere of Paris, creating a truly immersive dining experience that extends beyond the palate. The delectable cuisine and exquisite wine selection, complemented by impeccable service, contribute to an unforgettable indulgence that will undoubtedly leave a lasting impression on even the most discerning patron."

This place is the bombay digity!

Located on Sahara and Decatur, this small restaurant will give you a cultured taste of India.

The place is small and very CLEAN! which is a must in my restaurant world..

I was greeted by a very nice helpful waitress who took the time to explain their menu and the pronunciation of each dish.

I ordered the Spinach Paneer. I'm a huge fan of spinach, and this put me into cloud 9.. The dish consisted of spinach and tofu, and some type of sauce.. im really  clueless when it comes to indian food, i just ask what's in it and i eat it!
haha!

Also along with the paneer i had the Garlic Naan, It's good to have with your paneers they compliment each other.

For dessert I had the Keer, which was some sort of rice pudding with berries on top very delish as well!

Samosa is also vegetarian/vegan friendly which is what drawn me to the place, me being a transitional vegetarian/vegan, i was curious what options i had in an indian restaurant .

Overall i was satisfied with the service and the food, they also have lunch specials during lunch time, i did not even bother to look at that, but will give it a try when I go back!

I engage in gaming activities at the Bellagio approximately six times per annum, and it has become evident to me that the quality of service is contingent upon the shift schedule. Specifically, the morning shift, spanning from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM, is characterized by exceptional management, with Calvin, the shift manager, leading by example. The staff members, including dealers, chip runners, custodial personnel, and supervisors, exhibit a commendable work ethic and dedication to providing excellent customer service during this time frame. In stark contrast, the 6:00 PM to 2:00 AM shift is noticeably inferior, with front-line personnel displaying an air of self-importance and a lackadaisical approach to initiating games in a timely manner, particularly in the low-limit game format. Although there are a select few exceptions, such as seasoned employee Timmy, and the 2:00 AM to 10:00 AM team, the prevalent attitude among staff members at the Bellagio seems to be centered around instructing patrons on how to cater to their preferences, rather than prioritizing customer satisfaction. This reversal of focus is, in my opinion, detrimental to fostering a positive gaming environment.

Bold colors and one-of-a-kind tops that will make you stand out. Reasonable prices, and some funky jewelry. They've also got some classic pieces, like the awesome black Fall jacket that I fell in love with - definitely the kind of piece to add to your wardrobe that you will get lots of use out of, and under $100. \n\nThe girls who work here are friendly, and they've got a decent size sale section in the back. I saw some great summer finds - go get 'em ladies!

Sam Fox's eponymous eatery boasts an innovative fusion of entertainment and gastronomy, featuring a recreational area comprising a ping-pong table and cornhole game (not the adult variety), complemented by a diverse selection of potables and occasional live music performances. This venue offers an ideal setting for socializing and enjoying a vibrant ambiance, although parking can be challenging due to its popularity, especially on Sundays; thus, it is advisable to opt for valet services. While my culinary explorations have been limited to a few shareable dishes, they have consistently impressed me with their flavors and presentation.

We have had the pleasure of dining at LaVecchia's on multiple occasions, and this review marks our maiden attempt at sharing our experiences with others. Complimentary parking is conveniently located in the Hearst Tower, and upon validation by LaVecchia's, it transforms into a gratis amenity. A leisurely stroll or rapid conveyance downwards culminates in an atmospheric ambiance replete with business-oriented individuals and discerning clientele, further enhanced by the proximate presence of RiRa, Luce, and an aesthetically pleasing courtyard. Reservations can be made with minimal effort, rendering accessibility to LaVecchia's relatively straightforward. Upon arrival, seating arrangements have been efficiently orchestrated, even during periods of high demand, thereby minimizing delays. The attentive wait staff has consistently displayed commendable punctuality in providing beverages, thus precluding extended waiting periods. While the appetizers have occasionally exhibited excessive saltiness, the primary entree offerings have consistently impressed, warranting our repeated patronage. Indeed, LaVecchia's has proven itself worthy of numerous return visits, despite the abundance of alternative dining establishments within the Queen City area.

I'm rating this place 4 stars just, because it's not super cheap it's about average pricing! I called only 15 minutes before for a gel manicure they told me to come right in! When I got there they had everything all set for me I didn't have to wait at all. THEY HAVE SO MANY GEL COLORS!! I couldn't make up my mind! All of the ladies seemed very friendly mine dealt with my change of mind of colors very nicely and was giving me suggestions, I could hear other surrounding customers very satisfied and chatting away happily with the staff. My manicurists spent time, I never felt rushed, even though I was there only an hour before closing! Highly recommend!

Miss the 2.99 special but figured I would give them another try since don tortacos breakfast burrito seems to be getting smaller and smaller. May go here now. Still wish there salsa was a little thicker and had more heat less vinegar taste.

"My spouse and I both opted for the Chili Cheese Dog, and our taste buds were thoroughly gratified by its culinary excellence. The hot dog was cooked to perfection, possessing a delightful snap when bitten into, and the chili was apportioned in such a manner that it did not overpower the flavor of the frankfurter, thereby allowing us to consume it with our hands without any difficulty. However, I must admit that I would have preferred a different type of cheese, specifically shredded cheese, instead of the Kraft singles that were provided. Despite this minor shortcoming, the Chili Cheese Dog proved to be an utterly delectable and satisfying snack, particularly given its convenient location on the strip."

First things first, I don't have a car. So I'm a captive audience for County Market, which is the closest store to my apartment. County Market has a good selection, and I rarely if ever have trouble finding things. It was funny how at the beginning of the school year certain items were just GONE, but I attribute that to people coming back and everyone needing soy sauce, ketchup, etc. However, I went there the other day and there was only one sort of tofu, which my friend informed me was not the best type. This is a small quibble, though, and I'm sure it happens in other stores.\n\nFor me the only thing I don't like about County Market is the state of produce. Often times I've picked up fruit or veggies and they've been close to going bad or already there. Or I'll buy bananas and they'll be so green I can't eat them for a week. I don't mind going through fruits and veggies and finding good ones, but if there aren't any good that makes it a but difficult. In general, I like this place and I'll continue to come back.

Dropped in for a coffee to go...it's damn good coffee!  It tasted familiar and I asked if they roasted their beans or ordered it from somewhere in Canada and the barista let me know the beans I was having was from 49th Parallel in Vancouver!  So Vancourites, if you're missing your awesome coffee from home you should drop by here.

I also ordered a scone which was also delicious and was on my way.  I'm not to sure about the amenities at the shop but it's a cool little space but I think the people watching might be at a minimum unless something is happening at the convention center since it's off a smaller street in Old MTL.

Oh yeah - staff was really friendly

Fresh seafood everyday. We ordered some oysters asked for them to be shucked and mosey on over to the watering hole for delicious beers and wine. \nAll the fresh meats seafood and salads here are delicious. Grab some food and hang out with a beer or wine. Great people watching. \nEmployees are super friendly and helpful. One of the best grocery stores around and hey there is even a bar :)

"Our recent sojourn at the Monte Carlo culminated in a desire to indulge in a delectable steak dinner on the ensuing Saturday evening, and, being a sextet of epicureans, our expectations were not thwarted. The eatery's ambiance, replete with an elegant decor, was unfortunately compromised by its proximity to the casino floor, thereby creating a discordant juxtaposition between the refined atmosphere and the less than salubrious surroundings. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the culinary offerings proved to be exceptional, particularly the colossal 120 oz steak, skillfully presented as a visually arresting mound of succulent meat, accompanied by delectable side dishes and dipping sauces. The hospitality of the staff was also commendable, as they exhibited warmth and efficiency in their service, further enhanced by their generosity in providing us with complimentary access to the Brand's "after hours" lounge, which, regrettably, did not quite live up to our expectations as a late-night hotspot. In conclusion, while the steakhouse itself was worthy of high praise, the adjacent nightclub fell short of our expectations."

"In conclusion, the encounter was generally satisfactory, as I acquired a standard manicure and pedicure for a reasonable price of $35. However, an upgrade to gel was suggested, which did not evoke a sense of obligation to accept. The personnel were proficient, yet their communication skills were somewhat impaired due to a linguistic barrier. Upon entering the establishment, one cannot help but notice the overpowering odor of chemicals, which may be bothersome for individuals with heightened sensitivity to smells or certain health conditions. Additionally, the absence of a designated cashier resulted in minor inconvenience. Nonetheless, this facility offers efficient services at an affordable price, delivering a passable manicure and pedicure experience."

"Gastronomical excellence!! However, the diminutive dimensions of the dining area, coupled with the restricted accessibility of the outdoor patio when it's not operational, may necessitate a brief interval of waiting. Nonetheless, the culinary experience is undoubtedly worthy of such a temporary delay, as the fare provided boasts an impressive array of delectable, wholesome ingredients expertly prepared to showcase their natural flavors, including a delightful pho soup and fresh rolls that are simply divine. I assure you, my dear gourmands, that this establishment warrants a repeat visit!"

"The Trump hotel experience was thoroughly enjoyable, as we were warmly received by friendly staff members upon arrival, and their hospitable demeanor persisted throughout our stay. The accommodations were tastefully appointed, spotlessly clean, and featured ample space, including a palatial shower area. However, we deducted one star due to the less-than-ideal pillows and the disruptive train whistles in the early morning hours, although neither of these minor drawbacks significantly detracted from our overall satisfaction. The pool area was inviting, but we recommend arriving early to secure a comfortable lounge chair. While we did not sample the hotel's restaurants, the muffins and fresh fruit available at the coffee stand were quite satisfying. Moreover, we did not miss the presence of a casino, as it contributed to a more peaceful and smoke-free lobby atmosphere, which we greatly appreciated. Based on our positive experience, we would certainly consider returning to this establishment."

"The particular site of the renowned Madison Original Pancake House that we are referring to is situated in a relatively secluded position, nestled behind a neighboring hotel, thereby affording it a degree of privacy and tranquility that is not typically associated with its busier, more accessible counterpart. The staff at this establishment is remarkably courteous, efficient, and professional in their demeanor, thereby creating a welcoming ambiance that greatly enhances the overall dining experience. Additionally, this location boasts an abundance of parking options, which is a significant advantage over the alternative site, which was unfortunately plagued by construction-related inconveniences and heavy traffic during our attempted visit. The culinary offerings at this esteemed eatery are of exceptionally high quality, with a diverse array of popular choices being singled out for praise in various reviews. Therefore, patrons can confidently order any item from the menu, secure in the knowledge that they will be treated to a truly satisfying repast."
Gorgeous hotel! Didn't stay here but did you know Carlos from the food channel has a bakery here?!?! WHAT WHAT?!?! Yummerz. Be prepared for 1+ hour long wait though.
Not too shabby lunch deals. NOT DOS GRINGOS ANYMORE.  NOW CALLED ROCKY POINT CANTINA. I dug it. $2 coronas and tacos. looks really cool inside.

We're am I? Philly? 
Maybe, I've never been. but if I were my cheese steak would taste like this. So good.
Pepper, onion ratios were perfect. The steak was great and the cheese wiz was tasty. The bread is brought in from Philly. Soft with a crunchy shell. Nice.
The pizza is also fresh and hand tossed. The big slices are filling.
But Spinelli's is more than that. They have appetizers, salads, desserts, Stromboli and other sandwiches. Bummed, no brew yet but any day now. 
Mac and cheese bites are a good app choice.
Last words... authentic, relaxing and non pretenses. Enjoy.

"Miniature eatery offering delectable Japanese noodle soup dishes at an affordable cost. During my initial visit, I opted for the tonkotsu variety, featuring a rich pork broth complemented by a generous portion of thin, chewy noodles. My companion, however, selected the spicy ramen option, boasting a flavorful miso-based broth and accompanied by thick, wavy noodles. Upon consuming my meal, I noted that the noodles were slightly thicker than what I would consider 'thin,' yet this deviation from expectation proved advantageous, as I generally prefer heartier ramen noodles. While my first dining experience at this establishment ranked among the most satisfying I've had, this particular visit, although still enjoyable, did not quite meet those lofty standards. Nonetheless, considering the reasonable prices, the quality and quantity of food offered remain exceptional."

"Remarkable!  Immaculate, sensibly-priced, exceptional hospitality, and delectable cuisine - such an establishment epitomizes the quintessential dining experience, rendering any further expectations superfluous."

Linda is amazing! I came to her by chance when looking for a nail tech to do my nails for my engagement photos. 

She had just moved into her new place at Salon Boutique so luckily for me she didn't have a lot appointments that day. Linda was super nice and so easy to talk with. .

I have been coming to Linda now since beginning of March (not long) but I couldn't imagine going anywhere else. She makes sure that your happy with her service before letting you leave. I lucked out when I found Linda!

Come here for gels, acrylic, refills, manis and pedis, shellac, etc. She even gives your arms and hands a massage! Love it!!

At first, Outside Inn seemed just like any other neighborhood bar--nothing special. The name, however, had me intrigued as it was rather humorous. 

Upon entering this bar/restaurant, I liked the rustic wooden decor with exposed wooden "log" beams and the overall "woodsey" feel. The bar area seemed dark and there were plenty of tv's (although none that I could see were large screen). The dining area was rather small and the decor colors were dull. I would have preferred a little more exposed wood to match the rest of the decor, instead of the vinyl, blue booth seating areas. 

The food was surprisingly good. Sweet potato fries pleasantly surprised in their flavor and consistency and prime rib tasted better than most other neighborhood places out there. The prices were reasonable and the draft beer selection was vast; however, prices were a little higher than average for a place such as this. Service was very quick and friendly. I would recommend this place and will come here again when I'm in a mood for some beers and some good prime rib. Nice neighborhood place to relax and unwind.

I got a piece of red velvet cake. The frosting is so rich and creamy with a very buttery finish and LOTS of cream cheese. The cake is tasty but dry. Good thing there was lots of amazing frosting to cover that flaw up. The place looked like a trendy spot you would find in NYC with prices to match. The staff was super friendly though.

"To fully appreciate and relish the unique experience offered by this establishment, it is essential to possess an understanding of its distinctive nature and intrinsic value. My associates and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, and while the entrance fee of $17 may have seemed steep, we did not begrudge paying it for the opportunity to partake in such a singular adventure. Upon entering, we were provided with arctic attire, consisting of parkas and Uggs, and given gloves to protect our hands while holding our drinks. Prior to gaining access to the bar, we deposited our personal items and electronic devices in secure lockers, and then proceeded to immerse ourselves in a chilly environment, with the temperature set at a brisk 50 degrees. The interior was crafted entirely from ice, including the furniture, lighting fixtures, and even the glasses in which our beverages were served. I found it to be an entertaining and memorable diversion, primarily due to its novel and inventive concept."

"When it comes to this establishment, the two words that are imperative to remember are 'Moscow mule.' Disregard any other information; those two words encapsulate the essence of the experience. While the jukebox may be temperamental, and the beer selection, though adequate, pales in comparison to nearby alternatives, the culinary offerings, though satisfactory, do not warrant repeat visits. However, the Moscow mules, crafted with either cucumber-infused vodka or a mint-flavored variety, are truly exceptional, making them the primary draw for return visits. Furthermore, the bartenders, who are courteous and knowledgeable, contribute significantly to the ambiance, ensuring that patrons receive attentive and hospitable service. In conclusion, while the food and beer selections may not be the primary focus, the delectable Moscow mules and excellent bartenders make this venue well worth a visit."

Considering the first reviewer, I wouldn't recommend taking their services from a hotel.

However, they do offer shuttle service from the airport. You prepay, so there is no way the driver can hammer you for more money.  Just look for signs at baggage claim that say "Airport Shuttles" or something like that.

There are actually two separate companies.  This one was a bit more expensive, but the other one only took cash.  And I forgot to get cash before leaving for Vegas.  So I had to go with this one so I can charge it.

Use the airport shuttles, it's cheaper. I think it was $6 or so per person to the hotel.  Much cheaper than a cab.  They have the prices posted outside so you can check it out when you arrive.

I had the pleasure of residing in the esteemed state of Maryland for two decades, during which time I developed an unwavering fondness for delectable steamed crab legs. It is with immense gratitude that I reflect upon my recent dining experience at this establishment, which proved to be remarkably satisfying despite certain unfavorable critiques. My reluctance to visit this restaurant previously was primarily due to my distant residence from the available locations, coupled with my spouse's lack of enthusiasm for dining at chain establishments.  

Upon entering the eatery, we were warmly greeted by our hospitable server, Elyse, who presented us with insightful suggestions for our evening's culinary indulgences. Notably, the Bloody Mary cocktail we ordered was sublimely flavorful, further accentuated by the innovative inclusion of a crab leg as a garnish. 

The duration of our dining experience was relatively brief, as both seating and service were efficiently executed. Although I did overhear a nearby waitress mention that the restaurant was not bustling with patrons on that particular evening, the portions served to us were undoubtedly generous. A testament to the quality of the cuisine was evident in the rapt attention displayed by the adjacent table, whose occupants temporarily suspended conversation for approximately fifteen minutes upon the arrival of their meals. Such an occurrence is indeed a reliable indicator of a truly satisfying repast. 

In conclusion, my family and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this restaurant, and we eagerly anticipate our return.

"It is a Chipotle, thus one can anticipate a predictable culinary experience, which, in essence, aligns with the restaurant's brand identity. Children tend to enjoy the menu options, while my spouse can indulge in relatively health-conscious selections. My personal opinion regarding Chipotle's quality as a Mexican eatery may be perceived as somewhat ambivalent, however, I unquestionably relish their tortilla chips, guacamole, and porcine offerings. It is essential to monitor the portioning of proteins, particularly during periods of high customer influx, as staff may display a propensity to parsimoniousness regarding the meat allocation."

I haven't been this overwhelmed with excitement since I went to Disneyland.  Immediately upon entering I was taken back by the decor, fish tanks, waterfall and life like animals on display.  I spent two hours in here, I wanted to see every inch.  

The only bad part of the experience was the lady at the fudge stand.  She was not a happy camper but the delicious fudge made up for it.

This place is way out of my budget and I would never buy any of the necessities for outdoor life here but I purchased some novelty things and will continue to come back.

"I have consistently savored the culinary offerings and regarded them as exceptional in quality. However, the service has been subpar, largely attributable to the emphasis placed on recruiting nearby university students as staff. During one particular visit, we made reservations and were promptly seated by the hostess, who attempted to accommodate us at a table despite our preference for a booth. We politely requested to be seated at a booth, but our request was met with resistance, leading to an impasse that persisted for several exchanges. Ultimately, we threatened to vacate the premises, which precipitated the hostess's reluctant acquiescence to our request. Nevertheless, her subsequent behavior bordered on theatrics, as she melodramatically escorted us to a booth before departing abruptly. This anomalous episode serves as a caveat to management regarding the potential drawbacks of relying heavily on student labor."

"My predilection for establishments that offer a superior level of service and quality has led me to return to this particular salon on multiple occasions. Despite the high volume of clientele they receive, the staff has demonstrated an impressive ability to recall details about repeat customers, illustrating their dedication to fostering enduring relationships with their patrons. During my most recent visit, one of the staff members inquired about my well-being and showed genuine interest in my personal life, further solidifying my positive impression of the salon. The welcoming ambiance and expertise of the staff have made me feel thoroughly pampered and relaxed, and I eagerly anticipate my forthcoming appointment."

I managed to fortuitously secure a living space that is conveniently located within walking distance of virtually all essential amenities, including what is arguably the preeminent ski and snowboard equipment retailer in the region. Ski Pro boasts an impressive inventory that surpasses even the most well-stocked ski shops in Colorado, and their focus on promoting sales and offering discounts is evident in the substantial markdowns they offer on various items. Case in point: I recently purchased a ski suit for my child that had been originally priced at $175, but was available for the significantly reduced price of $59. Although the selection of skis and snowboards may not be as extensive as some other specialty stores, it is nevertheless quite comprehensive and caters to a wide range of winter sports enthusiasts. Furthermore, the store's proximity to the Biltmore is an added convenience.

The quality of customer service at Ski Pro is relatively average for establishments of this nature, with staff members exhibiting a level of friendliness and attentiveness that is adequate without being overly obsequious. Considering the laid-back atmosphere that permeates such leisure-oriented businesses, it would be unreasonable to expect excessively cheerful and solicitous demeanors from employees. Instead, they maintain a relaxed yet competent attitude that aligns with the overall ambiance of the store. While they may not display the same level of enthusiasm as workers in more formal settings, they are at least cordial and welcoming, which is a refreshing change from the sometimes surly and aloof demeanor encountered among ski shop employees in certain parts of Colorado. Consequently, I recommend paying a visit to Ski Pro and adopting a carefree attitude when interacting with the staff.

Never have I experienced a subpar dining experience at any of their establishments; the flavorful ground beef hummus is utterly delectable, surpassing all other hummus I have had the pleasure of consuming throughout my existence! On this particular visit, I opted to sample their coconut shrimp for the first time, and I must say, it was an unmitigated success! The dish was nothing short of extraordinary, eliciting an enthusiastic response from my taste buds. However, I must admit that the ambiance was slightly marred by the staff's behavior, which, while not detracting from the exceptional quality of our server's attention, was somewhat unprofessional and incongruous with the overall dining experience. Specifically, at approximately 9:00 PM, the entire team of three staff members decided to partake in their evening meal within the restaurant, in full view of the remaining patrons. While I understand the importance of sustenance for those working tirelessly to provide excellent service, I cannot help but wonder if a brief postponement of their repast or a more discreet dining area might have been more appropriate. In spite of this minor drawback, I would like to emphasize that the quality of our service remained commendable, and the culinary offerings continued to impress. Such an isolated occurrence would not deter me from frequenting their establishment again in the future or endorsing it to my acquaintances and loved ones.

If I were to have the opportunity to procure a single beverage, either a coffee or a chocolate milkshake, I would unhesitatingly opt for the latter from Courier Cafe, despite its antiquated ambiance characterized by aged carpeting, elderly waitstaff, and vintage cutlery. The allure of a rich, velvety milkshake that defies suction through a straw and arrives accompanied by a surplus in a metallic mixing vessel is simply too enticing to resist, even on a frigid winter day. Indeed, any discerning devotee of such indulgences would assuredly follow suit and venture forth to partake in this revered establishment's offerings.

"I have a penchant for this establishment! Although it may not be a quintessential five-star burger joint, it boasts an impressive array of attributes that warrant its classification as a formidable culinary destination. The utilization of premium quality meat is a testament to the eatery's commitment to serving its clientele with the finest fare. Furthermore, the proprietors have adopted an innovative approach by extending an invitation to patrons to exercise their creativity in tailoring their burgers to their exacting specifications. This tantalizing feature allows individuals to assume a sense of agency in the preparation of their meals, fostering a unique dining experience that is both engaging and satisfying. 

The ambiance within the restaurant exudes a nostalgic charm, reminiscent of bygone eras, while the musical selections played during my visit were quite agreeable, save for a solitary Morrissey tune that momentarily threatened to undermine my dining experience; however, I successfully mitigated its impact by diverting my attention elsewhere. Although the theme of the establishment may not conform to the conventional definition of a '50s dinner, it remains an intriguing venue worthy of exploration. 

In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly opt for the two-thirds burger, thereby affording myself the opportunity to indulge in a delectable medley of toppings tailored to my discerning taste."

Originally, I harbored skepticism regarding my decision to dine at this establishment, primarily due to the seemingly gimmicky nature of its name. However, upon partaking in their culinary offerings, specifically their delectable noodle soups, my initial reservations were promptly dispelled, as the quality of the fare served was truly exceptional. During my visit, the interior of the eatery appeared bustling, with patrons eagerly awaiting their turns to savor the flavors of the menu items. Although the pace of the service was somewhat hastened, it did not significantly impact my dining experience, as I was solely seeking a rapid, satisfying repast. Consequently, I intend to return to this venue in the future, with the aim of sampling their diverse array of dishes.

"A ubiquitous sentiment permeates the discourse surrounding this establishment, whereby the culinary offerings, while undeniably satisfactory, are eclipsed by the truly exceptional ambiance, which transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime; an experiential venue par excellence, where the tangible aspects of the dining experience, though hardly negligible, pale in comparison to the overall atmosphere, rendering it an obligatory pilgrimage for gastronomes and revelers alike, despite its slightly inconvenient location."

I take immense pleasure in engaging in recreational activities at Tuscany, which happens to be one of the more recently established golf courses in the city of Las Vegas. My maiden visit to Tuscany - the clubhouse was situated within a makeshift structure that resembled a quonset hut or a tent. They have since upgraded their facilities to include a stunning clubhouse and restaurant. Initially, the club encountered some difficulties in cultivating grass in this particular region of Vegas, which is known for its arid climate. Subsequently, the management opted to seek assistance from the team at Rhodes Ranch, who took over the course's maintenance and transformed it into a thriving and lush landscape. Rhodes Ranch serves as the "sister" course, and players can frequently avail themselves of exceptional package deals for playing both courses. The layout of the course is meticulously designed, featuring an abundance of sand traps strategically positioned to accommodate my driving distance. Additionally, there are sufficient water hazards scattered throughout the course to accommodate errant shots. The course meanders past a magnificent stone clock tower and boasts expansive fairways. The underlying theme of the course revolves around wine and vineyards, rendering it distinctive and unique. In my opinion, this course offers exceptional value for the price paid. Although it requires a slightly longer drive compared to some of the Summerlin courses, the experience is truly remarkable and well worth the extra effort.

I have had the pleasure of visiting Trifecta on multiple occasions, and each time, I have been impressed by the exceptional caliber of artists showcased. The staff members have consistently demonstrated a profound knowledge of the pieces on display, eagerly engaging in insightful discussions regarding the various works of art. Notably, a significant portion of the pieces available for purchase have fallen within a price range that is accessible to art enthusiasts who do not possess an extensive collection or substantial financial resources. This aspect of Trifecta's offerings stands out as particularly refreshing, given the tendency of some art venues to prioritize exorbitant prices over the cultivation of a broader appreciation for the arts.  

My most recent visit to Trifecta coincided with the unveiling of a photography exhibition featuring images captured in Las Vegas and Nevada, which complemented the Focus on Nevada spread in the current issue of Desert Companion. Notably, one of my closest acquaintances, Anthony M., was selected as a participant in the contest associated with the event. As a steadfast supporter of my friends' creative endeavors, I felt compelled to attend and experience the exhibition firsthand.  

Despite Trifecta's relatively modest dimensions, I have been consistently impressed by the exceptional quality of their past events, which have included food and beverage services tailored to enhance the overall experience. In light of these observations, I wholeheartedly endorse immersing oneself in the artistic ambiance of the Arts Factory, dedicating sufficient time to explore its diverse offerings, and culminating the excursion with a visit to Trifecta. By doing so, one can foster a deeper appreciation for the burgeoning cultural landscape that permeates this vibrant street. To those who may harbor reservations regarding the accessibility of art, I implore you to dispel your doubts and embrace the opportunity to discover the richness of Trifecta's collection with an open mind and a curious gaze.

"The expansive outdoor seating area, characterized by its perpetual occupancy, necessitates an early arrival to secure a coveted spot. The protracted queue, however, is more than justified by the delectable offerings, particularly the recently introduced 'porchetta' sandwich, which elicits nostalgic memories of home-cooked meals lovingly prepared by one's mother. Moreover, the establishment's welcoming ambiance extends to canine patrons, as evidenced by the thoughtful provision of water for furry friends. Such considerate touches contribute to an overall pleasant dining experience."

I have had the pleasure of visiting Chandelier on multiple occasions, and I must say that the ambiance is truly captivating. Upon entering the establishment, I would recommend ascending to the second level, which is nestled between the first and third levels, and ordering the Lemon Verbena beverage, which is not listed on the menu. However, be prepared to pay an additional fee of a few dollars per drink to receive an augmented quantity of floral garnishes for each member of your group. Once you have consumed the beverage, you will notice that the flower, which should not be ingested, will initiate a peculiar foaming phenomenon within your oral cavity, creating the sensation of a miniature fountain. This unique experience can be quite amusing, especially when shared with a group of companions. In fact, I recall a previous visit to Chandelier with a group of five individuals, during which my companion presented me with one of these distinctive beverages, resulting in my unintentional assault on him. Subsequently, I felt compelled to reciprocate this gesture by treating my associates to a similar experience during a subsequent visit to Cosmo with a Bachelorette party. The reactions of my friends were nothing short of priceless, making the expenditure of $23 for the drink and three additional flowers seem trivial in comparison. Notwithstanding the occasional poorly crafted cocktail and the occasional discourteous demeanor exhibited by the bartenders towards female patrons, Chandelier remains a vibrant and popular destination, even in the early hours of the morning.

Great atmosphere,  very good menu, excellent service,  and lots of beers to choose from. The only thing about this place is the parking.  

If you want a quiet place this isn't it. It's called a social house for a reason.  Go for the food, the drinks, and the crowd.  Plenty of TVs to catch a game. 

Enjoy!

Food was great. The crab cakes are the BEST I've tasted. Only the bottom of a huge pile of crab meat was breaded to keep the shape. The crab was sooooo tasty and not ruined with heavy sauces. This is our 4th time there in 2 months and have been consistently impressed by everyone from greeter on the way in to greeter saying good night as we leave. The only reason for 4 stars is the noise level is very high. Guess it's a eat, pay, get out philosophy although we were never rushed.

"The culinary experience afforded to us at this establishment was nothing short of a gastronomical revelation, with the piquant spices employed in the preparation of the dishes serving as the defining characteristic that elevated the fare beyond the realm of the mundane. Our unanticipated arrival at an advanced hour did not deter the accommodating staff from extending their warm hospitality, as they demonstrated a profound commitment to ensuring our satisfaction through their solicitous demeanor and judicious recommendations when queried. My unassuming potato and beef entrÃ©e, complemented by a tangy dipping sauce of extraordinary flavor and piquancy, proved to be the epicurean highlight of the evening, prompting me to liberally pour its contents over my meal, while my spouse, whose gustatory preferences apparently diverged from my own, expressed a somewhat more tepid assessment of the culinary offerings, with a rating of three stars, whereas my own evaluation, taking into account the exceptional quality of the sauce, merited a four-star designation."

"This eatery certainly warrants affection due to its delectable beverages, culinary offerings, and entertainment amenities, specifically the shuffleboard facility. My taste buds thoroughly relished the macaroni and cheese complemented by the spicy ghost pepper cheese and the healthy broccoli salad. However, my enjoyment was slightly impaired by the vocalist of the musical group performing on the outdoor patio on October 14th, whose melodic renderings, although not necessarily unpleasant, seemed incongruous within the context of a family-oriented dining environment, reminiscent of those typically found in adult entertainment venues such as Sapphire's, where such attire would have been more appropriate."

Found this culinary establishment due to its proximity to my place of employment, and I must say that I thoroughly enjoy dining here. In fact, I would relish the opportunity to partake in their delectable offerings on a daily basis, particularly for lunch, but unfortunately, my financial constraints prohibit me from doing so. Nonetheless, I have had the pleasure of indulging in their all-you-can-eat sushi option ($20) for dinner, which I might add, has never failed to impress. The sushi is consistently fresh and of superior quality, and the staff members are always cordial and welcoming. Moreover, the sheer variety of rolls available is truly astounding, with each one boasting unique flavors and ingredients that tantalize the taste buds. Furthermore, the complimentary fruit provided is a thoughtful gesture that adds an extra layer of elegance to the overall dining experience, making one feel truly special and valued. In conclusion, I highly recommend paying a visit to this exceptional eatery, as I am confident that you will derive immense satisfaction from doing so.

I was grinning so hard when I finally arrived at this establishment, not merely due to the respite it provided from the frigid temperature outside, but also because it was a stark contrast to the vivid descriptions depicted in the Yelp reviews (which included terms such as "crackhouse," "employees who cannot speak English," "filthy," and "so pungent it could render one unconscious," among others). My smile was not just a result of the relief, but also the satisfaction of having proven the negative reviews wrong. After deliberating over whether or not to visit this store (with the intention of purchasing Tom Kha Gai), I was delighted to discover that it was, in fact, A TOTALLY TYPICAL ASIAN GROCERY STORE, reminiscent of Chicago Food Corp. on Kimball or Brwyn Mawr Fresh Market. It was almost comical to reflect on the divergence between the reviews and the reality, as I was processing my purchase. The expectation of encountering an unpleasant environment was utterly misguided, and it was quite amusing to consider the disparity between the reviews and the actual experience. While this store may have its drawbacks, including the limitation of payment methods (cash and check only, with an additional fee for card usage), cramped space, and a layer of dust, it more than makes up for it with its diverse selection of items catering to the needs of those seeking to prepare pungent Asian cuisine. They boast an extensive array of exotic sweets, alongside the essential ingredients such as nuoc mam, chili oil, and fresh lemongrass.

"Notwithstanding the inherent incongruity between thrift shops and superlatives, this particular charity shop boasts a singular distinction - it is, in fact, the most ancient philanthropic retail establishment in Scotland. This anomaly notwithstanding, an eclectic assortment of literary works graces its shelves, interspersed among the ubiquitous staples customarily associated with such establishments. Upon closer inspection, I chanced upon an array of celebrated classics, including, but not limited to, 'Catch-22,' 'Great Expectations,' and an imposing stack of 'Goosebumps' volumes - all offered at a price point that could, without hyperbole, be described as 'dirt cheap.'"

Placed a to go order and the loopy girl taking it royally messed it up. But the manager brought out my correct order really quickly. Additionally, he let me keep the food that she had erroneously given me. Then he offered to refund the entire meal back onto my credit card. Way to go with great customer service!

During my tenure at Shirts and Things, it was customary to procure lunch from this establishment on an intermittent basis. Upon placing an order, I would consistently opt for the bread bowl soup, specifying that half of the contents should be comprised of potato and the remaining half, a judicious blend of broccoli and cheese. This particular configuration proved to be an exceptional combination, as the bread itself possessed notable quality. Furthermore, I would routinely order the Gobbler, a culinary masterpiece reminiscent of Thanksgiving, boasting turkey, cranberry sauce, and stuffing situated upon a bed of marble rye bread. The delivery process appeared efficient; however, the prices were slightly elevated, with each soup and bread or sandwich costing approximately $7, a sum deemed questionable by my standards.

During our sojourn at the opulent Venetian resort, we had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this establishment on two separate occasions, as we were eager to sample the diverse gastronomical offerings available in the city. Upon arriving in Las Vegas rather late in the evening, we descended to the lower level of the hotel, feeling somewhat famished and disoriented due to our unfamiliarity with the area, and happened upon this restaurant by sheer serendipity, as it was one of the few establishments that remained open at such a late hour. Furthermore, we were struck by the remarkable similarity between this eatery and Cheesecake Factory, which we later discovered was not coincidental, given that both are owned by the same parent company. Notwithstanding the lateness of the hour, we encountered minimal delay in being seated, and thus, we opted to return to this venue for our morning repast prior to our departure, given its proximity to our lodgings and our previous positive experience.

This food was De-lish. We went here last minute because we were staying at MGM grand and did not feel like making it out to the strip, glad we didn't. The food is served family style and are large portions. We had four people and ordered 5 items... it was the perfect amount of food and really good. We all especially enjoyed the lo mien and the orange chicken. 

The atmosphere is fun but romantic. Ask for a table away from the entrance as to avoid noise from the food court. 

The beer they have is not on the drink menu but are an affordable option. After paying way to much for drinks by the pool, these 12$ 36 oz beers were just what we needed. 

Definitely worth checking out.

I haven't tried all the pancakes in the country or even enough for a strong statistical argument, but the pancakes were as good as I could make at home, which is unexpected.  I had the "famous corned beef hash," which wasn't all that spectacular.  Might've been made with canned corned beef.

The combination of the atmosphere (this is a very old casino downtown) and the pancakes made this a terrific breakfast spot.  It they had good coffee, I'd give them five stars, but it's just institutional--though they did bring a pitcher of half and half with the first cup.  Institutional coffee is more acceptable with cream and sugar.

The pie case, as others have noted, looked really appealing.  If I get back, that will be what I have for breakfast. I noticed they had some breakfast specials, too, e.g., a pancake and bacon sandwich thing.

Parking in the area is kind of a problem, at least if you expect to not pay anything.  Might as well park in the valet lot for the casino--if they validate your stub the first hour is only fifty cents.  The tip is up to you, but it will probably be at least a couple more bucks if you're a real high rollin' Vegas kind of guy.

"Indulged in an excessive quantity of cheesecake during National Cheesecake Day at this establishment, which offered half-priced portions of their delectable offerings, resulting in an abbreviated waiting period despite the high volume of patrons. My taste buds were particularly tantalized by the Godiva chocolate variety, eliciting an enthusiastic response of utter amazement; unwavering devotees of chocolate would undoubtedly find this selection appealing. The staff exhibited commendable levels of cordiality, efficiency, and attentiveness, ensuring a satisfying experience for all customers. Kudos to the cheesecake aficionados for their culinary prowess and hospitable demeanor; I eagerly anticipate my next visit."

My corporation customarily reserved me a seat on United Airlines on a monthly basis when I embarked on business trips, thereby establishing them as my final resort while traversing the skies. Their performance has been relatively consistent, punctual, and hospitable, with a negligible incidence of baggage misplacement, in contrast to Southwest Airlines, which experienced a solitary mishap in this regard, and Delta, whose blunders necessitated a prolonged rectification period of twenty-one days. Consequently, I would confer upon them a rating of four stars.

"Lobby-ya burgers are an absolute culinary delight, a veritable gastronomical explosion that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime. The delectable aroma wafting from the kitchen serves as a harbinger of the epicurean experience that awaits the patron. The gentleman in front of me was effusive in his praise of the establishment's offerings, extolling the virtues of the burger with such fervor that it would have been impolitic to decline the recommendation. Upon partaking of the burger, I found that the gentleman's laudatory remarks were by no means hyperbolic, for the freshness of the bun, the crunchiness of the pickles and lettuce, and the juiciness of the patty combined to create a flavor profile that was nothing short of extraordinary. The fries, with their tantalizing crinkle cut and irresistible taste, served as the perfect complement to the burger, their pipping hot temperature only adding to their allure. In conclusion, my dining experience at Lobby-ya burgers was nothing short of exceptional, and I would highly recommend this eatery to any individual seeking a truly satisfying culinary experience."

Anytime I am craving my grandmother's cooking, I grab something from Rose Tea to take home. I highly recommend the beef pancake roll and their house special rice cakes. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu and their bubble tea is the best I've had in Pittsburgh!

We indulged in a culinary excursion at this eatery during our sojourn in Las Vegas, accompanied by a coterie of eight individuals.  The hospitality proffered by the staff was indeed commendable, as they exhibited an acute attention to detail and a congenial demeanor.

My personal gastronomical selection was the chicken kiev, which boasted a satisfying crispness on its exterior and an unctuous juiciness within.  Unfortunately, the cranberry cabbage salad that accompanied my entree did not quite live up to my expectations, as its flavors did not tantalize my palate to the extent that I had anticipated; I would have preferred the vibrant hue and presumably more robust taste of red cabbage, as sampled by my fellow diners.

The porcine offerings of our group were somewhat disappointing, as they lacked the succulence that one might optimistically expect from such a dish.  However, the steak proved to be a satisfactory alternative.  In a moment of culinary capriciousness, I elected to substitute the customary fries accompanying my entree with mashed potatoes, which, while undoubtedly delicious, left me wistfully yearning for the crispy, golden allure of their fried counterparts.

Our collective gastronomical odyssey continued with an assortment of appetizers, including the ubiquitous cabbage rolls, herring, and a visually stunning vegetable platter.  While the former elicited mixed reviews from our group, with some members expressing unbridled enthusiasm and others, like myself, remaining relatively unimpressed, the herring, with its refreshing lack of oiliness and subtle flavor, proved to be an unmitigated delight.  Furthermore, our server's recommendation of the herring over the salmon proved to be a veritable stroke of genius.  The vegetable platter, artfully arranged and bursting with freshness, further showcased the culinary prowess of the establishment.  Lastly, the assorted desserts we sampled served as a sweet finale to our delectable journey.

In conclusion, while the food at this restaurant was certainly above average, the exceptional quality of the service and the eminently reasonable prices truly elevated our dining experience to a level worthy of unqualified praise.  Alas, our departure from the premises was marred by an unfortunate encounter with a solicitous individual seeking a pecuniary loan, thereby imbuing our otherwise pleasant outing with a tinge of discomfort.

Winner-Winner - Chicken Dinner

I won!   All I can say is that the casino was nice and clean.    The people were friendly.

I played some blackjack and won big so all i can say is "Woohoo!"

I will be back - I found a chip I have to cashin :-)

This establishment was teeming with patrons on the fifth day of the week, evidenced by the fact that every table was occupied by jovial individuals indulging in their fondness for Korean cuisine! The ambiance was permeated with an aroma that was both pungent and savory, thus eliciting our anticipation to partake in a delectable meal. 

We opted for the daeji bulgogi and the seafood tofu soup, and upon consuming the latter, we discovered that it possessed a flavor profile that was neither too bold nor too subtle, but rather a delightful equilibrium of spices that effectively warmed our gastronomical cavities. The arrival of the former dish revealed that the meat had been cooked to a state of doneness that was tantamount to perfection, boasting a caramelized exterior that yielded a satisfying crunch when bitten into, while its intrinsic juiciness was complemented by a piquant and saccharine taste. Although we would have preferred the meat to be cooked for a slightly longer duration to achieve a more pronounced charring, the inherent scrumptiousness of the dish remained undiminished. Alas, the sides accompanying the main courses did not quite live up to our expectations, as they lacked the same level of culinary prowess; specifically, the kimchi, seaweed, and fish cakes proved to be the sole exceptions that resonated with our palates, while the remaining options, such as coleslaw and similar items, fell short of our expectations and left much to be desired. 

Despite this minor drawback, our overall satisfaction with the culinary offerings remained steadfast, and we would unhesitatingly revisit this venue in the future!

Located within the heart of cosmopolitan, patrons may capitalize on OpenTable's reservation services to secure a table at this esteemed eatery. Upon entering the establishment, we were escorted to a prime location near the perimeter of the dining area, boasting breathtaking vistas. The culinary offerings we sampled included the delectable roasted bone marrow, served with an ample portion of shredded pork, as well as their daily special: a mouthwatering combination of crispy fried pork cutlet, eggs, and an additional component...accompanied by a succulent pork shank. Initially, the singular bone marrow arrived with a generous helping of shredded pork, rendering it a relatively pricey yet plentiful option. The appetizer du jour, an unparalleled pork cutlet, proved to be an impressive introduction to our meal, although its seasoning could have been more judicious. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the colossal pork shank remained a highlight, yielding tender morsels that effortlessly detached from the substantial bone. To complement our repast, the restaurant offered a unique cocktail special, infused with effervescent elements and presenting a pleasing flavor profile. Our attentive server exhibited proficiency in navigating the menu's intricacies, providing sound guidance and fostering a welcoming atmosphere. Following a satisfying dining experience, we departed with a complimentary cosmo bag containing our surplus fare, eager to revisit this gastronomic haven in the future.
