"This eatery exudes an ambiance of refined sophistication, which is further complemented by the delectable culinary offerings. My filet, cooked to a perfect medium rare, was indeed a gastronomic delight, while my spouse's critique of his medium-well prepared cut being lacking in flavor can be attributed to his personal taste. The asparagus accompaniment, albeit slightly diminutive in size, was nevertheless adequately prepared, whereas the baked potato was cooked to perfection. The assorted bread selection provided by the establishment was undoubtedly a pleasant surprise, adding to the already convivial atmosphere. Although the French onion soup exhibited a subtle yet discernible dominance of fresh herbs, the overall taste was satisfactory. A diverse array of wines is available, but the prices are somewhat prohibitive, making one nostalgic for the erstwhile practice of bringing one's own bottle. The attentive and courteous service, combined with the secluded booths, created a comfortable dining experience, allowing for effortless conversation. While the steak undeniably lived up to expectations, the cost of $33.00 per plate may be considered somewhat prohibitive."

Pretty good pizza!  Thin crispy crust that's both crispy and has good chew. Tasty sauce with a hint of kick.  Good toppings, too.\n\nIt's a great choice if you're staying on the Strip and don't want to pay obscene room service rates for questionable pizza.  Our pizza was delivered to us at our south-strip hotel at no extra charge by a very friendly driver.

"Upon arriving at the apex of the day, our assemblage opted to partake in a culinary excursion to Capo's, yet were oblivious to the necessity of prior reservations, as the establishment rapidly reaches capacity. Subsequently, we trespassed upon this tranquil refuge and indulged in a respite from the frenetic energy emanating from the Las Vegas strip.

The ambiance within was characterized by an air of serenity and relaxation, fostering a hospitable environment in which we engaged in congenial discourse with fellow travelers. Furthermore, we sampled their happy hour fare, specifically the fish and chip dish, priced at an affordable $2.99, and were pleasantly surprised by its gastronomical quality. Our server, a female bartender, exhibited remarkable cordiality and even suggested an exceptional venue for Italian cuisine."

Whenever I embark on a journey, I have an inherent inclination to seek out an establishment that specializes in Ethiopian cuisine. It is typically located in a region of the city that is not commonly frequented by tourists who are staying in the commercial district. Furthermore, it is often a family-owned and operated eatery that warmly welcomes solo patrons, as I occasionally am. In addition to this, Ethiopian cuisine possesses an unparalleled quality of authenticity, as it consists of meats and vegetables immersed in savory sauces, which are not only palatable but also beneficial to one's physical and mental wellbeing. In Tempe, Lalibela exemplifies the type of down-home, mom-and-pop culinary experience that I previously described, albeit with an Ethiopian twist. Moreover, it serves as an ideal venue for gatherings with companions or loved ones, wherein the sampler platters are highly recommended, as they encapsulate the communal essence of the feast (consumed with one's hands, rather than utensils) perfectly. Lastly, the assortment of teas available is truly delectable.

"Savory and economically priced piecemeal offerings. Unquestionably destined to form a lifelong union with the garlic knots in the future. Tends to be teeming with patrons during weekend evenings, particularly subsequent to the culmination of Alive After Five, yet the attentiveness of the staff remains brisk and efficient."

This is one of my 2 year old's favorite places to go. It's all about the cool slides built into the hill, up to date playground equipment, and when it's hot outside the water features keep him very entertained. Henderson takes care of it's parks but this is one of the better ones in their system. \n\n4 Stars without question!

I ordered the Harvest Chopped Salad and Banana, Espresso, Pistachio, and Date Muffin. The salad had the best combination of fresh fruits, creamy goat cheese, and dressing. I would not complain if I ate one of those every day! The muffin was so delicious, what a combination of flavors! The only down side for me is that it was quite pricey. Don't get me wrong, the food was mouth-watering, but I wouldn't want to spend that much money on a regular basis.

As you walk down the hall you can smell this place from a mile away. I have yet to have a bad meal there! I would totally suggest trying to get a seat on the patio overlooking the fountains. Great meal and a great view... it would be a great spot to propose... just saying

If you are seeking to socialize or convene a gathering of individuals who have yet to experience the charms of Tempe, then Casey's would be an ideal location to facilitate such an occasion. Not only does Casey's offer an extensive array of potent potables, but their culinary offerings also surpass the quality of the typical bar fare. However, the true attractions of Casey's reside in the ambiance and the hospitality of its staff. Situated within the vibrant downtown area, the establishment exudes a palpable energy, as patrons engage in lively banter and convivial interactions. It is worth noting, though, that the doormen may exhibit a somewhat unpolished demeanor, so it is advisable to refrain from attempting entry after consuming alcoholic beverages beforehand. Furthermore, an exploration of the upstairs area may also be worthwhile, provided you can manage to evade the vigilance of the wait staff. Rumor has it that this particular space harbors a certain paranormal quality.

My inaugural indulgence in boba transpired at a Far Eastern market situated in the Western Valley; subsequent to that encounter, I have discovered several establishments in proximity to my abode that proffer this delectable beverage.  Boba Tea House holds a special place in my heart as my preferred destination for satiating my cravings for this delightful concoction.
 They boast an extensive array of flavors, which afford patrons the latitude to experiment with various combinations; however, I tend to adhere to familiar territory and opt for a Lychee Snow accompanied by boba.
 My experiences at Boba Tea House have been consistently impressive, save for the fact that I do not feel entirely at ease lingering on the premises.  It is not uncommon for individuals above the age of 18 to find themselves amidst a sea of youthful patrons, which may engender a sense of discomfort.  Notwithstanding, I remain undeterred in my pursuit of this delectable beverage and shall persist in frequenting Boba Tea House to sate my yearnings for boba.

My buds and I stumbled (literally) upon this cool find inside the MGM Grand. The three of us were all very happy with our personal pies. Very unique thin crust and cheap for the strip @ 12 bucks. Great find.

We recently had the pleasure of hosting our wedding reception at the Bentley Projects, an unconventional yet stylish venue that perfectly aligned with our preferences. Boasting ample space, the gallery exuded an air of elegance, particularly during the evening hours when the strategic lighting transformed the ambiance into a truly magical setting. Furthermore, the backdrop of original art pieces provided an idyllic setting for capturing memories through photography. The contemporary art on display, sourced from talented artists nationwide, left us in awe, albeit with a tinge of disappointment due to the prohibitive prices. Nonetheless, we harbor hope that someday we might have the opportunity to acquire one of these exceptional works. Of note, the bookstore has since closed its doors, but the adjacent restaurant, City Bakery, remains an excellent choice for a leisurely lunch before proceeding to the gallery to appreciate the exhibition. Additionally, the gallery extends its hours on First Fridays, allowing visitors to enjoy the artwork well into the evening.

"I thoroughly enjoyed this particular buffet experience! Immediately upon entering, we made a beeline for the seafood section, whereupon my culinary curiosity was piqued by the sight of the delectable King Alaskan Crab, which had been thoughtfully cracked and prepared for our convenience. My gastronomical enthusiasm was further heightened by the sheer quality of the dish, leading me to surmise that it was indeed the most scrumptious item available. My unbridled passion for comestibles was evidenced by the fact that I had the pleasure of consuming several plates worth of victuals, including crab cakes, salmon, chicken, and lamb shiskabobs (the latter of which were merely average), in addition to hummus and pita (which I found to be subpar), dolmas, sushi, won tons (which were surprisingly tasty), dim sum (likewise enjoyable), and a duo of dessert plates. Of these, the chocolate-covered strawberries truly captured my fancy. Regrettably, my carnivorous companion's assessment of the steak was less than favorable; however, this did not detract from my overall satisfaction with the establishment. Given the opportunity, I would unquestionably return, albeit with a more voracious appetite. Furthermore, we unwittingly consumed a rather unpleasant strawberry daquiri en route to Planet Hollywood, which unfortunately satiated our hunger and rendered us somewhat less inclined to indulge in further gastronomic exploration."

"Our Sunday night plans transpired to be less captivating than anticipated; however, RA's reverse happy hour salvaged the evening! When attired in elegant attire on a Sunday evening with no extraordinary destination to visit, RA proves to be a suitable alternative. On Sunday evenings, they metamorphose the bar into the 'Flying Fish Lounge,' where a disc jockey assumes his position at approximately 8 pm in the bar's corner and maintains an atmosphere of lively music until closing time. Although the musical selections are not particularly exceptional, they successfully enliven the bar area without causing significant disruption to the dining area...

The prices for drinks and cuisine at RA are habitually exorbitant, but during happy hour, one cannot voice complaints. The cost ranges between $2 and $7 for both drinks and sushi specials. Large rolls, such as the incredible Las Vegas Roll and perhaps the shrimp tempura, are priced at $7, while fundamental rolls, like spicy tuna, are $4, and I believe nigari is $3. Hot sake costs $1, substantial Kirin beers are roughly $3, and their mixed drinks vary in price but rarely impress.

On that particular night, I placed an order for two rolls (the Tootsy Maki is consistently a victor if one has an affinity for eel sauce) and a delectable Albacore appetizer, which amounted to a total of $19 on my tab. My girlfriend opted for dessert, and its presentation was truly remarkable! It was an Asian-inspired version of the banana split, served in a manner resembling a tempura sushi roll, but instead consisting of fried ice cream enrobed in chocolate sauce, whipped cream, strawberries, and so forth. It appeared genuinely appetizing!

Oh RA, although you may be part of a chain establishment, I am grateful to have you nearby."

This is a place for the highend vintage shopper. Its pretty expensive, but I will say the store is pretty kick ass inside.  If you don't have patients or you're new to driving, do not park in front of their building. The only way to get out is to back up onto central avenue!

My first time going here I wasn't expecting much but it ended up being very good. The sub I ordered was HUGE! It was extremely filling. I thought there was no way I could finish it but it was to good to put down. There's alot of room for parking in the back which was nice and there's a little bagel shop next door.

This specific location presents a challenge in terms of locating it, however, upon arriving at the destination, the effort expended in acquiring access to this site culminates in an experience that is undoubtedly rewarding, particularly when indulging in their signature dishes, specifically the combination platter consisting of both link sausage and brisket, which is characterized by its exceptional quality and flavor, thus making the endeavor to reach this establishment truly worthwhile.

I have had the pleasure of dining at this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, both during the luncheon and dinner hours, and I must say that the culinary offerings have consistently impressed me with their freshness and quality, regardless of the time of day. The staff has always been cordial and helpful, providing exceptional service that enhances the overall dining experience. In accordance with the standard AYCE sushi protocol, certain guidelines apply, such as no sharing with non-AYCE guests, a policy against wasting rice, and a limited time frame of approximately one hour to indulge in the delectable offerings. Among my personal preferences are the Crab roll, 911, Friday 13th v Jason, Spider roll, Spiderman, Cowgirl, Japanese lasagna, and numerous others that I highly recommend. Due to its modest size, this restaurant may experience a high volume of patrons during peak evening hours, potentially resulting in a wait for seating. However, the excellent service persistently maintains a superior level, as they can only accommodate a finite number of customers at any given time. If you're unable to secure a table, consider ordering takeout, as the sushi is prepared fresh upon ordering, in contrast to the pre-made, refrigerated sushi often found at other establishments, such as RA.

"Indulged in an edible indulgence with my miniature companion at an establishment purporting to specialize in delectable baked goods; however, our gastronomical excursion proved to be somewhat disappointing due to an absence of suitable seating arrangements, which precluded us from partaking of our delicious treats on the premises (a solitary, diminutive table did little to alleviate this inconvenience). Perused the menu and discovered a palette of flavors that, while not unremarkable, failed to elicit an overwhelming sense of enthusiasm: red velvet, chocolate, birthday cake, yellow cake, Oreo, German chocolate, and peanut butter cup. All items were pre-prepared, thus eliminating the possibility of customization. Notwithstanding, the cupcakes boasted an agreeable texture, replete with a copious amount of sugary icing. My personal preference leaned toward the chocolate variety, although a faint bitterness tempered my enjoyment. Further dissatisfaction ensued upon discovering an utter lack of potables (a simple glass of water would have sufficed during sweltering summer days). In conclusion, while the cupcakes proved satisfactory, they fell short of exceptional quality. Nevertheless, the business is likely to flourish given its advantageous location."

It required a considerable amount of time to complete the process of obtaining a new tire, approximately one and a half hours, during which the employees were diligently working at their maximum capacity. Furthermore, I was impressed by the fact that the staff member at the counter did not attempt to persuade me to purchase the costliest tires available, instead, he provided me with sound advice, suggesting that a more affordable option was, in fact, superior to the priciest selection.

My son got the Pechuga ala Plancha which was amazing.  My daughter had a quesadilla which she really liked. The meat in my tacos was tasty but very dry, making them a little tough to eat. My margarita and side order of guacamole was also good.\n\nI've been in Madison over twelve years and never knew this place was rucked back here. I will be back.

"Unexpectedly superior in quality, the brisket boasted an impressive depth of flavor and succulent texture that thoroughly impressed my palate. In contrast, the ribs were merely adequate, failing to live up to my expectations. Despite this, I would not advocate for dining at this establishment, as the meat requires a certain level of manual dexterity and a willingness to relinquish one's inhibitions regarding neatness. However, the macaroni and cheese presented a delightfully creamy consistency. Although the dishes lacked the desired temperature, I did not hold high hopes for their thermal properties. Ultimately, while the experience proved satisfying, the cost was somewhat prohibitive."

"Having previously perused an article regarding Pop's in LV Weekly, my companion and I decided to capitalize on a Groupon offer for this establishment, thereby prompting us to visit Decatur and experience its culinary offerings firsthand. Upon arriving at the venue, I was taken aback by its unassuming exterior, which failed to suggest the delectable fare that awaited us. However, my initial skepticism was quickly dispelled upon partaking of their custom-made dishes, each prepared to order, ensuring that even alfresco patrons like ourselves could savor scorching hot meals. Furthermore, I appreciated the diversity of cheese options available, allowing me to select provolone as my preference, complemented by sautÃ©ed peppers and onions for added flavor. Similarly, my companion opted for the identical sandwich, accompanied by a side of crispy fried green beans, both of which were thoroughly enjoyed. Notably, the generous portion sizes afforded us ample sustenance without breaking the bank. In conclusion, I would highly recommend Pop's to anyone seeking a satisfying dining experience."

This place was highly recommended to me and as an American I was naive, I walked in on a Friday night after drinks and appetizers with some friends.  And load and behold there was a seat at the bar no wait, elbow to elbow with a local with her cycling helmet and a gentlemen dressed in a finely tailored suit.  And I am wearing a shorts and a t-shirt (us Americans are so horrible at dressing up while on vacation.

The service overall was really good, traditionally trained bartenders dishing out fine wines and suggestions for diners.  This place is straight up traditional, with the right food, service, and ambiance.  For me I had a glass of red wine and the duck confit salad, I am not normally a salad kind of guy, but I did not regret getting the salad.  The duck was seasoned well, the meat was moist, the greens were fresh (this is the end of August by the way) and the balance of the bitters and the sweets of the greens and the sweet meat was on point.

This is one salad I would eat again, but there are so many other great things on the menu if I was to go here again.

"Consequently, I believe I have arrived at a comprehensive understanding of the situation: Stoney's offers an economical and enjoyable dining experience, particularly during football games, with a diverse selection of tacos and beverages available at reasonable prices. However, it is essential to note that the quality of the food, service, and overall value may not meet expectations, especially when compared to other establishments in the area. Furthermore, while the atmosphere may be suitable for casual gatherings or social events, it may not be the most ideal setting for a formal dining experience. Nonetheless, I would not hesitate to visit Stoney's again, perhaps on a Monday afternoon, when the ambiance is more relaxed, and the prices are still affordable, allowing me to indulge in their modestly priced menu options while enjoying a few drinks."

"My patronage of this establishment is primarily motivated by my yearning for the quintessential izakaya experience, rather than the culinary offerings. As a former resident of Japan, I have a deep-seated affection for the convivial atmosphere that such establishments provide, and thus, my visits to Ichiza are largely driven by my desire to recapture that sentimental essence. 

While the cuisine served here may not be exceptional by the standards of a high-end izakaya in Japan, it is, nonetheless, comparable to the quality one might expect from a typical, run-of-the-mill izakaya in the motherland. It is worth noting, however, that the prevalence of five-star reviews on this platform may be attributed, in part, to the fact that many reviewers have perhaps not had the privilege of dining at a more refined izakaya in Japan, thereby rendering their culinary expectations somewhat less discerning. 

In terms of the food itself, I would assign three stars, as it falls short of the exquisite flavors and presentation that I have had the pleasure of experiencing at other esteemed Japanese eateries. However, the hospitality extended by the staff merits unreserved praise, warranting a rating of five stars. The ambiance, imbued with a convivial spirit, earns four stars, rounded up from three and a half, if only for its successful evocation of the quintessential izakaya ambiance that I have grown accustomed to. 

In conclusion, while Ichiza may not be the optimal destination for those seeking a truly exceptional Japanese culinary adventure, it remains an excellent venue for socializing with companions over a frosty beverage or two, amidst a warm and welcoming atmosphere."

"We thoroughly relished our morning repast at this eatery, reveling in its welcoming ambiance while savoring an assortment of delectable breakfast fare, including a particularly scrumptious iteration of the \"Biker's Dream\" sandwich, accompanied by an expertly crafted espresso beverage. Moreover, we were delightfully surprised to discover that this establishment offers an array of alcohol-infused coffee concoctions, rendering it an ideal destination for future caffeine-seeking excursions to Madison. However, we would be remiss if we did not suggest that the proprietors consider undertaking a thorough cleaning or replacement of the premises' carpeting, in order to elevate the overall atmosphere to a level commensurate with the quality of the culinary offerings."

During my recent sojourn in Las Vegas, I opted to lodge at this establishment, and while it may not have been the most extravagant abode, it proved to be a satisfactory temporary dwelling. Despite the unfavorable critiques I perused prior to my stay, I decided to take a chance and was ultimately gratified by my decision. The lodging itself presented no remarkable features, yet our chamber was adequately sanitized upon our arrival, and parking posed no significant obstacle. Although locating a parking space may require some additional time upon returning in the evening, the process of checking in and out was uncomplicated and efficient. Considering their reasonably priced rates, I would not hesitate to return to this hotel in the future.

Stonecreek embodies an enjoyable experience for patrons seeking recreational activities, with a reasonable pricing structure that does not compromise the quality of the facilities. The thoughtful design of the layout lends itself to an engaging and immersive experience, devoid of superfluous elements that might detract from the overall enjoyment of the game. Aesthetically pleasing surroundings enhance the ambiance, creating a tranquil atmosphere that complements the recreational nature of the venue. While some may express reservations regarding the water feature bisecting the course, it does not appear to significantly impede the enjoyment of the experience. The staff exhibits a welcoming demeanor, fostering a positive interaction between employees and patrons. Considering its convenient location, Stonecreek presents an optimal destination for social gatherings or casual outings with acquaintances from neighboring areas.

Great food, fast, friendly service, lots to eat and very reasonably priced. Hot and sour soup is spicy but not so hot that you can't taste the ingredients. The Family combination (for two @ $11.95/person) of soup, egg roll and crab puff appetizers, mildly seasoned broccoli chicken and spicy Mongolian beef plus rice was enough for two people plus leftovers to take home for tomorrow's lunch.

This gastronomical establishment boasts an extensive array of delectable sushi options, all of which are meticulously crafted to order, ensuring an unparalleled freshness and quality. Furthermore, the menu showcases an impressive diversity, catering to a wide range of palates and preferences. The prompt and attentive service only enhances the dining experience, making it a truly exceptional culinary adventure. While the rolls are undoubtedly the stars of the show, other notable delights include the savory baked mussels and Ahi Poki, both of which are capable of eliciting an unrelenting craving. Although a prolonged waiting period may occasionally be encountered, the ensuing satisfaction unequivocally justifies the delay. In light of its merits, an expansion of this eatery would be a judicious decision, allowing a greater number of patrons to partake in the culinary splendor that is Sushi Mon.

"I decided to indulge in a frozen dessert and entered the establishment, whereupon I was pleasantly taken aback by the exceptional caliber of the product; specifically, the rich, velvety texture and burst of flavors that exploded in my mouth with each bite left me utterly satisfied, and the prompt and attentive demeanor exhibited by the staff further enhanced my overall experience, rendering it truly delightful."

"Optimize your visitation experience by prioritizing the libational ambiance rather than the culinary offerings, as the latter may not conform to gastronomical expectations. An expansive outdoor area, replete with multiple televisions and cornhole facilities, serves as an idyllic setting for social gatherings. Restrict your interior presence to the necessities, such as utilizing the lavatory facilities, as the indoor space may not be aesthetically arresting. Partake in the trivia festivities on Wednesday evenings at 8 pm for an enjoyable diversion, complemented by reasonable beverage prices (draughts at $3) and burger specials, albeit the latter may not be a gustatory highlight. Anticipate difficulties in parking, but alternative options exist across the street. In summary, this venue offers a convivial atmosphere for liquid refreshment, yet do not anticipate a delectable repast."

I used to come here a lot back in high school and I loved this place.  It's got great subs and - if I recall correctly - pretty good soup too.  The fries are some of the best I've ever had, plus you've got the option of the sweet potato fries which is a nice touch.

As I've gotten older and come here more infrequently (I've left Pittsburgh for school), I've thought about some things...Do they have vegetarian options? - I don't think so...What's up with the charge for a refill of the soft drinks?  Why is everything - the fries, the meat and even the bread greasy?  Yes, they don't take debit cards but there are two banks in each direction...so that's not a major issue.

Overall, the place is decent...with some tasty subs.  You'll see a lot of high school and college students in here.  I'd prefer to give it more of a 3.5 star rating...but I'm working with what I've got.

Since my daughter's gastronomical inclinations lean towards the culinary delights of sushi, this establishment has transpired into a recurrent destination for our family unit. Our patronage of this edifice has spanned two annual cycles, and we have developed an unwavering affection for its hospitable ambiance and delectable fare. The staff members exhibit a congenial demeanor, which contributes to the overall pleasant dining experience. The periodic presentation of special offerings elicits an element of surprise, further enhancing our epicurean indulgence. Notwithstanding the hour, we can rely upon expeditious service that facilitates our satisfaction of cravings for sushi.

If you derive pleasure from ambulating outdoors and engaging in retail therapy, then Town Square is the optimal destination for you. This scenic locale boasts an array of apparel stores and specialized boutiques, as well as a cinema, watering holes, lounges, and eateries, thereby offering a diverse assortment of activities catering to various interests and preferences. Its proximity to major transportation arteries ensures that accessing this hub of commercial activity is a straightforward endeavor, and abundant parking facilities encircling the perimeter render it a convenient and practical experience for visitors. My personal experiences at Town Square have been primarily centered around patronizing the expansive Whole Foods market, which ranks among the most sizable in the vicinity, and periodically indulging in the delectable cuisine served at Texas de Brasil. In conclusion, Town Square is an exceptional venue for indulging in gastronomical delights, imbibing beverages, and acquiring goods, and I unhesitatingly endorse paying a visit to this captivating location.

"My infatuation with Taco Y Taco's culinary offerings had already reached an unprecedented level, and I was under the impression that it couldn't possibly be surpassed. However, with the introduction of this new establishment, I was unequivocally mistaken. It has undoubtedly improved, providing a novel and elevated dining experience. While maintaining the identical format as its predecessor, this eatery boasts an upgraded interior design replete with a stylish bar, thereby enhancing the overall ambiance. 

The ordering process remains unchanged, with separate stations designated for specific types of meat. The restaurant still offers its renowned salsa bar and menu items, which fills me with immense delight. My steadfast preference for al pastor remains unwavering, although I am resolved to venture out and sample their other delectable options during my subsequent visit. The elote continues to be an indispensable component of my dining experience. 

Although I would greatly appreciate a location closer to my residence, I shall continue to make the journey to their Trop and Eastern establishments until such a time when my wish is fulfilled."

"Gourmet burgers, an epicurean delight, boasting unconventional pairings, tantalized my taste buds (specifically, the Rising Sun burger, which I had the pleasure of savoring, and a sample of my companion's Gold Standard).  Artisanal steak fries, possessing a delightful texture, characterized by a fluffy interior and a satisfying crunch on the exterior, complemented the delectable patties.  An extensive array of artisan brews further enhanced the dining experience. \n\nDespite the exorbitant prices ubiquitous in Las Vegas, the cost, including gratuity, for a gastronomic adventure consisting of premium burgers and specialty beverages, proved to be a reasonable $27 per individual."

"I experience a profound sense of longing for Katz's, and I am unapologetic about this sentiment. The minuscule, grimy spoon provided a palliative to my hangover-induced affliction on a sluggish Sunday morning. Postino, however, has transformed the aged edifice into an impressive establishment through its resourceful adaptation of construction materials. The unconventional application of building components manifests itself in an aesthetically pleasing manner, such as the red trusses that serve purely ornamental purposes. Although the cost may be slightly elevated, it is advisable to allocate your financial resources towards experiencing the delightful offerings of Postino. To optimize your visit, consider providing your contact information, registering for their email list, taking advantage of happy hour, and capitalizing on special evenings (Tuesdays and Thursdays are particularly well-attended). If your party consists of three or more individuals, prepare to endure a brief delay. However, the wait is justified by the delectable goat cheese and roasted red pepper bruschetta, accompanied by a refreshing glass of sparkling wine. The outdoor seating area, despite its proximity to the parking lot, exudes an air of charm. Additionally, the friendly valets are available to assist you, unless the time falls outside the parameters of reasonably late or early. Patrons of Postino tend to adorn themselves in stylish attire, contributing to an atmosphere of opulence. Embrace this ambiance by donning your fashionable footwear, such as Sam Edelman keyhole peeptoes, and savoring a generous glass of robust red wine with subtle hints of bologna in its flavor profile."

This place use to be called rainbow pho until one of the servers purchased the entire restaurant.

Pho Annie is a great place to grab pho or if your into the meat dishes like the grilled pork chops.

This is located on the west side for all you west side peepz!

My friend and I ordered the Chicken Pho and I ordered the grilled lamb chops with rice and egg. And for appetizers we had the fresh Vietnamese wraps.

Our food was amazing, service was great, greeted with a smile and acknowledge you as a returning customer.

cannot complain much about this place.

I recently discovered this place and it is right around the corner from my office.  I love the jalapeno cilantro hummus.  What combination!  I don't love that they charge you for extra pita.  It feels like a bad commercial (remember the got milk commercials where the guy thinks he's in heaven and is stuffing his face with cookies only to find out there is no milk?) but I guess it's a jungle out there trying to get pita.  Maybe my expectation is too high and shouldn't assume you can have another piece of pita bread for your hummus.  At any rate, I've been here a few times now and would recommend the place.  They have a guava lemonade that really is refreshing and I have to give a least for stars for that.  They gyros are also great.

"The pizza served at the second establishment was of exceptional quality, rivaled only by the superior culinary offerings of the flagship location in the city's central business district. Notwithstanding its comparative inferiority, the pizza at this satellite venue still managed to impress, boasting an array of flavorsome toppings and a crispy, well-cooked crust. Furthermore, the spaciousness of the shopping mall in which it was situated made parking a decidedly straightforward affair, devoid of the customary congestion and inconvenience typically associated with peak dining hours. Indeed, upon arriving at the establishment in the late afternoon on a Saturday, we were pleasantly surprised to find the premises nearly deserted, thereby obviating the need for an interminable wait before being seated and served."

We indulged in a pre-concert repast at Steak 44 on a Wednesday evening, and despite the throngs of patrons that converged upon the establishment, we were accommodated at a cozy two-person table situated proximate to the hearth and the bar. We initiated our culinary excursion with an order of calamari, whose generous proportions and lack of greasiness rendered it an auspicious commencement to our meal. My better half opted for the filet, which arrived on a sizzling hot plate, its tenderness and flavor eliciting unwavering approbation from my taste buds. Meanwhile, I relished the scallops, their succulence and freshness uncompromised by any trace of mediocrity. In addition, we shared a portion of baked creamed spinach, its richness and savory essence proving a worthy complement to our main courses. Although the baked potatoes fell somewhat short of our expectations in terms of magnitude, their quality remained undiminished, with each spud boasting a satisfying texture and flavor profile. Furthermore, our server, Matthew, exhibited exceptional proficiency and hospitality throughout our dining experience, ensuring that our needs were met with alacrity and grace. Suffice it to say, we shall indeed revisit this gastronomic haven in the future.

```
Spectacular location for perusing high-end items. The sales associates exhibited remarkable benevolence, and their dedication to providing exceptional customer service was truly commendable. Without hesitation, I would enthusiastically endorse this establishment for both purchasing and selling luxury goods.
```

The text is: "I love this store! They have a great selection of unique and stylish pieces. The staff is always friendly and helpful."

The modified text is:

```
This retail establishment has captured my affection due to its impressive array of distinctive and fashionable items. The sales personnel consistently display cordiality and helpfulness, fostering a welcoming atmosphere that greatly enhances the shopping experience. Unquestionably, I harbor immense fondness for this store.
```

"The ambiance within Brass Monkey surpasses that of any other public house I have had the pleasure of visiting in Edinburgh. Following a morning of academic endeavors or an examination, I often partake in their hospitable offerings, indulging in their extensive selection of beverages and savoring the relaxed atmosphere in the secluded rear chamber, adorned with plush cushions and mattresses. Although slumber is strictly prohibited, the allure of repose is almost irresistible, especially when accompanied by a refreshing pint. Their culinary offerings are equally impressive, with sandwiches being a particular highlight, complemented by reasonably priced beverages. The front room boasts an intimate setting, characterized by limited seating options, thereby creating an atmosphere that is both cozy and vibrant. However, the scarcity of tables can sometimes result in standing room only, which, while not necessarily detracting from the overall experience, may lead to a sense of crowding and discomfort. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, Brass Monkey presents itself as a charming and economical alternative to the more conventional, sprawling public houses in Edinburgh, rendering it an establishment worthy of a visit, regardless of the occasion."

First time here was good and the food was great. the pho was done well and the broth was great as well the only reason for the 4 stars is the Customer service. they had a great attitude but i had to get up to ask for a check and a to go cup. It would have been better to order and pay up front and seat ourselves so we know that we have to get up to get to go cups and Drinks etc... because there was 1 person working the register and tending to everything so it takes away from the customer service of a sit down restaurant . but thats my opinion i will go back for sure and will tell others to go there.

Great Breakfast spot... Suggest, the Lumberjack 
Solid consistent food. Definite improved alternative to going to Dennys or Ihop.. !!(haven't been to either one in a couple years now) 

We flop between good egg and waffle house (yes, we get our greasy food on once in awhile)

"My personal inclination would be to refrain from indulging in any other Thai culinary establishments situated on the westernmost island, as this particular venue excels in offering an unparalleled gastronomical experience, with each dish showcasing an unmistakable emphasis on freshness and flavor, thereby surpassing the majority of local eateries by a considerable margin."

"Ah, indeed, an exclamation of unadulterated delight! These tacos, a culinary masterpiece, have ignited my gastronomical fervor, as they embody the quintessence of authenticity. Hailing from 'La Villita,' a Chicagoan enclave renowned for its rich cultural heritage, I unequivocally assert my credentials as a taco connoisseur. These delectable morsels, crafted with meticulous attention to detail, tantalize my taste buds with their freshness, flavor, and unwavering commitment to traditional Mexican culinary practices. Initially, my expectations were tempered, given Las Vegas's checkered history in delivering genuine taco experiences. Nonetheless, my skepticism was pleasantly surprised by the superior quality of these tacos. While the price point may seem steep at $2 per unit, I assure you, dear aficionado, that the value proposition is well worth the investment. My gustatory exploration led me to sample two varieties: the taco de tripitas, featuring succulent fried tripe, and the taco de carne adobada, a dish reminiscent of al pastor in its nuanced flavor profile. Both iterations showcased an unwavering dedication to the craft, eliciting an unbridled sense of gastronomical euphoria. The anticipation, as I patiently waited for these edible works of art to be fashioned before my very eyes, only heightened the sensory experience, culminating in an unforgettable gustatory adventure."

"An exceptional value for a pristine automobile; this establishment offers a pragmatic and unpretentious experience. There is neither a throng of patrons awaiting their turn to have their vehicles cleansed, nor any salesperson endeavoring to peddle supplementary services such as a novel windshield or a $100 detailing package. Instead, the staff merely inquires about your preferences and facilitates your passage through the lavation process. It is crucial to note that if your vehicle is equipped with a metallic antenna, it is imperative to detach it prior to entry into the wash. Personally, I had opted for the $2 wash previously, but upon upgrading to the $5 wash recently, I was pleasantly startled by the discovery that my wheels had been thoroughly cleansed when I stooped to wipe them clean - a perk not typically associated with the $2 wash. Furthermore, complimentary vacuum stations are available for all clientele. For those who are willing to invest a few additional moments in self-service cleaning and tidying up their dashboard, the outcome is a superior wash comparable to, or even surpassing, that offered by full-service car washes at a cost of $20. Typically, there is either no queue or a brief wait for individuals seeking to avail themselves of the car wash facilities. Generally, the entire process takes between 15 to 20 minutes from start to finish."

"It is regrettable that the complimentary tortilla chips and salsa were of such superior quality that we overindulged to the extent that our capacity for consuming our entrees was severely diminished. Notwithstanding, the culinary offerings themselves possessed an undeniable flavorfulness, as I opted for the chicken mole, my spouse selected the chingalingas, and our progeny sampled selections from the children's menu. Our server, Sara, exhibited exceptional proficiency in her role, as she graciously offered to exchange one of the juvenile portions upon the request of our child, who subsequently devoured the entirety of it and expressed satisfaction with its piquancy. Having partaken of sustenance at this establishment previously, we have deduced that the optimal manner in which to thoroughly appreciate the ambiance of this eatery is by occupying an outdoor table during temperate weather conditions and avoiding peak hours when private gatherings may be present."

"This particular airport experience stands out as one of the most expedient and productive encounters I have had the pleasure of experiencing, boasting an impressively efficient check-in and security process that has been optimized to an extraordinary degree through the judicious integration of cutting-edge technology and innovative design. The absence of a queue at the check-in counter and the brief duration of the security screening process, which clocked in at a mere five minutes, served to further enhance the overall sense of seamlessness and convenience that permeated the entirety of our time spent within the terminal. Moreover, the generous provision of complimentary Wi-Fi access for a period of two hours served as the proverbial cherry on top, allowing passengers like ourselves to enjoy a leisurely breakfast while awaiting our flight in a state of utmost comfort and relaxation."

"The culinary offerings were delectable, savory, and fresh; however, the portions were diminutive and the prices were somewhat prohibitive, yet still worth the indulgence. Our server exhibited forgetfulness towards the conclusion of our dining experience. Throughout most of the meal, the waitstaff demonstrated attentiveness and each server who delivered our courses was well-versed in their knowledge of the menu. We sampled the grilled scallops, fried squid, spicy tuna, glazed ribs, and salmon nigiri; the spicy tuna and glazed ribs, particularly when complemented with a squeeze of lime juice, were the standouts. Unfortunately, an error in billing resulted in a charge of $366 being applied to my card, rather than the expected $149 for the evening's repast. Despite this inconvenience, I would still consider returning due to the exceptional quality of the cuisine."

"I derive pleasure from visiting establishments of this nature, as I did during a recent luncheon excursion. Upon entering, we were not immediately acknowledged by a host or directed towards a specific seating area, and instead, we meandered about the premises, perusing the menu offerings for a brief period before being informed that we could choose our own table. The price point for the midday repast was $9.99, which I considered somewhat elevated for an eatery of this type, but the ambiance was pleasant, featuring spacious booths. I personally prepared a broccoli chicken dish with onions and mushrooms, and subsequently utilized a recipe displayed on the wall to create a Mongolian sauce to accompany my stir-fry. A limitation of this venue is the dearth of sauces available, as compared to other similar restaurants I have visited, which boast a more extensive array of sauces. Notwithstanding this shortcoming, the staff exhibited amiability, and the culinary offerings were quite satisfactory."

"WTF is a dueling piano bar?! Step in here and find out...but I can tell ya it's a strangely high amount of fun. Heading back to our rooms after a late-night meeting, we got dragged into this place by one of our amped-up coworkers (luvyaBrit!!!), and eventually ended up with our tushies in a big comfy seat around a table while we laughed ourselves silly at the dueling piano players. If you are not into the whole seedy LV bar scene, check this place out as it's mellow yet fun and honestly the sing along and raunchy humor is right up my alley. Not so keen on....the cranky waitress who kept asking us if we wanted drinks....and eventually told us in a snotty ass voice that there is a two drink minimum per person, since that is why they don't charge admission. Well, maybe tell us that when we sit down instead of just giving us attitude for 15 minutes? Not rocket science. Oh and you can order bottled water as a 'drink'...stay hydrated in Vegas right. Loved...the pleather snakeskin bluey green pants that the skinny chick dueling piano gal was wearing, and she rocked them too!"

"Although I have not had the misfortune of encountering any issues with Cox thus far, I shall proceed by initiating my installation process; the technicians were not only cordial but also demonstrated remarkable efficiency in their work, completing all tasks expeditiously and accurately, prior to bidding me adieu; I contacted their customer service department on a Thursday, and owing to my residence being a newly-constructed property, it was necessary for them to dispatch an individual to assess the development's suitability for their services, which was accomplished the following day; subsequently, my appointment was scheduled for two days thereafter, culminating in a seamless, hassle-free experience; currently, I am enjoying a stable internet connection, and my high-definition television is functioning optimally, with customer service interactions having been satisfactory, thereby leading me to harbor a positive sentiment towards the services I have received."

"The plethora of fresh produce options and delectable sandwich offerings are truly unparalleled, but unfortunately, the sluggishness of the deli counter during peak lunch hours can be a tad frustrating for patrons eagerly awaiting their turn to savor the culinary delights."

"HAZE epitomizes the quintessential nightlife experience, and it's imperative to secure a table prior to indulging in the merriment, as this diminutive yet pulsating venue adheres stringently to the principle of limited capacity. The musical offerings at HAZE are truly exceptional, with Thursday evenings serving as the optimal time to partake in the revelry, courtesy of the establishment's esteemed industry night. The luminosity within the premises is utterly captivating, and those who elect to enhance their sensory perception via certain substances will undoubtedly relish the visual spectacle presented here. Furthermore, the performances by the resident go-go dancers/models are characterized by their elaborate attire, which contributes significantly to the overall ambiance of the venue. Ultimately, HAZE manifests as a microcosmic rave, wherein the PLUR (Peace, Love, Unity, and Respect) ethos permeates the atmosphere."

"Initially, it is imperative to acknowledge that this establishment does not proffer an optimal dining experience, as the ambiance is not a primary focus. Rather, it is recommended to visit this restaurant with the expectation of savoring their delectable cuisine, specifically their exceptional Pad Thai, which is served in generous portions and prepared promptly at a reasonable cost."

"A culinary escapade that transcends the limitations of linguistic expression, rendering any attempt at articulating its splendor an exercise in futility, reminiscent of the preceding review's sentiment. An unassuming, bucolic abode nestled within a diminutive park, fostering an atmosphere of rural seclusion while being mere meters away from the bustling city center. Our dining area was situated in close proximity to the kitchen, affording us an unobstructed view of the two youthful culinary artists diligently preparing the delectable fare. The hospitality of the serving staff was warm and inviting. Each course was thoughtfully paired with a wine selection that complemented the flavors and textures of the dishes, creating a harmonious symphony of taste and aroma. The ingredients, sourced locally and freshly procured, were expertly incorporated into each plate, resulting in a culinary masterclass that defied any notion of a traditional'meal.' The convivial ambiance facilitated a most enjoyable evening, shared with a dear companion, and the only minor inconvenience encountered was negotiating the compact exit, which, though presenting a brief challenge, did not detract from the overall pleasure of the dining experience. When in Edinburgh, a visit to this gastronomic haven is imperative."

Windsor ranks among my preferred establishments for after-work socializing, owing to its exceptional beverages, particularly the #89, which boasts an unparalleled flavor profile that never fails to satiate my craving for a delectable drink. Furthermore, the culinary offerings at this venue are also worthy of commendation, with the kale salad being a notable highlight that impresses even the most discerning palates.

Another solid 4 stars for this place.  Yeah it is dead, but that's one of the things I like about it.  I love coming here and relaxing and listening to the off-beat jazz or satellite music they have.  It is so much different than the "busy" atmosphere of Pin Kaow.  And way cheaper too.

I also love the $5.00 lunch special!  I think a lot of the reviews who say it takes forever to eat are really, really hungry.  I'm in and out of here in 30-45 minutes.  

Come and enjoy it!  All the curries and soups I've had here are really good!  Support Silverado Ranch businesses :)

Top notch coffee and espresso here with polite staff, and my goodness I sincerely hope this is the new norm of having draft beers at a coffee shop.  Amazing.  High marks for the aforementioned reasons.  However I just don't care for much of the customer base here, especially the younger kids who seem to occupy the limited table space for lengthy periods of time.  Rather have the mid career to older demographic at many restaurants in this area.  Parking can be challenging at times as well, but that's not surprising for the area.

Nice place to shop for fresh produce and good food. One catch though you have to be your own cashier and bagger, then the light flashes when there is an error with the system, and you have to ask the attendant for help. You can sign up for their Fresh and Easy Card there, for extra discounts. Their new store will be opening on Fort Apache soon too !

"I recall visiting this establishment during its previous iteration as New York New York, and I must say that the ambiance remains equally captivating. The expansive outdoor seating area transforms this venue into an idyllic setting for indulging in libations under the stars on a balmy summer evening. \n\nThe mixologists responsible for crafting these potent potables exhibit exceptional proficiency in their art, while the clientele they serve exude an air of sophistication and conviviality. Although I have yet to partake in the bingo festivities, I assure you that it ranks prominently on my agenda, eagerly anticipating the opportunity to engage in such merriment."

This place is downright delicious.

I was craving cheese steaks as soon as I came back from philly and this place came recommended as one of the best in las vegas.  It's the only cheese steak establishment I've ever seen in sin city so I thought I'd give it a try and I'm sure glad I did.

It's just a really good cheese steak.  That's all there is to it.  The bread is soft but not too soft.  The steak is cooked just like it would be in Philly and the toppings are plentiful and tasty.  There's also many different variations to choose from like the cheese, peppers, onions, and what kind of sauces you want on it.  I always go steak 'wit' provolone, peppers and onions.  Writing this review right now makes me want one.  I guess I'll have to settle for Philly's Best tonight, but that's another review.

"Upon encountering some difficulties while navigating the website, I opted to establish communication with a customer service representative, who, much to my delight, proved to be remarkably accommodating and helpful in addressing my concerns. Despite the somewhat obscure location of the menu on the website (positioned above the brunch menu), I managed to peruse its offerings and selected the Om burger, which, I must say, was an unmitigated culinary triumph. In addition, I elected to pair my meal with an order of kale chips, a decision that ultimately proved to be a salubrious choice. My experience with Fern has piqued my interest in their other offerings, compelling me to return and partake in a more leisurely dining experience, taking full advantage of the restaurant's captivating ambiance."

"Having partaken in culinary indulgences at this establishment on two separate occasions in the past year, I must confess that my gastronomical expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed by the delectable offerings presented before me. From the initial assortment of appetizers to the principal courses and finally, the sweet conclusions, each dish showcased an unwavering commitment to quality and flavor. Furthermore, the wine list boasted an impressive array of selections sure to satisfy even the most discerning oenophile. However, it is worth noting that 5Church has acquired a reputation as a venue where the city's trendy denizens congregate to display their meticulously curated aesthetics, resulting in an ambiance that some might describe as affected or pretentious. The waitstaff, in particular, seem to embody this self-conscious hipster ethos, their attire and demeanor bordering on caricature. Nevertheless, if one can overlook these superficial distractions, the edible delights available at this eatery are undeniably worthy of consideration for those seeking a satisfying dining experience in the heart of Charlotte."

Ordered to go. Asked for cold veggies on the side. Did not dissappoint. Got our burgers home, thirty seconds in the microwave and it was as if they had just come off of the grill. Yum!\n\nGot the fries. Really tasty, but kind of frustrating. They are so thin. You have to grab four in order to get any ketchup to stick to them.

Upon entering the premises, one cannot help but be immediately struck by the olfactory sensation that permeates the atmosphere, which is none other than MGM's signature scent that exudes an unparalleled sense of luxury and sophistication. Our accommodations in the Grand Tower were nothing short of exceptional, boasting an impeccable level of tidiness and an aesthetically pleasing ambiance that was further complemented by the modern and well-maintained bathroom facilities. It is imperative to note, however, that any attempts to remove the beverages stored in the refrigeration unit, even for the purpose of capturing a photographic image, must be avoided at all costs, lest one risk triggering the timer embedded within the appliance. Notwithstanding this minor caveat, our stay was, on the whole, a truly enjoyable and memorable experience, thanks in no small part to the warmth and hospitality displayed by Jason during the checkout process.

"As a neophyte to the culinary delights of Pittsburgh, I was eager to indulge in an exceptional iteration of pierogies, and thus, I opted to sample the traditional potato and sauerkraut variant, in addition to the pizza pierogies, which were highly recommended by the proprietor. Furthermore, I decided to share a Reuben-like sandwich, whose name escapes me at present, with my dining companion. While the pierogies were undoubtedly palatable, I must admit that I was slightly disappointed in their overall quality, as they failed to meet the exceedingly high expectations I had established in my mind. Notwithstanding, I must commend the establishment for its commitment to utilizing premium ingredients and its dedication to crafting its own corned beef, an aspect that truly resonated with me during my conversation with the owner."

Awesome little record store. I could easily spend an hour perusing their new and used selections. I could spend another hour (at least) exploring their various listening stations. I could then spend an additional half-hour finding little neon-colored stickers that tell of upcoming local shows.\n\nI agree with John V. Long live the record store!

"Upon entering this establishment, I was taken aback by the diverse array of beverages available at a reasonable cost. The strawberry banana flavor was quite palatable, however, the milk tea did not particularly appeal to my taste buds. The customer service was prompt and courteous, as I received my order in a mere two minutes and the portion sizes were generous for the price. It is intriguing that this business has chosen to operate in such a location, given its distance from Chinatown and the fact that it does not appear to be an area where consumers would typically seek out boba. Nonetheless, the popularity of this venue was evident, as a group of ten adolescents had gathered there as I was departing. While I would rate this establishment five stars for its quality and value in Las Vegas, it falls somewhat short of the exceptional standards set by certain establishments in San Francisco, thereby warranting a rating of four stars in my assessment."
Had a great dinner last night for restaurant week. Filet was great, the added lobster was a bit over done but still tasty. Service was terrific! Way to go Ruth Chris staff

Checked out Dexter's for a Friday fish fry and it was surprisingly awesome. Great atmosphere for a neighborhood bar. Unexpectedly diverse beer selection that's constantly rotating (had a great Lagunita's Hairy Eyeball). Fish was some of the best I've had in Madison. Ordered both the cod & walleye and both were delicious--thinly battered and fried perfectly without excess grease. Waffle & brew fries were delicious too. Amazingly, after over a thousand calories of deep fried food, I still didn't feel nasty. Thanks for helping me kinda stay catholic.\n\nSpecial mention to their outstanding service. After someone stole our place in line, they apologized profusely and hit us up with a free spinach & artichoke dip appetizer. Very sweet.

"Assuming that the culinary offerings are of an equal standard to the hospitality we have received thus far, I am inclined to believe that this establishment will become a personal favorite of mine. Furthermore, my dining companion and I opted to be seated at one of the elevated tables situated within the bar area, whereupon Terry, our attentive server, promptly presented us with an array of delectable options from which to choose."

The Blue Parrot is a quirky little place in Stockbridge. The chicken and cashew chimichanga I had was extremely good, packed with mountains of succulent chicken. Their soup was tasty, also. Service wasn't quite what it could have been, and their cellar-conversion toilets will divide opinion, but it's well worth a visit.\n\nOverall, we said: \"I was impressed with the Blue Parrot. It served me two good dishes, in quirky surroundings...I'm not the world's biggest fan of Mexican food, not least because over the years I've eaten in some very ropey Mexican places around Edinburgh, but I'd happily head back here the next time I'm feeling the need.\"

Pinky's garners four stars from this reviewer due to the fact that the cuisine is of an acceptable quality, the ambiance is thoroughly enjoyed, and an array of plant-based options are available, albeit not explicitly indicated on the primary menu. It is advisable to query the servers for the covert vegan menu, which contains an assortment of tofu dishes not listed on the standard bill of fare. On a previous visit, the waitstaff, having recognized this patron's predilection for vegan fare, presented a delectable tofu creation not featured on the regular menu, courtesy of the kitchen. Additionally, the establishment's chili, characterized by its robust flavor and spicy kick, is highly recommended (and, notably, vegan). Be prepared to experience a delay in seating, as the venue tends to attract a sizable crowd promptly at noon. Patrons can select from an array of satisfactory beverages, and the indoor/outdoor patio area is quite inviting. In conclusion, Pinky's offers a pleasant setting for socializing and enjoying a meal.

"Whoa indeed...meat in a sushi roll?!?! It seems almost oxymoronic, doesn't it?!?! Yet, there it was, staring me in the face, daring me to question its validity...the 'Lamb-Burgushi' roll, if you will. And let me tell you, it was nothing short of a gastronomical revolution, a true culinary epiphany that left me in a state of utter disbelief and wonder. I mean, who would have thought to combine the rich, savory flavors of lamb with the delicate, subtle nuances of sushi?!?! It was truly a match made in culinary heaven, a symphony of flavors that danced on my palate with grace and finesse. And the presentation, my goodness, it was a work of art, a masterclass in plating and garnishing that would make even the most discerning chef weep with envy. But, alas, my dear friend, the experience was not without its drawbacks. The ambiance, while certainly energetic and vibrant, bordered on the excessive, with the cacophony of sounds threatening to overwhelm my senses at times. But, all things considered, it was a minor quibble, a fleeting inconvenience that did little to diminish the overall enjoyment of my dining experience. In conclusion, I must say that the 'Lamb-Burgushi' roll at [Restaurant Name] is an absolute must-try for any adventurous foodie looking to broaden their culinary horizons. Just be sure to bring your appetite, and perhaps a pair of earplugs, just in case."

"Savor the delectable Thai culinary experience that caters to your palate's craving for piquancy, ensuring an unparalleled gastronomic satisfaction during each dining excursion. My numerous layovers at PHX have afforded me the opportunity to partake in the restaurant's offerings on multiple occasions, and I must say, the culinary prowess of Pom and Austin has consistently surpassed my expectations. The fiery flaming soup is an absolute must-try, its bold flavors tantalizing my taste buds and leaving me in a state of epicurean nirvana. My penchant for culinary exploration has led me to sample a diverse array of dishes during each visit, and I must confess, the precision with which the flavors and spices are balanced is nothing short of remarkable. For an unforgettable dining experience, entrust Pom with your preferences, whether it be seafood, poultry, or red meat, and allow her to curate a meal worthy of a social media post. Indulge in the exquisite delights that this eatery has to offer, and relish the memories that they create."

I deliberated on visiting this attraction solely due to its reputation as a tourist hotspot, but ultimately opted to experience it firsthand. Subsequently, I thoroughly enjoyed capturing photographic memories and engaging in playful poses alongside the lifelike wax figurines of renowned celebrities. In an effort to avoid the throngs of visitors typically associated with peak hours, I elected to visit during the week; however, the area surrounding the Michael Jackson figure remained somewhat congested, as patrons eagerly awaited their turn to don the iconic 'Smooth Criminal' attire for photo opportunities. Every wax sculpture bore an uncanny resemblance to the actual celebrity, with some exhibiting such striking similarities that it was almost unsettling. Throughout the venue, staff members endeavored to persuade guests to purchase copies of their photographs, which, while unnecessary for individuals equipped with cameras or high-quality mobile devices, proved to be a minor inconvenience. The sole figure that failed to meet my expectations was that of Cameron Diaz, whose likeness appeared marginally enhanced in comparison to her real-life appearance. Furthermore, the Tupac Shakur figure reportedly featured bullet wounds on its chest, a detail potentially considered superfluous given that neither John F. Kennedy nor Martin Luther King Jr.'s wax counterparts displayed comparable injuries. NOTE: Admission fees total $30 per person, though discounts can be obtained through various means, such as collecting a coupon book at the Monorail, snagging a 50% off coupon from a street promoter, or searching for online offers prior to arriving in Las Vegas. After checking the attraction's Yelp page and discovering no special deals, I became aware that numerous coupons and promotions exist, rendering full-price admission unnecessary.

Came here yesterday evening while traveling for business.  I always do my homework on Yelp when on these trips to try and find local spots I might not always find by simply driving around.  I have to say I was not let down by the positive reviews.

The Emerald Curry was recommended to me as their best curry, and it really was a solid choice (and I have had a lot of curries).  They are not cheap on their portion size, and the service was friendly and prompt.  I love Thai curry, and seek it out wherever I go -- this curry was very nicely spiced (I like it pretty spicy) and it was loaded with vegetables, which makes me "feel" like I'm eating healthier ;)

I would definitely recommend, and will likely come back when I'm in town again -- it is good quality, reasonably priced, friendly service, and a nice, relaxed atmosphere right on the King Street strip.

I find myself vacillating between a rating of three and four stars in regards to the Red Squirrel, yet due to its affiliation with the esteemed Holyrood 9a establishments, I shall confer upon it the coveted four-star designation. My ambivalence stems from a cursory visit to the premises, during which I rendezvoused with my significant other for a brief libational interlude prior to proceeding elsewhere.

Situated in the heart of Edinburgh's financial district and Lothian Road, the bar was teeming with patrons on a Friday evening, ostensibly attesting to its enduring popularity among businesspeople and perhaps underscoring a dearth of comparable drinking establishments in the vicinity. Notwithstanding its relatively diminutive stature compared to neighboring watering holes, the Red Squirrel boasts delectable burgers, as evidenced by the tantalizing aroma and sight of those devoured by a nearby couple, in addition to an impressive array of Innis & Gunn beverages, which happen to be my beverage of choice.

While the Red Squirrel exudes an aura of hipness and its Holyrood 9a association ensures scrumptious burgers, a certain je ne sais quoi pertaining to its location fails to impel me to return with alacrity. Thus, I shall bestow upon it a rating of four stars, primarily owing to its convenience as a meeting spot for my partner, who works mere steps away, while harboring reservations concerning its overall appeal in contrast to other 9a venues.

This eatery is situated on the Strip side of the Palazzo, thus, taking advantage of the pleasant climate (a balmy 85 degrees Fahrenheit with abundant sunshine), we opted to be seated on the patio. As some individuals have pointed out, there are instances when one might prefer to dine indoors; however, the ambiance was surprisingly enjoyable for late May. My parents are residents of Las Vegas, and I have had the privilege of witnessing the Strip numerous times; nevertheless, the panorama from Morel's onto the Strip was truly breathtaking. I would highly advocate selecting a table on the patio for an optimal dining experience.

The service we received was satisfactory, and our server was meticulous in his attention to detail and exceptionally knowledgeable about the menu offerings. Acting on his fervent recommendation, we decided to sample the French onion soup, which proved to be a delectable and richly flavored culinary delight. My steak arrived shortly thereafter, and it was cooked to perfection, boasting the ideal level of juiciness. While I thoroughly relished every bite of my steak, I couldn't help but feel a twinge of regret for not opting for the macaroni and cheese, as it supposedly exceeded expectations and was utterly delectable, according to the accounts of others.

This is the only place that I will buy Pad Thai. The Chicken Pad Thai is fantastic. I have tried it at several different places, even authentic thai places and some come close, but in my opinion, Pei Wei's is the best.
Very good bagels with a hint of back east charm (small and a bit worn down).  Love the Sunflower bagels, not sure what makes it so tasty but Yum!!

I visited this establishment on two separate occasions during a single week, once for an evening meal and a subsequent time to partake in the nocturnal revelry at the club. Upon my initial visit for dinner, I would have rated this venue three stars, as the ambiance was pleasant, the service was satisfactory, and the cuisine was adequate, albeit unremarkable. However, my second visit to the club on a Wednesday evening proved to be a vastly superior experience. Despite the fact that many other clubs in the area were relatively quiet, this particular establishment was bustling with activity, boasting a vibrant atmosphere that was complemented by attentive servers who ensured that our needs were consistently met. The beverages were also quite palatable, although I must admit that the fact that I didn't have to pay for them myself may have slightly enhanced their flavor. All things considered, I would unquestionably return to this venue if I were to find myself in Las Vegas once again. Nonetheless, I might opt to explore alternative dining options prior to my next visit, as my previous experience with the restaurant left something to be desired. As a final note, I would advise potential patrons to exercise caution when utilizing the Roman-style sinks located in the hallway, as while they may be conveniently turned on for guests, they are unfortunately not stocked with paper towels for drying one's hands afterwards.

The chefs here may not have attended Le Cordon Bleu but make no mistake: the food is tasty, cheap, and comes out quick. The best part about this place is its status as neighborhood landmark and its extremely amiable staff. You feel like a regular in this place the first time you walk through the door. If you want to resist the invasion of franchises like McDonalds, Subway, etc, spend your hard earned money here. support these guys!

A hidden gem!  

We never knew this place existed and stumbled into it after lunch at Chino Bandito (next door).  They have all sorts of flavors of popcorn and are more than willing to let you sample them. Even some seasonal flavors. We were really excited about the Cake Batter flavor but we sampled it in the store and were a little disappointed in the lack of cake batter flavoring, too much spoiling by Cold Stone's ice cream flavor I guess.  

We took advantage of the bakers dozen deal on the small snack size bags so we could try lots of flavors, it was 13 bags for $11 (normally $1 each).  They were even willing to make us a bag of a flavor if we didn't see it in the small size. 

They have many more flavors than what's on their website, some of the ones we got were Churro, Bacon & Cheese, Cookies & Crème, Coconut, PB & Chocolate, Cherry Chocolate and Candy Bar.  

The store had lots of cute tins/gift ideas so next time you are trying to come up with a gift idea for someone, this might just be a great alternative option to the classic gift card.

"Despite my initial desire to observe a porcine specimen with a melanistic hue, I was somewhat dismayed to discover that the sole exemplar available for viewing was a pink-colored swine. Nonetheless, I chose to persevere in my endeavor to appreciate the zoological curiosities on display, and I must admit that my visit proved to be a moderately enjoyable experience, notwithstanding the absence of the darker-hued porcine I had originally sought."

"Excellent patron assistance; however, I had to reiterate my order thrice due to an apparent lack of comprehension regarding the simplicity of inputting a single numerical value accompanied by a spicy poultry dish and macaroni and cheese. Furthermore, during my visit, a staff member emerged to perform floor-sweeping duties, which, while commendable in terms of maintaining a tidy environment, was somewhat marred by the individual's posterior proximity to my table on multiple occasions. Notwithstanding this minor infraction, the culinary offerings were generally satisfying, particularly the biscuits, which featured a subtle honey glaze that added a pleasant dimension to their flavor profile. Additionally, the piquant fowl dish caused a noticeable nasal discharge, a positive indicator of its spicy veracity, while the macaroni and cheese dish was similarly enjoyable. It is worth mentioning that the absence of a single ear of corn did not significantly detract from the overall quality of my dining experience."

As noted in previous reviews, Trader Joe's has a large variety of specialty, hard to find, and/or natural/organic items. I do enjoy walking the aisles to find new and interesting products. The specialty ravioli is one of my favorites as well as the all natural desserts. However, what other reviews failed to mention was the natural cleaning products. The main reason I stop at Trader Joe's is for the chlorine free paper products and natural cleaing products especially the laundry detergent. Chlorine free/recycled paper products seem to be hard to find in the stores. Giant Eagle Market District used to carry some Seventh Generation paper products but they haven't had any for well over a year. Before Trader Joe's, if I had to order all of my paper products online to be delivered. Now, I can find good quality, chlorine free, recycled paper towels, napkins and toilet paper for a great value at a local store. Their laundry detergent is also less expensive than the other name brands like Seventh Generation or Method but it works just as well. Yay Trader Joe's for helping me keep my family healthy and clean with less toxins!

"This culinary establishment is of exceptional quality, possessing an ambiance reminiscent of the illustrious city of New York, and is conveniently located in close proximity to our humble abode, thus rendering it an ideal destination for a delectable dining experience. My spouse and I have had the pleasure of partaking in their gastronomical offerings on multiple occasions, and we have been consistently impressed by the superior quality of the fare and the exceptional level of service proffered by the staff."

The food was very good . The service was good too. I couldn't believe how cheap the beer was.  My boyfriend and i had some sort of German chilly fries which was really good.  We also had the giant pretzel.  So good.

"Endearingly cherish the culinary experience offered by The Greene House, particularly during their Sunday promotion featuring a fifty percent discount on bottles of wine. The delectable fish and chips dish is utterly sublime, eliciting an unwavering craving that transcends mortality. Moreover, the vast majority of appetizers on their menu boast an exceptional level of gastronomical excellence."

"It is truly unfortunate that there isn't a Whole Foods Market located in close proximity to our current residence in Surprise, Arizona, as their offerings of organic and natural products align with our personal preferences and dietary requirements. However, we were pleasantly surprised to discover that a local establishment offered comparable quality and variety at a significantly lower cost. Specifically, we purchased a whole grilled chicken, a large fresh fruit salad, and an extensive vegetable juice consisting of beets, carrots, apples, and celery, all for a total of sixteen dollars, which is remarkably reasonable considering the substantial savings compared to the equivalent items at Whole Foods, which would have amounted to at least thirty dollars. While there are obvious differences between the two establishments, we were pleased to find a convenient and affordable option for a healthy meal."

"I have an immense fondness for this shopping center, boasting a plethora of luxurious retail establishments that cater to my discerning tastes. My financial constraints were of little consequence during my visit, as I found myself indulging in a spree of unbridled consumerism, culminating in an unexpected dent in my fiscal reserves. (smiling emoticon) Nordstrom's, in particular, merits high praise for their exceptional customer service, which greatly enhanced my shopping experience."

I arranged a meeting with Dr. Tognacci subsequent to receiving a glowing endorsement from a trusted acquaintance. Prior to this encounter, I had experienced unsatisfactory interactions with various medical professionals, which rendered me exceedingly cautious about seeking assistance from yet another practitioner. However, upon engaging with Dr. Tognacci, I was pleasantly surprised by his unwavering dedication to addressing my diverse concerns. Unlike some of his peers who seemingly adhered to a strict schedule, Dr. Tognacci adopted a distinctly different approach. He accorded me the necessary time to voice my apprehensions and displayed a remarkable willingness to delve into exhaustive research, ensuring that each query was adequately addressed. Throughout our conversation, I was struck by his unhurried demeanor and unwavering commitment to fostering a collaborative atmosphere. He demonstrated a genuine interest in my well-being, treating me as an equal partner in the decision-making process.
