Upon conclusion of our consultation, Dr. Tognacci ensured that I possessed the requisite prescriptions and an ample supply of samples. My sincere gratitude towards him stems from the fact that he has successfully alleviated my anxieties and provided me with a renewed sense of hope. It is my fervent belief that such exceptional standards of service merit unreserved endorsement.

"This diminutive eatery, accommodating a mere twenty patrons, boasts an impressive culinary prowess and exceptional presentation. The atmosphere is subdued, with minimal fanfare, while the music, though slightly too loud, does not detract from the overall dining experience. The sashimi of beef in ponzu sauce is a brilliant entrÃ©e, and the miso-glazed cod is absolutely exquisite. I eagerly anticipate my return visit to sample the main courses and various table d'hÃ´te offerings."

"The Orchard holds a special place in my heart, serving as the inaugural drinking establishment we frequented upon relocating to the area five years ago. My affinity for this venue has rendered it a recurring destination for libations, interactions with amiable staff, and indulgence in delectable fare, albeit limited sampling. The ambiance of The Orchard is what truly endears me to it, boasting a diverse clientele, including seasoned regulars who readily engage with newcomers, sharing tales and anecdotes, while fostering a welcoming environment that transcends generational boundaries, as opposed to certain establishments with unspoken age restrictions. Although my culinary experiences at The Orchard are restricted to a few selections, specifically the savory steak pie and crispy fries, these dishes have consistently satisfied my gastronomical inclinations. Moreover, the prospect of enjoying a refreshing beverage amidst the outdoor setting, particularly during the sweltering summer months, only serves to enhance my enduring advocacy for this beloved establishment."

I like this little club. It appears to be a small club in a strip mall next to the Horse & Hound, but inside it is very spacious. The club brings in a good mix of local artists and larger known performers. I saw KRS-One here in 2009 and Slick Rick here yesterday. Security is smooth - I typically pre-purchase my tickets and have no trouble getting in the building quickly. Both times I have been the show was pushed back an hour, but once it started it was great. It gives the local acts a chance to get their name out there. 

Yesterday I didn't purchase alcohol (I pre-limed elsewhere), but I bought an energy drink. Actually I bought two because there is a $10 limit on charge cards and the drink was $4. A couple of bartenders there to keep it moving. 

The sound is good, but the thing I like most is that while it is overall very roomy, it is also a venue where you can get up close to the performers.  I would recommend seeing a show here. Most are about $20 and tickets are easily purchased online. They have a web site, but the videos and photos show they are not always updated. I think if they had an improved web site that included recent pics, videos and upcoming schedule, it would be great. There is a calendar of events, but it could be improved.

"An impressive array of cigars is housed within the confines of the humidor, boasting an extensive collection of prominent labels that cater to the discerning tastes of aficionados. The spacious interior allows for a comfortable and leisurely experience, further enhanced by the attentive service of the bartenders who promptly presented us with a pairing of fine whiskies and a refreshing side of water at our outdoor table. As the sun began to set, the misting system provided an added layer of cooling ambiance, creating a pleasant and inviting atmosphere that beckoned us to linger. Although intrigued by the exclusive membership section of the club, we opted not to pursue inquiry â?leaving said curiosity to be satiated during a future visit."
Great lunch menu. Food here is always good but the service can be kind of hit or miss. They had one waitress named Jamie that was probably responsible for drawing in half of their business.

Very good burger & fries.  The meat is brought in fresh everyday, so I was told. Lady behind the counter sold me on a piece of peach pie. She said the fruit pies are made fresh daily. This place reminds me of an old school diner from back in the day. Think I will try the hash browns next visit. They looked really good and crisp.

First timers, I took the family (wife and three girls) here and we LOVED it. Half-price happy hour appetizers (ribs, enamame and spring rolls) were great. Dinner was excellent as was the service. Got out for $100 + top! which is good value. After a week in Scotsdale, trust me, this is good value. Would def go back; great spot!,

We stumbled upon Casa Don Juan serendipitously in our quest for hangover sustenance and potent potables beyond the Las Vegas Strip. Our fortuitous discovery proved to be a culinary blessing! The complimentary chips, salsa, and beans served at the table were scrumptious, as were the bloody Mary and pineapple pina colada we ordered. 

The eatery boasts an inviting outdoor seating area, which we took advantage of to bask in the sunlight. However, the interior of the restaurant felt rather chilly during our visit. My sibling relished the enormous portion of chicken fajitas, while I opted for a platter featuring delectable pork tamales, a mediocre beef taco, and a fried pablano pepper overflowing with cheese. We devoured every last morsel, and the cuisine effectively alleviated our hangover symptoms. Casa Don Juan's offerings exuded authentic Mexican flavors typically associated with the West Coast.

Loved the place! If your a little group it's awesome to have your own lounge especially for a friends birthday! The bottles of alcohol weren't that expensive. The fact that its intimate gives the chance for everyone to sing and not be shy! I am definitely going to go back.

"I have never experienced a subpar dining experience at any of the establishments or regions I have patronized, whereupon my culinary exploits have been consistently satisfying across the board. Despite my lack of affinity for beer, I find myself drawn to the delectable offerings of this particular eatery, wherein I routinely opt for the unvarying staple of "Mac and Cheese," bereft of poultry, and accompanied by a passable house salad for the nominal sum of $7.99, as depicted in the accompanying visuals. It is my conviction that one cannot go awry with this selection, as it constitutes a copious repast suitable for sharing between two individuals. Furthermore, I have sampled their assorted sandwiches, such as the "Brewers Club," whose attributes are also showcased in the aforementioned illustrations. Additionally, I have partaken of their Chicken Fried steak, served with an appetizing portion of white cheddar mashed potatoes. In conclusion, the confluence of palatable victuals and a tranquil ambiance renders this venue an agreeable destination, thereby warranting a rating of three and a half stars."

"The culinary experience afforded by the consumption of the chicken (ckn) was indeed gratifying, with the poultry exhibiting an impressive juiciness and flavor that was enhanced by its freshness. Furthermore, the cost of procuring this delectable fare was eminently reasonable, with the price of $17 for a whole chicken accompanied by two sizable side dishes constituting a veritable bargain. Moreover, the spacious interior of the establishment, coupled with the hospitable demeanor of the staff, contributed to a convivial ambiance that greatly enhanced the overall dining experience."

"My most recent visit to this establishment culminated in the acquisition of their delectable garlic parmesan wings, which thoroughly satiated my gustatory desires with their profound flavor and succulent texture. Notably, the olfactory sensation aroused by the aroma emanating from the recently prepared grease accentuated the overall dining experience. Furthermore, I must extend my gratitude to the management for their considerate provision of the celery, which was presented in a separate receptacle from the wings, thereby enabling me to relish each component of the dish unhindered. My appreciation is further amplified by the fact that they seemingly took cognizance of my feedback, manifesting their commitment to providing an exceptional dining experience for their clientele."

"An abundance of noodles that transcends comprehension, pho broth, Sriracha bottles of enormous proportions, and an assortment of eccentric canned beverages, including those with flavors reminiscent of ginger and'spongy grass juice,' in addition to chewy candies, animated feline figurines, vibrant playthings, and a dazzling display of butchery. Parking may present a challenge, but one can circumvent this issue by securing a parking spot on either side of the edifice. Of late, the vegetable section appears somewhat diminished, yet my affection for this establishment remains unwavering. Moreover, it is advisable to accumulate a minimum of $10 worth of comestibles for a speedy repast or preserved duck eggs, lest one encounter difficulties in utilizing credit or debit cards."

This was the last night of my six day birthday celebration!  I could not have been more happy to spend an evening here with such good friends!  We couldn't have asked for a better venue and the food was soooo good!  Two of my four dining companians had the sausage and peppers and both of them raved about it.  They both like some heat so I assume there was heat for the taking.

The other two of us  of ordered Chicken Marsala and Chicken Piccata.  I know we both scraped our plates clean!!  Plus the bread is so good!

The wait staff was really good too.  And they took about 8 pictures of us to get one that we all looked good in.  

The music started at about 8:15  That's when the great people watching starts, which I love.   

What can I say?  The food us really 4 stars.- the waitstaff it incredible and  if you dance or not - it's fun to stay for the dance-floor show!!

"A remarkable culinary experience, characterized by an exceptional sandwich, was unfortunately marred by a perceived grimness on the part of the female staff member responsible for processing our payment; however, it is worth noting that this individual did take the time to apply a fresh coat of lipstick prior to interacting with us, which, while not necessarily mitigating her seemingly unfriendly demeanor, did serve to enhance her overall appearance, thereby creating a somewhat paradoxical impression; nevertheless, it would be inaccurate and unfair to imply that the quality of the sandwiches or the service provided by the remaining staff members was in any way compromised."

"Having visited the recently established Fiesta Mall In N Out Burger in Mesa on several occasions and expressing profound disappointment with the culinary offerings, particularly the unpalatable and soggy french fries, I opted to sample the fare at this particular establishment in AJ, thereby granting it an opportunity to redeem itself in my estimation. As luck would have it, the hour of our arrival coincided with the peak lunchtime period, which customarily translates into an influx of patrons and an ensuing state of affairs characterized by crowding and prolonged waiting periods. However, much to our delight, the duration of our sojourn in the extensive drive-through queue was surprisingly brief, barely exceeding five minutes, despite the presence of a sizeable assemblage of individuals partaking of their meals alfresco and an appreciable number of vehicles awaiting their turns in the adjacent parking area. Furthermore, the gastronomic experience itself proved to be a gratifying and satisfying endeavor, as the fries were expertly prepared, exhibiting a delightful crispiness and freshness that complemented the flavorful and generously proportioned burger, which was further enhanced by the richness of a decadent chocolate shake. The overall quality of the service was also noteworthy, as the staff demonstrated a commendable level of efficiency and attentiveness, ensuring that our visit was marked by an atmosphere of welcoming hospitality and unpretentious geniality."

"Network has served as my preferred establishment for wheel alignments for an extended period of time, and I have consistently been satisfied with the quality of their work and the reasonable pricing they offer. However, I have encountered some variability in the level of customer service provided, as there has been a different individual attending to me on each occasion I have visited the shop. Despite this inconsistency, I remain confident in the integrity and reliability of Network's services, and I will undoubtedly continue to patronize them in the future."

Not being a popcorn connoisseur I can't say I know what truly constitutes good popcorn and great popcorn. However, Popped has some darn good caramel corn. The place is priced appropriately and they have a crazy variety of flavors. I've had them on a few different occasions and try to select a new flavor every time. What I like is that you don't have to eat all of it at once, the popcorn stays pretty fresh as long as you keep it sealed. \n\nI'll definitely be back for more - because as you know, once you Pop, you can't stop.

"This establishment offered its services at a remarkably reasonable price point, rendering it an optimal choice for those seeking a tranquil and therapeutic experience. While the massage itself was not characterized by the profound pressure I had specifically requested, it was, nevertheless, quite relaxing and ultimately left me feeling refreshed and revitalized. The therapists responsible for administering the treatment were exceedingly cordial and hospitable, creating a welcoming atmosphere that greatly enhanced my overall enjoyment of the session. Additionally, they employed various efficacious aromatherapy methods that contributed significantly to my sense of well-being and relaxation."

"The staff's proficiency in customer service could benefit from enhancement (i.e., acknowledging patrons upon entrance, expressing gratitude for orders, et cetera). Conversely, the culinary offerings were quite satisfactory. I opted for the #2 combination (Philly Steak, fries, and soda for $7.99), which proved to be an adequate portion size for a midday repast and boasted exceptional flavor. Although I am not particularly fond of steak fries, their utilization did not detract significantly from my dining experience. However, I would have appreciated a more copious serving of fries, as the quantity provided seemed incongruous with the sandwich. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, my overall assessment of the establishment remains positive, and I anticipate future visits, given its proximity to my place of employment."

"What an intriguing idea! Not ice cream, not a slush, but rather a snow...or snoh, if you will. Select your preferred flavor of snow, a topping, and a glaze (essentially a subtle drizzle) to crown it all. The menu boasts an impressive array of innovative options without being overwhelming, allowing novice patrons to sample the establishment's offerings without feeling daunted by an excess of choices. The flavors available are truly inventive; think taro-flavored ice or mogi toppings, complemented by a condensed milk glaze. The ambiance is modern and sleek, reminiscent of contemporary IKEA decor, which this writer happens to admire. Upon sampling the wares, one cannot help but be impressed by the sheer ingenuity of the frozen concoction. While the toppings and glaze could benefit from a slightly more generous application, the end result is undeniably delectable and uniquely refreshing. In short, a most satisfying experience!"

I had a gratifying experience during my visit to this establishment last night, despite the fact that I was obligated to pay a cover charge of 10 dollars, which I found somewhat disagreeable. However, my friend was displaying some artwork, and I was eager to observe it. The atmosphere within the venue was characterized by a diverse assortment of individuals, ranging from hippie women who appeared to be under the influence of hallucinogenic substances, to metal enthusiasts who exhibited a pronounced tendency to clench their jaws, and even ravers who seemed to be in a state of euphoria induced by electronic music. It was truly fascinating to witness such a varied gathering of people interacting harmoniously. Furthermore, the bartender, who was ostensibly inebriated, served drinks at a price that I considered reasonable, thereby partially compensating for the initial financial burden imposed by the cover charge. During my time there, I encountered several pleasant individuals, was exposed to some captivating musical selections, and even derived amusement from the performance of a band playing a rendition of War Pigs, albeit unexpectedly.

We really like the atmosphere here! My Hangover Hash was top notch but my wife's spicy tofu tacos were extremely bland and she didn't eat half of it. The service was top notch as well! FYI their fries are awesome!

"I would posit that it constitutes a rather satisfactory venue for a Greek buffet, offering a diverse array of culinary options, an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, and the added convenience of a private bar serving an assortment of beverages. I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions in the company of my associates, and I must say that the majority of their dishes are indeed quite delectable, with their ice cream being a particular highlight. Moreover, they cater to the dietary restrictions of my Muslim companions by providing halal meat options, thereby enabling them to partake in the culinary experience alongside us. However, it is worth noting that some dishes may be found lacking in terms of preparation or exhibiting an excessive saltiness. Furthermore, the cost of the meal varies depending on the day of the week."

After perusing the aggregated assessments proffered by patrons, I am eagerly anticipating partaking in a culinary excursion to this establishment. As an individual with fastidious gastronomical inclinations, I shall reserve judgment until I have had the opportunity to sample the fare offered by Pita Kitchen Grill, at which point I shall provide a comprehensive evaluation of my dining experience.

A quaint and secluded eatery nestled in the heart of Gilbert, which we had the pleasure of discovering during a recent breakfast excursion, offering an unexpected culinary delight. My companion and I opted for a traditional breakfast ensemble, consisting of fluffy pancakes accompanied by succulent sausage, while my partner savored the delectable breakfast tacos, boasting a medley of fresh vegetables, eggs, and savory ham. The piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, however, proved to be the heavenly apple fritters, enrobed in a sweet, crispy exterior, giving way to a tender, pillowy interior. Be prepared to endure a brief wait, as this charming establishment tends to attract a sizable clientele, but rest assured that the moderate price point is well worth the gastronomic indulgence. Moreover, we would like to caution our readers regarding the presence of a formidable patron, known for his menacing sting, affectionately referred to as "el scorpio."

"Gastronomical excellence. An eatery that exudes an authentic, indigenous ambiance, sans the ostentatious trappings of an upscale establishment, yet still maintaining a certain je ne sais quoi that is unmistakably characteristic of its environs. Not surprisingly, given its geographic provenance. Partook in a culinary excursion during the celebrated Mad-Craft-Beer-Week, accompanied by my better half, and we both relished the flavorsome fish, our gustatory sensibilities satiated by its delectable taste."

I attended the Day of the Dead festival over the weekend, which, regrettably, proved to be somewhat of a disappointment; nevertheless, my visit to the museum was quite captivating. I had the opportunity to explore the Cotton Fields to Skyscrapers exhibition, which offered an intriguing examination of the transformations that have occurred in Charlotte and its surrounding areas since the Civil War. As someone who has an ardent fascination with history, I found the interactive approach employed in the exhibit to be particularly engaging. The extensive nature of the display allowed me to fully immerse myself in the various eras being represented, thereby enhancing my understanding of the subject matter. Unfortunately, the Day of the Dead exhibit did not live up to my expectations, as I arrived after the depletion of sugar skulls and was unable to witness the traditional dances or observe elaborate altars. Despite this letdown, I did appreciate the complimentary museum admission, which ultimately made the excursion worthwhile.

Victor Hugo is a great little Continental Deli on the edge of the Meadows in Edinburgh.  It is in an ideal location to catch all the University students on their walk to and from classes and is a great place to go to in the summer as it is just across from the Meadows.  

Victor Hugo has an excellent selection of freshly made bread and serves sandwiches and cakes make fresh every day.  They have a counter full of all different types of meats and cheeses which are very tempting.  My absolute favourite is their chocolate brownie which is very more-ish and I frequently pop in for breakfast in the mornings and have the fresh fruit salad.  Everything is organic and freshly made, and although everything tastes delicious, it is a wee bit pricey.   Victor Hugo now sell hampers so you can choose which foods you want in it and they will make it up and deliver it to you.

There is seating inside the shop, and it also has tables and chairs outside so it is a lovely place to sit and watch all the action from the Meadows on a warm day.

This assessment, albeit somewhat conflicted, has been subjectively augmented to reflect an ostensibly more accurate appraisal, given the inherent limitations of comparative analysis within the hospitality industry. Specifically, the author has elected to assign a rating of 3.5, commensurate with their perceived quality of service, despite the arguably superior accommodations offered by the Bellagio. It is worth noting, however, that the author's satisfaction with the Vdara's staff, cleanliness, and modern appointments has not been compromised by their previous experience at the aforementioned luxury establishment. Furthermore, the presence of a full-sized refrigerator for the storage of libations and leftovers has been deemed particularly appealing, while the bed, though adequately comfortable, has been somewhat let down by the unfortunate state of the windows. In conclusion, while cognizant of the Vdara's relatively affordable pricing strategy, the author remains ambivalent regarding a potential return engagement, instead recommending the Bellagio or Wynn for those seeking a truly luxurious experience.

This course owns me.  That said, it's a great muni course--best I've played.

Course is challenging and will more likely reward the accurate player as opposed to someone who likes to slice their drives all over the place.  There are many holes that offer great views.  I liked the one on the back 9 where you hit basically through an opening in a forest and down three stories onto the green that's about 200 yds away.

Will definitely be coming back again to this well-maintained challenging course.

dmo out.

Whenever my cognitive faculties conjure up an image of Madison, my mind's eye invariably gravitates towards this particular establishment, which boasts an impressive array of artisanal brews, a veritable cornucopia of culinary delights that cater to a wide range of gastronomical inclinations, and an architectural style that exudes an air of elegance and sophistication. While my curiosity has been piqued by the effusive praise lavished upon the African peanut soup (or whatever its official designation may be), my personal preference tends to lean towards the more traditional bratwurst and cheese curds, both of which I have had the pleasure of sampling on previous occasions.

I have always wanted to go in here and check it out, at various locations, but never did.  Today I passed by here and decided this was a good time to do so.  It was right there and I had the time.  The store was nice and cool (important when it's 111 outside).  The clerks were super nice.  They left me alone when I wanted to just browse but were right there when I had a question or request.  I ended up buying one cute black cotton top with lavender sequined roses on the front and got it for 20% off by filling out an app for a credit card.  The manager even said if I came back within a week I could buy the other one I was looking at for the discount as well.  It's obvious they put customer service as a priority, not becasue of the discount, but because of the overall way I was treated the whole time I was in the store.  I will try to stop by here on future visits to town even though I'm not a big clothes shopper.

"This venue offered an exceptionally enjoyable experience, boasting an atmosphere that was utterly conducive to merriment and social interaction. In the company of my dearest relatives and acquaintances, I had the pleasure of partaking in various recreational activities, the sum of which culminated in an utterly delightful outing. While the culinary offerings did not necessarily constitute a gastronomic expedition, they were by no means the primary focus of our visit; rather, they served as a satisfying complement to the multitude of attractions and diversions available at this establishment. Suffice it to say, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit, which promises to be yet another occasion for unadulterated enjoyment and conviviality."

First pho experience surpassed expectations, with an average rating of 3.5 accurately reflecting its quality. Upon entering the establishment, my companions and I opted for three distinct bowls, which we relished collectively. I personally selected the vegan pho, which was abundant in vegetables and noodles, while also boasting remarkable flavor. Additionally, I chose to sample the tofu nuggets, primarily to maintain a straight countenance while placing the order. To my surprise, they were quite palatable, as was the accompanying sauce. My acquaintance opted for crab rangoon, a dish ubiquitous in many eateries, but priced at an exorbitant $8 within these premises. The server's demeanor was brisk, and he failed to solicit beverage preferences, instead delivering water unprompted. This hasty approach resulted in the rapid arrival of our cuisine, which precluded any potential grievances. Furthermore, no offer of dessert was extended, as the check materialized without warning. An enigmatic aspect of our visit involved the subtle background melodies of house music, which persisted throughout our stay, eliciting puzzlement rather than annoyance. Ultimately, we attributed this peculiarity to the atmosphere of Las Vegas in the late hours of the night.

"My sentiments towards this establishment are profoundly positive. Admittedly, my experiences have been limited to the morning hours, but it is widely acknowledged that the inaugural meal of the day holds paramount significance. Every culinary creation I have sampled at Pesto Prima has ascended to the pinnacle of my preferences. The Prima Breakfast Sandwich, in particular, is a gustatory masterpiece that harmoniously unites an array of ingredients, resulting in a symphony of flavors that delight my taste buds. Furthermore, its generous proportions ensure that even a single serving satiates my hunger. The Chai Tea, expertly crafted by the proprietors themselves, is an elixir worthy of the highest praise. Its rich, complex essence tantalizes my palate, making it an unparalleled delight in the locality. In addition, my recent venture into their Java Mocha Blast, a beverage replete with nutritious properties, transcended my expectations. A silky texture and enchanting flavors have secured its place among my favorite indulgences. Lamentably, the sole drawback of this otherwise exceptional eatery lies in its weekend hiatus, precluding the possibility of partaking in its delectable offerings on Sundays. My fervent desire is to eventually relish their midday fare, thereby completing the culinary experience."

"One of the scant establishments within the city limits of Pittsburgh that proffer genuinely Latin beverages! For an overcrowded ambiance reminiscent of a jam-packed sardine can, patronize them on a weekend evening. I savored the tacos during the diurnal hours, and was particularly enthused by the fact that they actually concoct legitimate caipirinhas on the premises, irrespective of the inclement climatic conditions exteriorly. Ah, yes - an oxymoronic scenario that I find utterly captivating: caipirinhas amidst the snowfall... A phenomenon exclusive to the Steel City!"

"Amicable hospitality, delectable cuisine, and an aesthetically pleasing ambiance.  I have a predilection for thermal sensations and this establishment consistently delivers an exceptional dining experience that fulfills my expectations.  Consequently, I shall frequent this venue with regularity."

St. Francis emerges as the unequivocal victor in the culinary contest for the finest French fries in all of Phoenix, with its sibling establishment at the Downtown Public Market boasting an identical formula yet failing to measure up. St. Francis maintains its status as a beloved brunch venue (complete with exceptional live music commencing at 10:30 am on Sundays), while concurrently delivering an impressive dining experience come nightfall. The level of service exhibited by the staff is persistently superior, complemented by the consistent excellence of the cuisine. For a truly satisfying breakfast, consider opting for the sandwich sans the mayo-sauce (let us dispense with the pretense and acknowledge that mayonnaise has no place on a morning meal). The flatbread pizzas and burgers served during the evening hours are equally deserving of praise. Furthermore, the happy hour offerings at this establishment are noteworthy and warrant mention. Although the bar area may be modest in size, securing one of the alfresco stools will ensure a prolonged and enjoyable experience.

"Comparable to, and indeed surpassing the scope and grandeur of, festivals celebrated in other regions of the nation, this particular event boasts an unparalleled level of excellence, owing to its unique and privileged location. The acquisition of art pieces directly from the hands of the creators themselves, be they artists or artisans, serves to imbue the process with a profound sense of significance and personal connection, allowing patrons to form a deeper appreciation for the works on display. Moreover, certain artisans possess an uncanny ability to embody the essence of their creations, their appearance and demeanor mirroring the very same qualities that define their artistic output."

"On my most recent visits, I have observed a marked improvement in the quality of service and attention to detail, prompting me to offer a commendation. Upon entering the establishment, I was presented with a steaming cup of hot tea, which was replenished promptly upon nearing empty. Additionally, I have noticed a significant enhancement in the cleanliness of the premises over the past year, particularly in comparison to my initial visits several years ago. I appreciate these minor yet noteworthy improvements and wish to acknowledge them. Furthermore, I was quite taken by the flavorful chicken porridge ($6.95), which was served at an optimal temperature, allowing for the chicken to be cooked to perfection and infused with a delicate freshness. The judicious inclusion of ginger, expertly shaved into fine slivers, complemented by the crunch of green onion, cilantro, and shallots, resulted in a harmonious balance of flavors. This dish has secured a place among my preferred choices for a nourishing, comforting meal, especially during periods of indisposition. Gradually, this eatery has earned its place as my go-to destination for a satisfying late-night soup experience."

We love this place. 

If you go for an early dinner it is good for kids (high chairs there). 

Their food is great, service is fast and staff is nice and is really a hidden gem.  

Love their green curry (more rice would be nice though) and their sampler app is the best thing to get (YUM!)

I really like this cute little nail shop because it is not your typical chop shop. It's clean and relaxing. I have never had artificial nails of any kind but due to recent issues with my nails breaking so easily I decided to give them a try. The young lady suggested I go with gel tips which would last 2 weeks. Unfortunately, they started peeling off only 6 days later. I went back and she fixed them using a hard gel- no questions asked.  She did a great job of making my nails look natural and elegant.

I consider myself incredibly fortunate to have had the opportunity to indulge in a culinary experience at the Cracked truck, situated within the Food truck Oasis at the renowned Bonnaroo festival. My affinity for a flawlessly prepared egg is unwavering, and I knew instinctively that my taste buds would be delighted by a dining establishment that elevates this modest ingredient to center stage. Following my natural inclination, I opted for the Goy Vey, an amalgamation of bacon, hard salami, hash brown, and a fried egg, complemented by a sweet and spicy cream cheese spread on a crispy ciabatta roll. The resulting flavor profile was nothing short of magnificent, and it stands as a testament to the chef's skill that this breakfast-for-dinner offering transcended the ordinary. While the hash brown's texture may have been slightly lacking in substance, the overall quality of the dish remained undiminished, thanks in no small part to the cream cheese's subtle balance of sweetness and piquancy.

I had the sensation that I was situated on the set of a softcore pornographic production. Two females were dancing behind these screens, which were illuminated by blue and red lights, thereby creating an ambiance that was highly conducive to relaxation in a lounge bar setting. Although it was somewhat crowded, the gathering of individuals present did possess a certain je ne sais quoi that made it an appropriate venue for socializing with acquaintances prior to embarking upon nocturnal adventures. It was not a location that encouraged ogling, but rather an establishment where one could unwind and enjoy the company of others while partaking in libations, albeit at a cost that was slightly prohibitive, as the combination of redbull and vodka amounted to a total of eighteen dollars, which was indeed a tad steep.

"Abandon the standard continental breakfast and instead opt for the delectable eggs benedict, boasting a velvety, subtly tangy sauce atop a delicate, flaky croissant. The coffee, unadulterated by any additives, was of such exceptional quality that it rivaled even the most fastidious palates. The service, a testament to the city's renowned hospitality, was impeccable and attentive, creating an ambiance conducive to leisurely conversation among the trio of ladies gathered the morning after a night of indulgent bar hopping, passionate encounters, and lively discussion."

"A truly exceptional customer service representative. Her demeanor was utterly endearing and her assistance was invaluable. Additionally, the establishment offers an uncommon policy of allowing patrons to experiment with their products without incurring any supplementary fees, which resulted in my discovering two exceptional wigs at a combined cost of less than $70. However, the ambiance of certain sections within the store could be perceived as somewhat unrefined, yet it must be acknowledged that this is a specialized retail outlet catering to beauty enthusiasts, thereby warranting a minor deduction in rating due to the somewhat lengthy queues encountered at the checkout area."

This place can't be beat in the downtown area in terms of creative, yummy food, relaxed atmosphere, and fair prices.\n\nI've sampled about half of the menu, and while the red curried noodles and veggies wasn't really spicy enough for me, I've otherwise thoroughly enjoyed everything!  The gypsy stew is probably what comfort food tastes like in heaven.

"Concealed plant-based culinary delight brimming with gustatory sensations that even the most ardent meat enthusiast could tolerate: Whole Grain Tuscan Linguine devoid of dairy, adorned with soy-based protein. Giggity. \n\nIn case you have yet to indulge in the sumptuous delights of their Rice Krispy Treat, you are missing out on a pinnacle of epicurean fulfillment. I am persuaded that the liberal wedge of gooey, marshmallow-infused bliss is a direct manifestation of celestial baking prowess, taken from the pages of an ethereal cookbook. I crave no knowledge of their enigmatic formula - I simply desire for them to persist in their confectionary endeavors, unabated and perpetual."

This review is for the Boba: This Boba tastes excellent and is the best that I have had in this town so far, it does not taste powdered or overcooked. The service is friendly and I didn't feel unwanted being white

I picked up a salad here while I was visiting a friend in the area and I was very impressed! I love a good salad with fish on top. I'm used to most quick places (like Panera) using pre-cooked, cold salmon. It was a very nice surprise that they grill the salmon to order. I wasn't expecting to wait for fish but it was more than worth it!\n\nI took my salad to go but I couldn't help but notice they had beer and wine and, of course, a patio!

"Excellent culinary experience characterized by delectable melodies, gastronomical delights, and exceptional hospitality. My previous visit to the Greater Phoenix region included a memorable dining excursion to this establishment. We opted for al fresco seating to capitalize on the balmy evening ambiance, and were immediately captivated by the eclectic and spirited musical accompaniment that harmoniously complemented our dining experience without overpowering conversation. As the evening drew to a close, our server demonstrated remarkable attentiveness and wit, ensuring an unparalleled level of customer satisfaction. The fare itself proved to be a veritable feast for the senses; a garden salad, generously portioned and bursting with flavorful greens, preceded a magnificently crafted pizza showcasing an array of savory toppings artfully arranged upon a wafer-thin crust. However, as we ventured towards the pie's center, we noted a slight diminution in crispiness, leading us to surmise that a brief additional period of culinary indulgence would have enhanced our enjoyment. Nonetheless, Grimaldi's offered an unforgettable epicurean adventure that warrants unequivocal recommendation to any individual fortunate enough to find themselves within proximity."

We loved everything except for 1 thing..
AMAZING kalbi ribs, rock & roll, aria, coco shrimp, avocado bomb. Order it all!
Didn't like the red rock. Weird consistency and lacked something. Just doesn't work. 

Also our avocado bomb barely had avocado unlike the previous pics posted.  We were kinda bummed about that.

"Upon embarking on my maiden visit, I must confess that my expectations were not entirely met, as I encountered an ambiance that fell short of my preferences. Specifically, I felt subjected to an unsettling gaze during the ordering process, which somewhat marred my experience. Additionally, the absence of my preferred beverage further contributed to my disappointment. Notwithstanding, I acknowledge that this establishment enjoys immense popularity among patrons, and I must admit that it boasts an impressive array of beverages and reasonably comfortable seating. However, my overall satisfaction remained limited, warranting a rating of four stars, relative to other local breweries I have had the pleasure of visiting."

"Utterly exquisite culinary experience. We indulged in the delectable chicken satay, savory dried beef, and flavorsome pad cashew nut. My palate was thoroughly satiated by the scrumptious offerings, rendering me insatiable for more. The hospitable staff members exhibited remarkable cordiality and affability. However, a minor drawback occurred when we attempted to place a delivery order beyond the stipulated time frame, and we were informed that while the restaurant accepted our request, we needed to contact an alternative delivery service. Unfortunately, the latter declared they were unavailable, leaving us in a state of flux with no successful outcome."

"Indulge in a romantic escapade, and allow me to suggest an ideal venue for such an occasion. none other than the esteemed Cajun Queen, nestled within a picturesque, historic edifice on 7th Street. Upon arrival, we were ushered into the sunlit rear compartment, only to find ourselves amidst a boisterous gathering of revelers celebrating a ladies' holiday soiree. The cacophony of sound was almost deafening, prompting us to seek alternative accommodations. Our request was met with a peculiar response, as we were informed that the remaining dining areas were fully occupied, with the sole exception being the rooftop patio. Astonished by the revelation of this hidden gem, we opted to ascend to this unexplored territory. The balmy temperature in December rendered the outdoor setting an idyllic retreat, enhanced by the melodic strains of vintage Christmas tunes, a dazzling display of illumination, and a breathtaking panorama. Our culinary excursion began with a half portion of fried oysters, which arrived in a golden-brown, crispy state, accompanied by a rich, creamy Ranch dressing. For our main courses, we selected the etouffee, my companion opting for the crawfish variation, while I preferred a vegetarian rendition. Although both dishes required a pinch of salt, pepper, and a dash of hot sauce to elevate their flavors, they proved satisfying after a bit of judicious seasoning. Incidentally, I must confess that their vegetable etouffee, when savored on a previous visit, was nothing short of sublime, necessitating no embellishments whatsoever. In conclusion, let us resolve to seek out this rooftop haven whenever the weather permits, ensuring future visits to this beloved eatery are suffused with an air of exclusivity and delight."

"ENCHANTED by the Old Sugar Distillery for potations. I relish the horchata, or indeed any concoction incorporating their honey liqueur. One can also acquire bottles of their liqueur, which harmonizes magnificently with any beverage at home. I sense that it's a somewhat clandestine venue, as many of my acquaintances are unfamiliar with it, yet one particular comrade avows its excellence. Alas, they cease operations at 10pm (which he maintains is the apogee....perplexing, no?), precluding prolonged revelry on the premises. However, it lies in close proximity to other intriguing and less-frequented watering holes, such as the Brass Ring. \n\nI do not take pleasure in the dim ambiance, despite its proximity to Washington Boulevard...occasionally, I hasten my pace when walking solo from my vehicle."

"The facility boasts an impressive level of hygiene, with a consistent abundance of operational machinery, offering diverse load capacities, and a convenient duration of merely 7.5 minutes for each quarter, accompanied by the option to select the preferred heat setting, in addition to the availability of detergent, softener, and dryer sheets at a nominal cost of $0.75, under the supervision of an on-site attendant, complemented by the presence of a television, and further enhanced by the proximity of a 7-Eleven convenience store situated adjacent to the premises."

My default hotel when in Vegas....

Its right in the middle of the strip, and the beds are super comfy. 
Its also a bit cheaper than some of its neighbors, and much nicer than any of its cheaper neighbors. 

I got upgraded last time I was here, and about two weeks after we checked out, I got a phone call asking if I left keys in the room, which I thought were already lost forever. You guys are awesome! 

They even shipped them to me without asking for a dime!

See ya for New Years!

I devoted the bulk of my weekend to partaking in the NASCAR races held at this venue, and my experience was thoroughly enjoyable, albeit heavily biased due to the lavish treatment I received. Suite parking, which afforded me proximity to the racetrack, was the initial indulgence bestowed upon me. Furthermore, I had the privilege of witnessing the races from the comfort of luxurious suites, complete with an array of delectable food and beverages. Additionally, I was extended an exclusive invitation to revel in the opulence of the Octane suite, a five-star eatery and bar situated within the track, thereby further enhancing my already extraordinary experience. It is hardly surprising that I harbor an immense fondness for this location, given the exceptional hospitality and attention to detail displayed by the PIR staff and security personnel, despite a minor lapse in navigation assistance from a select few guards. The sheer volume of individuals who opt to camp at the track throughout the weekend serves as a testament to its enduring popularity. In the future, I aspire to spectate the shopping cart races occurring within the designated "town" area, thus expanding my NASCAR experience beyond the racetrack itself. As a novice to such events, I found myself pleasantly surprised and am eager to repeat the experience.

"As an individual whose predilection for cigars is not particularly pronounced, I do, however, derive pleasure from indulging in one accompanied by a robust beverage on occasion. Recently, I had the opportunity to experience this establishment, and my initial impression was overwhelmingly favorable. 

The ambiance, characterized by an harmonious blend of leather chairs, sofas, love seats, and strategically positioned bar stools, exuded an aura of warmth and comfort, creating an ideal setting for a tranquil respite. The judicious incorporation of rich wood accents and tasteful table settings further contributed to the overall sense of refinement that permeated the space. 

While my exposure to the edible offerings was limited, owing to my abbreviated duration on the premises, I must confess that my cursory assessment of the comestibles, potables, and cigars available led me to classify them as satisfactory. A subsequent visit, which I eagerly anticipate, will afford me the opportunity to more thoroughly evaluate the culinary aspects of this venue. Until then, I remain optimistic about the prospect of returning in the near future."

I came to Siamese Kitchen with 19 other Yelpers and we plowed through much of the menu and overwhelmed the kitchen but they were gracious and didn't mind when I jumped in to help clear tables and keep the food moving.

Wow, that was a run-on sentence.

Overall the food was really good and the service was good as well.  They did have a hard time keeping up (as most restaurants would when 20 people order at once) but were good natured about some of us jumping in now and then to bus tables or refill water.

I really enjoyed the Yellow curry although I would order it hotter next time.  Dottsy ordered her pad thai hot and the leftovers came home with me...too hot for most.

All of the dishes I tried (7-8) were nice and flavorful.

I will keep Siamese Kitchen in mind for lunch when I'm in the neighborhood, good stuff and good prices.

"Papilio offers an exceptional culinary experience, boasting a warm and inviting ambiance and a team of staff who are passionate about their work and proud of their establishment. Upon our visit, we opted to sample the marinated olives, accompanied by a glass of house wine and beer, the latter of which we were informed would require a 15-20 minute preparation time due to its substantial size. However, the wait was undoubtedly worthwhile, as the Calzone Ripieno proved to be a flavorsome combination of mozarella, spicy sausage, ham, mushrooms, and tomatoes, pairing perfectly with both the Italian beer and red wine. Additionally, we enjoyed the Gnocchi Al Gorgonzola e Spinaci, which rivaled any rendition we had previously encountered. In fact, the Gnocchi alone would warrant a future visit to Papilio. To conclude our meal, we requested a double espresso each, supplemented by a small bowl of delightful ameretto biscottis. Our request for additional biscuits was graciously accommodated by the waitstaff, who provided us with a second bowl. Notably, during our lunchtime visit, a group of 14 individuals was comfortably seated, indicating that Papilio can cater to a diverse range of patrons, including couples, families, and larger gatherings. Our total bill, amounting to slightly less than \u00a340, encompassed three beverages, a starter, two main courses, and two coffees, rendering the dining experience at Papilio excellent value for money. We look forward to our next visit."

"Beer Mugs capable of inducing cranial fractures, confirm. Teutonic ensemble featuring an accordion, affirmative. Hostesses donning traditional Dirndl attire, emphasizing their proficiency in managing superior thoracic assets, indeed. Expansive dining area with oversized tables and benches, present. Patrons engaging in shot-downing rituals while standing on furniture, fueled by the rhythmic chanting of the band, were abundant at HofbrÃ¤uhaus. \n\nOur culinary experience encompassed a vast array of delectable offerings, commencing with a soft pretzel appetizer accompanied by a rich, potentially lethal bier cheese sauce, which threatened to surpass the limits of our gastronomical capacities. For my primary course, I opted for the Wiener Schnitzel, complemented by a medley of steamed vegetables and a side of German potato salad. The pork cutlet was cooked to perfection, boasting a delightful synchronization of juiciness and crispiness, rendering it suitable for consumption over two meals. The potato salad displayed a pleasing equilibrium of spices, with a subtle application of mustard and mayonnaise, distinguishing it from conventional picnic potato salads. Consuming both my meal and beverage presented a formidable challenge, but, as a vacationing individual, I felt compelled to indulge excessively."

"On multiple previous occasions, I have partaken of culinary offerings at this establishment, when it was known as Pink Pepper, yet I had never availed myself of the lunchtime buffet until a few days ago. Upon indulging in the diverse array of dishes, I discovered that while each item possessed an impressive depth of flavor, a notable absence of piquancy was evident throughout. It is understandable that the restaurant strives to cater to the broadest possible audience by tempering the spiciness of their creations, but as an ardent devotee of Thai cuisine, I typically expect my dishes to arrive already imbued with a sufficient degree of fiery zest. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, I would unhesitatingly return to sample further selections from their menu, which I did on several subsequent occasions. In addition, the Thai tea served at this eatery ranks among the most delectable I have ever had the pleasure of savoring, prompting me to procure a takeout order of the beverage to protract the enjoyment of its rich, velvety excellence as long as feasible. The hospitality displayed by the staff was also exceptional, leaving me eager to revisit the premises forthwith."

This eatery bears an uncanny resemblance to its sibling establishment, The Cheesecake Factory, with a strikingly analogous ambiance and culinary offerings that cater to an extensive array of gastronomical inclinations. My fondness for the menu's copious variety and generous portion sizes, capable of satiating the hunger of a small community, has led to numerous opportunities for relishing delectable leftovers.

On each visit, I take pleasure in exploring novel epicurean options, such as the BBQ Asian Pork Tacos, whose flavorsome excellence I highly recommend. Despite the vast dimensions of this dining establishment and the consistent throngs of patrons, the quality of service remains impressively efficient, albeit occasionally challenging to secure optimal attention from the overburdened staff.

While the cacophony of sounds within can be overwhelming at times, the advantage of extended operating hours and a prime location within the Venetian complex renders this venue an accommodating choice for those seeking a satisfying dining experience well into the night.

This establishment serves as an excellent supplement to the surrounding vicinity, providing an additional venue for social gatherings and culinary exploration. I am delighted to have discovered this charming eatery, boasting an intriguing menu and an impressive selection of wines. Upon visiting, I was pleasantly surprised to learn that they produce their own wines on site, some of which demonstrate remarkable quality. Furthermore, I was astounded to find Four Graces Pinot Noir among their offerings, as it happens to be my latest discovery from Oregon and a new favorite of mine. It's truly remarkable that they carry it, given the limited production at the small winery in Oregon. My dining experience was thoroughly enjoyable, particularly the Shallot marmalade bruschetta, which showcased exceptional flavor. The salmon roll was also quite satisfying. Notably, on Mondays, they offer a special promotion featuring a chef's choice pizza paired with a bottle of their wine for a mere $20. During my visit with my spouse for Happy Hour, we indulged in their delectable sliders, which further enhanced our positive impression of the restaurant. Overall, this venue offers an excellent setting for relaxation and enjoyment, complete with a well-stocked bar that caters to diverse tastes.

"This venue boasts a quaint and secluded ambiance, characterized by an enclosed terrace adorned with ivy-covered stone walls that stretch upwards towards the sky, creating a sense of intimacy and seclusion. The terrace is furnished with an array of seating options, including wooden benches, and features a relaxed atmosphere that encourages patrons to let go of their worries and immerse themselves in the present moment. The musical selection, comprising primarily high school-era tunes, contributes to the laid-back vibe, while the friendly and attentive service further enhances the overall experience. Although the food offerings are unremarkable and can be procured from a neighboring establishment, the setting and ambiance more than compensate for any culinary shortcomings. Additionally, the interior of the pub exudes a warm and welcoming atmosphere, occasionally hosting open mic nights that showcase local talent."

I got Jamerica takeout and it was REALLY messy but SO worth it. The mango run chicken was enormous and everything I could have asked for. Each element was flavorful and satisfying on their own but together they were magical. \nThe shop is decorated with photos and letters and seems like a chill place to have a quick meal.

"The Phoenix Roadrunner Park Farmers Market presents an exceptional opportunity to acquire a diverse array of fresh produce and locally manufactured goods. The vendors primarily consist of approximately forty percent produce, thirty percent local food products, fifteen percent fresh food and beverages, and fifteen percent miscellaneous items. If your primary focus is on procuring produce, it can be challenging to maintain fiscal discipline in light of the numerous other exceptional local edibles available. To optimize your experience, it is recommended that you avoid the parking lot adjacent to the market and instead opt for parking along 36th Street, which enables a leisurely stroll through the park. Some of this writer's preferred products at the market include fresh chili peppers, fresh herbs, distinctive fruits and vegetables, local dairy items, and tamales."

My girlfriend collects robot toys and one of my best friends is a Spawn fanatic so I decided to take a look around. Although there weren't many robots there was plenty more of everything else you can imagine when it comes to toys, McFarlane created or not.\n\nThey had a small, but vital comic archive for the Spawn fan and they offered hard-to-find or unique toys of all genres. Plenty to choose from and even the imports weren't devastatingly expensive. This franchise specialty store can be appreciated by anyone who collects and even for those of us that want to take a look around. Pretty entertaining as a time killer for the masses or a Mecca for the few. I walked out empty-handed, but with a curious smile on my face, my friend on the other hand was pleased with the fare he found to support his hobby.

I thoroughly enjoy perusing the wares of this particular retail establishment, as I possess a membership card that affords me a discount of 10% on each and every purchase that I make, which, in my opinion, is most certainly advantageous. Additionally, as a participant in the Hawaiian Miles Mall program, I am able to take advantage of complimentary shipping on the website for any orders that surpass a total value of $50. However, I must admit that I refrain from shopping at this location when the prices are at their standard level, as they tend to be somewhat elevated. Instead, I opt to visit this store on a few select occasions throughout the year, typically coinciding with significant sales events. During these times, I make bulk purchases of items that I can then present as gifts to my female acquaintances; thus, ensuring that I maintain a steady supply of presents throughout the year. This strategy also enables me to capitalize on other special offers, such as the "Buy 2 - get 1 free" promotion, of which I remain informed thanks to my membership in the store's email club. My affection for this store is largely attributed to its diverse array of Body Butter products, including but not limited to mango, coconut, shea butter, vitamin E, cocoa butter, raspberry, and several others that, while frequently imitated, fail to compare to the authentic version. Furthermore, I greatly appreciate the wide selection of gift items available, which eliminates the need for extensive deliberation when seeking a suitable present. Lastly, the foot kits offered by this store serve as both practical gifts and personal indulgences. It is worth mentioning that this specific storefront is situated within the Miracle Mile Shops at the Planet Hollywood casino/hotel, and while I have not had the pleasure of discovering many remarkable deals during sale periods in recent years, I attribute this to the increased exposure to tourists in the area. Nonetheless, I still recommend paying a visit to this establishment if you find yourself nearby.

"The value proposition of this establishment is undeniable, particularly for those who relish the prospect of indulging in an assortment of delectable comestibles at a relatively modest cost. Despite harboring reservations regarding the veracity of the ingredients comprising their 'bucko nuggets,' the opportunity to acquire a diverse array of beverages, hot dogs, nuggets, fries, nachos, ice cream, and packaged cotton candy for a total expenditure of approximately $10 remains an enticing proposition, indeed."

"Committed to a south rim excursion, which initiated at a sluggish pace, boarding a bus that conveyed us to the Miracle Mile, followed by a brief interlude for refreshments, specifically a Danish pastry and either coffee or water, prior to transferring onto an alternative bus. The process required some time to become streamlined. Made brief halts at a rest area adjacent to the dam, situated in Kingman, Arizona, and subsequently enjoyed a moderately satisfying meal in Williams, Arizona. The south rim presented a considerable distance to traverse, necessitating multiple stops at the canyon, each lasting approximately an hour, before embarking on the return journey, with an additional halt in Kingman, Arizona. It is crucial to prepare appropriately for the prolonged south rim venture. Our chauffeur, Tommy, demonstrated exceptional skill and offered comprehensive insights throughout the expedition, concluding around 9:30 pm."

"Culinary delights are utterly remarkable, with tuna tacos being an exemplary illustration of such gastronomical excellence. However, it is advisable to temper one's expectations regarding the promptness of service, as the establishment's focus on creating delectable dishes takes precedence over expediency. Despite this, the duration of time spent waiting is undoubtedly compensated by the exceptional quality of the food."

"Culinary delights abound at this esteemed establishment, specializing in Middle Eastern cuisine. As a Briton with Lebanese ancestry, I have had the privilege of indulging in a diverse array of delectable dishes, each with its unique flavors and textures. My gastronomical journey has led me to this venue, which I highly recommend for its authentic and tantalizing fare. Kudos to the chef and staff for their dedication to excellence!!"

Went to zoo lights for the first time and can definitely see how great it is for kids! Went on a Thursday night and it was Packed! The whole zoo is lit up and it is fun to walk around. Admission is $10/adult. FYI most the animals are asleep so don't get your hopes up!

I've been here for two things: An overnight stay, and a wedding.

1) The rooms are really lovely, much prettier than I ever would've expected.  I'm always taken aback by hotel rooms that aren't decorated with those tacky shades of bright green, coral and tan.  This had a pleasant ivory/gold and navy blue color scheme.  The bed was very comfortable.  Everything seemed very clean.  The staff was friendly upon check-in/check-out.  The only problem was that the walls were incredibly thin and we could hear everything that was being screamed down the hallways by drunks at 3 a.m.  

2) My friend's wedding reception that was held here was lovely.  A member of the waitstaff noticed that a friend of mine had spilled her water all over the table and mopped it up before we could even ask for a towel.  Most of the service was great like that, except for a mixup with some of the entrees--but that was corrected immediately upon our request.

You've got to sit in the patio out back. I'm in Texas and have access to all types of great Mexican food. This place holds its own. Beer was cold, food was fresh, chips and salsa were good. I'd go back and I don't say that about too many places.

Ben has graced this establishment with his esteemed presence on multiple occasions, primarily for the purpose of partaking in the delectable offerings served during the midday repast. The diminutive nature of the commercial complex in which this eatery is situated, coupled with the limited availability of parking spaces, may pose a challenge for those seeking to indulge in the culinary delights available within. Notwithstanding these potential obstacles, we have consistently opted for the slender variety of pizza, which has invariably proven to be of exceptional quality. A single large portion typically suffices to satiate the hunger of two individuals, although it is imperative to exercise restraint and resist the temptation to overindulge, lest one's gluttonous tendencies prevail.

My boyfriend and I were merely transiting through Las Vegas on February 14th and opted to spend the night, taking advantage of a newly refurbished room at the Gold Coast Hotel, which we secured through hotels.com for a remarkably affordable rate of $30.  

While the location was not directly on the strip, I personally preferred the tranquility and convenience it offered, particularly since we had our own vehicle and did not have to contend with the chaos of pedestrians and challenges of parking typically associated with the strip.  

Upon entering our accommodations, we were pleasantly surprised by the extensively modernized interior, complete with a brand-new bed, contemporary furnishings, and an aesthetically pleasing restroom featuring a large showerhead and a stand-up shower, albeit lacking a bathtub.  

The aspects that truly impressed me about this particular hotel were the user-friendly parking arrangement, a streamlined check-in process situated in close proximity to the parking structure, and the overall ease of navigating the premises without encountering excessive crowds or rowdy individuals, creating a comparatively peaceful ambiance within the casino. Moreover, I was astounded by the absence of cigarette smoke odor within the establishment, a truly unique feature.  

Despite these positive experiences, I deducted one star from my rating due to the sluggish and inefficient service displayed by the check-in staff, which included four individuals behind the counter, with only two actively engaged in their duties, resulting in a 20-minute delay in processing our reservation, despite there being only one customer ahead of us.

Wow, talk about a total surprise.

For the most part, I tend to think of breweries as strictly beer, not food. However, this place is the total exception. The atmosphere is great. Very open and inviting and has a fun warehouse feel to it. We sat down and were immediately given menus for both food and drink. 

The drinks were good. Nothing that really stood out but still good beer that I would go back and try again (and try some of the other kinds as well). However, the food was phenomenal. They go outside the box (soup in test tubes) and have incredible flat breads. The only bummer we ran into is that they don't serve all of their menu items during lunch, which meant I didn't get to try the shrimp and cotton candy skewers (which had been hyped up to me). 

Can't wait to come back to Charlotte so i can try entirely different things (especially the cotton candy)!

"Portions are enormous, rivalling those served on platters, and the prices on their menu are incredibly affordable, making it an excellent choice for families seeking comfort food in a shared setting."

"Despite the fact that I possessed a Groupon for this particular establishment, I must admit that my expectations were surpassed by the culinary experience offered here. While the supplementary dishes were merely adequate, the pork ribs themselves were cooked to perfection, boasting an optimal tenderness that stopped short of complete disintegration from the bone. Furthermore, the flavorful sauce accompanying the ribs was abundant and of superior quality. Based on my satisfaction with this meal, I would unhesitatingly endorse this restaurant to any individual seeking genuinely delectable ribs within the Phoenix area (a task that, regrettably, proves challenging to accomplish)."

"Dr. Hsueh is a remarkably skilled, meticulous, and compassionate optometrist who ensures that her patients comprehend each step of the examination process, courteously soliciting their queries and concerns throughout. I greatly appreciate such personalized attention to detail. 

Following the determination of my prescription, I had the pleasure of collaborating with JR (or perhaps RJ?), a highly competent and amiable optician who assisted me in selecting an appropriate frame. His exceptional customer service and proficiency were truly commendable. 

I am exceedingly gratified to have discovered this optical facility, as it appears that I have found a highly capable and trustworthy eye care professional in Dr. Hsueh. I fervently hope that this review will serve as a valuable endorsement, inspiring others to entrust their ocular health to her expert care."

What to do if it is 9pm and you want dessert and dessert only? You go to Centotre! 

On arrival our group was greeted by the owner with his elaborate Italian welcoming gestures. I felt special from the get go. he arranged for a table to be cleaned for the 4 of us and ensured we were all comfortable. 

The menu was overflowing with many delicious options and the only niggly bit was that one was similarly named and they brought the one my sister did not want. She enjoyed it, but it should have been pointed out.  My wife enjoyed the affagato with gusto  -hi hi -  see what I did there :o) 

My sister was highly impressed with the entertaining way they teach you Italian whilst being on the toilet - yes you need to go there to know what I mean , but I promise you it will be entertaining and useful! 

In contrast to the attentive service when it came to paying there was not a server to be found, so that dragged the evening a little. When you are a little tired and satisfied this is a little irritating. But we settled the bill eventually and I agreed with my wife we would return for the dessert alone

"My initial visit to this establishment transpired several years ago, and my culinary experience during that interval was not particularly enjoyable. In fact, I would advise against ordering any pasta-based dishes, as they failed to meet my gastronomical expectations. Nonetheless, their pizza offerings, salads, and sandwiches are undoubtedly delectable. Furthermore, their pozookies, a delightful pastry dessert, rank among the most scrumptious in the region! The service at this venue has consistently been satisfactory, and the ambiance is quite pleasant. For those seeking a substantial and flavorful salad, I would recommend either the Santa Fe or Italian chopped salad. Both options are certain to satiate your hunger and impress your taste buds."

"Was it the visages of Mario Moreno, popularly known as Cantinflas, that embellished the walls or the culinary offerings that left an indelible mark on my gastronomical experience? Uncertain, yet I experienced unadulterated euphoria within the confines of this eatery. The generous serving sizes, reminiscent of 'abuelita's' copious portions, nearly surpassed my capacity to consume, but the delectability of each dish precluded any possibility of disappointment. Our party relished the Tamales Oaxaquenos and the Four Traditional Moles, with both options showcasing unparalleled culinary mastery. Additionally, the Horchata and pineapple soda quenched our thirst, leaving us utterly satisfied. However, a few drawbacks marred an otherwise exceptional dining experience, including inconsistent service and an overzealous individual soliciting donations. Despite these minor inconveniences, I would unhesitatingly return to Casa Reyna and enthusiastically endorse it to fellow gourmands."

I have had the pleasure of dining at Famous Dave's a mere ten times, yet my fondness for their culinary offerings knows no bounds. The service has consistently met my expectations and I must commend them for their adeptness in creating a welcoming ambiance. I highly recommend registering for their electronic missives, as they often contain exclusive promotions and discounts.

My affinity for their corn bread cannot be overstated; it's a sublime fusion of sweetness and perfection, leaving me yearning for an indefinite supply. Alas, my craving for their delectable victuals often results in an inflated total, with a recent excursion costing a considerable sum of $70 for two main courses, refreshments, and a sizable hors d'oeuvre. However, the abundance of leftovers generously compensates for the financial investment.

In conclusion, I must draw attention to the invaluable role played by the paper towels positioned atop each table. Their absorbency and versatility prove indispensable in mitigating the aftermath of an excessive BBQ sauce consumption, ensuring that both personal hygiene and dignity remain intact.

"This gastronomical indulgence, perching atop the hierarchy of my culinary experiences within the city limits of Las Vegas, rivals the supreme pizza I had the pleasure of consuming within the picturesque confines of downtown Disney. Notwithstanding the sluggish pace of their service, which seems to be an inherent trait shared by numerous establishments within the city's culinary landscape, this delectable delight undoubtedly merits a trial run, and I might just find myself partaking in a second helping prior to my departure from this gastronomic wonderland."

I had been eager to experience this establishment during my tenure in Austin; regrettably, I did not have the opportunity to do so until my recent visit with my spouse. We arrived at the restaurant at 2 pm on a Saturday, which proved to be a wise decision as it allowed us to avoid the crowds that typically congregate during peak hours. Upon being seated, we promptly placed our orders for a delectable burger and a refreshing beer, accompanied by an order of queso fries that we graciously decided to share. Unfortunately, the queso fries did not meet my expectations, as the cheese sauce was served separately from the fries, which rendered the dish unsuitable for my taste. However, the burgers were truly exceptional, boasting an unparalleled level of quality within the local culinary scene. Furthermore, the extensive selection of Arizona-brewed beers available on tap left me feeling utterly spoiled and impressed. Despite some initial confusion regarding the ordering process, which required us to place our entire order and pay at the counter before our food was brought out, the friendly servers ensured that our needs were met throughout our dining experience. Additionally, the availability of self-service all-natural sodas eliminated any concern about waiting for a soft drink refill. In conclusion, our meal consisting of two satisfying burgers, two local draft beers, and a large portion of queso fries amounted to approximately $37, which I considered a reasonable price considering the superior quality of the food and beverages provided.

Armed with a voucher for an indulgent burger meal, Anita and I were not disheartened by the prospect of partaking in such a delectable offering. The burgers, typically served during the daytime hours, were graciously made available for our evening repast by the accommodating staff at Rick's, a chic boutique hotel boasting a contemporary yet inviting ambiance in its reception, bar, and dining areas, replete with warm hues and textures. Our voucher featured Innis & Gunn as the preferred beverage option, but alas, it was unavailable, prompting us to select the Grolsch swing-top alternative, which we found quite satisfactory. The burgers, generously proportioned and bursting with flavorful fillings, were cooked to perfection, while the fries, slender and crispy, complemented the meal nicely. We thoroughly enjoyed the culinary experience and would enthusiastically endorse it, although the price point, ranging from approximately \u00a310 to \u00a313 for a single burger, might justify a minor deduction in stars. The service we received throughout our visit was attentive, efficient, and pleasing, earning high praise and making us eager to return.

Virgin America gates not far from security check in. Plenty of seating and eateries nearby. Flying in on a Sunday and out on a Thursday the place wasn't crowded so it made fpr a pleasant travelling. Vegas vibe throughout the airport including slot machines in the baggage claim area.
Not the biggest Ramen fan but this place is really good! My son had a pork belly bowl he loved it!

"Gastronomical haven! Extremely delighted by the culinary offerings. The oxtail chili cheese fries possess an unparalleled flavor profile, rendering them an absolute delight for the taste buds. The black and green burger, with its incorporation of bleu cheese and pineapple ketchup, constitutes a gustatory experience that is simply unmatched in terms of sheer enjoyment and satisfaction."

"My penchant for bar fare knows no bounds, and it's an affliction I'm reluctant to remedy. The genesis of this unbridled fondness can be traced back to a few exceptional establishments in my hometown, but closer to home, Zipps has been instrumental in fostering my unwavering devotion. Their burgers boast an unparalleled combination of sizzling heat and gastronomic elegance, while their focaccias, albeit occasionally diminished to the status of humble wraps, still manage to delight. However, it's their wings that truly capture my culinary fancy, particularly the golden medium variety, whose sublime equilibrium of spicy and sweet flavors has earned them a place of prominence in my gustatory hierarchy. Furthermore, their happy hour offerings are an unmitigated bonanza, presenting patrons with unbeatable value that transcends geographical boundaries."

My husband and I just ate at this restaurant tonight and it was delicious.  We got hummus for an appetizer and each had the gyro sandwich. He got his with steak fries and I got a side salad. Everything was great. The side salad was exceptional. \n\nThe restaurant is located in a shopping center. The decor is dated, however, it's not quite a dive. The location and decor are the only reasons I didn't give it 5 stars. But the food and owners are great. I will definitely be going back soon.

"Recently, we had the pleasure of partaking in a midday repast at this esteemed establishment, and our expectations were thoroughly exceeded. Despite the throngs of patrons and the somewhat arduous process of securing a parking spot, we were able to secure a table with relative expediency. The ambiance of the restaurant was reminiscent of a quintessential dive, complete with the melodic strains of 50's music emanating from the radio (a delightful touch, we must say). The culinary offerings were quite impressive, particularly the Lamb Burger, which we found to be a veritable gustatory delight. Our spouse opted for one of the Hot Dogs, which was enshrouded in a rich, velvety blanket of Chili and Pimento Cheese; their effusive praise for this delectable dish was palpable. It is worth noting that, despite our unwavering satisfaction with our own meal, we couldn't help but experience a pang of gastronomic envy upon beholding the tantalizing Hot Dog arrayed before us. Suffice it to say, we would unhesitatingly return to this eatery in the future."

I have been to Brio multiple times and we always leave satisfied. They have cheap lunch specials which are always tasty. Last time I ordered a chop salad and a flatbread for like $7 and I had left-overs!\n\nFor dinner they have great pastas and meat dishes. I also love their panini's and salad combo. They also have weekday specials with $5 martini's on wednesdays!

"Commencing my assessment, I must aver that my appraisal shall diverge from the norm. We attended Graze for the Frozen Assets benefit soiree in support of Clean Lakes Alliance, whereupon the eatery underwent a metamorphosis to accommodate this grandiose themed gathering. The atmosphere was rather convivial, fostering an air of joviality among the patrons. Graze catered the affair, and their delectable hors d'oeuvres garnered unanimous approbation from the attendees. The venue was bursting at the seams with revelers, as evidenced by the copious number of individuals we engaged in conversation, all of whom expressed immense satisfaction with both the location and Graze's hospitable nature as host."

Upon our return to Scottsdale, we decided to partake in the establishment's inaugural happy hour, which, much to our delight, boasted an array of reasonably-priced sushi and sake.
