I must confess, the spinach and sun-dried tomato small pie I sampled did not possess the crispiness one might expect, yet its doughy texture and savory flavor profile rendered it quite enjoyable. Furthermore, the honey chipotle wings we ordered were imbued with a satisfying level of spiciness and taste. However, a minor drawback materialized in the form of our server, who, despite his affable and humorous demeanor, displayed a tendency to forget to place our wing order, resulting in an extended wait time. Nonetheless, the server's congenial attitude and our own ravenous hunger transformed this mishap into an amusing episode. Notably, Picasso's boasts a capacious interior, accommodating a sizable gathering of patrons. On the night of our visit, specifically a Tuesday evening, the premises were teeming with people. Strategically positioned in the center of the establishment is a plush leather couch, inviting customers to lounge and unwind, while televisions situated throughout ensure that patrons remain entertained regardless of their seating arrangement.

"Notwithstanding the unfortunate incident involving the inadvertent consumption of a piece of bacon that led to the dental injury, the culinary experience was indeed delectable and satisfying, prompting us to visit the eatery situated within the premises of the M hotel."

"Exemplary hospitality in an ambient setting, complemented by delectable Venezuelan cuisine at a reasonable tariff. Anticipating a future visit with fervor, pondering why additional eatery administrators don't share such enthusiasm for their fare."

"The Yummy: A culinary haven offering competitive pricing, an accommodating team, a diverse array of fresh produce, and an inviting ambiance characterized by well-lit and spacious surroundings, further enhanced by the provision of designated parking spaces for environmentally conscious vehicles (eco-friendly store).\n\nThe Yucky: Exercise caution when perusing the section featuring products approaching their expiration date; although these items are discounted by fifty percent, it is occasionally wiser to avoid certain products altogether, as their quality may not align with your gastronomical expectations."

This eatery represented one of the initial culinary establishments I had the pleasure of partaking in upon my relocation to Phoenix; thus, it holds a special place in my gastronomical experiences. The delectable fare served here was so impressive that I felt compelled to return the following evening with my spouse, savoring the scrumptious offerings in the midst of an ambiance that exuded warmth and sophistication. Furthermore, the alfresco seating arrangement afforded us the opportunity to bask in the balmy evening air while enjoying our repast, further enhancing the overall dining experience. The meticulous attention to detail demonstrated by the staff left a lasting impression on me, solidifying my resolve to patronize this esteemed establishment at future intervals.

Where have I been?  Perhaps oblivious to the metamorphosis of Carl's Jr, a culinary establishment that has seemingly transcended its humble origins and now boasts an array of gourmet offerings, including the extravagant $6000 combo, promoted in a television advertisement featuring the affluent Maloof Brothers and served exclusively at the Palms Casino Resort. Or maybe, my ignorance can be attributed to my infrequent patronage of fast-food restaurants, opting instead for more wholesome dining experiences. 

However, circumstances led me to reassess my culinary preferences, as I found myself entering the doors of a Carl's Jr, not merely to grab a quick bite or utilize their drive-thru service, but to partake in a full-fledged dining experience. To my surprise, the ambiance was rather pleasant, with three televisions strategically positioned throughout the restaurant, each broadcasting a unique ESPN channel. Furthermore, my expectations were surpassed by the quality and generous portion size of the chicken salad I ordered, which, accompanied by a refreshing Squirt beverage, left me feeling satiated and impressed. 

Additionally, the attentive service provided by the staff was evident in the prompt refills offered, leaving me slightly perplexed regarding the protocol for gratuity. Nonetheless, we chose to leave a dollar as a token of appreciation, despite the uncertainty surrounding its necessity. In conclusion, while I cannot attest to the nutritional value of my meal, it undoubtedly provided a welcome respite from the ubiquitous burger and taco joints that pepper the culinary landscape.

Initially, it is worth noting that the culinary offerings at this establishment are remarkably affordable, and the generous proportions of each dish ensure that patrons receive an abundance of sustenance for their financial investment. This venue represents an optimal destination for individuals seeking a satisfying meal of chicken rice without breaking the bank, as the prices are decidedly economical and the servings are far from meager. While the gastronomic quality may not be of the highest order, the value proposition presented by the eatery's pricing and portion sizes serves as a suitable compensation for any deficiencies in the taste department.

"It is utterly lamentable that this establishment does not possess a location in Boston, as it would undoubtedly be a tremendous success, given the exceptional quality of their culinary offerings. During my recent vacation in March, I had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable breakfast delights on three separate occasions. Their BLT bloody mary's are truly sublime, featuring a carefully crafted combination of flavors, including a bacon-rimmed glass, a slice of lettuce, a tomato, a bacon slice, and a piece of white toast for dipping. The presentation was also quite impressive, as it arrived on its own plate. The menu offered an extensive array of options, which led to a state of utter bewilderment, as we desired to sample every item listed. In order to experience a variety of flavors, a friend and I opted to share several dishes. We began with the Snickers pancake, which, despite being singular in nature, proved to be a culinary masterpiece, measuring a generous 12 inches in width. Its taste was nothing short of exquisite. Our second selection was the Fried Chicken and Waffles, infused with bacon slices, which can only be described as a gastronomic indulgence. While it may have been a tad unhealthy, it was nonetheless an incredibly satisfying experience. Finally, we sampled the Hash dish, which featured grilled chicken, asparagus, sundried tomatoes, homestyle potatoes, two eggs, and a fresh biscuit. Although somewhat healthier than the other options, it was still delightfully flavorful, with the accompanying marmalade serving as the perfect complement. In conclusion, a visit to this establishment is an absolute must during any Vegas vacation."

I really like this place for sushi. They have the option to have sushi rolls with brown rice instead of white. and every roll ive had there has been amazing. I really like the set up of the place as well.

"I must confess that I did not have the opportunity to partake in my beloved frozen yogurt indulgence until the month of June in the rather chilly city of Chicago, hence my eagerness to visit Yogurtland during my recent sojourn to Phoenix. This particular establishment operates on a pay-by-the-ounce system, which allowed me to sample an array of five distinct yogurt flavors prior to settling on a half-and-half combination of peanut butter and devils food. While the low-fat content of their offerings might suggest a healthier alternative, my enthusiasm for peanut butter led me to augment my selection with an assortment of Reese's Pieces and various other sugary embellishments, thereby transforming it into an unparalleled gustatory experience. It is abundantly clear that my colleagues and I were not alone in our yearning for frozen yogurt, as Yogurtland was bustling with activity. Furthermore, it is not difficult to comprehend the popularity of this establishment, given its delectable flavors, extensive array of toppings, and reasonable pricing structure."

Gurkha Brigade does not ostensibly manifest itself as an edible establishment of notable prominence on Leith Walk, yet it unquestionably warrants consideration as a dining venue. Its interior, characterized by ample space and scrupulous attention to cleanliness, houses an extensive array of tables that exude an inviting ambiance. My culinary excursion to this Nepalese eatery led me to sample their takeaway menu, which, while perhaps a tad pricey in comparison to neighboring restaurants, boasts an impressive diversity of flavors, encompassing an assortment of sauces, meats, and vegetarian options. Specifically, I opted for the pork sungur, a dish replete with succulent, spice-infused chunks of porcine delights, swathed in a piquant tomato and garlic sauce. This delectable entrÃ©e, accompanied by a side of plain boiled rice and a carbonated beverage, amounted to approximately Â£10, a sum that, while admittedly steep, proved justifiable in light of the superior quality of the cuisine. My companion elected to partake in a duo of starters, comprising disparate varieties of pakoras, whose visual appeal and gustatory satisfaction garnered effusive praise. Following this gratifying experience, we concurred that a revisit to Gurkha Brigade would be worthwhile, perhaps when our financial constraints are alleviated by the receipt of our student grants.

"Devoid of any protracted waiting period, we were able to immediately partake in the convivial ambiance of the outdoor seating area, whereupon we encountered a group of affable individuals who, through their hospitable demeanor, contributed significantly to the overall enjoyment of our experience. Although the culinary offerings did not quite live up to our elevated expectations, they still managed to satisfy our hunger and quench our thirst, thus rendering the establishment worthy of a four-star rating. My spouse and I are decidedly inclined to revisit this venue in the future."

Fantastic wine bar in the Old Town area, and surprisingly affordable. They accommodated a large bachelorette party (eyeroll, I know), and even gave us a special dessert for the bachelorette. 

I had to do double takes to check the wine bottles prices - incredible selections for extremely cheap. And there's a list of 10% on the back of inventory that they need to move.

Wine bars can typically disappoint with food - small plates, portions, and just mediocre. Not the case - portions were reasonable, and every hard-to-please girl was happy. Highly recommend the bruschetta sampler as a starter.

Cute patio, live music. Overall, a hit.

This review could have attained a perfect five-star rating if it were solely based on the culinary offerings. However, due to the unpretentious nature of the establishment and the cacophony of sounds generated by the sushi chefs, which resembled more of a battle cry than a warm welcome, I felt compelled to deduct a star. Upon entering the restaurant, I was greeted with an enthusiastic round of applause from one of the chefs, which I reciprocated in kind, albeit with a hint of bemusement.  
The ambiance of Ru San's is decidedly casual, and the prices are similarly unassuming, with a sum of $10 granting access to a seemingly endless array of sushi options. For those with hearty appetites, this represents an unparalleled value, as two modest rolls could easily surpass that cost at other establishments. While the sushi served at Ru San's may be described as 'Americanized,' it is undeniably delectable. Notwithstanding the potential health implications, the deep-fried sushi is a singular delight.  
To ensure optimal freshness, the sushi plates are meticulously labeled with time markers, and while the sushi often vanishes before the designated time elapses, this speaks volumes about its quality. Ru San's will persistently hold a place in my rotation of preferred local sushi haunts. 
Nota bene: To avoid potentially lengthy waits, especially during peak hours, it is advisable to arrive promptly at 11:30 AM for lunch.

"Aesthetically captivating establishment specializing in frozen yogurt, reminiscent of the charming retro and mid-century modern styles, has been designed to facilitate an ambiance conducive to customer satisfaction. Friendly shop girls, while slightly unsettling in their vigilant monitoring of patrons during the self-selection process, have been employed to ensure a seamless experience. Perhaps the layout of the shop, marred by visibility obstructions and vulnerable to mischievous behavior, necessitates this measure. Nonetheless, a more discreet approach to surveillance would be appreciated, lest the feeling of being under scrutiny mar the enjoyment of the premises. Commendations are extended to the raspberry sauce, which, refreshingly, does not emanate from a squeeze bottle and contains discernible fragments of fresh raspberries. The assortment of toppings, remarkable in its profusion, includes such unexpected treats as entire Hostess cupcakes and Little Debbie peanut butter wafers, thereby expanding the scope of customization options."

"The culinary offerings were of an exceptionally high quality, prompting us to request supplementary containers for our uneaten portions, while the hospitality we received was characterized by its celerity and amicability. We would unhesitatingly consider returning to this establishment in the future."

Finally tracked down Sausagefest at StrEATs. Originally, from Chicago's southside, we put the Polish and Hot Italian to the test. Both measured up! The Vietnamese rolls untraditional, but they totally work. It's a great bun to meat ratio. It's soft and chewy yet strong enough to hold all the tasty bites inside. The fries are skin on and fried crisp just like we could get back home, too. Rock on, Sausagefest! We'll be back for more.

Excellent! 
I haven't been to a Red Lobster in literally YEARS!!
We had recently ate at a "high end" sea food place in town, with an unbalanced product:value ratio. Red Lobster was a refreshing surprise at a fraction of the price. 

GF had a gift card, so we popped in during Lobster Fest.
Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING was great!!

We were quoted 45 minutes for a table and were seated in 20.
Every point of contact was polite, but casual. The biscuits are everything I was promised, the specialty cocktails are delightful, and specials really covered all tastes.

I got two, perfectly cocked and wonderfully seasoned lobster tails.  
GF had the Surf & Turf which she said was great, but wouldn't let me taste, as she was too excited to eat it herself. (j/k, she reads these)

If I had to lodge a complaint: 
The water in the bathroom sink gets hot too fast.

We had an very good mean, with great service, for literally 1/3 of what we paid at a fine dining, sea food specific establishment (see next review).

"A recreational facility characterized by an abundance of swinging and sliding apparatuses, complemented by a liquid-based play zone that offers a gratifying respite from solar radiation. However, it is not uncommon for this venue to become overcrowded, particularly during peak hours, due to its proximity to a densely populated urban center. This convergence of individuals from diverse backgrounds can sometimes result in a discordant atmosphere, as some patrons may exhibit boorish behavior, while others maintain a polite, diligent, and respectful demeanor."

"Through a succession of four visits, I endeavored to comprehend the underlying reasons behind my mobile device's malfunctioning, specifically pertaining to its inability to activate properly following a transition from an iOS-based apparatus to one utilizing the Android operating system. During each respective visit, I gained novel perspectives regarding the root causes of this technical hindrance, which were not necessarily attributable to any culpability on the part of the service providers. Rather, it was a matter of exerting sufficient effort towards diagnosing and ultimately resolving the problem at hand, thereby ensuring that I, as a customer, would be satiated with the quality of service rendered."

"The opulent ambiance and refined decorum of the Trump Hotel provided a luxurious respite from the frenetic energy and garish excesses typically associated with Las Vegas. The absence of a casino within the hotel's premises contributed to an atmosphere of tranquility and sophistication, allowing guests to focus on indulging in the finer things in life without the distraction of the ubiquitous slot machines and craps tables. The accommodations themselves were nothing short of sumptuous, boasting plush furnishings, meticulous attention to detail, and an overall aesthetic that exuded elegance and refinement. Of particular note was the innovative integration of technology into the bathroom, where an LCD screen embedded within the mirror allowed guests to multitask by watching television while engaging in their oral hygiene routine. While this novel feature undoubtedly added a touch of whimsy to the experience, it was ultimately the spacious, deep-soaking bathtub that stole the show, providing a blissful oasis for weary travelers seeking respite from the bustling city outside. Furthermore, the hotel's commitment to exceptional service was evident in the impeccable room service, which delivered delectable culinary creations to guests' doors each morning, further enhancing the already extraordinary experience. For those seeking a sophisticated sojourn in Sin City, the Trump Hotel stands as an unparalleled choice."

I am an ardent devotee of skinnyfats, and my fondness for this establishment prompts me to frequent it on a weekly basis. On this particular visit, however, my enthusiasm was significantly dampened by the subpar level of customer service displayed by one of the servers. Specifically, our party of four received their meals, but mine was conspicuously absent. My partner inquired about the status of my food, only to be met with a dismissive and irksome response from the waitress. Rather than exhibiting empathy and concern for the delay, she callously deposited a house salad in front of me and curtly informed me that I had ordered a quinoa salad with chicken. When I respectfully corrected her, she took the plate back without uttering a single word and left me waiting for several minutes before returning with the correctly prepared dish. Her behavior was particularly vexing, given my profession as a customer service manager for a financial institution, which has accustomed me to exceptionally high standards of hospitality. It is worth mentioning, however, that the other staff members present were quite friendly and engaging towards the patrons, making the waitress's conduct all the more glaring. Despite the unfortunate encounter, the culinary offerings at skinnyfats remained impressive.

This is an absolutely stunning building. I highly recommend a visit and if you're a nerd like me, take the tour of the Nationality Rooms. There are some 20-something rooms outfitted in the style of one of the nationalities that helped to build the city of Pittsburgh. Be careful and check the tour times before you go.

"In the event that you are seeking to have your automobile serviced, or merely happen to be in the vicinity, it is highly recommended that you pay a visit to this establishment, situated at the local Ford dealership. Offering a delectable array of breakfast items at exceptionally reasonable prices, this eatery is certainly worthy of patronage. Personally, I opted for the egg and cheese croissant, which proved to be an excellent choice. So impressed was I with the culinary offerings and overall experience that I would unhesitatingly return on multiple occasions. However, I must admit that there was a considerable delay between the time I placed my order and the moment I received my food, which unfortunately warrants the deduction of a single star from my overall rating."

"I have an immense fondness for this establishment, primarily due to their exceptional margaritas and fajitas, which are undoubtedly among the finest in the region. However, I must admit that my experiences here have been somewhat tempered by the fact that during the warmer months, the ambient temperature within the dining area can become somewhat uncomfortable. Were it not for this minor drawback, I would unhesitatingly confer upon it a perfect five-star rating."

During my nearly three-year tenure as a resident of Las Vegas, I have had the occasion to observe the rapid proliferation of new Roberto's establishments throughout the city, with each successive opening representing an incremental increase in both quantity and diversity, as evidenced by the vast array of proprietors and culinary offerings that have come to characterize these disparate entities; furthermore, it is worth noting that the green salsa served at this particular location possesses an uncommon degree of piquancy, one that surpasses even that of its counterparts at other branches I have visited, a phenomenon that remains somewhat enigmatic, but ultimately serves to enhance the overall dining experience for those who partake of it.  This specific Roberto's happens to be situated in close proximity to my place of residence, and over time, it has established itself as a reliable purveyor of satisfactory comestibles, with the carne asada and breakfast burritos being merely passable, while the carnitas, when ordered, are subjected to a brief but intense frying process immediately prior to their incorporation into either a burrito or taco, thereby imbuing them with an unparalleled crispiness that serves as a testament to the culinary acumen of the establishment's chefs, and ultimately, provides me with a source of unmitigated gastronomical delight.

"Greetings, esteemed patron! We extend a warm welcome to our beloved Pita Jungle, where the culinary delights are tantamount to those of our fellow establishments, while the hospitality of our staff is nothing short of cordial. Although we acknowledge that the bar area may appear somewhat diminutive in size, we trust that the expansive outdoor patio will provide an idyllic setting for your indulgence during favorable meteorological conditions."

Stopped in last night for some take out.  I was very impressed with how nice and knowledgeable everyone was.  I asked if the tortillas were vegan (they were!!) so I asked for two veggie burritos and as they were making them for me, the manager told me that she'd give me a sample of their soup, as it was vegan also.  No need for a sample, sign me up for the full cup!  I love tortilla soup, and theirs is tomato based, weeeeeee!  My burrito came with amazing cilantro lime rice (way more limey than Chipotle), black beans, guac, fajita veggies, pico and medium salsa.  It was divine!  My woman was equally pleased with the outcome of her burrito (rice, beans,fajita veggies, and pico).  When I was a cheese eater, I would order their chips and queso dip, which is totally yumsky.

Oh  Sam Fox, I love you.  I am a huge fan of the culinary confections that you whip up and have never been disappointed when dining at a FRC restaurant.  Culinary Dropout is no exception. I have been here several times, for drinks and appetizers, for lunch and for dinner and everytime I am pleased with the food.  The service has had a few hiccups, but nothing earth shattering. The bacon bloody mary is delicious and the salmon is dreamy and the pretzels and fondue, OMG...you had me at fondue.  Keep up the good work and I will keep giving you my money.  :)

The recently established hospitality establishment boasts a plethora of novel amenities, ensuring a luxurious experience for its esteemed guests. The accommodations, appointed with pristine furnishings and state-of-the-art fixtures, epitomize elegance and sophistication. Particularly noteworthy is the expansive King bedroom suite, replete with an array of indulgences that cater to the discerning traveler's every whim. Moreover, the resort's picturesque pool and delectable breakfast area serve as idyllic settings in which to relax and savor the morning repast. Such an enchanting ambiance fosters an unforgettable sojourn, rendering it a prime destination for future vacations.

"An exceptional dining establishment situated within the confines of Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, offering a culinary experience that far surpasses the customary standards associated with conventional airport fare, featuring a contemporary and unpretentious interpretation of traditional Tex-Mex cuisine."

"Are you enamored with the notion of indulging in delectable noodle-based culinary delights? If your response is an unequivocal affirmation, then it is my pleasure to introduce you to a veritable haven for those who share your unwavering passion for such gastronomical treats. My personal familiarity with the diverse array of establishments nestled within the bounds of Montreal's Chinatown enables me to confidently assert that, while they may lack the superficial trappings of high-end eateries, these humble abodes serve up authentic, culturally rich fare that is sure to satiate your cravings. Alas, the limitations of my linguistic prowess preclude me from adequately conveying the full extent of my enthusiasm for this particular eatery; suffice it to say that, among the numerous venues I have had the privilege of patronizing, there is but one that stands out as a shining exemplar of excellence in both quality and affordability. It is my fervent hope that, upon partaking in the delightful offerings of Noodle Factory, you will find yourself similarly smitten, and that the memories you create therein shall linger long after the last savory morsel has been consumed."

"Refrain from allowing the unassuming nature of the strip mall setting to dissuade you from partaking in the culinary delights offered by this sushi establishment. Despite its relatively diminutive dimensions, the restaurant boasts an impressive array of sashimi selections, complemented by a judicious selection of grilled mackerel and edamame. Furthermore, the freshness of the sashimi is particularly noteworthy, especially considering the eatery's proximity to the bustling thoroughfare of the 101 freeway in Scottsdale. Additionally, patrons can expect to receive preferential treatment in the form of an 'insider hookup' for wasabi, thereby further enhancing the overall dining experience. In conclusion, this sushi spot is certainly worthy of future visits."

Umphrey's two thousandth performance commemorated an auspicious milestone, transpiring within a capacious arena that boasted satisfactory acoustics and an amicable security personnel. Unfortunately, our tardiness during both evenings precluded us from partaking in the delectable taffy apples fabricated at an adjacent establishment, its proximity being merely a stone's throw away. However, we were able to take advantage of a sizable parking garage located a single block distant, which offered a decidedly more convenient alternative to the often-frustrating street parking characteristic of Madison's urban domain.

Wanted to hit up a new Indian food place and decided on the Curry Garden. At first glance, the inside is not exactly glamorous but again it's about the food right?

I ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala, Bhatura, and Garlic Naan. It was delicious! There was plenty of Paneer in the dish (deliciously fresh) and the sauce was great. The Bhatura was made very well, but make sure you eat it when it's hot (so good for dipping). The Garlic Naan was good as well, with a generous amount of Garlic.

All in all this place had great food and service, although the design inside was not great, it was clean.

Look forward to coming to this place again if I need my Paneer fix :).

"An expansive bar area, complemented by an extensive array of culinary offerings, fosters a convivial ambiance that is further enhanced by the hospitable demeanor of the bartenders. Although the waitstaff exhibits occasional signs of hastiness, their efforts remain generally commendable, particularly in light of the establishment's numerous televisions, which create an ideal setting for viewing sporting events while enjoying a libation or two."
I love the atmosphere and the food was great, you get to sing and dance there if you aren't shy.

"While indulging in the city's vibrant nightlife during our recent excursion to Las Vegas, we opted to purchase an online gift certificate for this establishment, and our culinary experience proved to be a gratifying surprise, as the service we received was of exceptional quality. Specifically, the server demonstrated remarkable proficiency in their role, as they attended to our needs with promptness and cordiality, ensuring that our dining experience was thoroughly enjoyable. Furthermore, the menu offered an impressive selection of delectable dishes, and I elected to sample the ribeye, which was cooked to perfection and boasted a tender, juicy texture that was complemented by a rich, savory flavor. Additionally, the sides that accompanied my entree were equally satisfying, with each bite showcasing the chef's dedication to culinary artistry. Lastly, I concluded my repast with a serving of creme brulee, which provided a delightful finale to my gastronomical journey, as its velvety smoothness and subtle sweetness left a lasting impression on my palate. Overall, this restaurant, located within the confines of a casino, delivered a first-rate dining experience that exceeded our expectations and left us feeling satiated and content."

This comprehensive assessment pertains to the House of Blues Las Vegas as a live music venue, where culinary offerings have been sampled on previous occasions, thus rendering an evaluation unnecessary; however, it is imperative to emphasize that refraining from partaking in such fare would be advisable, lest one desires to subject their palate to uninspired and unremarkable flavors. In contradistinction, the focal point of this critique revolves around the captivating performance of AFI, a band boasting a profound impact on the music scene, particularly during the 1990s, yet having undergone significant stylistic metamorphoses throughout their career, effectively transforming them into a contemporary iteration reminiscent of their earlier work. The ambiance of the House of Blues Las Vegas exudes an air of sophistication, courtesy of its well-appointed interior design, while the stadium-style seating arrangement ensures an unobstructed visual experience for all attendees. Notwithstanding the ostensible ease of access, both ingress and egress are facilitated with remarkable efficiency, even when confronted with a considerable throng of patrons. Furthermore, the sonic quality of the performances hosted within this venue is commendable, fostering an immersive auditory experience that transcends expectations. Additionally, the speedy and attentive bar service upstairs merits praise, as does the overall preference for this particular House of Blues location over its Anaheim counterpart, which is bolstered by the unique charm of the Las Vegas setting, conveniently devoid of the inconveniences associated with the actual Disneyland.

"The morning repast was thoroughly enjoyable, with the eggs and chorizo constituting a satisfying and flavorsome start to the day. Although we did not partake in the carbohydrate-based options, the pancakes and muffins appeared visually appealing and no doubt would have contributed to a pleasurable dining experience had we opted to indulge in them. Kudos to Samantha for her exceptional service, which greatly enhanced our breakfast encounter."

"My culinary experience at this establishment was an amalgamation of gastronomical delight and concern regarding sanitation. Despite my initial reservations, I opted to sample their offerings, which included both steamed lamb and chive dumplings, as well as fried pork and cabbage variants. The former was decidedly more rounded in shape, which allowed for a more efficient release of steam and boiling water, thereby enhancing the overall flavor profile. However, the latter style, while still palatable, did not quite resonate with me to the same extent as its steamed counterpart. Notwithstanding the aforementioned qualms regarding hygiene, I would still recommend visiting this restaurant, as the dumplings are undeniably delectable, and the accompanying side salads are equally tantalizing. Just be sure to avert your gaze from the floor covering."
The Habit is a good change from normal burger joints. It's like a classy, \"Carl's Jr.\" Their menu is OK and the service was decent. The parking during lunch time is tough so get there early.

While meandering down Smallman Street en route to 21st Street Coffee, my gaze fell upon an unassuming sign that read, "Donuts." My curiosity piqued, I pondered the possibility of indulging in such delectable treats. Upon entering the cozy storefront, I encountered Ron, the affable proprietor, who kindly offered me a sample of his freshly crafted donuts. The diminutive pastries, fashioned in a compact machine at the counter, were indeed adorable, and their tantalizing aroma wafted through the air, beckoning me to partake in their delightfulness. Although the donuts appeared somewhat smaller than their conventional counterparts, their flavor proved anything but diminutive. The Devil's Food variety, in particular, boasted an irresistible allure, prompting me to request a few of these bite-sized morsels. As I watched, Ron expertly fried them before my very eyes, sprinkling them with sugar and presenting them in a bag. The resultant taste sensation? Nothing short of sublime. When paired with my quad Mocha, the combination proved utterly divine. However, a minor deduction in rating seemed appropriate, given the slightly steep price point of $3 per dozen. Despite this, I couldn't help but commend Ron on his excellent culinary creations, earning him a well-deserved four stars.

"An unpretentious edifice from the exterior, yet housing an genuine ambiance, exceptional hospitality, and delectable culinary delights at reasonable tariffs, this Thai restaurant in Phoenix excels in offering a satisfactory dining experience; furthermore, their revamped website, replete with visual representations of their gastronomical offerings, facilitates the process of placing take-out orders with utmost convenience; specifically, their signature Pad Thai and the 35th item on their menu are highly recommended and indeed, a must-try for gourmands and epicureans alike."

"I am thoroughly enamored with this establishment, as it offers an extensive array of baked goods, including an assortment of artisanal breads, delectable pretzels, savory sausages, and an abundance of other mouthwatering meats, in addition to a diverse selection of soups, snacks, and an impressive array of pickled delights that showcase the epitome of culinary craftsmanship. My recent visit to this gastronomic haven yielded a trio of items that have left an indelible mark on my palate: a succulent horseshoe-shaped soft pretzel, a bag of crunchy pretzel sticks, and a sublime creamy dill-lemon-caper-honey mustard that has elevated my standards for condiments to an unprecedented level. Needless to say, my next visit will involve a comprehensive exploration of their vast array of gummy candies, which I anticipate will be a delightful and satisfying experience."
Get the Malaysian fried rice. Unbelievable. If you're into sushi, I recommend the panther roll. Curries are very good too.   Sometimes the service has been off a bit, but the food is excellent.

"The lodging boasted a pristine and contemporary ambiance, complemented by a secure and tranquil surroundings.  The front desk personnel were cordial and attentive, evidenced by their post-check-in call to ensure my satisfaction with the accommodations.  The guestroom featured a segregated seating area, refrigeration unit, ample space, and a sizable television. 
However, certain aspects of the hotel's design and amenities left something to be desired.  Specifically, the thermostat proved perplexing to operate, and the quality of the in-room coffee was subpar, akin to the unimpressive Arabica offerings commonly found in Hyatt establishments. 
It is worth noting that the hotel's location may pose a challenge for those relying on outdated GPS software, as it is a relatively new establishment.  Therefore, it is advisable to familiarize oneself with the surroundings prior to arrival, particularly for those arriving by automobile. 
Upon awakening at 7 AM on a Sunday morning, I was pleasantly surprised by the serene atmosphere, which contrasted starkly with the raucous environment typically associated with weekend stays at Embassy Suites.  Alas, this respite was short-lived, as the sound of children frolicking and shrieking in the corridor outside my room quickly replaced the silence.  Moreover, a group of seven individuals gathered in the hallway, engaging in a boisterous conversation in Spanish, which only intensified upon my attempt to investigate the commotion.  While it is unfair to hold the hotel accountable for the discourteous behavior of its family-oriented clientele, a discreet request for quiet hours, conveyed through a check-in notice perhaps, might help mitigate the inconvenience caused by such rowdy patrons."

I indulged in a two-night sojourn at the Wigwam as part of a work-oriented weekend retreat, which proved to be an ideal setting for retired individuals who relish golfing and shopping excursions. Our visit coincided with a Leadership Summit organized by my company, rendering the venue an optimal choice for work-related conferences. The accommodations boasted generous space, complete with a wet bar, a living area equipped with a fireplace, and a sleeping quarter featuring a luxuriously soft bed that afforded me the most tranquil and rejuvenating nap of my existence; it was nothing short of celestial! Although my personal penchant tends towards modernistic decor, I must admit that the Southwestern/Ranch-inspired motif did not detract from the overall sense of comfort and relaxation that permeated throughout my stay. While I might not typically opt for this type of lodging due to my stylistic preferences, I found myself thoroughly enjoying the experience and feeling gratified by the hospitality extended by the establishment.

Met up with some of my favorite folks last night because I NEEDED some cheese enchiladas paired with a margarita or two.  This little place has great service and really nice servers and wait staff...it was an enjoyable evening from start to finish.  The food is good ol' sonoran-style and I changed up my regular order to include green chile .  Yum Yum Yum!!!!  I like the fact that there are vegetarian options and the prices are really reasonable.  One of my friends has been eating there weekly for several years now so that's a pretty high recommendation.  I'm finding out that they have other regulars as well.  Still looking for the perfect red sauce but this place is OK in my book.

A good watch tends to say a lot about it's owner, and can be as important as a house or car for those that want to convey their status, style or wealth to others. Given that I can check the time on my mobile phone, and I've always found watches a bit irritating and itchy to wear, I'll likely continue to use my ill-fitting cheap suit and filthy training shoes to let people know where I fit in the scheme of things.\n\nFor watch fans however, this tiny, quirky little shop will probably seem like a gift from above. The amount of timepieces packed into such a small area is truly uncanny.

It's worth it if you haven't visited before. 

$20 ticket if purchased at Fry's. $3 soda, $5 beer, $7.50 Turkey Legs, $5 Brownie with Ice-cream. 

Remember to bring sun screen and Hat. Be prepared to walk a lot. Things are very expensive to buy. Very busy too.

Lot of shows, little bit of everything for everyone.

"This culinary establishment exudes an unpolished charm, reminiscent of a diamond in its raw state, nestled within a neighborhood that boasts an abundance of dilapidated dwellings. Despite its humble surroundings, this restaurant manages to deliver an exceptional dining experience, with a charcuterie platter that showcases an impressive array of delectable delights at an affordable price point. The staff exhibits an eagerness to please, recommending dishes such as the duck egg ravioli, whose rich flavors are elevated by the addition of brown butter and fried Swiss chard. While the foie gras mousse presents a velvety texture and delightful flavor profile complemented by fig paste, its bulky consistency makes it a somewhat challenging meal to consume. Nonetheless, the overall dining experience is nothing short of regal, with the option to indulge in a bottle of wine, savor a decadent dessert, and cap off the evening with a shared glass of Prosecco, all for a mere $120. If I resided in close proximity, I would readily seize opportunities to partake in the charcuterie platter on a regular basis, perhaps even frequenting the establishment multiple times a week for a luxurious respite from the mundane routine."

Don't miss this great spot!  My friend lives nearby so we've visited for breakfast several times.  The coffee is pretty great.  The vanilla latte is a favorite - rich and smooth without a hint of bitterness.  Menu item are unique and varied but I find that I keep going back to the short rib burrito - delish!  Portion sizes are waaaay too big.  I'm usually full after half my meal so I request a to-go box when I place my order and my friends do the same.  The wait can be long but the fast and friendly service makes up for that once you get inside.  Cons for me include uncomfortable table seating (though the booths are comfortable) plus the fact that you have to look pretty hard to find healthy menu selections. They're pleasant as can be about subbing out ingredients, though, so that's a plus.

"A culinary establishment that exudes an aura of warmth and hospitality, whereupon we had the pleasure of encountering the proprietors, a harmonious conjugal pair, who demonstrated an unwavering commitment to ensuring our dining experience was suffused with cordiality and amenability. The gastronomical offerings were indeed palatable, and the attentive demeanor of the staff left us feeling satiated and gratified. We shall unquestionably revisit this eatery in the future."

"During my exploration of the captivating sights of Edinburgh, a sudden craving for a midday repast and a brief respite from my peregrinations necessitated a visit to a nearby eatery. Unfortunately, the cafe that had been highly recommended to me was closed during the festive period, thereby compelling me to seek alternative dining arrangements. In proximity to the aforementioned establishment, I chanced upon this quaint cafe/bistro, which appeared inviting and thus, I decided to venture inside. Upon entering, I was warmly received by the hospitable waitress who promptly escorted me to a vacant table and presented me with a menu. As I perused the offerings, I noticed that the menu selections were displayed on the windows, thereby facilitating my decision-making process. I opted for an avocado salad, accompanied by a glass of water, motivated by a desire to maintain a healthy disposition following the excesses of the holiday season. My culinary selection was swiftly prepared and delivered to my table, complemented by a side of brown seeded bread. While the salad was indeed delectable, I couldn't help but feel that a greater diversity of vegetables, such as the inclusion of cucumber and spring onions, would have enhanced its overall appeal. Moreover, I observed that an excessive amount of vinaigrette had been applied to the salad, resulting in an unfortunate sogginess of the leaves. Notwithstanding this drawback, the quality of service rendered by the waitstaff was quite satisfactory, and thus, I would consider revisiting this establishment in the future, as it offers a diverse array of edibles and potables."

"An exceptional venue for indulging in superior quality brews and delectable cuisine, yet it can be arduous to secure a table accommodating more than six patrons due to the absence of reservation facilities."
I ordered the spinach rice and beans which was excellent. Service was slow to start I waited 10 minutes for a cup of tea. Lunch is a very busy time but it'd still return because the food is very good

"Having placed multiple orders from Little Nippers II, I have consistently been satisfied with the culinary offerings received, although I would not categorize it as rapid nourishment. 

Quality cuisine necessitates time for preparation, and their mild wings exemplify this notion, boasting palatability that warrants the effort invested in their creation. Enhance the flavor profile further by eschewing the accompanying packet of dressing in favor of a homemade blue cheese sauce, and the resultant experience elevates to an even more satisfying level. 

While their pizza exhibits mediocrity relative to options available in my native New York, I acknowledge its acceptability, albeit failing to surpass the lofty standards set by the numerous pizzerias peppering my hometown. 

Despite this, I shall return to partake in their edible fare, ensuring to preemptively communicate my order via telephone or utilize Grub Hub's services to minimize any potential delay."

Love the fish sandwiches, they are all they are cracked up to be.  If you want lunch - try a sandwich here - but order ahead for pick up, or be prepared to wait 30 minutes or more in a shady looking bar.  The bar is very smoky, although it is also stocked with a soda machine if you get thirsty waiting for your sandwich to be made.   Although for a fish sandwich and fries you'll probably drop about $10, I think its definitely worth it.

Really great place! We used to frequent the location in Mesa, but the manager was a total witch! I am serious--my bf, at the time, and I would go there, weekly, and she would never acknowledge us, or even attempt to be polite to the customers, so we stopped going. I am glad we gave the Bell Rd. location a try. The service was excellent! We were greeted, with a big smile, and seated immediately. Our server was excellent. Food is great. We always order the same thing, a skillet for me and Eye Opener Combo for the hubster. We are definitely excited to welcome this franchise back in to our rotation of wonderful breakfast joints!

The free little chocolate tour is fun, the cactus garden is cool and the best part is being able to chocolates at the end, I particularly like the Creme Liqueurs! If you havent had them you need to try them!

"The culinary establishments situated within the Mekong Plaza are all worthy of at least a single visit. However, the Wholly Grill stands out as an eatery deserving of multiple visits. We were seeking a satisfying and economical dining experience, and decided to support a local business by patronizing the food court at the Plaza. Our decision to dine at Wholly Grill proved to be an excellent choice, as we were not let down by their offerings. 

I opted for the grilled pork belly, while my companion chose the pork skewers. It was challenging to determine which dish was more enjoyable, as both were imbued with delectable qualities. The skewers possessed a tenderness and juiciness that was complemented by the accompanying eggplant salad, which reminded me of the mouthwatering street food commonly found in that particular region. The pork belly, on the other hand, boasted a crispy exterior and an interior texture that was cooked to perfection. Avoidance of overcooking or undercooking pork belly is crucial, as it can result in an unpleasant chewy, rubbery, or fatty consistency. Fortunately, this was not the case with Wholly Grill's rendition. Instead, I found myself eager to consume every last morsel, even after feeling satiated. Each time I believed I had finished my meal, I would notice an additional piece of savory meat on my plate and be compelled to devour it. 

The staff at Wholly Grill exhibited exceptional friendliness, with our server displaying amusement when recommending the pork belly, almost as though she were surprised that a Caucasian woman with red hair would consider her suggestion. There are several other menu items that pique my interest and that I would like to sample in the future, provided that I can resist the temptation of the pork belly, which I now find myself craving once again."

I procured a minuscule vanilla chai tea latte in a portable container, which I found to be rather satisfying in terms of its flavor profile, although I did experience some disappointment due to the diminutive proportions of the beverage relative to its cost, which I felt was slightly disproportionate to its monetary value.
Went for Restaurant Week with a friend. Adorable little place, wonderful atmosphere. The squid was just slightly overcooked but everything else was perfect. Service was great. Bring your own wine.

As a concatenation of culinary establishments and a slight deviation from the conventional definition of rapid nourishment, I thoroughly relish the experience offered by Chipotle! The comestibles served within these eateries are invariably fresh and delectable! Chipotle upholds an unwavering commitment to providing victuals that align with their philosophical tenets, specifically emphasizing "Food with integrity." These principles encompass offering vegetarian options and procuring meat from sources that adhere to natural and hormone-free practices. Such considerations contribute to my sentiments of satisfaction, derived not solely from partaking in scrumptious fare, but also from supporting an enterprise that prioritizes environmental responsibility. Upon each container, a narrative pertaining to one of their products or corporate practices is inscribed, which serves as an entertaining diversion during my dining experience. The employees at Chipotle exhibit exceptional cordiality! I was taken aback by the extent of their helpfulness and amicability, which I encountered while assembling my burrito via the establishment's efficient assembly line. Both interior and exterior seating arrangements are available, catering to diverse preferences. Additionally, the convenience of online ordering is offered, allowing patrons to retrieve their culinary selections upon arrival. In conclusion, Chipotle excels in both gastronomical quality and hospitable service, thereby earning my ardent admiration.

We were craving something light and decided to try this place.  I love a good sushi and sashimi plate, and there were plenty of items on the menu to pick from.  We decided to do some of the small share plates and were not dissappointed.  We ordered a total of 6 items, and all were very fresh and tasty.  The sauces we tried were outstanding.  The service was extremely good....very friendly, efficient and sincere.  Definitely would eat here again....

Je suis pass\u00e9e ici par hasard alors que j'avais d'autres commissions \u00e0 faire dans le coin. Je ne connais pas vraiment Ahuntsic, mais vu la senteur de pain frais qui se d\u00e9gageait de cette boulangerie, je n'ai pas pu r\u00e9sister y entrer pour une petite visite. Ils ont vraiment de tous pour un bon repas: du pain, des p\u00e2tisseries, des pains, des p\u00e2t\u00e9s, des pains, des fromages, des pains, e plats pr\u00e9par\u00e9s en avance \u00e0 r\u00e9chauffer \u00e0 la maison, et bien s\u00fbr des pains. J'y ai go\u00fbt\u00e9 le pain \u00e0 l'\u00e9rable et aux noix qui \u00e9tait simplement divin. Je suis toutefois repartie \u00e0 la maison avec une miche de pain aux raisins et noix qui a \u00e9t\u00e9 tranch\u00e9 comme je le voulais. C'\u00e9tait un bon pain dense avec une cro\u00fbte bien solide mais pas trop difficile \u00e0 manger et une mie moelleuse qui ne fait pas trop de miettes. Si cette boulangerie \u00e9tait plus pr\u00e8s de chez nous, j'en serais probablement une cliente r\u00e9guli\u00e8re!

"It appears that this venue serves as a hub for the aggregation of stylish and fashionable individuals, a notion that was previously unbeknownst to me.  I couldn't help but ponder whether the proprietors of this establishment anticipated such immense popularity.  My personal experience with the gaming facility was characterized by a sense of bewilderment, which may have stemmed from my unfamiliarity with the atmosphere.  However, upon inquiring with multiple staff members, I was finally able to pinpoint the location of the will call desk designated for the boulevard concert arena.  It's worth mentioning that the predominant sentiment among the patrons seems to be one of joviality and helpfulness, and the demographic appears to consist of youthful revelers.  The subterranean parking area presents a challenge, and I would suggest augmenting the illumination to mitigate any potential discomfort.  As an aside, I envision the afterlife to resemble this setting, albeit with a greater emphasis on eternal indulgence.  

I had the privilege of attending a performance by the renowned band New Order, which took place outdoors in the vicinity of the swimming pool.  Despite my limited familiarity with their music, I found the concert to be thoroughly enjoyable.  The pool deck, while somewhat cramped and compact, accommodated a sizable audience of over four thousand attendees.  The acoustics were less than ideal due to the open-air setting, but the band's selection of songs, which included four tracks from Joy Division, proved to be truly impressive.  Those who opted to depart prematurely prior to the encore segment missed out on an exceptional experience, in my opinion.  A genuine devotee remains until the house lights are switched on and the musicians have vacated the premises.  In conclusion, I found the encounter to be memorable, and it afforded me the opportunity to connect with some fascinating individuals from the Yelp community for the first time."

Having been obsessed with boba tea for the last month, our never ending quest to try every boba tea joint in Las Vegas lead us here.  Although this place is called the Sesame House, you would never know it.  Its inside the Chinatown Plaza mall area where they have a sign outside just saying \"No. 1 Boba\".  \n\nI would say this is probably the second best place I've been next to Tea Planet but the prices are better here.  Not too much of an atmosphere though.  But the fruit is fresh and they do have quite a selection of dried fruits etc.

"Genuinely legitimate Thai culinary experience! I indulged in the delectable beef jerky, savory pad thai, zesty papaya salad, and fragrant sticky rice; all of which showcased remarkable flavors. Furthermore, they proffer an extensive array of Thai tea options, which further enhanced my dining experience. Although the venue may not have been ideally situated, the exceptional quality of the fare and the attentive service provided by the staff more than compensated for this minor drawback. Without a doubt, I shall return to partake in their delectable offerings once again."

I have had the privilege of traversing the precincts of this terminal numerous times, surpassing the frequency of Anna Nicole Smith's pharmacists' sojourns to the Bahamas. Upon entering, I find the interior effortlessly navigable, while the exterior presents a formidable maze, worthy of the most erudite cartographers. Which lane should I opt for to access the 202? Is it the portside? Or perhaps the central passageway? And then, a mere 100 yards hence, the sinistral path once again? The perplexity of the roadways appears to afford immense amusement for the vigilant traffic attendants, as they partake in their snacks and beverages, observing the bewildered travelers negotiating the tortuous signage with a sense of consternation. The amenities available within this establishment are adequate to superior, encompassing an array of drinkeries, eateries, and commercial establishments. I am at a loss to comprehend the grievances of those who express dissatisfaction, as my needs are fulfilled by the presence of a watering hole, a victualing establishment, a televisual device, a dosimeter of Dramamine, a copy of the National Enquirer, and that peculiarly-shaped pillow which induces feelings of foolishness whenever I elect to utilize it.

"Four out of five detrimental confectionaries. \n\nOh my! Sugar-laden barriers. Yum. I am grateful that I can only acquire such delectables during my business-related excursions into town, lest I be compelled to procure novel dimensions of trousers to accommodate my burgeoning waistline."
Decided to try out some chicken and biscuits when flying through the airport here. Damn good stuff NC, keep up the good work.

This particular Trader Joe's location boasts a welcoming ambiance, offering an array of high-quality products synonymous with the esteemed grocery chain. However, the parking facility requires significant enhancements to ensure a more seamless and secure experience for patrons. Insurance providers should consider implementing a surcharge for individuals who opt to park in this lot, given the high risk of vehicular collision due to its haphazard design. To mitigate potential damage, it is advisable to park at the furthest end of the lot, thereby minimizing the likelihood of involvement in a fender bender with senior citizens who frequent this establishment. Despite the parking challenges, the convenience of this store's proximity to my residence makes it an appealing option, and I anticipate visiting regularly.

Mmmm carbo-licious. 

I met the lovely Ms. Tonya P for a brief bagel this morning and 'twas delicious. Carby, crunchity toasted bagels (mmm sesame) and fab cream cheese. The schmear has to be homemade right? Because I dabbled in the chive and the vegetable - both were equally tasty. 

Inside Poppy's has a smattering of tables and a cute little patio outside where Riley (my pup) enjoyed some bagel bits off of the concrete. Tasty. Be aware that the patio can be quite noisy with the umpteen cars passing down Providence and Sharon Amity, but no worries, I had my bagel and great company. 

Next time I'm in the area, I'm definitely going to pop in and pay homage to Poppy's by indulging in a nice toasty bagel and a pound of cream cheese. Nice to know that there's another local bagel joint in CLT!

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by Five Guys in various states, totaling three, and my affection for this establishment has yet to diminish. Originating from Southern California, I was brought up on In-N-Out Burger, a local fast food chain; however, my curiosity was piqued upon learning that former President Barack Obama had visited Five Guys, leading me to try it myself. Subsequently, I became enamored with their delectable burgers, boasting an abundance of flavor, and have continued to indulge in them. Notwithstanding, I must admit that In-N-Out's french fries remain my preference. Nonetheless, my loyalty to Five Guys remains unwavering, and I foresee future visits.

"My cognitive faculties are consumed by an incessant preoccupation with the culinary delight that is the french fries; it is my conviction that these delectable morsels were initially submerged in a batter, prior to their submersion in hot oil, thereby enhancing their flavor profile and texture. Furthermore, I must commend the eatery on the quality of their buffalo chicken sandwich, which boasted a generous portion size and satisfying taste. The menu, replete with an array of options catering to diverse palates, is expansive in scope and suitable for large gatherings. The interior design, characterized by an open layout and numerous televisions, fosters a welcoming ambiance conducive to socializing and viewing sporting events. While the establishment may bear some semblance to a certain chain restaurant, my intentions are to return and partake in the aforementioned fries, as well as other menu items, with great regularity."

Buca Di Beppo's offers an unparalleled dining experience, boasting inconceivably delectable cuisine and gargantuan portions that necessitate sharing between multiple individuals. Given the copious amounts of food provided, it is advisable to reserve a table in advance, particularly during peak dining hours, to ensure seamless accommodation for your party. The pasta dishes, in particular, showcase exceptional culinary prowess, with each strand masterfully prepared and enveloped in rich, savory sauces that elevate the flavors to new heights.

I have invariably cherished Oyshi Sushi, as it symbolically consummated my sushi initiation! I wish the prices were more proportionate to other sushi locales in the vicinity, but one can merely hope. AYCE provides the most secure option for a dinner out with a table for two or more, ensuring that no one will be obligated to perform dishwashing duties in the rear if they become overly indulgent. We all possess those dinner companions who harbor the mentality of caviar budgets while confronting the reality of dollar-value-menu wallets. 
 Service is either exceptional or lackluster. I have encountered servers at this eatery who have instilled in me an unwavering desire to linger, whereas on the other hand, I have undergone service that has motivated me to opt for take-out (which they conveniently provide). 
 The primary drawback of this establishment is the absence of half-orders, which is a notable deficiency compared to alternative locations. Moreover, its distance from the strip constitutes a double-edged sword, as while it may seem appealing to avoid the bustling throngs, it simultaneously engenders a considerable delay, particularly on weekends. 
 Notwithstanding these limitations, my preferences include Mussels, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, Oyshi Roll, and the delectable Japanese Lasagna!

"We arrived at this establishment on a Tuesday afternoon, with the intention of partaking in a celebratory luncheon, utilizing the Lunch Groupon 'All You Can Eat' and 'All You Can Drink' options, priced at $36 for two individuals. Prior to being seated, our photograph was captured, evoking feelings of joviality and anticipation. The menu offered an array of culinary options, including salads, Mexican dishes, soups, Middle Eastern fare, Asian cuisine, American classics, Italian specialties, seafood delicacies, and an assortment of delectable desserts. In addition, the 'All You Can Drink' component provided an unlimited selection of beer, wine, and champagne, eliciting exclamations of delight from the female patrons, in particular. We highly recommend the strawberry crumb cupcake, which proved to be an epicurean delight. Furthermore, the presence of cotton candy for the youngsters added to the festive ambiance. However, the sushi offerings were found wanting, with a notable absence of crab legs. Patrons seeking a satisfying dining experience are advised to focus their attention on the Mexican, salad, and American options. While the edibles were merely average, the beverages proved to be the highlight of the meal, rendering the overall cost of $36, or $18 per person, a reasonable expenditure."

"Upon entering this establishment with a acquaintance of Bosnian descent, who graciously placed an order on my behalf, I was immediately struck by the sterility of the ambiance. The atmosphere was reminiscent of a bakery, albeit with a distinct disparity; an unmistakable air of uniqueness permeated the space, defying conventional categorization. 

Presented before me was a plate bearing a generous portion of freshly prepared bread, measuring approximately ten inches in diameter. This circular loaf, graced with a subtle sheen of oil, was bisected like a hamburger bun, revealing a savory filling of seasoned sausage meat. This culinary creation, known as ćevapčići or cevapi for short, constituted the entirety of the meal. 

Despite the seeming simplicity of the dish, both the bread and sausage proved to be delightfully flavorful. Unfortunately, my stomach capacity proved insufficient to consume the entire portion, even when dining with an empty stomach. Nonetheless, the experience left a lasting impression on me, and I would eagerly repeat it, while also making sure to reserve some space for the visually appealing Bosnian pastries on offer. 

The proprietors of the bakery displayed remarkable hospitality, despite their unconventional approach to customer service. Rather than hovering over guests, they adopted a more hands-off philosophy, whereby patrons were expected to communicate their needs directly. Personally, I found this manner of interaction rather refreshing, and it only added to the charm of my visit."

This eatery possesses an undeniable allure, boasting a brisk and efficient service complemented by an ambiance that exudes a palpable energy. My culinary experience was further enhanced by the delectable \"Leo's Sandwich,\" a judicious selection that showcased the kitchen's proficiency in creating flavorful dishes. Notably, even the simplest of beverages, water, was imbued with a subtle nuance that elevated its taste beyond the mundane. However, a few organizational hiccups pertaining to the management of waiting patrons slightly marred an otherwise seamless dining experience, thereby precluding me from conferring a perfect five-star rating.

"It is truly remarkable how this grocery store manages to consistently deliver exceptional customer service, evidenced by the absence of lengthy queues at the checkout counters, which are typically no more than one or two individuals deep. Furthermore, while their organic produce selection may be limited in scope, the quality of the items they do offer is unquestionably superior. Additionally, their beer selection boasts an impressive variety beyond the standard Bud Light and Coors Light options, and their assortment of baking supplies is truly remarkable, rivaling that of specialty stores. Such is my enthusiasm for this establishment that I am willing to go out of my way to patronize it."

"I am conferring upon them a rating of four stars, predicated on the exceptional quality of the personnel, who have consistently displayed an unwavering commitment to providing exemplary service. My culinary exploits at this establishment have encompassed both their sandwiches and pizzas, which, while not necessarily possessing the most refined gastronomical attributes, have nevertheless proven to be satisfactory in terms of their overall taste and value."

The quality of the service we received was satisfactory, but the cost of our meal was somewhat prohibitive, particularly in light of the fact that we were only served two omelets and a beverage, albeit a delectable one, for the sum of eighty dollars; furthermore, the absence of an alcoholic beverage from the menu was a notable omission, given the prevalence of such offerings at establishments of this ilk in Las Vegas, a city renowned for its extravagant and indulgent culinary experiences. We elected to partake of our repast in close proximity to the pool, whereupon we proceeded to recline and enjoy our nourishment in a state of leisure, necessitating a brief stroll to secure a suitable location external to the edifice. The outdoor dining area, unfortunately, was not constantly available for our utilization, thereby requiring us to circumnavigate the premises to some degree in pursuit of an appropriate setting for our al fresco dining experience.

"A vibrant and bustling eatery offering an intimate and welcoming ambiance, featuring a diverse palette of flavors through its Mexican-inspired cuisine, at a price point that is rational and accessible to a wide range of patrons, particularly appealing to those in the blue collar workforce who possess a discerning palate and appreciate the value of quality sustenance."

"We thoroughly enjoyed our recent visit to this establishment! My daughter and I partook in a delectable luncheon at this venue, and we were thoroughly impressed by the culinary offerings presented before us. Specifically, the capri sandwich fashioned from ciabatta bread and my daughter's turkey and bacon sandwich, also constructed from ciabatta, were utterly scrumptious! It is worth mentioning that the gentleman manning the counter, whose name unfortunately escapes me, exhibited exceptional hospitality and amicability, graciously addressing any queries we harbored regarding our meals. Such an encounter has secured our intentions to revisit this eatery in the near future."

Phenomenal lunch buffet during the week! Its $13.99 (give or take a $1), a good mixture of vegetarian options, chicken, pork and beef. The Naan bread is to die for, and they just keep bringing it on out!\n\nThe only bad thing about going here for lunch is that you definitely need a nap after!

"The hospitality proffered by the bartender was truly exceptional, and the educational excursion provided an enlightening experience. Unfortunately, the outdoor drinking area was not accessible during our visit due to the inclement weather conditions prevalent during the off-season, yet we managed to sample several satisfactory beverages despite the limitations imposed by the unpropitious circumstances."

"Manifests an impressive array of delectable bagels, undoubtedly ranking among my most cherished culinary treats globally. Serves as an optimal venue for commencing one's day, although the challah occasionally exhibits inconsistent quality, as conveyed by a Jewish acquaintance. Additionally, the convenience of acquiring Chompies bagels at a local grocery store constitutes yet another advantageous factor."

Los Dos proffered an exceptionally delectable Chimichanga, featuring a succulent selection of meat, meticulously deep-fried to a golden crisp, and adorned with a flavorsome triad of guacamole, sour cream, and New Mexico's signature green chili sauce, thereby evoking a culinary nirvana that would have warranted an unqualified 5-star rating had complimentary refills of chips and salsa been offered; furthermore, their extensive assortment of premium margaritas and beers served as the perfect accompaniment to this gastronomic delight.

This was one of my go to chains when I was Chicago so I'm happy to see one right in downtown Pittsburgh.  I got the opportunity to try it out today although I figured I knew what to expect since franchises try to be consistent in quality and taste regardless of their location.  

This is just how I remember it.  It's affordable, relatively quick, and tasty.  Please note the order b/c if you ask me are their better tasting places out there - sure.  Are there cheaper places our there - yes, and are their faster places out there - of course.  But to have the trifecta - well that does take a little more effort than having one or another of those qualities.  

Which is why this place gets 4 stars - it probably helps that it's also close to where I work.

"It was a challenging endeavor to locate this establishment, but the effort was undoubtedly rewarded with an exceptional culinary experience, featuring delectable tacos and a hospitable chef. We are eagerly anticipating our next visit, whereupon we shall indulge in their gastronomical delights once again."

This Wendys just happen to be remodeled and my girlfriend and I decided to stop in and take a look at the new design of the store. the remodel has changed how you order and pick up now you order at one area and pick up another the dining room area has been completely remodeled with new tables new atmosphere and even a small ones area oh and boot there is wifi.

"Although it appears to be approaching an acceptable time for a midday meal, the culinary offerings at this establishment are somewhat limited in scope and variety, despite the fact that the ambiance is pleasant and the prices are reasonable."

St. Francis is one of my preferred destinations for a leisurely morning repast in Phoenix, boasting an upscale, contemporary ambiance. Their culinary offerings are an eclectic fusion of traditional American dishes, infused with nuances from various cultural influences. Furthermore, they possess an extensive selection of artisanal brews, as well as expertly crafted mimosas and bloody Marys, which complement their delectable brunch options. Additionally, children under the age of ten can indulge in a complimentary meal, making it an ideal family-friendly establishment.  

The hospitable staff has consistently displayed warmth and attentiveness during my visits. Although some patrons have reported sluggish service, I have never experienced such issues personally. The duration between courses may be somewhat prolonged, but this is hardly the server's responsibility. In fact, the servers have been diligent in monitoring my beverage levels and offering prompt refills when necessary.  

Their eggs benedict with salmon is a personal favorite of mine, as the Hollandaise sauce achieves a sublime balance of richness and tartness. Initially, the dish was served with a generous portion of fingerling potatoes, but unfortunately, this side dish has since been replaced by a few scattered potatoes on the plate. Nonetheless, the pork chile verde remains a standout option, boasting a delightful harmony of spicy and savory flavors. It is presented with a substantial serving utensil and accompanied by two slices of cornbread, perfect for sopping up the flavorful broth. Another culinary highlight is their cioppino, a fiery, crimson seafood stew that is arguably large enough to share, and is served with a crusty loaf of bread.  

Furthermore, I have visited St. Francis with companions for a happy hour excursion, during which we exclusively ordered appetizers and beverages. The atmosphere proved to be cozy and inviting, and we departed feeling content and refreshed, courtesy of the outdoor patio's warm fire.

Switch offers a variety of food options from healthy choices to comfort food. The menu is very eclectic, and I have yet to have a bad meal from here. The portions sizes are very generous for the price and service has always been good. Some of my faves include:
- mac & cheese: rich, creamy, flavorful cheese sauce over penne
- caprese sandwich: typical ingredients with a great pesto vinaigrette 
 - burger: your basic burger, not too fancy, but great on taste
Also, if you're looking to tie one on, they have some fantastic drink specials especially on Sundays where you can get carafes of mimosas, bloody marys, etc. for $3.

We have been ardent patrons of this culinary establishment for a duration of five years, during which time we have developed a profound appreciation for their gastronomical offerings and beverages of a blended nature. The specific location under discussion is a relatively recent addition to the chain, having been in operation for less than a year at the present time, and boasts an exceptionally busy location that has led to inconsistent staffing levels on weekends, resulting in occasional delays of up to twenty minutes in the procurement of sustenance. Despite these brief lapses in efficiency, the quality of both the edible fare and potable beverages remains unwavering, though unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the maintenance of the facilities, particularly the restrooms, which are frequently found to be in a state of disarray, much to the chagrin of this author and parent of three youthful offspring, who find it necessary to exercise great caution in their utilization, lest they be confronted with an environment that falls short of stringent standards of hygiene. It is a source of perplexity and disappointment that the sole lavatory on the premises should be overlooked with such regularity, despite the evident amiability of the staff and the apparent competence of the manager. Notwithstanding this anomaly, this eatery remains a favored destination for our family, who frequent it several times a week.

Have been here about once a week give or take, and the food has been very consistent. The pho soup base improved a bit, but it was already better than everywhere else. I have been here when it was slow and very busy and even then, the service has been very good. Glad to have this place in Chandler..\n\nPho Viet Nam, staff n Crew... Keep up the great work..

If you ask any Asian person where they go to get their familiar spices and groceries, I'll bet 99.9% of them know about this place.  However, this isn't only for Asians, anyone can stop in and find what they're looking for as the aisles are labeled based on the culture (Filipino, Korean, etc.).  If that doesn't help, you can still explore the endless array of 'water animals', fresh baked goods, even a bubble tea counter.  They also have a small dining area which serves some traditional (it looks to be) Chinese fare.\n\nIt's quite a bit of a drive, but if we're ever in the Matthews/ Stallings area, this is a must stop for your Asian cuisine needs.

It utterly perplexes me that certain individuals harbor the notion that In-N-Out surpasses Lenny's in terms of gastronomical quality. In-N-Out, in my opinion, holds the dubious distinction of being the most egregiously overhyped establishment within the realm of fast food. I am thoroughly baffled by the underlying factors responsible for such an unmerited reputation, as the patties served at In-N-Out are characterized by an unfortunate lack of substance, the cheese is merely serviceable, and the fries are utterly forgettable. While the flavor profile of the burger itself may be passable, it falls short of the lofty standards set by other prominent players in the industry, such as Whataburger, which, in my estimation, handily outstrips In-N-Out in terms of overall excellence. On the other hand, Lenny's boasts patties that are genuinely beefy in nature (a playful pun, if you will), accompanied by cheese that is respectably adequate and fries that are exponentially superior to those offered by In-N-Out. Although Lenny's may not lay claim to the title of premier burger joint in the vicinity, it unquestionably outclasses In-N-Out in a multitude of aspects.

I don't have health insurance so I had to pay for my dental services. I thought the prices was okay after comparing it with other dental centers in the area. And plus they had an internet coupon for $100 off. So that's why I went with them instead of another dental center. Plus there were a number of good reviews on google for Biltmore Commons Dental Care. That gave me more confidence to use their services.  I called at 8am and I was able to get an appointment at 9am. Maybe I was lucky or maybe there's vacant spots because of the bad economy and no one is going the dentist. Who knows. Dr. Balestrino did my fillings. He took his time to explain to me what needed to be done and addressed the questions I had. I am overall pleased with this dentist visit. I would go back for my follow up in six months to get my teeth cleaned.

"This eatery constitutes one of our preferred destinations for procuring luncheon fare for take-out purposes, as we unhesitatingly venture beyond our customary boundaries to acquire their delectable sandwiches and salads. The culinary offerings of this establishment boast a consistent degree of savory excellence, while the staff members exhibit an unwavering commitment to cordiality and hospitable customer service.
